Gordiano's have a thicker body with more cheese, which a lot of my friends like better. I personally like Lou because it's the right proportion of crust, meat, and sauce. It's almost like eating a burger on a pizza (if you order the sausage, that is). They have good vegetarian options, too.

Do try the ice cream/ cookie dessert too if you have a chance.

Pretty solid pizza deep dish pizza. From what I remember a few years back, Giordano's pizza is better.

Their stuffed spinach bread was tasty but needed something other than marinara sauce for dipping.

Caesar salad came with to tomatoes which is new for me. Really basic dressing that I assume is premade.
Best pizza ever.. I definitely recommend! Keep in mind This is coming from a fatboy .

This place gave me food poisoning.

Coming to Chicago for the first time ever, I was excited to try some authentic deep dish pizza.  Showed up at Lou Malnati's around 6 PM for dinner.  I was told that because they make all of their pizza from scratch, it would take 45 minutes after ordering to serve.  Not a problem, but just an FYI for anyone coming here... probably better to place your order in advance by phone.

When my pizza did arrive, I thought it was alright, but nothing particularly exceptional.  I guess I'm more of a NY style pizza person.  Anyways, if my night had ended just like that, I'd probably be leaving a 3 star review instead.

However, later I had some awful food poisoning that nearly caused me to miss my flight home the next morning because I felt so bad.  Won't go into details to keep this review PG, but yeah... I will never be back here again.

OVERALL: 1/5.  Blech.

I was very disappointed with the way we were treated on Saturday. Having been a few times we knew there was about an hour wait before being sat so we called to ask about the process or if there was a process for getting sat without doing a walk up. We were told to call on our way to be added to the list, so we did and were told it was 35 minute wait. When we arrived an arrogant individual said it was now an hour and 15 minute wait. How is that possible if the restaurant is a 15 minute walk from my apt? When posed this question, he smirked and said "Well as time passes, it takes longer. Just the way it is at Lou's" (WOW!!)

If we didn't have guests in town, we would have left after speaking to his manager about the snarky service. We put our name in, placed our order with the register as instructed and were added to the list which thankfully was updated via a website so we went to Pink Taco for drinks. An hour and 15 minutes later we were sat, then WAITED ANOTHER HOUR AND 15 MINUTES for our pizzas. What was the point in putting in our order ahead of time? Our server, while nice was aloof and did not take good care of us on drinks or time updates. We asked for water several times, refill on beers and iced tea with no luck.  The pizza is good, do not get me wrong because it is my favorite deep dish in the city. The crust is the secret!

However, it will be a very long time before we visit or order again because this was an abysmal showing for a Chicago staple that should have it under control.

It's ok, as good as pizzeria uno in my opinion. Bar is  small and not good if you're looking for that, service is not what I would expect. Asked for a recommendation from bar tender several minutes later another patron asked the same bartender for a recommendation and got a totally different response. Food isn't bad like just not what I'd expect with so many yelp reviews. Writing this review cause I'm sitting at bar with an empty glass for the second time and not being offered another drink or given a check.

I value the service and really appreciate the time taken by the management to reach out an remedy my experience. Although I couldn't take them up on it they demonstrated they want every dining experience to be a great one. Next time I'm in Chicago I'm heading back to this location, thanks guys!!!

Two words: HUGE Portions!

I am not a huge fan of deep dish pizza but I can't leave Chicago without eating it either.

Here is what we order and shared between three people.  

The Malanti Chicago Classic (medium) $21.05
The Lou (small) $17.95
House Salad (family size) $12.95
Calamari Fritti $9.95

I definitely enjoyed the Lou more than the classic because the classic had too much meat. I know what you are thinking, is she serious? I am. This pie is already heavy so the meat makes its 5X more fulfilling IMO. The salad was huge, like it totally can feed 6-7 people. The calamari was ok, it was a little cold and soggy when it got to us.

I've only had deep dish in Chicago twice and both times was at Lou's, even though it has been good I think I'll try a different place next time.

pics.caption: Anchovies that look like grey slugs

review.des:
It's probably blasphemy as a New Yorker to say this, but I love Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. It's not better than NY thin crust... it's different. Kinda like spaghetti vs rigatoni... not better, different.

Was in Chicago on biz, and a stop at Lou Malnati's seemed necessary. Our group ordered several pies, all of which were delicious, with the sausage being a highlight.

So many times, a place that gets this much attention - especially from tourists - is overrated. Lou Malnati's is not. It's a slice of it's city and damned tempting to order via shipping to treat myself on occasion.

First time having a Chicago deep dish pizza in Chicago. You definitely have to wait for the experience, 2 to 3 hours. We got both of the Chicago deep dish pizzas and both were really good. One large pizza definitely is enough for three people.
Great, friendly service right up at the bar, which is the place to eat if you need to plug in your phone. Got the small cheese deep dish. Two of us shared it and it hit the spot!

I came in here with a party of 6 one night at around 10pm.  We all ordered different pan sizes and I gotta say, it's really just OK pizza.

The wait was about 45minutes and I wish we all Uber'd to Pequods instead

Great deep dish pizza!

We got the small and it was more than enough! Very filling! I would suggest ordering a small and other sides.

We got the buffalo wings and a small salad.

It was the perfect combination.

We put our name on the list, preordered our pizza, and got a text about 45 mins later. It was enough time to go to a nearby bar to grab a drink, and when we got our text we came back and was seated right away.

Would recommend and come back here.

I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could but it's not worth 4 stars. I've heard a lot of people mention that Chicago is the place for deep dish pizza. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. Maybe we ordered the wrong pizza.

We got the 9" The Malnati Classic. Definitely is enough for two people unless your man has a big appetite. The flavor was decent but I expected more. The crust wasn't anything special.

We also got the Trio dip. It's good but super oily.

We waited about and hour to be seated on a Saturday night. Service was good.

First time at Malnati's... I've had other deep dish pizza here in Chicago so wanted to give this place a try.

Ordered a large classic deep dish.  2/5 stars
- It was just okay. Best part of the pizza was the sausage. Not much to say l, just didn't taste as fresh as I'm accustomed to.

Service 3/5

Went to have dinner at carmines and as im having dinner my mom calls to pick her up a deep dish pizza as im on the phone my server overhears and recommends lou malnati's.
So i call this location and place a order to go large pepperoni and sausage deep dish pizza with extra cheese.

Taste was horrible can tomatoes terrible sauce barley any cheese or toppings??? Most of the pizza was just horribly cooked dough...so disappointed this place has alot of reviews but taste is bad. Not what i expected for Chicago deep dish.

So this place was literally a cluster f^*k on st. Paddy's day evening!! Im from DC, and I cant even remember the last time Ive seen an establishment soo packed.

So the question is "why 5 stars?!"

The staff (takeout and hostess) were phenomenal!! These young ladies kept their composure the entire time I was there waiting for our order. They were polite and tried their best to keep things moving. We were finally able to get our online order after an hour of waiting inside, and I still had to compliment the young lady who finally handed us our pies. Great job!! You cant get customer service like from just anywhere..I mean that place was soo congested.

Our food was fantastic and actually worth the wait!! Oh...thats pains me to write that..but I truly understand the stampede at this place. We had the Malnati chicago classic (deep dish butter-crust pizza with with sausage and extra cheese), and a thin crust pepperoni pizza-both we delicious. Thank goodness I dont live out there, cause my waist line wouldn't stand a chance against those pies. BTW, this was my first chicago style pizza...and now I may have to give back my east coast NY pizza loyalty card...but we'll leave that discussion for another review.

Overall..highly recommend!! Its truly worth the hype.

Pro tip: (this for my tourist folks)..place your order way ahead of time..and be patient during the dinner rush. Its worth it!

Food: Came here to try deep dish pizza for the first time and it did not disappoint. We tried two of their pizzas and they were great. Very hearty, nice crust, and quality ingredients. The food took a while to come out and I feel it would've been better if it were hotter, however for my first deep dish the chain Lou Malnati's is not a bad bet.

Atmosphere: unique atmosphere. Waiter said every restaurant had a different theme and this one was a sports themed one with many memorabilia on the wall. The waiter was friendly and nothing to complains bout overall.

Price: the price was fair and around how much you would normally pay for deep dish pizza in the city.

Overall: I was not disappointed coming here to try deep dish. It did not blow me away and I am sure there are some local gems that might be better however. Lou gets the job done and should be commended for doing what they are known for with high quality.

Recently my son and I stopped by for dinner. My son loves the deep dish type. I think it tastes like bad tomato sauce on top of a piece of buttered cake. No way it can compare with the original pizza from Brooklyn. Therefore I choose the lasagna.
After fifty minutes the deep dish comes out, but no lasagna. Server tells me "something happened to the lasagna. I think it fell on the floor."  It was a huge blob of ricotta wit a few slabs of pasta.
Louie, you will never see me again!

So while we were in Chicago we were told this is the place to go for the authentic Chicago pizza . We arrived just before lunch and had to wait to get a table ..no big deal. This place gets busy fast so get here early !

As we were waiting we ordered our pizza ( it takes about 40 mins for deep dish ). I had a beer and relaxed outside with my group . Thankfully it was a beautiful day and not too hot  .

Once we got our pizza it was hot and delicious! I did not think I would like deep dish , but I highly recommend this ! The butter-crust is fantastic !

NY style is still my favorite though.

When in Chicago you have this try this place, went here based as suggested by locals and 4000+ reviews on yelp. Though very few options for Vegetarians but had to try the Chicago style deep dish pizza. We ordered "The Lou" and all deep dish pizzas take more than 35 mins to arrive so make sure to order some salad or beer to kill some time. The 45 minute wait was totally worth it. 4 stars not for food but only because it takes a long time to arrive.

cheesus crust. If there's ever a tomatoe shortage I know who the culprit is. Food was alright but I thought I ordered a pizza and a salad not a tomato with lettuce and a tomato with toppings. There were tomato's on everything. My salad was covered, my pizza had tomato sauce and full slices. We're good on the red veggie/fruit.

My least favorite aspect of the meal was the crust. And before you get all judgy let me say I had deep dish the day before and didn't need to have it two days in a row, so I did get the thin crust pizza, but it had no flavor in my opinion. I got the Lou on a thin crust, so I asked for their signature just without the deep dish. I thought at least the favor of the toppings would've been good but all I could taste was the cardboard of crust.

Service was decent and fast. But the restaurant was slightly messy, I was also next to a family with 2-12 kids so that would be on them. All the staff was patient and I was seated right away.

If you're traveling to the Windy City, a lot of people recommended this place to me. The atmosphere is great and it's very homely inside but the food (unless you LOVE tomatoes) wasn't really worth it to me.
One of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicagoi hands down. The crust is amazing and the flavor is too good.

My girlfriend and I always get a plain cheese pizza, although this time she requested anchovies on the side (I can't stand them). Understandably, the staff accidentally put them on top of the pizza. We wouldn't have even said anything, considering how weird our request was at such a busy time, but manager (owner/etc.?) Matt came to personally apologize to us, bring us a SECOND pizza free of charge (both ended up being free) and even personally served the pizza to us. We couldn't believe how nice the staff was about such an understandable mistake. Great pizza and great people.

In my humble opinion, I feel like I got my favorite Chicago deep dish pizza experience here. While there are many more places to try and my opinions may change I'm the future, at this moment, this was my favorite deep dish experience. There's just something so different and delicious about their crust here. A lot of other places you go, sometimes you feel like you are getting overwhelmed by the sheer amount of crust and sauce on your pizza. Like literally you are experiencing a waterfall of tomato sauce and the never-ending doughiness of pizza crust. But not here. The best thing I love about this place, hands down, is the uniqueness of the pizza crust. It's light and crispy, almost like eating a pie crust. It is so satisfying to eat. Let me emphasize: SATISFYING. The crispiness is such a fantastic contrast to the cheese, sauce, and toppings. And that's the other thing, this place doesn't go overboard on the sauce. You have the sauce covering the top of the pizza but it's not excessive to the point where everything is becoming soggy. To me, the crust, cheese, topping, and sauce ratio is perfectly balanced. Just writing and thinking about my experience here makes me crave for the taste of a deep dish pizza from here. That's it, I need to make another trip to Chicago lol.

pics.caption: What a beauty. Sausage and Cheese Deep Dish

review.des:
Lou's has multiple locations; we ate at the Wells street location.

We started with the house salad which was amazing, delicious and well done.  

We ordered a small sausage deep dish.  The pizza was awesome, the crust was tasty; you can tell the ingredients were fresh. This is an excellent pizza.

The service was implacable.  We enjoyed our visit!

There's a reason why Lou Malnati is one of the highest rated pizza restaurant in Chicago. Their pizza sure tastes very good!

Please note that it takes about 40-45 minutes for your pizza to cook and be served. If you don't have time to wait that long, I'd recommend you to call in ahead of time and place your order over the phone.
Or plan to order an appetizer, which comes out in about 15min from the time you order. I got their calamari as an appetizer and I loved it. It's very tender, juicy and great flavor!

It tends to get very busy during dinner time. I'd recommend to come around 5:30pm to beat the rush. 30min makes a huge difference in your wait time. The restaurant has second floor dining hall too, so don't get scared thinking it's just first floor.

I got the Lou pizza, which is a great vegetarian option (it has spinach, tomatoes and mushrooms). I wanted some extra protein added, so I added sausage to my Lou pizza, and it was .

I've had frozen Lou's pizza togo-ed and baked it at home, and I honestly liked it better because I managed to get the crust to be little more crunchier. I'm not sure if you can ask them to make the crust extra crispy when you order, but if they're able to, I'd give it a chance.
Very good pizza indeed. This place was a full house from top to bottom. The sauce on the pizza was simply fresh. Everything you would expect at a pizza joint.

pics.caption: The Malnati Chicago Classic Pizza. First time having deep dish pizza.

review.des: Honestly this place never disappoints. If you read my last review from last night in my stay in Chicago you'll know I was at Gino's. & it was the worst meal all of my trip. However tonight I decided to come to Lou malnatis and OF COURSE it was amazing !!! Ordered to go after a night out and it was HOT, great service & delicious !!! Totally wish we had this is California

There is no way I can be at Chicago without trying deep dish pizza, and as a fellow Yelp Elite, how can I miss the opportunity to visit one of the most famous restaurants in Chicago?!

*Quick note, if you do plan on ordering their deep dish pizza, expect about a 45 minute wait for your pizza to arrive!

Wait/Reservation: They don't take reservations, first come first served. My group and I came here around 5pm on a Saturday evening; we were seated within 20 minutes. I recommend arriving around that time because there's a huge dinner rush by 7pm and the wait could be over an hour!

Menu: They offer a good variety of salads, appetizers, and sandwiches, but the star of the show is their deep dish pizza! My roommate and I ordered a personal size "Malnati Chicago Classic" which comes with sausage, vine-ripened tomato sauce, and loaded with cheese. I definitely fell in love with this pizza from my first bite. There was a nice cheese pull to it, but I feel it could be stringier if the pizza was a little warmer because I felt that our pizza was left out a little long. Nonetheless, the sausage and tomato sauce goes well with each other. The sauce isn't heavy or overwhelming and I'm honestly very impressed that by how delicious deep dish pizza truly is.

I personally feel that the personal is honestly enough to feed one very hungry person. However, I shared it with my roommate because we weren't too hungry. The small is also huge and was enough to feed 3 of my guy friends with one slice remaining. I also got to try their buffalo wings, which were actually very delicious. Their buffalo sauce is very buttery and not too salty or overwhelming. I would recommend this appetizer to anyone!

Overall experience here was great, but the customer service was disappointing. Our server was completely overwhelmed and took it out on our table. He would cut us off when we'd try to order more items. And when it was time to pay for the bill, he gave my friend an attitude stating he has a lot of tables to serve and he can't help her. I was appalled by his attitude, I wish he could have said it more nicely, but he did not. We weren't there to make his job harder on him, but his attitude did. Nonetheless, the pizza and wings were amazing and I would definitely come back to try their other ones.

Oh the great Chi Town deep dish. We grabbed an Uber to come here and luckily were with veterans who knew that you could pre-order your meal. We arrived and put our names in for the wait, which wasnt horrible. They then allow you to also pre-order your meal so that when you are finally seated things come out fairly quickly. This is the secret. While we waited we grabbed some craft beers at the bar and went outside to enjoy them and people watch. They do have limited outdoor seating but during a heatwave, umm no. After a reasonable wait we were seated, ordered drinks and our appetizer of Calamari came right out. It was very tasty but small. My friend ordered the seasonal drink Red white and Lou which I did not taste because I hate cherry, but she loved it. For our pizzas we got a "The Lou" and a plain cheese, both small sized. Our group had 4 people who were starving and even those 2 small pizzas were too much. Id say we had about half left, so order conservatively. The pizza was awesome. Our service was awesome. Yet again a Chi Town staple you must visit.

Lou Malnati's is a must try in Chicago. I usually get the Lou with sausage. If you dine-in, the pizzas take 30-40mins to make so definitely order some appetizers to curb your hunger until the pizza is out. I tried the calamari and garlic bread appetizers which were both really good.

This is the best deep dish I've ever had. Given I'm a straight up tourist and have only had one or 2 slices of Chicago Deep Dish in Chicago, the crust was buttery and crispy but not dry near the sauce. The tomatoes were fresh and and sausage was delicious. It was super filling and I was barely able to eat half of a personal size one. Somehow after I brought 2 larger ones home I was able to eat more than half of that after baking it at home. The frozen pizzas survived a couple hours to the airport and a 4 hour plane ride, and the hour long drive home. I popped that baby right in the oven as soon as I put my stuff down...and even the frozen version was amazing

if in Chicago and wanting original deep dish... here would be an excellent choice. Bar had a neighborhood vibe, baseball on, chatting with me friends
It will be 45-60 mins after ordering. That is normal for these monsters of flavor. Notice the butter crust is awesome! I had great House salad while waiting.

This is my favorite deep dish in Chicago now.

In my opinion there is nothing different about this place than the other pizza places, they just have the better recipe and ingredients. I'm not sure what makes all of the deep dishes different but Lou does something better than them all.

The service was slightly slow although nothing worth complaining about. Definitely good stuff and I'll be coming around next time I'm in town.

Thanks again.

This is my first chicago deep dish so really have nothing to compare it to. Ordered pick up. There was about a one hour time difference between when I ordered and the soonest I could pick it up. When I showed up it was pretty seamless. Told them I was there to pick up and they had my pizza within 5 minutes. They first just gave me the pizza in a box, but when I asked for a paper plate they gave me Parmesan cheese and crushed red pepper, which if you want to put on your pizza definitely ask for (I put it on and it was great).

As a New Yorker getting a deep dish pizza I would first like to say that I have no ill will towards deep dish. Any combination of tomatoes, dough, and cheese is ok by me. This was pretty tasty. The dough was a little under cooked in certain parts and the sausage could have been better, but overall pretty solid. Had it with some Italian wine I bought from a store near by and it was great (artisan cellar). I got the "small" and it was more than enough for me (ate 3/4 and was very full, and I am on the small side).

I cannot say enough about Lou Malnati's so let's start with the process.

You park (good luck finding parking)  you put your name on a waiting list, go through menu, and place your order. By the time they seat you, your pizza is just about ready

Let's talk about the pizza, deep dish, yummy buttery crust,  and they do not get stingy with the cheese. Oh Lou's why must you be so far away from us California's?

Restaurant is packed so dont expect a nice quiet dinner, but on the bright side you get amazing pizza!

It was sooooo busy when we arrived on July 1st, but we were in this for the long haul and hoping for the best. The BEST is what we got! We checked in, we were told it would be about a hour or more but we could order our food and it would be almost ready when we were seated. . . . PERFECT! We ordered, went a few doors down for a drink, and returned when we were texted. The pizza arrived approximately 30 minutes later and did not disappoint. I am currently doing the keto diet and their crustless pizza was on point! Sausage used as the crust and delicious topping throughout, highly recommend if you aren't eating bread. Just because I'm weak, I also tried the deep dish we ordered.  . . . OMG, so amazing. The crust, the sausage, the sauce, it works so well together.

I'm sorry. . . I don't care if it's a tourist trap or not, Lou's got it figured out!

I believe this is the original location for Lou's. It's ALWAYS busy and you will wait to sit or for pickup or delivery. It's crowded. The seating is not ideal because it's jam packed. There is seating upstairs and downstairs. The drinks are decent. The service is decent.

What makes it five stars is the food. The deep dish is not as thick as giordanos but it's much much more delicious.

When you get delivery, leave it uncut. It arrives crispy and not soggy.

I'm all about Lou's. It's a must try. It's a Chicago favorite. Your friends will love you that are from out of town if you bring them here.

I live in Atlanta, but had been craving deep dish pizza for months. When my husband and I visited Chicago last weekend, that was my chance. I was given 3 choices by Chicago natives and decided on Lou's.

It was raining and way too cold for our tastes so we decided to get delivery. I was a bit concerned about how the delivery trip would impact the pie. It arrived at our room PERFECT! We were advised to order a small for 2 adults and it was the perfect amount. We had the pepperoni and lean sausage pie and it was beyond good. I almost never eat pizza and at alllllllllll of my share.  

This is a solid pick. I'll definitely be back!

pics.caption: Pepperoni and sausage deep dish pizza

review.des: Came here one evening with my boyfriend. I had such a great time. The food, drinks, and vibe was amazzzzing. We got calamari as an appetizer and we got a deep dish - half pepperoni and half sausage. It was so yummy. Its as good as everyone says it is ! We got blue moon beers as our drink and my boyfriend had way too many shots !!! Overall we had a great time and I'll be back whenever I'm in Chicago ! I recommend to anyone who is looking for a great time and some good deep dish.

So.  I nust revise my initial review.  Please note we visited this locale 1 year later and found EVERYTHING to be exquisite.  The gluten free pizza was excellent, as were the wings and tiramisu.   Huge portion, btw, of tiramisu.    Pizza was piping hot and so gosh darn tasty, I recommend it to all regardless of allergies.  Nice job !

Worth the wait.. simply put. We had a three hour wait last Sunday early evening. But the pizza was absolutely impeccable. Made fresh to order, and you can order frozen pizzas to be shipped domestically. If you've never had deep dish pizza before and you are visiting Chicago this place is a must visit!

Awesome service. The staff are incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and just all around wonderful. They do expect that you have ordered your pizza ahead of time and act like you're an idiot if you're a first timer and don't know about this.

The restaurant was extremely dirty. I don't even feel comfortable sharing the photo I took of the restroom. Just absolutely disgusting. Do NOT go in there. Even my husband was disgusted by the men's room. Yikes.

The calamari was delicious. The pizza was soggy, something tasted rotten (I think it was the mushrooms) and was just not good at all.

First and last time. Do not recommend.

A Chicago staple! This pizza place is fantastic! We came here while in town visiting and choose it because of the high praises it gets.

As soon as we walked in I loved the decor. It was unique and featured a lot of Chicago's past. We were sat upstairs in a nice open area that felt casual but had an air of sophistication as well.

Our service was super friendly and have us sugestions and information about each option. We ordered the large Italian salad and the traditional deep dish pizza to share. The salad arrived first and was fresh and delicious but the real deal was the pizza!

The pizza crust was crispy and flaky when I bit into it. The cheese was delicous and the pepperoni and sausage was very flavorful. I am a huge pizza fan and was blown away by how fresh everything was and how much flavor it all had.

This place is truly outstanding and represents Chicago well!

What we expected. Super crowded! Luckily, we got there at 5pm and we were able to snag 2 seats at the bar. Peroni anyone?

They said the pizza takes about 30-40 min and that was spot on. We ordered 2 personal pizzas (Lou & classic) for two ppl but the genius bartender advised us to get a small, half and half. So dope. Didn't know you could do that! The Lou is better than the classic. Garlic galore, in a good way. Lots-o-cheese on both! Plus the crust was crispy and not soggy, even on the bottom. Eat quickly because the cheese gets tough after sitting too long.

Disappointed to be honest. I'm surprised this place has 4 stars as usually on yelp a score of 3.5 and up indicates a good place to eat.

We ordered the following:

House salad with thousand island dressing 3/5:
Only reason this gets 3 stars is for the dressing and the croutons. They claim it's a house made sauce and it was great. The croutons were also fresh and toasted. The salad itself was poorly thought out. Big chunks of lettuce with finely diced cucumber and tomato and huge circles of onions. Not easy to put together into one bite.

Chicago style pizza with their signature sausage topping, extra cheese, and tomato sauce 2/5: The pizza took 40 min to make but was served room temperature. The cheese was solid and not gooey at all. The sausage was very underwhelming considering it is what the restaurant is known for according to the waitress. The tomato sauce has a nice flavour to it but due to the temperature the pizza was served at it was underwhelming

I think this is the best deep
Dish in Chicago! However it is very SAUCY and not enough toppings.

As far as Chicago Style Pizza goes you are going to be hard pressed to beat Lou's.  It is a hard thin crust pie that is thick with cheese, sauce, and toppings.  

The sauce is a tomato based homemade sauce,  with a part skim mozzarella used.  The pepperoni was very thinly sliced but abundant.  The black olives were excellent and not lacking in favor.  

The Malnati's salad comes with a mix of blue cheese and a sweetened vinaigrette.  I suspect they use canola oil for the dressing and a sweetened white wine vinegar.  It also includes extra crispy bacon crumbles.  

Service was friendly and attentive though it was very busy.  Get your table online if possible.  If not, preorder your pizza while waiting for your table.

The first pizza place we tried when we arrive in Chicago was Lou Malnati's. The wait was about 40 minutes and they told us we can preorder our pizza and by the time a table is ready for us, so is the pizza.

When we got seated, we did not get the pizza yet and we still had to order with the server.

I am not sure if the pizza was the best. I had to try another brand to determine that.

I thought it was a simple pizza, not too flavorful but the pizza got cold fast and the cheese hardens, so eat it fast!

Typical pizza joint environment, very nice staff! My boyfriend and I went for lunch and knowing ahead of time it usually takes a deep dish pizza 45 minutes to bake we went early and had a couple beers and the small deep dish serves 2 slices for 2 people, good size for 2 if you don't want leftovers. The pizza wasn't very hot but the flavor was delicious, I however thought the original had a little too much cheese my boyfriend loved the pizza! (If you don't like cheese that much like I do, ask for light cheese) Our server was Brenda F and she did awesome!

I've had the opportunity to try out Lou Malnati's numerous times throughout my life and everytime it feels like I'm just eating to quench my hunger, not that the food is good. Lou's is about as average as you can get. I'm not a fan of the crust either, it's a razor sharp brick that poorly tries to imitate Home Run Inn's butter crust and it takes away from the entire experience. By far the deep dish is their better pie. The sausage layer it has actually saves the day in some cases.

Other than that nothing really stands out, a lot of their ingredients are just meh. Prices are just ok, nothing special.

Overall, I can't recommend this place. There are much better pizzerias out there and at the same time... much worse. Lou Malnati's fits right in the middle.

3 out of 5 stars

I'm so glad I listened to the recommendation of one of my Chicago-afficionado friends when I was deciding where to eat Chicago Deep Dish: I was not disappointed! This place is great! I had the Lou in a personal size and it was quite lovely. I really enjoyed the flavour of my pizza, it came hot and was such a great texture. I'm glad this place has personal-sized pizzas as many of the other pizzerias do not have quite as small of options and I didn't want the same flavour as my dining companion (she got the lunch deal which included her sausage pie and a salad). Regardless it was great.

This location opens at 10:30am and that was wonderful as we got there shortly after 11am so that we could eat before the next part of the convention we were attending began at our hotel. It was a great choice as it wasn't terribly busy but by the time we left it was quite busy and the wait for a table would be quite long.
All I can say is the best Deep Dish Pizza and when my family come into town to visit Chicago they always crave the deep dish from Low Malnatis

Called in our pizza at 10:00 and told them we would be arriving at 10:30 to grab a table! Got their at 10:30 was seated right away, ordered the bruschetta while we waited for our pizza to cook, the bruschetta was AMAZING! The ingredients were fresh, we devoured this. We ordered a medium half cheese half deep dish. Both sides were very good, I liked the cheese better though!

Ask anyone where you should grab the best deep dish and 8/10 will say Lou Malnati's. We keep calling it Illuminati's. We had a long flight and drive into the city so we were experiencing a serious case of hanger. We wasted no time ordering the pepperoni deep dish, and some garlic bread to hold us over (deep dish takes 30 minutes so don't be like me and wait until you're starving). Everything was delicious! There are several locations around the city, but some are take out only, so make sure you check ahead of time if you plan on dining in.

Lou's is my deep dish of choice. When people come from out of town to visit, this is where I take them! This location is really convenient if you're downtown doing touristy things as it is right across the street from Merchandise Mart.

I always come in for lunch, usually slightly before or after peak times and have never had to wait for a table. Their lunch special of a personal sized cheese, sausage or pepperoni pizza and a small salad is a very nice deal and you will leave full! Service has always been good too.

I think Lou's is the best place for deep dish because they don't mess with a good thing. It's the perfect ratio of sauce, cheese and toppings. The crust on the little pizzas is always perfectly done. It's NEVER soggy (looking at you, Giordanos). I will be back, of course!

The most famous deep dish in Chicago! Highly recommended .........!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  

I don't want to type that music

Leaving Chicago wasn't too difficult when I moved to Los Angeles...however the thing I missed most of all after Ravinia - see review- and of course my family and friends was Lou Malnatis! It's the best comfort food ever. The cheese- even low fat is amazing. It's flavorful and not overpowering.  The deep dish crust is the main thing that makes Lou's special. The Lou's salad is also fabulous with delicious dressing and tons of mushrooms. I literally order it to be flown in for special occasions

This was my first time having deep dish pizza in Chicago! We tried out the "Lou", which features spinach, mushrooms, and sliced roma tomatoes. I was surprised by how much I liked the pizza, despite lacking classic protein elements. Two things made the pizza stand out to me: 1) The fresh ingredients. 2) THAT CRUST. Not your standard doughy crust. It is a wonderful crispy buttercrust that is just as delicious as the rest of the pizza.

You can also pre-order your pizza so that you can cut down on the wait time. We called about 20-25 minutes before we got the restaurant, got seated, waited another 5 minutes or so, and then dug in!

WOW!!! This place blew my mind!!! I was not a fan of deep dish pizzas because I always saw it as too heavy or too messy (and because I've only have Bj's brew house deep dish pizzas in CA).

When their was an advisory of how we needed to wait about 30 minutes after ordering, I felt a little more impressed. They would handmake the deep dish pizza by order. Which is why it would take a while to reach the table.

I had the Lou's special with tomatoes and sausage. It was VERY GOOD!

I admit, I am a thin crust pizza lover (NY style pizzas), but I will admit: Lou Malnati's took my heart with every scrumptious bite of that beloved deep dish pizza.

The crust was nice and crunchy, but not so crunchy as to think it was a thin crust. It was perfectly golden.

The toppings we chose were perfect, and the mozzarella cheese was gooey enough to blanket our pizza!

I'm a pretty big guy, but two slices of the deep dish got me feeling really satisfied and sad. I was sad because I wished I had more space in my stomach to eat the entire pie.

Hats off to you Lou, truly changed my entire deep dish pizza experience. Can't wait to come back for more!!

While visiting Chicago, I was told I should not leave without trying the deep dish pizza. A few of my friends highly recommended Lou Malnati's and so I ended up ordering delivery to my hotel on a Sunday evening. The online ordering was easy to navigate and the food was delivered right around the time that was estimated.

I ended up ordering a small build your own deep dish pizza (serves 2) as well as a Malnati salad. On my pizza I had pepperoni, cheese, and hot giardiniera. I wasn't too hungry and was able to eat the entire pizza without trouble. The pizza was decent, unique, but not great. I would come back here again in the future to get pizza in the hopes of having a better experience (maybe all the hype got my expectations up too high). The salad was a very artful creation. I loved the mushroom, bacon, and gorgonzola with a sweet vinaigrette dressing. It was a huge salad and I felt somewhat healthy eating it.

The bottom line is I would come back here again next time I'm in Chicago. I think this is a cool experience that is unique to the area and that if you're visiting you should definitely try this out for yourself. I bet the pizza also tastes better fresh out of the oven rather than being delivered.

Lou Malnati's the best Chicago pizza. Don't @ me, obviously I'm just one human with one mouth and this mouth prefers Lou Malnati's.

We get the deep dish about once a month and only once was it not perfect (it slid around on delivery) and they were great about sending us a replacement.

If you get spinach on your pizza, be warned that it is seasoned, and if i remember correctly, shredded. It's good, but it may be different than what you are used to.

I told my concierge that I was in the mood for Chicago deep dish pizza and he recommended this spot, which was about 4 blocks from my hotel. It certainly didn't disappoint. I ordered a small Malnati Chicago Classic Pizza. It takes about 35 minutes to prepare. It was worth the wait. The pizza is so thick and cheesy I could only eat 2 pieces.
I am no Chicago deep dish pizza aficionado and I know there are a lot of other spots locals probably love, but I was completely satisfied. In addition, nice bartenders who took good care of me.

I've visited Chicago a number of times, and I'm convinced Lou Malnati's is the best deep dish pizza. There are a number of locations in Chicago, and this one is a decent size. The service is also very good, and the interior is fun and inviting.

The Deep Dish Malnati Chicago Classic is my favorite, as I love the sausage. The Buttercrust on the pizza is AMAZING. I also love the Deep Dish Lou. Both are fantastic.

I will say that I am from the NJ/NY area, so I will never believe deep dish is better than our pizza! But it was a wonderful and nice change (as long as its not permanent lol!)

Definitely recommend Lou Malnati's for an authentic Chicago experience!

Wow! I'm from Los Angeles and I really wanted to experience the famous Chicago deep dish pizza! My husband and I were so happy we chose to come to Lou Malnati!
Their pizza is so good and not too doughy. The deep dish was just perfectly right! I was so impressed with this establishment and their food. We also got their house salad with the Malnati dressing! Best dressing I have ever had!! And I am a big sauce person! Had to also get the cookie for dessert- it was perfection!

They don't take any reservations, but you can preorder your pizza so that when you get to your table you don't have to wait for that long for the pizza to get ready. They also keep the pizza at your table in the pan to keep it warm longer unlike Giordano's. If you like a lot of dough then go to Giordano's. That's too much for me, which is why I think I liked Lou Malnati a lot. Also their food tasted really authentic and homemade like their marinara sauce.

Our waitress was super nice and made the experience really enjoyable too.

Definitely a must try if you are in Chicago!!!!

FUN FACT: They have over 70 ovens underneath the restaurant!!!

I was so excited to come here after reading on all the great reviews on yelp.   I came here Tuesday afternoon after my big bus tour.   I got the classic pie but was a bit disappointed with the crust.  It was really doughy borderline raw in some spots.  Probably the oven wasn't hot enough.  Fortunately the sausage and sauce was incredibly good.

pics.caption: Crust is a bit raw and doughy
Crust is a bit too doughy and dense

review.des:
Not sure what all the hype is about.  I'm not going to go into that much detail but after the the couple bites, it went downhill fast.  Pizza was a bit bland to me.  I liked the sauce for the most part.   You could tell that it was fresh tomato.   The sausage was a bit much.  They could have had less and I would have been happier.  And I don't say that about meat very often.   Maybe I'm just not a deep dish guy.  But I would 1000% take New York style pizza over this every day.   Took about an hour to get seated.  Ordered first and then was able to leave and walk around since they text when your table is ready.  We ordered calamari but the pizza came first first and we canceled that.   By the second slice I was just trying to force the pizza down with a disappointed look on my face.  

My wife and I split the medium and I was too much food for us.  I would stick with the small for a couple with a normal appetite, especially if you order an app.

I once had a hard time finding something I really enjoy eating when I was on a keto diet. No carb? So much pain! The diet didn't last over a week but I found Lou's crustless pizza the only little happiness I had in that week.
If you are also happen to on a keto or whatever diet that bans you to have carbs, you may want to order a crustless pizza which has very low carb and a lot fat -.a perfect ketogenic food but also tastes great to make the diet less painful.

We were visiting and were told we HAD to have this pizza. We were warned of the wait and put our names on the list and told it was a 30 minute wait for a table - no big deal because we could also put in our order with the expectation that our pizza would essentially be delivered to our table as we were seated. WRONG.

The wait to be seated was about 30. No complaints. It was the waiting once we were seated that was the real problem. Waiting for someone to acknowledge us. Waiting for drinks and waiting for our pre-ordered pizza. Pizza took 45 minutes after we were seated. Not that the pizza wasn't good, it's  that I don't wait for anything that long. There's just no excuse.

Warning to parents, the cheese is under the sauce (sauce is excellent), my son was scraping off the sauce and complained there was no cheese. There was plenty of cheese but it wasn't the way he was used to seeing it.

In the world of Chicago style pizza, Lou Malnati's has to rank among the top of my favorites. Though I'm not typically a fan of the deep dish pizza, when in Chicago, I must have a slice or two of this style. The crust was flaky and crunchy and served as a feature to the pie.

On this visit, I ordered the deep dish sausage. The sausage was a good blend and there was a lot of sausage on my pie. The sauce was chunky and flavorful. A good balance of sweetness and tangy, but neither was overwhelming.

Lou's is my fav local chain for deep dish. I have never had a bad pizza here. Both the deep dish and thin crust are equally great. Skip Girordano's and head here for your deep dish! The crust here is perfect. They also have an amazing salad that tastes too good to be healthy!

They do an individual pan pizza which is great when you don't want a ton of leftovers. This location is convenient and gets packed on the weekends so be ready to wait for a table during peak hours.

The line was kind of crazy but it's all about planning. We wait about 20 mins to get our name on the list then went straight to a bar close by so that we won't waste our time  Got a text in the middle of drinking (it was fairly fast), so we finished and rushed back (should have planned it better lol). We barely made it but were managed to get a table after another 10 mins wait, which I am pretty happy about. If there is one tip I would give is to order your deep dish ahead of time. It takes around 40 mins to get baked in the oven, but it was worth the wait. We ordered half "Lou" with extra pepperoni (Lou by itself is vegetarian) and half Malnati Chicago Classic. It came in less deep than I pictured in my mind haha but it was delicious. The crust was well seasoned and crispy but the toppings were fresh and juicy. I liked the Lou better cause it's more refreshing and well-balanced with the protein, and bf liked the meaty one because of course. Service was great. Very attentive even during the waiting time. I would like to go back and try out their cheese deep dish.

We ordered this for delivery and it arrived quicker than promised and it was plenty hot and very yummy.  

A good tip when ordering delivery is to order the pizza uncut -  it travels better and stays hot and together well.  

First impression - when the delivery guy handed me our two large pizzas, I couldn't believe how HEAVY they were.  I had to increase the tip for this poor guy carrying these beasts around!

We ordered a classic (sausage) and a cheese with pepperoni. We got one with the butter-crust ($.75 up-charge) just to see what that was about but there really wasn't much of a noticeable difference.  Maybe the butter-crust one didn't get as hard on the edges when it got colder later.

My son and I preferred the pepperoni for a more traditional pizza taste but my wife preferred the classic.  The others just seemed to like both equally. We fed five very hungry people and still had 1/3 of a pizza left and everyone was stuffed.

For travelers,  basically this thing is about 2" deep overall and is built from the ground up as follows: crust, then mozzarella, followed by topping (sausage/pepperoni), and finally the tomato sauce.  

Lou is very generous with his ingredients and even Mr. Creasote himself couldn't eat more than three slices of this. The cheese layer was at least a quarter inch thick and when you lifted a slice out of the box, it would raise up more than 24" and still have molten cheese connected to the remainder in the box! For the sausage is almost like they covered the whole surface with a big sausage patty!

Anyway,  it's a great Chicago style pizza that you shouldn't miss out on!

4.5

I mean damn. I thought the hype was real! Delicious pizza.  Granted I've only tried two other places that are famous in Chicago but this was one was the best! Got your basic cheese deep dish and half with sausage and I felt like I was floating on a pizza shaped cloud in heaven.

Got it uncut and even though I picked it up and walked back to my hotel, it remained warm and super crispy. Ridiculously delicious! If I lived in Chicago I'm sure I would try a million other places but I'm a New Yorker living in California and in going to say this place is super LEGIT!

The layering of the Pizza is almost perfect with every damn bite so fulfilling. The tomatoes were diced perfectly and cooked to perfection. One of my biggest reasons for always taking a regular slice over a deep dish type is some places always leave that sourness of the tomatoes in and I hate that. These tomatoes had a nice sweetness to them and I loved it!

Overall great pizza, can never go wrong with this in a million years. Will be back! My even take a whole pie back on the way for that 2500 mile drive to Cali!

Visited Chicago for my first time and everyone told me that deep dish was a must try when visiting. When I looked through Yelp, there were so many options to choose from, but Lou Malnati's had the most reviews and I was around the area so I gave it a shot. The menu was simple, and being my first time, I went with the original deep dish which consists of cheese, sausage, and tomato sauce.

If this is your first time trying deep dish from the area, be prepared to wait 30-45 minutes for the pizza because that is how long it will take for the pizza to be made. As a New Yorker, I was not used to that long of a wait for pizza because in New York, you can get your pizza within seconds to minutes of ordering.

When the pizza came, the server served it to us on our plates. These pizzas are generous with cheese, so perfect for a cheese lover! The server was patient and greatly accommodating. She recommended us items on the menu to get since it was our first time in Chicago trying deep dish.

The pizza is really filling and you have to use a fork and knife to eat. Two slices will get anyone full. The pizza that I ordered was for 2 people, it came with 4 slices and I was not able to finish my portion of the pizza. The pizza had a perfect ratio of cheese, topping, as well as tomato sauce. Definitely recommend if you are to visit Chicago!

I traveled to this location for one of the best mouth watering Chicago pizza ! There is nothing like Chicago pizza and this is one of the best there is! The deep dish crust is delicious ! The sausage is authentic Italian patties!
Although I want to try east coast sometime lol!

Wow
This place is awesome
We got the small each...it was a lot of food. This is some of the best pizza (Deep dish) I've ever had. Be warned, it gets crowded.  Not uncommon for 1-2 hour wait.  Totally worth it. Pre buy your order to save time!

Deep dish pizza heaven! Of course when we came to Chicago, my friend & I were on the hunt for the perfect deep dish pizza and this place did not let us down. We ordered the small Chicago malnati classic (4 decently-sized slices) which was more than enough for us to split. We also ordered a side of buffalo wings to split as an app which had a nice kick.

We went on a Monday night around 7 pm for dinner. When checking in w/ the host to place or name for a table, we were handed a menu to preorder our pizza since the wait time for a deep dish pizza can be quite long. However, we got seated almost immediately upstairs and placed our order then. We were given a wait time of 40 minutes for the pizza. Service was great overall. Our server constantly came to check on us to be sure we were doing ok throughout the wait time. Now that I have tried the classic, I would definitely consider coming back to try their other options (& their thin crust)!
Great first pizza in Chicago! We needed delivery for this trip and it was superb. I can only imagine how much better it would be to have it straight from the oven. We will certainly give that a shot!

Long wait but very worth while! My date and I had a drink and were able to order before we sat down so the 45 minute wait flew by. Best deep dish I've ever had hands down. It was hard to eat with a knife and our hands but that's half the fun! It was very lively and the staff were attentive to us. We had the Lou and a bruschetta for an appetizer. everything was cooked perfectly and it wasn't crazy loud inside. Would recommend to anyone who is passing through or staying in Chicago!

Extremely disappointing deep dish pizza at Lou's. Being from Florida, I was looking forward to deep dish but it didn't lead up to expectations we had heard about Lou's. Our pizza was cold and mainly all cheese and barely any sauce. It was almost as if it was previously frozen and re- heated. Couldn't even finish one slice. Ordered a small cheese deep dish and it was as if the cheese congealed more and more as we attempted to eat it. Waiter rushed us out and 5 minutes after we got our pizza, he asked if we needed a box. Might have just been an off day but would not recommend Lou's to anyone, frozen pizza is better than what we were served.

I wanted to try Chicago deep-dish pizza for the first time, and I was happy that it got to be from Lou's. We got a sausage pizza, a Lou Malnati's salad, and four slices of their tiramisu delivered to us.

The pizza was pretty great! There was sausage lining the entire pizza- there was not a single bite that didn't have some in it. I found it very interesting that the sauce was put on top of the cheese. I had two slices and was borderline sick from being so full.

What I like about their pizza is that it's not one big cheesy mess. I've had pizza where it's just a big greasy bite of cheese and a little bread or sauce, but this pizza was very in tact, not messy at all, and not too cheesy.

The salad was not very good- too much bleu cheese. The tiramisu seemed like it was straight out of the freezer and had some freezer burn.

If you've never had Chicago deep dish, I think this is a great place to first try it. Skip out on the salad and tiramisu from here.

pics.caption: Sauce is on top of the cheese

review.des:
You absolutely cannot dismiss how friggin' mouthwatering Chicago deep dish pizza is!  The cheese is gooey and its elasticity is maintained by a heated, rich layer of tomato sauce steaming underneath it.  

The proportionality of sauce, cheese, toppings, and dough is simply perfect.

Definitely one of many locations, so check it out while you're in the Windy City!

Was meeting up with a friend who was in the Midwest for a conference. She had Lou Malnati's on her to-do list, so I happily went a long. It was a Saturday night when we went for a party of 3. It was pretty chilly evening in June so Everyone was waiting inside. Really-- it felt like Everyone in the city was waiting inside. I can't even remember how long we waited, it was close to an hour probably. But we were so cold and hungry and the food smelled so good.

Finally, we were able to get to a table up on the second floor. Service was very friendly and efficient for how busy it was! Shared a simple salad to feel a little bit better about all of the calories we were about to inhale. This Chicago deep dish pizza was so decadant, buttery, delicious. This was my first time trying Chicago pizza, and for it to be Lou Malnati's... now nothing else can compare! Would highly recommend.

We weren't planning to try Lou Malnati's during our trip to Chicago but we felt like we needed to, in order to properly say which deep dish was better between Lou Malnati's and Giordano's. I can't really judge if this was a fair comparison though, because we ate Giordano's fresh out of the oven in the restaurant, but ate Lou Malnati's out of the box after ordering to-go. Another factor, we had two different flavors. Here at Lou Malnati's, we picked the Chicago style. The sausage was so tender and the sauce was just enough. However I think the difference was the crust, I just didn't enjoy it as much. Other than that I think it was pretty close to even between the two places, and you couldn't go wrong with Lou Malnati's - and I'm sure half of the population here would favor Lou Malnati's anyway.

From NYC but was in town on business and had to check out all the hype around deep dish, specifically Lou Malnati's.

It was feeling extremely lazy so ended up ordering delivery to the hotel and it was such a treat!

When I first saw the delivery man and the size of the the pizza I thought no way this could feed 1, let alone 2 people for the size. However, once I picked it up I felt from the weight it clearly was a whole different ball game then traditional pizza.

Got a Lou's special, size small which they said could feed 2 but if you're hungry and find it as delicious as I did get a size bigger than recommend.

I was expecting big things after hearing all the hype. Unfortunately, I was completely disappointed. The pizza was average. The flavors just weren't there and fell flat. I enjoyed the buffalo wings more than the pizza.

Experience: First time in Chicago and my first time having deep dish pizza. By coincidence, Lou Malnati's famously known pizzeria was a few blocks away from my hotel so we decided to try it out. When we got there my aunt realized how well known in Chicago it was and of course there was a line. They originally told us the wait was gonna be 50-60 minutes, it ended up being only 30! You could also track your how many parties are ahead of you through an app which was very convenient. Lou Malnati's also allows you to preorder before actually sitting down to get your food out faster once you actually get a table so that was another thumbs up!

Once we were finally seated we did wait a while for our pizza even though we had preordered it but it was 110% worth the wait! Being that it was my first time ever trying deep dish pizza, I don't have any other pizza to compare it to other than regular pizza and Lou Malnati's is hands down one of the best pizzas I've ever had!

Food: We were a party of three so we ordered a small size of the Malnati pizza (served 2 ppl) and one serving on the Lou Pizza. The pizza was delicious (you eat this type of pizza with forks, something I had no clue about!). Pizza was cheesy and flavor. Pizza serving was also more than enough.

Overall: I'm so glad I got to try this place out. If I'm ever back in this wonderful city I'll be sure to stop by again!

Pizza is my type of love triangle!

To start I ordered the Lou's Bruschetta, this by far is the best Bruschetta, I have ever had the privilege to try. Seriously, this bread melts in your mouth. Buttery heaven.

I ordered 2 personal size pizza's:

Deep Dish Malnati Classic: This was my first time trying deep dish pizza and it was everything I was hoping for! I wanted my pizza filled with meat and mozzarella and I am so glad I ordered it. There is a reason this is a classic.

Deep Dish The Lou: I liked it but as a pizza fan I would have preferred it thin crust.

Obviously, the Malnati Classic (IMO) should be your Go to order.

I paired the pizza with a glass of wine, because pizza and vino are a thing that everyone should try.

Of course we had to come here! What would a trip to Chicago be without some authentic pizza. We had the classic. It was amazing. The butter-crust was worth running a few extra miles. The bartender was friendly and the beer was cold. It was awesome to watch the bears win while throwing a few back in the heart of Chicago!

Lou's is fantastic but a little bit overrated. Another thing I noticed
is that their quality varies from store to store. In some places it's
tremendous in other locations its ok. But we are lucky to have them
in Chicago. They have really good salads and a killer Meatball
sandwich as well. They're Cub fans though. After the Sox won the
series in '05 their Wells St location refused to put the sound on for
the rest of the parade. How petty is that? I eat there only because
they're good. That's it.

BEST DEEP DISH I HAD! Okay so we had to wait over an out to eat here but it was well worth the wait! It's nice they have different size pizzas so you don't have to order a huge one if you don't have many people eating. The place gets really crowded so it's hard to find a place to stand if you're inside. I'm glad my friend recommended this spot to eat. It did not disappoint!
Best deep dish in Chicago. I've tried every other place and I can't seem to enjoy it as much as I love Lou's.
Love this place! Best pizza in the city, the state! Great quality fast delivery, only pizza I order!

My BF and I took his son who lives in CA to Lou's because he had been craving it!  When we arrived, we were told there was a 45-minute wait for the table but the stars must have been shining on us because we were seated within 5 minutes.  Service was friendly and upbeat.  The reason this experience got only 3 stars is that one member of the party ordered a GF pizza with toppings and no cheese due to allergy.  

The server arrived and let us know that the GF pizza had been made incorrectly (presumably with cheese), so the deep dish was delivered while the GF pizza was re-made.  In total, that took an more than 15 minutes, so everyone else had basically finished eating while the GF person (me) watched.  

The restaurant did comp the GF pizza (right thing to do) and offered a free dessert for the table (which I unfortunately could not enjoy due to ingredients).  I could most likely just chalk this up and not mention it, other than the fact that the server says 'this happens all the time with the GF pizza."  Sounds like an operational opportunity for Lou's! and word to the wise for other GF pizza fans.

I've never had deep dish pizza before, so I really had no idea what to expect.

Operationally, this place is like Kaizen-heaven. Yes, there is always a line. But they're efficient and as a former supply chain manager, that's my sweet spot. When you arrive, you give your name and phone number. That puts you on the list and they give you updates on where you are in line. Then the hostess gives you a menu and recommends you order with the cashier, because a deep dish pizza takes a while to cook since it's so big.

We were seated after 20 minutes, and our pizza came right out almost immediately after. See? Efficient!

Obviously there are flaws. If we didn't order enough food, then it would be a pain to get more pizza. There didn't seem to be a convenient elevator nearby and I had sprained my knee, so the stairs were a bit brutal for me. The plates on the table seemed to have some food on it, which looks like transfer from dirty plate onto a wet but clean plate. The staff took it away and gave me a new one, and I have no idea if they just wiped it down and gave back the same plate. But I've eaten in some sketchy places in Asia and Africa, so this was still ok for me.

pics.caption: Sauce is important, so it's not tomato soup in a bread bowl. This sauce was delicious.
Small pizza (the Lou) is enough for a light meal for 2

review.des: Avoid all others ask for extra tomatoes and extra sauce.  Best pizza on earth and I watch and follow barstool sports and am not a rookie reviewer

Vacationing in Chicago during the winter month has some drawbacks. Your face might get so numb because of the bitter cold that you may forget how many ears or noses you have. However, if you survive, you will get to enjoy some of the best deep dish pizza the city has to offer at Lou Malnati's.

Here are my ratings based on different criteria:

Quality of food: Great. We got the deep dish with cheese. I suggest ordering a size small for a group of 2 as you'll each get to have 2 slices. For a thin crust, 2 slices is not enough, however, for a deep dish this is more than enough. If one has never had a deep dish pizza before, it has basically a thick buttery crust with a lot of cheese and tomatoes piled on top. So...2 slices for lunch will have you pretty full. Lou's pizza is best compared to the competition as the sauce is not too tangy or sweet but seasoned just right. Also, the crust is not overly buttered up. The knife cuts through the crust with a nice pop proving that the crust is baked just right.

Decor: Kinda cool. Every location has a different theme but this one is all about baseball. There are all kinds of White Sox and Cubs memorabilia everywhere. From autographed team jerseys to baseballs neatly displayed in a case, this Lou's is a haven for Chicago baseball lovers.

Cleanliness: No complaints. All the tables and floor were kept clean and crumbs free!

Service: Friendly but very busy. The place was absolutely packed at 1 pm on a Saturday. This kept the staff very busy and looking stressed. The entrance area had so many people hanging out that it was impossible to get in/out and almost made it a fire hazard.

Speed of food preparation: As expected...for a deep dish pizza. Something to keep in mind when ordering a deep dish pizza is that because of the thick crust and heavy amount of toppings, your pizza will normally take 35 minutes to make. If a restaurant claims to have a deep dish ready for you in 15 minutes then either they are reheating an old pizza or not serving a true deep dish pizza.

Price: cheap. Our small pizza was $15. A glass of Root Beer with free refills for $2.75. A relatively cheap lunch for 2 if you ask me!

Everybody has their own favorite spot in Chicago for a true deep dish pizza. That's what makes this city great! For me, Lou's wins it hands-down when compared to the other 3 big competitors (Gino's, Giordano's, and Uno).

My first experience with Chicago Style Deep Dish pizza began years ago at Lou Malnati's. Upon trying this place a second time, I left satisfied and (only slightly) underwhelmed. They undoubtedly serve a solid deep dish pizza and their service is good. Based on high expectations and tough nearby competition, this place is A-OK. Three stars for Lou Malnati's.

My favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago!

BF and I both got personal sizes so the crust was crispy and the taste was delicious. I definitely recommend getting personal sizes unless you have a large party. Comparing it to Giordianos, it's definitely better. The crust and the taste alone will have you coming back.

Keep in mind it takes a while to cook deep dish pizzas so order a small appetizer if you are starving, while they cook your pizza. But don't get discouraged by the wait time, Lou Malnati's is worth it.

Lou Malnati's Chicago Classic Pizza (sausage) is to die for. First, the crust is buttery and delicious. Then comes the cheese, next a big "brick" of sausage, and finally the freshest tomato sauce ever. The Caesar salad is very good also. It has tomatoes which is different. The shaved Parmesan cheese is tasty.

we had a group of about 15 and Lou's made the experience really easy. they booked us upstairs with plenty of room for us to mingle before dinner, with frequent wait service to order drinks. the wine list isn't extensive but the pinot noir was pretty good and was very suitable for a more casual pizza night.

the tables each had 2 large salads, a Caesar and a Greek. both were actually really good, not too heavily dressed and with lots of tomatoes, cheese, and olives in the Greek.

the pizzas were served slice by slice from the waiters, which was a little awkward for the hungry eaters at the table who had to wait for the second or third piece, and I think some people were uncomfortable to have to keep asking. luckily the deep dish slices were super filling so it wasn't too much of a problem.

the crust was flaky and stood up to the heavy pie. I had a slice of the vegetarian and liked the roasted tomato slices on top but wish there was a lot more mushroom and spinach.

We were recommended Lou Malnati's (which I kept misunderstanding as Illuminati) by multiple people during our last trip to Chicago. I've visited other deep dish pizza establishments in Chicago before, and while they've tasted good, I've never felt totally wowed by deep dish pizza.

But now, I have to say that Lou Malnati's is the best out of all of them, and I am definitely going back the next time I'm in Chicago. They've perfected deep dish pizza so that the crust isn't soggy, the toppings stay intact on your plate instead of flowing flat into a pile of ingredients, and the flavors are simple and delicious.

The service is also really great; our server cut the pizza up like a true professional, and served each slice to each of our plates quickly and cleanly. I mean, I guess that sounds kind of high maintenance, but I've had bad experiences cutting and serving deep dish pizza before, so I appreciated his help!

I see why everyone talks about butter crust - that stuff is delicious!
I'm not from Chicago, nor do I live there, but I have tried a few of the more 'popular'/chain pizza places and I must say - I can't tell a huge difference (sorry!!!). They are all good in their own way.
The sauce was on point, maybe a bit more cheese would have done the trick.
The service was friendly, if a little slow, but the food was good & thats what really matters in my world!

Hands down way better than Giordano's! Love their buttery crust. Ordered half the classic and the Lou. The Lou was soooooo good! It's less than cheesy than Giordano's but that's why I like it better. It's less greasy and way more flavorful instead of just cheese. The line was so long even at 5 o'clock. We put our name down and went to a bar next door to chill until it was ready. You can order ahead so the food will be out by the time you are seated. We waited about 1 hour.
Lou's hardly needs another 5 star review.  It's the best!

Ah-mazing! A must when in Chicago area. I know there's a pizza challenge by the locals for Lou's vs Giordano's and I feel bad weighing in as a non-local BUT after asking several locals and trying myself - Lou's is the winner. The Malnati's salad is one of the best salads I've ever had in my life! It tastes like a wedge salad but with a lighter vinaigrette dressing. It's the most popular and worth splitting the family size to start off with. They even sell their dressing! We got the Classic deep dish half sausage and half cheese, a medium for two people but honestly we couldn't finish it. We could've gotten a small after sharing the salad. Going to NYC often, we were hesitant about Chicago deep dish pizza but it's a totally different taste and filling pie, DELICIOUS!!!
The staff was so friendly and helpful, a must visit!

We stopped in on a food tour, and had a wonderful slice of Lou's deep dish pizza. It was perfect!  Thank you for being part of the Food Planet food tour and exposing us to a wonderful experience. We will be back.

Well I have to admit it! I liked it. I have tried all the Chicago style pizza restaurants and this one is the best. I like that you put your name on the list and while you wait for a table they cook your pizza!  The roasted tomatoes were the yummy and so much cheese!!

Hitting this those 4 stars, because it's not the best pizza I've ever had, but it might be the best deep dish.

They've got their service mostly figured out.  Don't be deterred by the long line up front.  You can put your name in and order your pizza immediately.  Lou's will text you when your table is ready.  Just don't be farther than 5 minutes away.  We smashed some margaritas and chips with salsas at Pink Taco next door.  Don't judge us, we were on a foodie weekend.  We got the call and dashed to get our seat.

We were seated comfortably near the front of the restaurant and bar.  The three of us shared a medium deep dish, with pepperoni and jalapeño.  I think deep dish needs a sausage with some dimension to fill it out, so maybe we will try that next time.  We also had a salad, which to be honest, it didn't seem like Lou cared much for his salad.  It was out of a bag, with barely any dressing on it. Is it serviceable as a side? Barely.  We downed all this with a pitcher a Revolution Anti-Hero IPA.

So yea, do Lou's.  Don't be intimidated.  And stick with the za.

Came for their famous deep dish pizza. 45 min wait to cook the pizza, so we ordered an appetizer and beer first. Loved the calamari, crispy and fresh. Ordered Small Lou add pepperoni and hot giardiniera, which was awesome. Extremely filling; a small was enough for the 2 of us.

I've only had Lou Malnati's deep dish, so I've got no other Chicago staples to compare it to, but I really liked it. I was here in the very back room upstairs with a food tour, so we came on a Saturday morning when it wasn't crowded.

We each had a slice of deep dish pizza, specifically par baked deep dish cheese pizza with a butter crust. The cheese was cheesy, the crust was thick and bready, and it was nice and hot. Apparently, they use slices of cheese instead of shredded cheese. I loved the taste of really fresh tomatoes on the pizza! Our food tour guide said they don't use tomato sauce; they use crushed tomatoes.

I liked it! Again, I don't know how it compares to other places, but I wouldn't be opposed to coming back!
Out of the deep dish chains, Lou's is probably the best. Always high quality, pizza is tasty if not a little heavy.
This deep dish pizza is way lighter than Giordano's. The crust is very crispy and the amount of cheese/sauce is just right. I really enjoyed it.

I'm glad I tried deep dish here! We came late night after our flight so we were starving and Lou Malnati's is the most satisfying type of food you can get in Chicago.

We ordered one small deep dish and split it half Lou and half Classic. I loved the Lou and my husband thoroughly enjoyed the meat-laden Classic. I'm glad we got a small and split because it was a LOT of pizza. Extremely filling and tasty. The server was super nice and offered suggestions for us deep dish novices.

If I come back to Chicago, I'm definitely stopping by Lou Malnati's again.

Had the Chicago Classic. We went in with high hopes and they delivered! The Pizza met all our expectations! Buttery Crust, lots of lean and tasty Sausage, delicious Marinara and a perfect amount of gooey cheese!
All the hype is justified - don't leave Chicago without trying this Pizza!

We had a meeting at work and ordered up Pizza from the Wells Street location, it arrived within an hour, was hot.  I suggested to my boss that he order from Lou's, they open at 10:30AM and that worked great for our lunch meeting.   It was a last minute decision by our guy in charge to order pizza.  So our fairly large order went to Lou's, I figured they could handle it.  They did.

The deep dish was the same as ever from there, top notch.  Sadly the thin crust does not live up to some of the better thin crusts around, like Pat's or Vito and Nick's.  If you have ever had either one of those thin crusts, that is the gold standard as far as I think thin crust pizza should be.  The sausage thin crust from Lou's could have been more crispy, a little thinner perhaps and for sure, cooked more.

We were traveling for work and this place came highly recommended. Having not been impressed by my first Chicago Deep Dish, I was hesitant.
We started out with bruschetta, which was really good. I then had a cup of minestrone. While it was good, it 'could' have come from a can.
We each had our own personal size Malnati Classic deep dish pizza. I added garlic and onions, while my friends added jalapeños and others. The pizza was exceptional and enough to fill me up.
We finished by sharing the Tre Dolci. The chocolate chip pizza was the best of the three. The key lime pie was good, but no better/worse than others I've had. The tiramisu, however, ranked lowest for all three of us.
I had both the seasonal drink (Red, White, and Blou [pictured]), and the twisted lemonade. Both were good, but the twisted lemonade was the best.
We sat in the back on the main floor. While a little crowded and loud, we still enjoyed ourselves.

Pizza took about 30-40 minutes like the waiter said. He was very sweet and very attentive. Made sure we got everything promptly and even checked to see what kind of frozen pizza they had left.

BEST OF THE BEST PIZZA, CHEESE BREAD AND SALAD! don't miss out!

There's only Lou's as far as Pizza goes.    Deserves 6 yelp stars and 3 Michelin stars.  Been a customer since 1977.  
God bless Lou and Ed L.

I was visiting Chicago with my friend; we would park our car and visit the city on foot. So, we got lost going to a pizza place; when we checked to see the closest pizzeria, this one popped up. It was said to be the best pizzeria in Chicago. So my friend and I decided to check it out.

Right when we arrived, we could get the cool vibe emerging from the place. First off, a few people were conversing outside waiting on their pizza. The conversations and laughter coming out the little crowd made us thing the we were off for a good start. We got in and put ourselves on the waiting list for a table. There is an option on putting your order in online while waiting on your table to reduce the wait time; however, since it was our first time there, we didn't want to risk it. So we waited about 30-45 minutes.

Finally, we were sited in a little corner overlooking the street, but still offered privacy. Then we placed our order. Water came to my mouth when the waitress came in with our deep dish pizza. Let me tell you, it was worth the wait. They have this hot pepper flakes that I spread  over my pizza which give it this little spicy hint. Man!! that pizza was so juicy and  was melting in my mouth. I am telling you, I got much more than I was expecting.

I cannot testify as to whether this place is the best pizzeria in Chicago, but It's the best pizza that I have ever had in my life.

pics.caption: In Chicago for the first time; checking this place out

review.des:
Holy Pizza!!! This was the BEST pizza we think we ever had! We ordered delivery and it came piping hot and delicious! There was only 3 of us - but a large pizza fed us well for dinner, and 2 late night snacks! The deep dish Malnati was amazing and I highly suggest it! The 3 cheese bread was delicious too!

Best pizza in Chicago!!!!

Man...I thought deep dish would be better than this. I had imagined a flaky thick crust, with hot melted cheese, topped with a lot of tomato sauce.

What I got: dry crust, unmelted cheese, decent amount of tomato sauce.

Pro tip 1: after putting your name on the wait list, you can pre-order at the cashier's so that they can get your order running. They only take pizza orders, and the appetizers and such are taken at your table.
Pro tip 2: Bar seating is also available. First come first serve, and make sure to bring your ID!

We ordered:
1. Calamari fritti ($9.95) //
+1 really good tomato sauce! So good that I wanted even more!
+1 Fried well, and breading was light enough so that it didn't have an overkill in flavor.

2. Medium size "The Classic" ($21.05) //
+1 Good portion size. Definitely true to serving size of 3 people!
-1 Too much cheese that did not melt all the way....
+1 liked the sausage- definitely not the cheap pellets!
-1 Tomato sauce not evenly distributed, so it got super dry as I got to the bottom
-1 Really dry crust, even though it's supposed to be butter crust?
-1 I wish my pizza was piping hot. Sadly, it was not...
