There are both bottom and top floor seating options. They prompt you to order the pizza you want up front since it takes 40 minutes to cook, then you wait to be seated!

Ok so, fast forward to us being seated... Voila! The deep dish large pizza has arrived! Oh my lantaaaa, the aroma just engulfs your being. The waitress cuts it at the table for us and plates it. The large pizza was easily shareable between 4-5 people with seconds to spare!

The pizza - ooooey, gooooey goodness! Everything you can imagine a deep dish straight from the kitchen of Chicago would be!

Thank you, it was grrrrreat!

Delicious pizza, tasty salad with housemade Gorgonzola dressing, and excellent service. This Lou's does it right! We enjoyed the lunch special which included a pepperoni pizza and salad for about $10.

Favorite Chicago pizza. Make sure it try the Lou or the sausage pizza. Deep dish is a must at this place it will change your life. Also I love ranch and giardinara with my pizza so ask for them on the side. Some restaurants have different appetizers I love the mozzarella sticks they are baked perfectly. Also adding the butter crust is a must to every deep dish order.

Location:
Lou Malnati's is located in downtown Chicago, IL. I was in town on business and my hosts insisted we give this a try.

Vibe:
The atmosphere has an old-school vibe, with lots of activity, which was the perfect atmosphere for this business.

First Impressions:
We did make reservations and were very glad we did. The place was jam packed with people. We were greeted immediately and told our table would be ready in 20 minutes. The nice thing is they provide menus and ask that you place your order before your table is ready.  We did so and then hung out at the bar.  We were seated earlier than the 20 minutes.

Food and Drink:
We started with a couple of appetizers to include bruschetta and a calzone like dish  Both were very good.  The martinis were also made well.  We each order a different pizza with the intent on sharing and taking the left overs with us. The pizzas were Chicago deep dish and we could have easily shared two pizzas and have been more than satisfied.  The pizzas were both very good but we served at room temperature.  Would have preferred them being hot.  Maybe this was because we had to order prior to being seated?  Not sure why but did not expect that.

Overall Experience:
The drinks, food and service was very good.  Our waitress was very attentive and extremely nice. This is a fun place to experience and I can recommend giving it a try.

Tips:
The bar is very small.  Don't plan to hang out for drinks prior to dinner if the place is as busy as it was for us that night.
Pizza was ok. Def not life changing like the first time i came to Chicago. Service was top notch and the wait wasn't bad.

We arrived to Chicago for the first time, and wanted to try its famous deep dish pizza. We checked Yelp and chose the restaurant  with the highest ranking, which was Lou Malnati's. The place is pretty packed, we had to wait for 10 minutes, we made a preorder though. Anyways, we were waiting our pizza for 40 mins, although it is said 30 mins to make it. It couldn't be a problem if the pizza wouldn't be such a disappointment. It's really hard to call it "deep dish" pizza, because it was pretty thin. And it was warm, not hot, so we ate the second slices cold. The waiter was nice. Beer was good too.
Really good for deep dish pizza! We got the Lou which hit the spot but I also couldn't eat more than a slice. If you have to pick a Chicago pizza spot, this is it.

Enjoyed the best deep dish pizza!! The Lou is the best. While they said there was 45 minutes wait, but they are creative, they let us order the pizza ahead of the time and brought the food much more quickly once on the table. The large pizza says it feeds four, but accompanied with large salad, it would feed our party of 6 (4 adults and 4 kids) easily. Great experience and not too expensive either.

Interesting way to manage the queue of people who want to try Lou Malnati's pizza. You check-in and then wait for a text when your table is ready.
As you wait outside the restaurant, you get the nice pizza smell outside (weather permitting) which raises your appetite too.
We ordered "The Lou", Calamari Fritti, garlic bread and minestrone soup. All the dishes were delicious and quite filling. We were so full that we had no space for dessert.

pics.caption: Lou Malnati from across the street

review.des: One of the legendary pizza places and had to try the true deep dish. The crust was crispy, full, buttery, not too flaky. The sauce itself might have been the best part - slightly watery, soaked up well by the sauce, the ingredients were very well done.
I think everyone has a different preference for Chicago pizza, but for me it is Lou Malnati's. I just love the crust and sauce. Out of all the places in Chicago, Lou is my favorite. Awesome pizza.

I always order a deep dish pizza. I preferred date this over thin crust and are usually get the Chicago classic and add pepperoni.  Most of the time I have it delivered,  but I have eaten in the dining room on State Street, in Chicago. Love this pizza place!

Always searching for the best thin crust pizza in Chgo...  Lou Malnati's is right up there. Interesting and tasty crust with fresh toppings. We had the meatball and mushroom pizza which was excellent...
Forgot to mention the chicken wings which were also very good

Lou Malnati's is hands down my favorite pizza shop in Chicago. The best deep dish pizza ever! The buttercrust makes everything that much better. I've also had their fettuccine Alfredo and wings, and I wasn't disappointed. Everyone rants and raves over Giordano's pizza, but Lou Malnati's definitely has them beat!
I've crossed over, Chicago pizza is THE BEST!! It was incredible, I was in heaven! This restaurant is worth the wait. We ordered our pizza when we were put on the list to get a table which was great.

Lou's is firmly in the Mount Rushmore of Pizza in Chicago.  Their buttery, flakey crust separates their deep dish from your run of the mill Chicago style joint.  Don't sleep on their thin crust either, which is also among the best in the city.  If you're not in a coma after throwing back a few heavy slices, their warm cookie with ice cream is a fantastic desert to cap off what is always an incredible meal.

Bad service (en general, even in the bar, except for Alex the server on the 2nd floor)
1:30 wait time
Good pizza but is not enough
Whenever we have out-of-town visitors who want the best deep dish pizza Chicago has to offer, we ALWAYS take them to Lou Malnati's. It is, hands down, the best deep dish pizza in Chicago.

Wow. This pizza ticks all the boxes for an absolutely delicious, decadent, crunchy, juicy, savory Chicago style pie. Rarely is it so evident that every component is made in house. Generous meat placement and sauce/cheese coverage, crunchy crust on bottom and sides. The service was also amazing. Delightful in every way.

They're good and they know it! Hailed as the best deep dish in Chicago, this place doesn't need much explaining. The Buttercrust is amazing. Be ready to wait because the pizza takes 45 minutes. And if you don't get the deep dish, you're a fool!

I don't get to go to Chicago much have been maybe three times my entire life and the past few times I've visited Lou Malnati's pizza I really enjoyed it never been to this establishment before cuz there's about 20 of them across the city of Chicago so my family and I stopped in here on a Monday night. 6 it is extremely crowded which is not their fault whatsoever it's a good thing but Monday night at 6: 55 minute wait now I have a 2 year old and 4 year old so anybody out there with kids know how difficult it is to control it to 6 in the evening once again not their fault I just wanted to establish what I was going through I've been waiting and waiting for this Lou Malnati's ever since I found out we are coming to Chicago so I was excited we pre-ordered our pizza and 55 minutes later we were seated in the totals would be another 20 minutes which I was a little upset about order my kids a spaghetti kids meal and it was out in about 5 minutes so they ate their spaghetti they were finished and then I'll Pizza arrived and my 2 year old is ready to go in the pizza unfortunately was just not very good it was just not up to par and I don't know what it is it might have been because there was 7 million people in The Establishment and they made 40 million but the cross just didn't taste that great and there was enough sauce on top of it which is very unfortunate so I'll give it a three out of five I mean it was still good but for the price of $26 for a medium sausage pizza it's just not worth it in my opinion so we went to another deep dish Italian restaurant the day before and it was much better I gave that one to five out of five I don't know might just caught him on a bad night but I'm disappointed
Love it! One of my faves! I love to bring my out of town family to try a Chicago classic :))

Came to Chicago and had to try deep dish pizza. With tons of options, I did not know which one to choose. Eventually felt that Lou Malnati's was getting more recommendations than the others.

I headed over to the location on Wells around 11:30am on a Saturday. It wasn't packed but it seemed like a tour group was heading in there around the same time. I ended up sitting at the bar since it was convenient and they have full service there as well. Didn't get any drinks besides water and chose the Malnati's special (personal size).

They were not kidding when they say it takes about 35 minutes but watching tv for a bit and chatting it up and the time kind of flew by though I kept thinking about the pizza. It finally came out and after a photo, I dug in (with a fork and knife. Fork and knife not required but helpful. When you first look at it, the personal size didn't seem too big but it was deep and heavy so it is enough. The crust was amazing. It was the perfect crispness and felt almost like a pie crust. As for the filling, I felt the cheese was too tough and not gooey at all. it felt like a block of cheese underneath the sauce and meats. As for the meats, it was overwhelming. The sausage was laid out over all of the pizza and there was no other flavor that permeated through. The tomatoes on top also leaked out some water so if I didn't let out the juices, I felt the crust would get somewhat soggy.

I love deep dish and I was definitely looking forward to getting some in Chicago. The pizza was decent but not as good as I expected. Overall, the service was decent as well but I felt a bit pushy in terms of getting a drink (even though I was sitting at the bar). I will have to try out the others to do a proper comparison...

I had dinner at Lou Malnati's Pizza on my first night in Chicago. I ordered a House Salad with their House Red Wine Viniagrette Dressing and the "Lou." It was EXCELLENT! The Deep Dish pizza was tasty, though it does take a while for them to cook it. The salad was alright, I had to ask for extra dressing because there was barely any on there. They also ask you to prepare for at least a 45 minute wait. The sever was attentive. Overall, I would definitely go back and I would absolutely recommend Lou Malnati's to anyone that wants authentic Chicago style deep dish pizza.

pics.caption: The "Lou" Deep Dish Pizza! It was sooooo GOOD!

review.des:
I've lived 45 miles north of Chicago my whole life, I've grown up on the Chicago style pizza, thin and deep dish, but sadly, I've never had many actual Chicago pizza. Went there today, was blown away. We got the Lou's special, and I never want another pizza again in my life, I was so blown away!
While waiting for a table, they take your order, which cuts down on your time big time. Very awesome experience in that part.
But the main course was the pizza. Perfectly cooked cheese on the bottom, sausage in every bite, and the Crust, my god, melt in your mouth amazing.
Thank you Lou's for ruining my pizza experience forever, since I may never have a better pizza ever again!

This is what deep dish pizza is all about!  First time traveller to Chicago and this place did not disappoint. Took the advice of reviewers and ordered it to go, since the place is small and always busy (which it was).

Had the standard deep dish and stuffed cheesy bread. Both were mouthwatering and packed full of flavor (and cheese!).  Perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned, and exactly how I wanted to start my trip to Chicago.

pics.caption: Small deep dish and stuffed cheesy bread

review.des:
No trip to Chicago would be complete with a visit to Lou Malnati's to feast on their specialty deep-dish pizzas.

After a trip to Millennium Park to do "touristy things," my friends and I decided to stop here for a quick dinner. We came at around 9 on a Monday  evening and there was about a 20 minute wait for seats. No biggie. Once we were seated, our server greeted us and took our orders. We settled for an order of fried calamari, Lou's bruschetta and the Malnati's salad. All 3 appetizers were delicious and were amazing to munch on before our deep-dish pizzas came.

For the pizzas, we settled for the large Lou and a large sausage thin crust. Be warned that the deep-dish pizzas take about 30-45 minutes to prepare since they make everything fresh. Once our pizzas came, we all looked forward to digging in, and at the end, we weren't disappointed. The pizzas definitely filled us up and were delectable. We even had a few slices left over to take home.

Overall, I definitely enjoyed my experience here and I'll definitely be back whenever I'm back in Chicago. Our server was quick and efficient and even had the patience to deal with 10+ rowdy college kids.

I'm sure there are better kept secrets amongst the locals than Lou Malnati's. But even a lot of Chicago locals I've spoken to consider this to be the first name in pizza. And it was good, but I guess I was just expecting something more.

Their reputation seems to hinge on their crust. And that was certainly the unexpected surprise to me - it's not a dense, doughy crust. Instead, it's thinner than I had expected, crisp, and buttery. The sauce was really good too; not sweet, but not acidic either.

It's better than chain deep dishes, sure. I guess I just expected it to be dramatically better. Instead, I left - satisfied enough - wondering why some people are such hardcore deep dish devotees. To me, the difference between a pie at Malnati's and Pizzeria UNO's is just a more interesting crust and slightly better sauce.
If you know anything about CHICAGO pizza this is the only real CHICAGO pizza. Must must must must have ! So good but won't eat a lot after haba

Had lunch here the other day while on a vacation in Chicago. Had the family with me and went to great lengths to state how good the pizza is. While they agreed when we eventually received it 55 minutes after ordering we all agreed worst server we experienced in over 20 years. Just did not pay attention to our table at all. We had to ask several times for drink refills and she gave no status when the food would be ready as we all know it does not take an hour on a weekday at 2:30 pm. Overall, she was NOT pleasant.

Lou's needs to step up the game with wait staff quality.

It is like basic training is not a part of the program anymore.

Very disappointing.

Fun environment.   Great service.   We were seated quickly even though the said 30 minute wait.  Great wings and bruschetta  appys.   Deep dish pizza was good.   Cheese pie could have had more flavor but meat pie was really good.  Chocolate chip dessert was amazing!    I highly recommend this place.   Just needs more TVs for the games.

Customer service is great!

Ordered the calamari fritti, the lou, and the classic.

Calamari was amazing especially with the red sauce. It's served on a lettuce leaf with a star cut lemon. Make sure to squeeze the lemon over the calamari.

The pizzas were not exactly what I was expecting. It was a smaller than I imagined and the pizza in my opinion needed a little salt.

It took us about 45 minutes to get our pizza, but it was 100% worth the wait. We opted for the traditional malnati pizza. The pizza was beyond perfect. Rich buttery crust, the sausage and sauce were delicious, and the amount of cheese was perfect. By far our favorite Chicago deep dish!

Food: I typically don't like deep dish, but the Lou's special from here is SO good! I tried deep dish from a couple other places, but I'm so glad I looked up yelp reviews and tried this place first. It was hands down the best deep dish I tried while in Chicago.

Be aware it takes about 40 mins for the pizza to cook after you order it. And yes, it's still 40 mins even if you get a personal size so try looking at the menu before you arrive. I suggest getting the spinach salad with fresh fruit and goat cheese while you wait.

Parking: There is street parking however you have to pay the meter and it's a 2 hour max. There are also parking lots nearby.

Ambience: I sat in the first room when you enter and it was well lit & a lot more inviting then some pictures I've seen on other reviews.

pics.caption: Lou's special - personal size. So yummy!

review.des: The Original Lou pizza was fairly tasty with italian sausage and extra cheese. It was a busy afternoon on a wednesday, and were told that if we preorder our pizza, it would come out earlier. We preordered our personal pizzas and then were sat down 10 minutes thereafter. The pizza didn't come out until 45 minutes later. The pizza and service was pleasant however the pizza just took longer than what was told to us.
This is a Chicago staple. The Lou with giardinara (another Chicago tradition) is my fave - thin or deep - and you should try both. I prefer my pizzas delivered, uncut

Great deep dish pizza that's very comparable to Giordano's but for me it's a tad better because of the Minalti classic with the lean sausage patty underneath the sauce and cheese and the better crust is tastier that Giordano's. But to be honest you couldn't go wrong with either of these options.
Cornbread butter crust. Yeah, it's that good. I also ordered the three dip and chip appetizer which was okay.

Ordered a pizza to go tonight 11/3. The pizza was supposed to be ready at the 11:40 (I manage a pizza restaurant so I knew to give some time for error). When I got there at 11:55 and they said the pizza was broken so the new one would be ready in 12 minutes and no problem! Ordering a pIzza at midnight, i had nothing but time. When I got back, i had a discount on the pizza and even though closed, the staff was so nice. A+ To the manager on duty (I didn't catch his name) and A++ to his staff! Great experience that could have gone much differently

GO TO PEQUOD'S

This place was SO DISAPPOINTING

GO TO PEQUOD'S

We came for lunch and the the server didn't have time to answer our questions and rushed and pressured us to put the order in even when we weren't ready.

GO TO PEQUOD'S

GO TO PEQUOD'S

GO TO PEQUOD'S

A small pizza was $25.

GO TO PEQUOD'S

Pequod's is so tasty and good and cheap.

GO TO PEQUOD'S

Legit a$$ pizza!!!!!!!!! This place was last on my itinerary, but I wish we came here the first thing we landed in Chicago. Had to order to go since we were running a bit late to the airport for our flight back home. We ordered a personal "The Malnati Chicago Classic". Came out so fresh and it was perfect for two people to share, it was also perfect for my hangover that I had that morning. I really didn't expect much since I don't like New York style pizza's at all, but you MUST try Lou Malnati's. Believe the hype because best believe it is that amazing!!!!!!!

We had the Chicken club salad and the Lou's deep dish pizza. The salad had chicken, bacon, and a couple of different cheeses. Tasty but too heavy for us. The pizza had mushrooms, tomatoes, and a lot of cheeeeeeze. Pizza crust was nothing to write home about. Too heavy. Prefer NY thin crust.

Acceptable service.

Visited Chicago for the first time and obviously had to have some of that famous deep dish pizza! We had a long day and decided to order delivery for dinner. We were able to order everything online, did half spinach, half sausage, and it took just about the amount of time to get the food that we were told - which was wonderful.

Once the pizza came, it was the delicious, cheesy mess I was hoping for! We ordered a small, which was perfect to split for 2 people. Also got it extra crispy, so it held together really nicely and made for a nice texture.

Definitely lived up to the hype.

Apparently when it's rainy and chilly in Chicago, 23% of the city's population comes to this Lou Malnati's location for deep dish pizza. Time to get in line.

My experience with pizza is generally New York style--at the most, i'm waiting 12 minutes for a pie, though sometimes it's being cooked in a custom 850 degree ceramic oven and it's ready in 43 seconds.

In Chicago, pizza takes time. This was my first time with deep dish, so I was coming in very open minded, very excited, and very hungry. Sauce on the top? Sure, why not?

We waited just over an hour for our table, but preordered our chosen pizzas beforehand. The hour went by pretty quickly--the bar was close and there was plenty of people watching to do.

Once we sat, the salads showed up first, and about 20 minutes later, the pizza came. We had the classic sausage and the pepperoni, and the sausage was by far my favorite. A gigantic wheel of solid sausage was surrounded by cheese on all sides, and had a crust that was far crunchier than I expected. I did cut the first few slices knife and fork style, but the rest I was able to pick and eat like normal.

Back to the sausage--I don't mean that there were "a lot of sausage crumbles" or "a lot of sausage patties"--I mean there was a gigantic wheel of sausage that was the exact diameter of the pan and a solid quarter inch thick. Every bite had sausage. Sausage. So much sausage. Sausage surrounded by cheese, topped with sauce, wrapped up in a big crust hug.

New York pizza is my standard slice, but i'll never say no to deep dish done right.

TIP - read the size recommendations and follow it!

I ordered a Personal size. I thought it would be big enough for my bf and I. NOPE! Super tiny. lol. Definitely good for 1 person (Get it? Personal size). Or good for 2 kids to share.

Pizza was good. I can see why it's so popular. I ordered for pickup, so my order was ready when I got there. Easy and convenient. There was a long line when I got there.

I've had the pleasure of eating Lou's on more than a few occasions. I've sampled the calamari, fries, salads, and a couple of the deep dish pizzas. Let me tell you, just order "the Lou" and you will be happy. It is the best deep dish pizza I've had and the flavors are pure succulence. There are some fun little cheeses, spinach, tomato, as well as a garlic butter crust which combine beautifully to the delight of my tastebuds. When I'm feeling extra hongry I add sausage. I've never had anything bad from there. It's a great casual Chicago spot and in my opinion they have the best deep dish. Definitely recommend trying it once.

This place is amazing! If you want the best authentic Chicago deep dish pizza, you need to go here! We ate here during both trips to Chicago and will hopefully go back next time too. The pizza is pricey but oh so worth it!

This place is always packed! Went to Chicago for a girls trip and even though we'd been going around on our own food tour we knew we had to squeeze in Lou Malnati's in our itinerary. So what did we do? Order TO GO!

It worked out perfect since we had finished our boat architecture tour and had to walk to the restaurant. I called ahead and ordered a small pepperoni pizza. We just had lunch before the tour and was full but still had to get some Pizza. They said it'd be ready in 15 minutes.

Once we arrived it was a madhouse. This place is very popular so expect a line if you want to be seated! The small pizza was almost ready, and some of the other girls even ordered food once we arrived and still got it in a reasonable time.

That little pizza was some of the best bites as we ate and walked around downtown Chicago! :D love the deep dish!! Last time I had a bigger portion, it did get a little filling, so this was the perfect size!

Did lots of research to find the best pizza place in Chicago and many said this place. And I knew I was there when the line of people were waiting outside and even more people were inside.  There was an hour wait once I finally got inside and put my name down.

They did have free pizza made and sitting on the counter for those who were waiting which is a nice touch.  They were also allowing people to pre order which is a good option. While I don't know how much longer it would have been if I didn't pre order, it's still better than waiting and hour for a table then ordering.

Got the deep dish option with the famous butter crust and a thin crust personal pizza.

Th thin crust option was pretty good. It's crispier and more like a cornmeal crust which is different. The toppings I had were chicken sausage, mushroom, and the spinach mix which has garlic and onion in it. So good.

I know people like deep dish but I sure don't so I was very pleased with the thin crust option.

Only con is I wish the small was smaller honestly. It's meant for two people vs one like the menu said.

Worth a stop seeing as the whole town is there lol

Went here for their famous Chicago pizza. The hostess said the wait would be 50 mins but it only took 20 mins. We preordered the pizza and waited about 20-30 minutes once we were seated for the food. The pizza was delicious- I would recommend getting a small and not an individual (leftovers are always good). They did mess up one order at our table but it was a small fix and they adjusted it on the bill. Definitely worth going to!

The crust on this pizza is absolutely to die for!!! This is the best pizza I have ever had in Chicago ! It is always a stop when I travel to the greatest city in the world. The staff is always friendly and even though it is always crowded, the staff is well organized. A must on your visits to Chicago .

We were back home in Chicago and ordered delivery from here. They didn't send any red pepper or parmesan which officially makes them the WORST. PIZZA. IN. CHICAGO. Seriously, who sends a pizza with nothing else? We had to call to get them to send it and our pizza was cold by the time it arrived.

Started with spinach bread stuffed with cheese and spinach and pizza split in half - first half is the Malnati pizza with lean sausage, mozzarella and tomato sauce on butter crust (so good) and second half is Lou's pizza with spinach, garlic, basil, onion and mushroom on garlic butter crust!! I would get the Malnati's pizza again. Overall a great experience.

We came on a Monday night around 6pm and only faced a 20 minute wait for two. Started with the Calamari which came in delicious large juicy chunks. Then followed with a small Chicago Classic pizza. It was scrumptious. Sad we couldn't take our leftovers as we were lodging at a hotel. The crust is crunchy and heavily buttery just as promised on their menu, there was a thick (nearly solid) layer of sausage crumbled over a substantial  layer of mozzarella, all covered with a delightfully fresh and light-tasting coating of chunky tomato sauce. There are no gimmicks here -- the ingredients for each flavorful and well made, layered for an impressive deep dish. Come here if you like your crusts super crunchy and buttery; that was definitely the standout characteristic for us.
Staff was nice, pizza was delicious. I don't eat dairy so they accommodated that well. The wait is long but goes quick and the process is smooth.

First off, I do like Lou Malnati's pizza.  However, I find the service at this location to be lacking.  As usual, when traveling to Chicago for business, I get seated in the smallest corner seat they have.  I get that they want to save better tables for larger groups who will buy more.  But this place wasn't busy.  Anyway, par for the course and it just isn't this place.  So, on this trip I ordered a beer, a small house salad, and a personal size deep dish pizza.  Items are usually delivered by runners and not your actual server.  It took forever to get my beer.  When it arrived, it was in a dirty glass, but the kid dropped it off and split.  So, I was stuck with it. Next, the salad arrived.  I waited so long, I wanted another beer.  The delivery person dropped off the salad and split, so, there was no chance to place an order.   The house salad dressing, which is a red wine vinaigrette, is really good and a favorite of mine.  Unfortunately, my salad had a hair in it.  I will give them the benefit of the doubt on that one.  After all, I guess it could have been mine.  Besides, there was no one around to tell about it anyway.  Since the wait took so long for the salad and beer, I figured I better get another beer in the works when my pizza arrived (or on the slim chance that my waitress came to check on me).  Well, that second beer arrived AFTER I ate my pizza.  I really didn't need it at that point.  Oh well.  As always, the pizza was good.  For whatever reason, the personal size seems lacking.  Perhaps, it is because you are immediately disappointed when it is eaten so quickly.  More than likely, it is because the recipe just wasn't designed for this size.  Do yourself a favor and get a small (or larger).  You will be happy you have leftovers.  Despite the fact that many describe the crust as buttery and they have something called Buttercrust, supposedly the deep dish dough does not actually contain dairy.  As such, the deep dish is vegan friendly, and I hope this is true, if you order your pizza sans cheese.  Doing just that on this visit, I opted for no cheese and hot giardiniera as a topping.  It is the perfect topping when in Chicago.

The butter crust in the deep dish was out of this world. My husband and I loved it so much. The pizza is very filling we had a medium out which comes with 6 slices and he ate 2 slices and I had 1 slice and we stuffed. There is no need for appetizers with the deep dish. There is a bit of a wait. We were told we had a 1 hour and 15 minute wait even though we preorder the pizza we still waited about 15 minutes before we actually got the pizza. However the pizza is worth the wait. I enjoyed the crust in this pizza more than Giordano's. We had the classic and i would recommend is the sausage and sauce on this pizza is amazing. We had the leftover tonight and it still taste delicious a day after.
First time having Real Chicago style pizza. Got the Lou personal pizza. It was very good. I can't wait to come back and eat around this city again!
Perfect crust, delicious ingredients, spread out at a perfect ratio! The calamari appetizer was "steaky" and pretty amazing as well!

We were visiting from out of town and had to try this famous Chicago style pizza Lou's was walking distance. Katie was our server, very polite and efficient. We ordered the spinach stuffed bread not knowing what to expect. It was delicious. We got a medium sized pizza. More than enough for the 2 of us. That cheese was delicious. Im not a fan of the deep dish type crust but non the less the pizza was good and so was the butter crust

The best deep dish pizza in Chicago. We went as part of Bobby's bites and brews bike tour so there was no wait and the pizza is excellent. All the local's would recommend Peaquod's however I would say that Lou Malnati's was the superior deep dish.

Now when I think Chicago I think deep dish pizza. I have tried a number of deep dish pizza places, and this is THE place that I think it well worth the wait. After hearing from a number of Yelpers and locals, I was really excited to try this place. Coming in on a Friday night at 7pm, there was a good 45 minute wait for a party of 4.

You get in line to first make your order, then you put your name down and wait. As many of you know it takes at least 30-40 minutes for them to make the deep dish pizza so 45 minutes was no big deal as we would have been waiting that time anyways. We ended up ordering a large Malnati Chicago classic with added mushrooms to half the pie.

The crust was really good and had crisp edges with good texture, the sausage was well seasoned and perfect in portion relative to the cheese. And boy there is a good amount of cheese, that was my favorite part. I loved how the cheese was really cheesy and every bite had a perfect portion of sausage, cheese, sauce, and that buttery crust. This pizza was well worth the trip. Now Chicago style deep dish here is very different from deep dish in California. In California there's more sauce and substance, where was in Chicago the content and cheese are the main stars. Either way, great dish and I would love to come back to eat here again when in the area.

Hands down the best deep dish pizza I've eaten. The butter crust was amazing and how the cheese, meat, cheese and sauce is piled on is heavenly.

Eat here and be happy!

Trying a deep dish pizza is a must in Chicago and I don't regret my decision of coming here! Came here on a Sunday night and it was busy! Surprisingly, the wait for a table wasn't long. Only the wait for the pizza was long, but they suggest you to pre-order the pizza before being seated!

TIP* The waiter suggests not to add too much toppings (~1-2) or else the crust will be too soggy!

We ordered a Medium Malnati's Chicago Classic ($15.45) and added pepperoni and fresh spinach mix! SOOOO GOOD. You definitely have to get the butter crust! We shared this pizza among 2 people and we had 2 slices leftover, which was our drunchie meal after the club. hehe

Would DEFINITELY come back here next time I'm in Chicago!

Lou Malnati's did not disappoint! I read reviews where people had to wait hours for a table but when my boyfriend and I walked in we got seated within 5 minutes! woohoo! The waiter Jason was awesome and explained to us that it would take about 30-45 mins for the pizza which was reasonable and told us that if we are really hungry we should order some appetizers or a salad to hold us down.

If you're not a pizza person the Spinach stuffed Bread for an appetizer is good and the Bowtie pasta with vodka sauce is AMAZING. My one regret...I wish I ordered a bowtie pasta with vodka sauce for my plane ride home.

I'm sure a lot of people may disagree but I prefer the deep dish from Giordano's. When we first moved to Chi-town the people we first friended told us that Lou's is good for its pasta and regular crust pizzas. So for many years I would go to Giordano's for deep dish when the craving strikes (which wasn't often since its such a heavy meal) or when friends came to visit (multiple times a year). Not once did I consider anywhere else for deep dish until we come back to Chicago as a tourist.

Stopped by just before noon on a Saturday and the wait was only 20-25 minutes. We ordered the classic deep dish, the bow tie pasta, and a side salad.

The butter crust that Lou is famous for was dry, hard, and bland. The cheese hardened pretty quickly and did not have the yummy gooey-ness that makes pizza so great. The sausage in the pizza was way too much! I hate to complain about too much of a topping but it was basically a meat patty layered on top of the cheese.

The pasta on the other hand was really tasty. I would come back for the pasta and skip the deep dish.
Got it delivered to the hotel. Both deep dish and salad was delish! They included utensils and plates which was much needed even tho we forgot to ask for it ourselves.

Pizza was delicious but service was just okay. We expected the long wait, and we pre-ordered our pizza so it would be ready (or near enough) by the time we were seated. An hour later we get to our seats and the server takes our ticket for the pizza which should have been about done. About 35 minutes after that we had to flag our server to ask where the pizza was. He explained deep dish takes 40-45 minutes to bake and we explained we had ordered it over an hour and a half ago. He went to check and shortly after brought a deep dish pizza out with his apologies. The rest of the night went fine. Unfortunately it was only much later we realized he brought us a small when we had paid for a medium. (It was our first time there so we didn't realize the size difference until we ordered a medium two days later and saw how large it was.)

The pizza is still worth it--we ordered it for takeout twice more during our trip. But the delay and wrong size after such a long wait put a bit of a damper on things. Also don't bother with the bruschetta, at least not for take out. They serve it as grilled bread with no toppings and then give a whole lot of diced tomatoes and very little cheese for you to add yourself. Just stick with the pizza.

Best Chicago style pizza hands down.  This is where I take my out of town visitors for a Chicago experience.  The wait can be really long.  Plan on putting your name on a wait list and then grabbing a drink nearby.  Their salad is a must have.  Awesome dressing.

As a new yorker thin foldable pizza will always be my preference but when in Chicago home of the deep dish there is only one way to go LOU MALNATI'S. this pizza is very tasty and filling. We ordered the Lou and the Malnati's. Both pizza's were delicious.regret not getting a larger pie as the personal seemed a bit small. Great service. Make sure you go with ample time as it takes about 45 mins to make a pizza.

After trying Giordianos, I had to come here to compare the difference because my first impression of deep dish wasn't that great. I ordered a small malnatis classic considering I wanted some to eat left over if it was good enough as left overs.

First impression it looks very very different compared to Giordiano's. The top layer of the pizza pie you have tomatoes, middle is sausage, and then the cheese is on the bottom protecting the crust. Let me tell you, this place is freaking great and the ingredients they used made such a huge difference. You can actually taste the sweetness and the acidity of the tomatoes and its a nice balance with the savory sausage and the mozerella cheese. It's so simple but the individual ingredients are great and combined blends together really well.

The Lou malnati butter crust is really thin, and it provides this nice flaky texture component to the deep dish pie and it has a touch of what butter tastes like but its not heavy, its light. I ended up eating the whole small pizza by myself....even though its suppose to feed like 3 people HAHA. If you're visiting chicago like me for the first time, come here. Try it and i'm sure it'll be well worth trying. Simplicity at its best.

Lou Malnati's is one of a handful of really good Chicago pizzeria's. "The Lou" (perhaps not the best name if you're used to British English, but okay...) is a classic Chicago deep dish spinach pizza, and it's wonderful. The beer list was also quite presentable. We had an Antihero IPA, which was a perfect accompaniment to the pizza. They advertise the large as for four people, and, with three of us working on it, they weren't kidding. Service was great, and the ambiance is classic old-school Chicago pizza. This was our first visit to this particular location, but it more than lives up to the brand's well-deserved reputation.

First stop when I landed in Chi-town was to get my hands on a slice of Lou Malnati's deep dish. Came here on Saturday at around 4pm and it was still a 45 minute wait. I was starving but I held on knowing it'd be worth the wait.

After checking in with the host, we were told that we could pre-order our pizza to eliminate the extra wait after being seated. We ordered a small Chicago Classic and added some bell peppers.

When we finally got seated (uptairs, which I didn't know they had) we still ended up waiting maybe 20-25 minutes. Not sure what the point was in pre-ordering when it still felt like eternity. When we finally got our pizza it wasn't even piping hot. I boomeranged the first slice getting pulled and the cheese pull was hardly there. Slight disappointment.

The pizza was good. It was on the cheesier side without it being hot and stringy (-___-). The butter crust was good, since that butta gave it an extra flavoring than plain bread. Overall I wasn't blown away but it was good. We finished the entire pizza. It was definitely shareable.

Would I come back? Not sure, but it is definitely worth trying if you're visiting Chicago for the first time.

I am normally patient with restaurant during busy hours but if you are short staffed or whatever reason it may be .  The restaurant needs to let the customers know better approx of when they can expect their food.  If the food will take 2 hours let me know it will take 2 hours and not 1 hour 20 mins.  The staff was not apologetic that the food was delayed after asking them for updates 5 times for foods and being told the food would be ready in 20 mins. No matter how good the food is there needs to be better management.

The pizza was excellent the service not attentive and somewhat lack luster. Order when you arrive helps cut down on wait time when seated. Placed order received text table was ready and they couldn't locate my order. Wait ten more minutes seated the manager expedites the order pizza arrives quickly. Server doesn't stop back for 55 minutes when Place order for their cookie dessert she tells me about 13 minutes to prepare she returns in 35 finally with dessert food good service not so great.

Lou Malnati's came recommended by several Chicago locals and it didn't disappoint. We ordered the small Chicago classic deep dish and we were nervous it would be a heavy meal that made us feel fat but surprisingly, the pizza was deliciously satisfying. We were warned in advance to be expecting a 40-50 minute wait since they make the pizza from scratch so we also ordered some mozarella sticks which were meh. The pizza had this delicious sausage inside of the dough that was so yummy. No wonder even my Uber driver recommended this place. Its a must visit.

Worth stopping by for tourists to try deep dish, but not the best in my opinion. I find the pizza to lack flavor and be overpriced for the quality. I would recommend seeking out a different deep dish spot to try!

Good Chicago deep dish pizza, our waiter was great about explaining the menu and wait time for a deep dish pizza which takes 45 mins to bake.

The floors were extremely sticky, they said the floors had just been refinished but not sure if that was the case or they just aren't cleaned regularly.

I'd return for this pizza if in town.
Haven't tried the food yet, but so far it feels like I'm at a Cub's game...crowd is straight out of a cub's game, if you know what I mean.

This is our third trip to this particular location.  Past two have been perfect.  This visit was off the mark.  Ordered a Lou classic.  Toppings were lacking, crust was hard.  Top and bottom and cool to the touch.  Almost sent it back but we ate it.   Salad was good.    Service was adequate given the amount of people and time.   Seating was quick and 30 min ahead of schedule.

pics.caption: Pizza was not so great.  Looked good but crust was hard, dry and cool to the touch

review.des: As a Floridian visiting Chicago, my knowledge of deep dish pizza is very limited so we relied on a buddy of mine who is a local for his recommendation. He recommended we check out Lou Malnati's in downtown and he was not wrong. The pizza was legit. Being used to very commercial, crappy pizza down in Florida this was a treat. Just make sure you give yourself plenty of time as they did warn us upon ordering that it'd take about 40 minutes for the pizza to be ready, but it's worth the wait.

This is definitely my favorite pizzeria in Chicago!

The wait was insane!! I think we waited for 1.5 hours but it was nice that they have the texting system so we just walked around until we were notified our table was ready. I definitely like that we can preorder our deep dish which cut the waiting time in half after being seated.

The food was just... ahh there are no words. We got the appetizer platter which was perfect since I always have a hard time deciding what I want. Also, it's always nice to have a variety. We got 2 small deep dish - the Malnati Chicago Classic and the Lou. Like I said, I have a hard time deciding when there's too much options! Can't remember which one I liked better, they were both delicious! I like Lou's better than Giordano because the crust was not hard and definitely easier to eat.

The service here is phenomenal. It was so hectic throughout the whole place but the hosts were very nice and accommodating. Our server was exceptional because he never forgot to check in on us and even though he was running around like a chicken, he would find time to chat with us and give us pointers about where to go, what to see, where to eat, etc.

If you can't decide which deep dish pizzeria to try, try Lou's!!!

I'm from California and was looking for some "authentic" deep dish pizza. Everyone pointed us to Lou Malnatis! I really liked that we could order the pizza in advance so it would be closer to ready when we arrived.

While in Chicago, deep dish pizza was a must on my list.
We arrived at the restaurant around dinner time and the line was already out the door. When we finally put our name in at the host stand we also put in our order for the deep dish pizza since it takes longer to cook. I'm glad this was an option.
We waited for our table around 25 minutes which wasn't too bad considering. We were seated upstairs near one of the windows looking out on the street. It was a very nice set up for such a narrow restaurant.
The deep dish pizza was great! We also ordered some of the local beers to try which I recommend!
The deep dish here is a staple in ant Chicago tourist's and Chiago native's diet. Nothing compared to a Lumalmadis"deep dish with a salad and a cookie pizza to finish it off.

Good pizza, but being from Boston I'm so used to New England style pizza so don't think I could give a fair review. I guess I'm a bit of a pizza snob! I had the malnati chicago classic the sauce and cheese were good, sausage maybe a little fatty for me. Service was good.

Our pizza tour is coming to an end...we found our favourite hands down or up or where you want to put them. The crust is light and buttery, the cheese is stringy and the right amount. The tomato sauce is tangy good. We had the "Lou" with spinach, mushrooms and onions. So good we gobbled up every bite. We highly recommended this pizza landmark. Thanks for reading. Avram

I always heard great things about this place and it's pizza and was really looking forward to it after a full day of Chicago siteseeing. I was a tad disappointed in the food. I wanted and expected more. I could of had better tasting pizza back home in Florida. But because even the worst pizza is still good, I'm not rating this a 1 star.

One of my favorite pizza places! Will only eat deep dish here. Usually there is a wait but you can order your pizza ahead of time as well to make it quicker. The dessert cookie/ice cream is also amazing!

My go-to pizza in the big city of Chicago!  Excellent salads and pizzas with yummy sauce and perfectly cooked crusts.  Have tried many pizza places in town and highly recommend this Chicago restaurant!

Came here 1130 on a Saturday and it was half empty. Definitely come early because when we were done at 1230, there was a long wait outside.

It takes 40 minutes for them to make the pizza. We ordered the Chicago classic which was delicious. It's not going to blow your mind, so don't have sky high expectations when you come here. The small was more than enough food for the 2 of us, so don't order more than that because the portions are large and you're going to end up with a lot of leftovers

I personally liked the pizza more than pequods because it wasn't as greasy, and the meat was spread more evenly throughout the pizza. It doesn't have that burnt crispiness that pequods had, but that's based on your preference. It's definitely a more touristy destination than other deep dish pizza places, but it still delivers a solid pizza.

I was me in Chicago for a conference, and had to try the famous Lou Malnati's after it was recommended constantly by my friends. We had the Three Cheese Bread and the Malnati Chicago Classic, and let me tell you, it did not dissapoint! Both were absolutely fantastic, and a great first experience of Chicago deep dish pizza!

The atmosphere is just like a classic Italian-American restaurant look with lots of sports jerseys. Our waiter was very attentive as well! Just keep in mind when you go, you will need to wait as we were told the pizzas take 30-40 mins to make! But highly worth the wait, and will definitely be returning next time I'm back in Chicago!
Very good pizza, possibly one of the best I've ever had. Had a little bit of a wait (30 min or so for 5 people). Chicago. Deep dish. Original. Worth it.

I am Lou's backer all the way. Once in awhile, small neighborhood joints open, replace my love for Lou, and then I get tired as a hell of waiting an hour and a half for them to perform their magic. Lou ALWAYS comes through. This is also the best Lou's in my opinion. The waitstaff is friendly, especially with tourists.  The establishment itself gives a happy air, and the food, well, welcome to some good pizza.

On one of my last trips here, our service was just about perfect. The sky had opened and it was pouring BUCKETS!!  Lou's glowed like a homing beacon and we headed in. There were two of us eating and we were seated immediately. Hot coffee, cold drink, and we were on our way. Being Chicagoans, we really don't eat deep dish often, but we splurged and ordered the namesake. Right on time, our pizza sailed to our table and we ATE. To top off all of the glorious cheese, our waiter came by and provided a free dessert that someone had changed their mind on. We found room for that sweetness too!

***Accessibility Thoughts***
This Lous is extremely cozy. Tables are adjacent to each other and depending on the personalities of the diners, you may make new friends. Know this going in. Be prepared, and, of course, call ahead. They are absolutely wonderful!!!

I'm gonna say this right now that I've never had a deep dish pizza before. This was my first time visiting Chicago and my boyfriend (ex-chicago resident) really wanted to come back here. The place was PACKED, as expected, but we were quickly seated. We ordered some minestrone soup and the Malnati classic Medium, which is for 3-4 people. If you don't want leftovers please listen to the suggestions on the menu (small=2 people). Soup was yummy, but very small (I've never had minestrone soup before either so I'm not a good judge). We waited about an hour for the pizza, which is understandable since they told us ahead of time when we ordered. Our pizza was good, I just don't think I'm a deep dish kind of girl, I had to find out after giving it a try of course. My boyfriend loves it though! So if you know you love deep dish, go for it! Definitely a must try for tourists (me).

pics.caption: Small minestrone soup with my boyfriends hands breaking crackers for comparison

review.des:
Yum! Having lived in New York the past few years, I've definitely become somewhat of a pizza snob, with a penchant for the thin slice variety New York is known for. But after a memorable meal at Lou Malnati's, my eyes have been opened to the wonderful world of deep dish.

We couldn't decide between the classic pie or the Lou, so our waiter suggested we get the pie half/half, which was awesome as both flavors were different yet equally delicious. The classic is a sausage pie, while the Lou is topped with a blend of veggies. But the real magic was the crust. My, oh my, that cruuuuuuusssssttttttt...

It is buttery with the perfect amount of crunch, while still maintaining just the right amount of doughiness. It's really unlike any other crust I've had before.

We also ordered a side salad to share, which was nothing special, but fresh veggies are a much needed side to balance out the richness of the pizza, so I'd recommend it.

All in all, I had a wonderful time here. I don't think I've completely traded teams (sorry, but thin crust will always have a special place in my heart), but if you're like me and new to deep dish, I challenge you to try Lou Malnati's and not develop a newfound appreciation.

Best deep dish pizza in Chicago? I haven't tried them all but I think I'm convinced. The butter crust matched with the pizza is truly quite a combination!

The calamari fritti is a must! Unexpectedly it was a little spicy, I got this for our children but they couldn't enjoy it

The stuffed spinach bread with the crusty loaf we got as it was frequently recommended. It was good, nice crust but spectacular? Not really.

The atmosphere at d second floor seems spacious and modern. The downstairs where we were felt dark, old n moody... But one could call it traditional I guess.

Verdict: it would be gluttony to have this regularly, but when friend come over, this is d place to go!

pics.caption: First floor, Moody? Dark? Or traditional?
Second floor. Very modern n spacious

review.des:
I was in Chicago for a night on business and came here with co-workers. They all were saying that Lou Malnati's is better than Giordano's. I personally like Giordano's more as my last visit to Lou Malnati's wasn't great.

As I was told that they don't take a reservation, we came here around 4:30pm and sat at the bar until other folks arrived.
We told the staff that we wanted to have a table at 5pm, and they were able to accommodate our request.

The staff called us and took us to the table where was on the second floor.
We first started off appetizers: Malnati salad, mozzarella stick, buffalo wings, and calamari. Malnati salad was very delicious! It wasn't too heavy, so I could eat it all. Salad dressing was perfectly matches to the salad. Loved it.  Mozzarella stick was okay. Nothing special. I didn't eat wings or calamari.

For pizza, we ordered Large The Malnati Chicago Classic and The "Lou" with pepperoni. We ordered right after we ordered appetizer, so our pizza came a little after we finished our appetizers.
The Lou which I had last time wasn't great, but I had with crustless and personal size, so I was hoping this time was better, but no. It was the same. I didn't like it. On the other hand, The Malnati Chicago Classis tasted good which was good surprise. I wish I knew that at the first time. It had chunk of tomatoes and very flavorful.
When we were leaving, there were so many groups waiting to be seated. I'm glad we came here early enough, so we didn't have to wait!

The staff was nice, and the service was good. I'm not a big fan of pizza, but Chicago pizza is better than regular pizza personally. I may come back if others want to come.

Simply delish. Wait is a little hefty but put your order in and grab a drink down the street. Food is worth the wait and the staff was attentive and professional as they managed the rush. Highly recommend for the "Chicago pizza" experience.

Great pizza, as advertised. The only knock is the wait and nothing done about it. I didn't order an app because it's freaking deep dish pizza (c'mon, I'm about to ingest 3.5 million calories already!) Perhaps give table games or something to keep people busy for 45 min while they wait. Good food takes some time, yes, but it'd be nice to kill that time somehow.

Also, the force was strong with the a/c that day. Brrrrrrrrr!

When in Chicago, you eat Chicago Style Pizza!  Lou's is one of the best. Thick, heavy, deep dish melt in your mouth delish.

Don't be surprised if you can only eat 1 piece!

Make sure you have enough time on the meter because pies take a long time (40+ min sometimes) to make. It's worth it though.

Like the sport pictures and memorabilia. Need more soccer stuff though!

Actually did finally make it here during business hours..after multiple attempts past 35 years. Busy friday evening but seating at bar is great. So a pizza requires about 40 minutes...so I'm having a pasta and sausage choice with white Moscato drink. All was very good.

I'm sure this place is much better when you eat there but taking out wasn't the best pizza experience. It was soggy and way over hyped. I will go back to try it there to make a better judgement because I've heard so many great things. Maybe people that grew up with it love it?
The pizza was delicious! It was a long wait and was pretty crowded so I'd probably recommend going during off hours but the food was great!

I have to get a Lou's deep dish every time I'm in Chicago but I have to admit I wasn't absolutely in love with my pizza this time. Perhaps it's just this location because I've never been here before but the pizza was on the very soggy side.  Service was fantastic though. Our server was really attentive and funny.

It was okay. I have to admit I am not a huge pizza fan. It's never my first pick, atleast not recently. We ordered the crust less pizza which is made with a sausage crust. And a regular pepperoni pizza. Both small and both filling between four people. We had leftovers. We also ordered wings, maybe that's why. But it's worth a visit. I liked this we were able to order the pizza while we waited 45 mins, so when we sat, the pizza was ready shortly after. Very efficient

This was amazing! It was my first time in Chicago and first time trying deep dish pizza! We asked the locals and they all suggested Lou Malnati's Pizzeria over any other pizza place and god were they right! They are extremely efficient with handling the long wait times that they get almost everyday. We went on a Monday night and the wait was about 20 mins. They encourage you to order your pizza while you are waiting as it takes almost 45mins to bake. Kudos to the team they make sure not to waste your time!
We got the Lou Malnati's Special and added jalapeños and onions. The pizza is really delicious! The crust makes it, its buttery almost like a crunchy biscuit. The sauce is perfect..tangy spicy and sweet! The sausage is flavorful as well. We loved the jalapeños on top they were perfect to cut through the cheesy contents. We got garlic bread which was good and the baked cookie which was a perfect way to end an amazing dinner!

I have no complains..it's tasty, value for money and for almost 60$ after tip we had dinner drinks dessert and some pizza for breakfast next morning! Do NOT miss this spot if it's your first time in Chicago!

I've visited Chicago a few times in the last couple of years and this is a go-to spot. I am a true NY lover of pizza but its ok to like something else from time to time. The thick buttery crust is like the guilty pleasure that you crave. This is not the type of pizza that you have 1000 toppings on. Keep it simple with one meat and cheese. The best part of this spot - I got to take some frozen ones back home. Once I cooked them back home - it tasted exactly the same. So, don't be afraid to purchase the frozen ones.

Definitely enjoyed this place a lot. I've been waiting to try deep dish pizza in Chicago, and Lou Malnati's did not disappoint.

We were told to wait ~40 minutes, but were seated faster than that. The service was efficient too.

The pizza when it came out was steaming hot and very yummy. Held together very well, great flavors, and especially the tomato sauce was really good. We had leftovers and gladly finished them the following day.

I'm unfortunately not from Chicago and can't go back here anytime soon but I would certainly enjoy coming back here again.

Salad was very good because it was laced heavily in dressing that was pretty sweet. I suspect it wasn't very healthy - but you don't come here because you want to be healthy ;)

We had a large group and they were very accommodating and instead of bringing out large pies they served each slice separately to us.

My favorite pizza was the plain cheese and vegetarian one. My favorite part of the meal was dessert! :)

pics.caption: Ice cream on a warm gooey cookie!

review.des:
So...I really always thought of myself as a devout lover of NY style pizza that could never love Chicago style pizza as much. Well, I have never had Chicago style pizza before. And that is because I have never been to Chicago and never trusted anything deemed "Chicago style pizza." After extensive research and gaining approval from some locals, my husband and I settled on Lou's. We were not sure how much pizza to order because we can typically devour a large thin crust pizza. So we figured 2 smalls would allow us to indulge while having the chance to get a couple different kinds. We opted for plain cheese deep dish and the Malnati classic pie. The classic was by far our favorite but the cheese was so good as well.

In the end, we did not finish the two smalls but we came pretty damn close. The result was us being extremely full until bedtime that evening (lol!) It was definitely all that cheese! It was layer upon layer of thick, warm, gooey cheese and I do not regret one bite regardless of how large my food baby was.

The service was quick, friendly, attentive, and honest. I say honest because they tell you that the pizza will take about 45 mins to cook (if you're ordering deep dish...and I don't know how you couldn't!) So, take that 45 minutes to drink a couple beers and build up the anticipation of great pizza to come.

I loved everything about that pizza. So thick and unlike any pizza I've ever tried before. I am so sad that I've waited so long to try this style pizza but I am so glad it was at a place that clearly is doing something right. To make it clear, I am no expert on Chicago pizza but I am certainly an expert on pizza in general...and by expert I mean I eat a lot of pizza. Hehe.

So if you're a newbie like me, give it a try and you will be surprised at how much you could love something you were so unsure of. I hope to try more Chicago-style pizza in the future and at least I will have a really great place to compare it to.

Came to Chicago for some deep dish pizza. The crust was way too dry. I did, however, enjoy their salad. It was delicious!

May or may not return in order to try another pizza

I was so stoked to try Chicago pizza! I got the lunch special ($9.95), which includes a personal pizza as well as your choice of soup or salad. I went for the soup, which was cream of broccoli. Flipping delicious. Creamy as it should be, and broccoli was tender. I got a simple cheese pizza and it was pretty good. The cheese would string when you pull up a piece of pizza, always a good sign lol. I just wish the crust was less crispy, more soft. Maybe it would have been if I ordered the butter crust for $0.75 more.

I wish I could give it more stars, but there were somethings that prevent me from doing that.

I am from NY and was visiting on business, and this was the first place I came due to all the reviews.  I ordered a medium size pizza and must say, got a bit of a sticker shock, but it is Chicago style and I did have some toppings so went with the flow.

When I opened the box it looked amazing, but when I started eating it, I must confess, the crust was a bit much.  Usually I can finish off at least 3 NY slices no problem.  This one I was feeling full after a slice and a half.

The toppings and sauce were excellent, but the thickness of the crust was a bit too much for me.  Basically it felt like eating a loaf of bread with pizza toppings.

For me, this was an experience that, next time I will try to enjoy with a group of friends, as for a one person experience I will pass.

Overall good experience but I will stick with regular crust pizza for now.

Best chicago pizza in town.  Been coming to Chicago since 2008 from California and have tried them all deep dish pizza's and this by far is the best.  The classic with spicy sausage and corn bread cruch is heaven.  All the employees are so nice and friendly.  I was just there 2 weeks ago and I can't wait to go back.   It's always packed but lunch show up 11:30 to beat the rush or dinner 5pm or else wait but even then you'll thank me later because it's worth it.

I enjoyed the deep dish at Lou Malnati's, but the seating and ordering process was a little chaotic. The crust was VERY buttery and had a nice crisp to it. The wait was around an hour and a half, but they do have the text message updates so we were able to wait in a juice shop nearby. Once seated, the pizza do take 45-50 minutes to cook. I think that's something important to know before choosing this restaurant! All that being said, I don't think any of that was a deal breaker! Our waiter was very kind, the food was great!

pics.caption: A slice of the small classic chicago deep dish!

review.des: Definitely the best pizza in Chicago, we tried several pizzas like Pizza Uno and Pizza Due, but this is definitely the best pizza in the city.

The infamous Chicago DEEP DISH pizza.

Date: 10/07/2017
Time: 3:30PM

It was a Saturday afternoon, pouring rain in the city, and people suddenly all rushed indoors to the first place they could find. That's how we ended up here.

Wait time: 10 minutes

I have eaten at several other Lou Malnati's locations but this one takes the cake.

First, we get seated and NOBODY brings us water. After 5 minutes, I had to physically get up out of my chair and ask somebody.

We finally meet our server after 10 more minutes.
We place our order right away.

Bruschetta - $7.45 - 4 stars - The best appetizer of the night! Perfectly toasted garlic rounds with fresh diced tomatoes, shaved Parmesan, olive oil, and pepper.

Garlic Bread - $5.25 - 2.5 stars - The flavor was there, but the dish came out luke warm.

Calamari Fritti - $9.95 - 3.5 stars - Nothing special. Not the best, but not the worst.

(1) Medium Malnati Classic - $20.45 - 3.5 stars - Lean sausage, cheese, and tomatoes, on a butter crust. I don't understand why you'd pay extra for the butter crust when it comes out hard as a rock. I always order the same pizza and it literally has no hint of butter. The pizza, being deep dish style, is rather heavy. That's to be expected of course. I don't think the pizza here is spectacular in any way but you can't really fail at pizza, can you?

We had one server in our half of the room. He never came back to check on any of his tables - approx (8-9 of them) Second, he disappears after taking our order. Our water cups were empty and no appetizers in sight. The table next to us finished eating for over 10 minutes and their plates still weren't cleared. Another table accidentally knocked their glass of water to the floor, and nobody came by to pick it up or clean the mess until a good 15 minutes later. That is how poor the service was.

Twenty minutes later, another server appeared (female) - and tells us that she is now replacing him. She seemed pleasant enough. THE SAME THING HAPPENED. She never came back to check on us or any of the other tables after introducing herself.

Our last server was somebody completely different. He was the only one who was consistent, but he just started serving our tables when we had already finished eating. Overall, we had three servers throughout the course of our meal.

All of the tables around us seemed extremely frustrated as well and the tension was very uncomfortable. Everybody was complaining.

YOUR WAIT STAFF NEEDS TO GET IT TOGETHER. I will be going to the other locations from now.
This place has great pizza especially for big events for like football, family parties or anything. Definitely recommend!

This was my first time
Going to a deep dish tester aunt in Chicago. It definitely did not disappoint. Service was great. Appetizers were fresh. Try the calamari! We had the Lou pizza and it was fabulous. I will definitely be back

I got a phone call from someone and they seemed very concerned about my experience at their restaurant. He was very polite and offered to send me a gift card for the troubles I went through. Even though so highly doubt I'll ever return to Lou's, it was still very nice of them to care.

It was my first time in Chicago, so I had to hit the perfect deep dish slice as my first stop. I did my research and told my local friends to take me straight to Lou malnatis. I was not disappointed at all, the cheese/sauce/bread ratio was absolutely perfect. Each bite was its own trip through heaven. For some reason the slices with toppings weren't nearly as good as the classic slice but I was still super content with my meal.

After all of the hype I had created for my friends, the second trip was a little underwhelming. It was a Saturday night and the place super packed even for its own high standards but it tasted like the pizza had been sitting out for a while. The sauce quantity was also lacking this time so please keep up the consistency and I'll never cheat on you guys with another deep dish establishment.

This place delivered me hands-down the best Chicago pizza I have ever eaten. Great salad for the side. Great sides and condiments.

Just go for it!

I should start by saying I know absolutely nothing about Chicago pizza. I chose this restaurant based upon online recommendations and the fact that it had fairly easy access to the I-94. I don't know whether the pizza was in fact authentic, but it was unique and very good. The service was top-notch, especially considering how busy the place was at lunchtime on Tuesday. The decor and overall ambiance of the place was exactly what I was hoping for from a Chicago pizzeria. My only complaint was that there was no parking nearby, so I had to leave my car in the carpark down the street -- it cost me 44 freakin' dollars for an hour!

Delish delectable deep dish.  You want a fantastic pie with a buttery, grainy crust, sweet and flavorful tomato sauce, a sausage patty that extends throughout the surface area of the pizza (hell yeah!), and a mozzarella that my wife described as "just ok"?  Come on down to Lou's, a yummier and less "chainy" experience than other deep dish eateries one could easily name - and certainly better than a Red Baron frozen pizza.  The service was top ten greatest of all time.  After eating my portion of the pie, my stomach only felt like I was in my first trimester - not bad.

After walking the streets of Chicago, we ended up here because of all the reviews. We thought this place was alright, pizza took 45 mins to make. I really enjoyed the buttery crust but i dislike how the pizza is watery. I believe that's due to the tomatoes that is in the sauce, not bad of a place, i come back if i'm in the area.

Best Chicago style deep dish pizza.

Nothing else needs to be said other than it's a sit down place, very comfortable, and they have gluten free crust.

I'm lukewarm about this place.  And I've decided, about deep dish pizza in general.

The queue can look intimidating for this River North Lou Malanti's, but it's a huge place with 2 floors so the wait isn't bad. My friend and I waited for ~20 minutes. However after we ordered, I don't know if they're understaffed or what, but it took almost an hour for our food to come. We didn't even get anything crazy. Just 2 personal pies - the Malnati Chicago classic and the "lou."

Final verdict: underwhelming.

Came here with family and had a Medium pizza and split It in half- 3 slices of The Lou and 3 slices The Malnati pizza!

I only ate my one slice of "The Lou," and was stuffed! I am waiting for the munchies to kick in so I can enjoy the other slice of The Malnati

Great places for groups. They don't have happy hour although I found there prices to be very reasonable! Great location to eat a traditional Chicago style pizza!

pics.caption: Cheese pizza to the left and Malnati to the right! There was the Lou as well but we ate It up!

review.des: For a great deep dish pizza, this is your place. It's a Chicago classic and so damn good!!!

Definitely one of the better deep dish pizza places I tried on my trip to Chicago. We ordered a salad and a small deep dish pizza to share amongst 3 people and it was more than enough, but keep in mind we also ate beforehand.

We started off with a Chicken BBQ Club Salad. It tasted like a southwest salad to me, but that's not a bad thing. It was flavorful and not too heavy.

For the pizza we ordered The "Lou". The place is called LOU Malnati's so it just seemed appropriate since it was our first time. The pizza was the perfect ratio of cheese, tomato sauce, and toppings. We did order a small and share amongst three people and I was very stuffed after 1.5 slices. I would have ate more if I didn't eat before going to Lou Malnati's.

I definitely would be back if I were to ever find myself in Chicago again. But for now, I'll just suggest Lou Malnati's to friends who plan to travel to Chicago.

The wait was an hour which was fine because it was a Friday night. Make sure if you're ordering a deep dish, you order while waiting because it takes 40-45 minutes for them to bake it. Overall the food was good but the service was lacking. Very slow in refilling drinks and slow service overall. I'd come back for the food though.

This place gets packed and for good reason.

On our last night in Chicago, a group of us decided we wanted some deep dish to close out our trip. This place was highly recommended, and by the look of the crowds waiting to get in, was popular among the locals as well.

One thing that's really awesome about this place is that they let you pre-order your pizza (because they take up to 50-minutes to cook) so that it's ready to be set at the table when it's finally your turn snag some seats. With our group of five on a Thursday night, it was a 45-minute wait even around 8PM, so we enjoyed each others company while grabbing a few drinks at their bar.

What I liked is that within a few minutes of being seated, pizza magically made its way to the tables and we were ready to eat. We got two medium sausage and pepperoni pizzas to share as well as a salad to break up the gluttonous amount of cheese we were about to indulge in. The salad was a great starter and that pizza was nothing to scoff at. The crust was super buttery and they didn't skimp on the meaty toppings.

Two pieces are enough for most, but because I was starving, I went for three. I felt like I was pregnant for the rest of the night, but didn't regret any of the bites I had to force myself to take.

Service was friendly and the company was even better. I'd definitely recommend Lou Malnati's if you're craving deep dish deliciousness!

Let me start off by saying, this was my first time in Chicago and the first time I had deep dish, and the wait was so worth it! However, it gets a 3 because the waitress at the front getting our names, was rude, disrespectful and inconsiderate.

Nonetheless, a HUGE shoutout to our server Yellana (hope I got the spelling right!) she was amazing!! Caring, sweet, respectful. She makes the place a 5 star :)

Visiting cousins living close to Chicago. They recommended this place. It did not disappoint! Tasty and juicy calamari...Cobb salad with perfect amount of dressing, Chicago-style deep dish pizzas with generous portions of meat and cheese, tasty sauce and crunchy crust. My goodness! I needed a second stomach! Everything was so delish! If you are in Chicago, must stop and eat here!

We are from out of town so naturally we had to get a deep dish pizza. Upon our arrival to Lou Malnati's (we sat at the bar due to a half hour wait time), the server at the bar quickly explained to us that the pizza would take 45 minutes to make and that we should get their salad to start. Boom. Easy for us. Good to know right off the bat in case you're in a time crunch. We first enjoyed a salad with hard salami pieces, Gorgonzola, tomato, and a sweet vinaigrette dressing. Then our original pizza came out. The crust was perfectly cooked. The mozzarella cheese was thick and gooey. The sauce was smothered over the top and there was slightly spicy sausage inside. I was more than pleased with the meal and the overall experience. I would recommend this place to tourists looking for some classic deep dish pizza, but make sure you have time to sit and enjoy it and an empty stomach because man it is filling!

pics.caption: Sauce and cheese overload! In the best way possible!

review.des: Great food. The pizza was authentic and tasty. The family size salad fed the whole table (7 people). The sauce was a lot, but tasty. It was crowded, but we got in and out pretty fast. I recommend if you are in Chicago check out one of their locations.

The locals suggested this spot, so we decided to see what's good about it. Since the place was busy, we immediately voted to sit at the bar. The service there was ok. The bartender had a little too much on his plate and was rather slow making his rounds to us. The food was delicious. We had a Bloody Mary, Buffalo Wings, and their house deep dish pizza. Everything exceeded our expectations except for the fact that our pizza took about  an hour to come out. That's the only reason why I can't give them 5 stars. Don't know if the bartender forgot to put the order in, but the guy next to us got his pizza in about 20 minutes. You make the call

Listen, this IS CHICAGO DEEP DISH. Don't go anywhere further.

The perfect seasoned tomatoes, with the right balence of cheese. You can't officially say you've come to Chicago without going to Lou's!
Very traditional place for a delicious deep dish pizza in Chicago. We always order the sausage deep dish. They don't really have a lot of other options. I recommend and will definitely be back.

Before heading in to Lou Malnati's, I exercised a healthy bit of cynicism about the hype. While I love a good slice of pizza, most pizza is some variation of dough, tomato sauce, and cheese. I tend to think that even the best pizza, is just pizza.

I went in on a Friday around 5pm. It was starting to get really busy, but I was able to avoid the lines and got seated at the bar. Bartenders were extremely friendly; they took the time to help a tourist like me decide which pizza to order (which I appreciate, I'm sure it gets annoying sometimes). Put it an order for a classic deep dish pizza, personal size.

I wasn't aware of the wait time and thought they had forgotten about my order until I checked in with the bartender who informed me that each pizza takes about 45 minutes. He told me this confidently, with absolutely no apologetic tone in his voice--which tells you that they believe it's worth the wait.

Typically, I'd think 45 minutes is a ridiculous wait time for pizza. Let me tell you, Lou Malnati's was worth the wait. The pizza was cheesy and saucy with the perfect cheese to meat ratio. ALSO, the crust was both crispy and soft, and coupled with the cheesiness and sauciness of the pizza ... OMG. Heaven in my mouth. I devoured my personal pizza. I swear I did not even look up from my place 'til I was finished.

My only gripe was that I had ordered a personal pizza...which was was there and gone in 2 minutes. I wanted more but did not want to wait another 45 minutes. I secretly hoped the couple next to me who ordered a full-size pizza (and had many slices left, let me tell ya) would offer me a slice. Haha!

Pls stop by this place if you're in the Chicago area! I saw a couple order their pizza to-go and eat it by the river walk, which I'd recommend as a cute lil' way to spend your afternoon :)
