Butter crust. Why did i never think of putting butter on pizza, it makes it so much better. Now maybe butter on hot dogs? Donuts?

This pizza is delicious. I am so happy I stopped here to experience deep dish style. It takes 35 - 45 min to cook so we ordered Apps, calamari. Again, yummy and a fresh salad. Brenda was quick and had good eye contact- great service.
Thanks for making this great.
Love their sauce and the sausage. Now something I eat all of the time but definitely have to hit it up a few times a year with friends.

Having a wife from Illinois I know all about Lou's and other Chicago pizza places. Here in Texas where we live we do not have Lou Malnati's and on a recent trip to Illinois I had two requirements while visiting: 1.we visit and eat Lou Malnati's 2. We visit and eat Garret's popcorn. We did both along with many other places and I am glad we did. As far as I am concerned Lou's is not only the best Chicago style pizza they are absolutely the best pizza in the United States. I do have Lou's shipped every now and then and that is also amazing but when in town it is a great place to visit. The food, atmosphere and service were all top notch!

Let me start by saying I LOVED the pizza. The pizza was not what we had a problem with on our visit to Lou Malnati's. We came here celebrating my birthday and many yelpers expressed their excitement about a special treat on their birthday. We pre-ordered our pizza and waited another 20 minutes before being able to be seated inside (upstairs, which seemed to be ONLY for customers who had pre-ordered).
This is where the experience goes bad.
Our waiter was terrible. When my boyfriend had asked about the birthday special, he straight up said NO with a stern, unfriendly face. WOW. Since he didn't take our order, as we had pre-ordered, he asked what we wanted to drink, we just wanted ice water. He took 15-20 minutes to bring us two cups of water. By that time, our pizza was almost ready and another waiter brought us our pizza and utensils because somehow we had been waiting and did not even receive the proper utensils. The other waiter served our pizzas and left. The pizza was good, the crust was buttery and crunchy with nice layers of cheese, sauce, toppings. One of the freshest I've ever had.
Upon finish our pizza, our initial waiter returns to collect the pizza pan and saying "good job" for finishing our small pizza. Frustrated and annoyed about the service and attitude in this place, we skipped dessert and got the check. ABSOLUTELY one of the worst customer service experiences I've had in restaurant.
We'll be back for the pizza, either to-go or waiting for a decent waiter NOT pre-ordering. Perhaps, maybe we'll just go to a different location.
Place was cozy and friendly but the pizza had something missing. Pepperoni was good but dough tasted raw and was missing flavor.
Amazing pizza!!! Amazing!!! Happening atmosphere! Great pizza!!!! So good! Must dine in! Friendly service. You may have to wait, but the wait is worth it!

not sure what all the fuss is about.  Money wise good value.  nice flavor.  was too mamy whole tomatoes for me in sauce.  added parm and pepper flakes.  That helped.  Brough wrong salad, but ok.  Waiter did not want to be here.  Something smelled like a dirty dish towel.  Might try on another trip....

Don't let the 4k+ reviews fool you. We ordered the chicken wings and salad to start. The salad was fine but the wings were salty. After waiting the 30min it takes to make the deep dish, it arrived room temperature. We ordered the small and we could've done fine with the personal. It was bland ... not sure what the hype is. Our server was very friendly and nice, Sara G.

Updates review. This was always my favorite but something seems to have changed over the last decade. Will I still eat here? Yes. Is it my go to Chicago style pizzeria? Not any more.

Service is good, atmosphere is good but something seems to be missing as of late. Hopefully things change and they can go back up in the star rankings.

I'm obsessed with this place!!!

The fiancé and I spent 4 days in Chicago, and I had two people from my hometown message me saying I HAVE to try Lou Malnati's. Sooo obviously we had to try.

We luckily had no problem getting a table and were able to sit at a booth right away. First things first, the menu all sounds DELISH. We had the hardest time deciding on what to try. Our lovely waitress recommended the Chicago Classic. A butter crust sausage pizza that they're well known for, and we were not disappointed. That crust was hella buttery, but equally hella tasty. The crushed tomatoes on top was the perfect balance to all the sausage and crust. Super thick, the definition of a Chicago deep dish. Absolutely would get this again.
We also tried the Lou but on a thin crust, maybe not quite as spectacular as the Chicago Classic but still great. Good enough to have again for sure.

We love loved this place. We have plans to go to Chicago in the future, and we absolutely will be back!!

pics.caption: The Lou as a thin crust

review.des: Aside from Pequods, this is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago.  There is really nothing else to say.

This was the first time I ever had Chicago style pizza. I'm in love. It was so good and there was so much food. We ordered the small which should serve 1-2 people. We also got the bruschetta because we were nervous that a small wouldn't be enough. The bruschetta was amazing and I'm so glad we got it, but we definitely didn't need too. We could only handle a half of the small after having the bruschetta. The pizza, we got the classic, was amazing.

The place was completely packed at 6pm on a Thursday night. The wait for 2 people was 45min. You walk in and put your name on the list. It's always a pain to wait, but they don't take reservations so what can you do? The great part is that they let you order your pizza while you're waiting so it's ready shortly after you're sat. This is such a great idea.

The best deep pizza ever!! You have to try The Lou, so tasty and so fresh, it is just delicious. Also, the Calamari Fritti is really good as an appetizers. The service is awesome, even the manager came to check on us. I will come back for sure, now I love Chicago even more.
Don't come to eat here unless you have more than 40 minutes to wait for your small pan pizza. The bartender needs to smile more and be more customer service oriented. Not worth your time!

My fiancé and I came here on a Thursday afternoon, to which we were told there was about a 15-20 minute wait. We ended up sitting at the bar since there were openings, and ordered a Malnati Mule and a beer. My Malnati Mule was pretty disgusting... I couldn't finish it, and my fiancé didn't want to either. It was mostly ginger beer with some lime.

We ordered the Malnati salad, as well as "The Lou" with sausage added on top (chunks, not crumbled pieces covering the top) with Malnati's World Famous Buttercrust. The salad was absolutely delicious, especially because of the housemade dressing that it had. The pizza itself, however, was extremely underwhelming. The buttercrust really had no flavor - it just felt like we were eating plain butter. The tomatoes weren't very sweet, but they were okay. The sausage, however, was delicious. I wish there had been more of it on top.

We had high expectations for their deep dish pizza, but were highly disappointed, especially because this was our first meal in Chicago. Maybe one day we'll give them another shot.

My first review of 2017!

DISCLAIMER

I'm not actually at Lou Malnati's in Chicago. I'm in the comfort of my home in Portland Oregon watching the Golden Globes eating my Lou Malnati's pepperoni pizza.

The pizza was a gift from one of my favorite sales reps who lives in Chicago. It was one of 4 Pepperoni Pizzas that she sent me for Christmas. I gave each of my 3 brothers a pizza.

These Lou Malnati's Pepperoni Pizzas are an excellent representation of the definitive Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. They are OUTSTANDING!

Thank you again RB!

Sent from my iPad

According to a Fengshui Master in HK:

This February won't come in our lifetime again. Because this February has 4 Sundays, 4 Mondays, 4 Tuesdays, 4 Wednesdays, 4 Thursdays, 4 Fridays & 4 Saturdays. This only happens once every 823 years. This is called money bags. So share to at least 5 people or 5 groups and money will arrive within 4 days. Based on Chinese Feng Shui. Share within 11 minutes of reading.

I'm not actually at Lou Malnati's in Chicago.
Best pizza in Chicago. Hands down. Nufffff said. Period point blank. Every single time I would choose Lou. Don't look anywhere else

There's a lot of debate about best deep dish in Chicago, ask any Chicagoan. But I also reach for Lou's. The crust has a nice buttery flavor to it and the sauce has just the right amount of garlic. The Lou is one of my favorites but you also can't go wrong with pepperoni! I sometimes get the personal size and a side salad which is just perfect.

The general manager called me back and apologized for the delay. He was glad to hear the feedback about how it was difficult to email them. He refunded the order for me. Appreciate the nice customer service. Will def try delivery here again at some point in the future because Lou Malnati's is just too good and hopefully it's better.
Always the best thick crust pizza you can never go wrong. I love the buttery crust and thick cheese. We had the original meat pizza, delicious!!!

Visiting Chicago and wanted a true deep dish pizza experience. WOW...this pizza is AMAZING! Bar drinks were gooood! And service was great! We went for dinner and the wait time was not as long as they said it might take. The bar was a great place to kill time. I can't wait to visit Chicago again and be back for more!!!

The amount of Lou Malnati's Pizzerias around the Chicago area make it seem like a fast food chain. Do NOT be fooled however, the deep dish pizza, the appetizers, the service, and the atmosphere is nothing like a fast food chain. Their pizzas are made from scratch and you are forewarned that it will take 40 minutes for the pizza to cook. I highly suggest their fried calamaris for an appetizer paired with your favorite beer, in the summer potentially a Blue Moon or an Angry Orchard cider. For a pizza, I suggest The Malnati's Chicago Classic. The description is simple, but the pizza is far from it. The crust and the bread are perfectly crisp, and not soggy at all, with every bite providing a perfect combination of sausage patty, mozzarella cheese, and tomatoes! Perfect place to try Chicago's deep dish pizzas!!

Had to try a Chicago deep dish pizza when on a trip in the Windy City with friends. Lou Malnati's ended up being the choice and it didn't disappoint.

We had an appetizer sampler, a large pepperoni deep dish, and another large deep dish with spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes. I'm not a pepperoni person (or a mushroom person) but I loved these pies. The cheese is thick and gooey, the sauce is tasty, and the crust is flaky. I preferred the simple pepperoni over the specialty pizza, but both were quite good. Appetizers were just okay.

There was a bit of wait, but not bad for accommodating a party of 7 without reservations. Our total was $71, which seems like a lot but for 7 people (and including an appetizer sampler), but when you divide it that many ways this place was actually pretty cheap, especially compared to most other places in the area.

Nestled in the heart of Chicago, this place keeps themselves very busy even on weeknights. We visited this place and had a 40 minute wait on a Tuesday night. However, they let you place your pizza order right away because the pizza will take about 40 minutes to cook. Folks, well worth the wait. The pizza was amazing. We had the standard pepperoni and sausage deep dish with butter crust. The sausage was like a layer of sausage, like a pancake. Very flavorful through and through. We ordered some drinks to go with it. No I would not recommend them. They tasted fine, but had no strength in them. But we did not come here for the drinks so I don't take anything away from them for that.

Yup, Chicago Pizza and the places that serve it suck.  I've finally made up my mind.  I tried Malnati's, Uno, Giordano's and Pizano's, so you can't say that I didn't  give it a shot. The sauce is always watery and tasteless, without even a hint of garlic.  Like pomodoro vs. marinara maybe, to make a pasta comparison.  The outside crust is almost always too hard, due to the long time required to cook something as thick as lasagne.

Lou Malnati's in particular is plagued by service problems even if their version of the Deep Dish is the least worst I've tasted.  An hour to get an appetizer?  90 minutes to get a pizza or a seat?  Wall to wall tourists?  Check, check, and check.  If you want to lose your sanity come here on a weekend night.  You can have my seat; I won't be using it.

Other reviewers who didn't really like it gave this place 3 stars because they have become a famous brand.  I docked them a star for taking forever.

And to you Chicago natives that argue your thin crust, square slice is the real Chicago pizza, please tell the rest of the world.  Deep dish is giving Chicago a bad rap.

Came here solo while in town on business.  I came on a Thursday evening.  I sat at the bar.  Nice little section with TVs and comfortable barstools.  I ordered a beer and a pizza.  A medium for myself, deep dish, the "original".  Absolutely delicious.  Will come back next time I'm in town.

First time here and the buttery crust is amazing!l on the deep dish. We even got the Malnati's salad while we wait for our deep dish, it was so good!  Service was amazing. First trip to Chicago and we will probably make another stop here before we leave.
They are very biz but everyone is very friendly and nice the deep dish pizza was the best deep dish pizza i ever had the salad was good as well

SOLID solid Chicago style deep dish pizza.

Some pro tips:
This place gets busy. And I mean really busy. A 30-45 minute wait for a table during peak hours is not unheard of.

Also the pizzas themselves take 30-45 minutes to bake. Do yourself a favor, order your pies **BEFORE** you get seated. Trust me, it's what the locals do.

We started with calamari and four cheese bread. The cheesy bread was "meh" but the calamari was good.

Two medium pies fed four hungry guys and one hungry gal.

As if on a timer, 30-45 minutes after ordering our pizzas came out.

"The Malnati" was chock full of meat and cheese -- essentially a meat lovers classic.

From their menu: "Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust."

The "Lou" was a veggie pie with spinach, mushrooms and tomatoes. Both were good in their own right.

First time patrons but will definitely come back. We arrived just before 6 on a Thursday night. 15-20 minute wait, but they recommend placing order while waiting, which we did. We were seated within 10 minutes. Great service. Traditional Chicago style deep dish took about 40 minutes to come out which we were told. It is so worth the wait. Perfect flavors, crust was fantastic, and perfectly melted cheese. People were lined up out the door when we left about 7:30, so go early or prepare to wait. They do take phone number and will text you when table is ready.  Must try when you visit Chicago.

On a business trip in Chicago and decided this is had to be one of two stops I made. The deep dish is delish! I came in and as expected this place was quite busy but had no problem getting a seat at the bar.

Ordered the personal classic, which was a big mistake on my part.....I should have ordered the small. After eating the personal I was craving more!! Do yourself a favor and get the small, you won't regret that decision.

The bartenders were great and as they said, the wait for the pizza was just about 35 minutes. If there are two of you in the party, a small salad is plenty to hold you over.  

Can't wait to make a another stop here when I am back in the windy city.

They have gluten free pizza and it was pretty good! Crust was very well done but the sauce and toppings were excellent! Bloody Mary came with cheese and pepperoni which was delicious but the bar tender was all over the place. The restaurant was warm and muggy inside and very very loud. My friend had the deep dish pizza and said it was good! All the food was very filling! Definitely worth trying but come hungry!

It was an OK experience.  This was one of the top places suggested to me by friends when I first moved to Chicago.  I was not impressed with their pizza.  The service was good, but the waiter got our order wrong.

To be fair to this rating: First, our server was excellent. Second, of our family of four, three of us after having the signature deep dish with butter crust decided we don't really get the fanaticism about Chicago deep dish. It's okay, but much prefer traditional crust or thin crust--and unfortunately did not try either of those.

Too much sauce, after the first slice the cheese sort of hardens and congeals a bit, the bottom crust is very thin and you can't taste the dough.

I get that Lou Malnati's is an iconic Chicago restaurant, but seems more of a tourist thing than a great food thing. Glad we had our dinner there and experienced it, but we know there are better pizza places in Chicago to explore during our next visit.

Totally overrated. Hey, the service is good, the salads are good, the coca cola is good, but the pizza is totally middle-of-the-road. Malnati's is not one of a kind. It's a large chain. To be asked to wait 45 minutes to an hour for a soupy cheese/sauce deep dish pizza. I won't recommend other places here because that's not the point. Forget about looking at all the top-ten lists when you Google Chicago pizza. Go to a neighborhood and ask the people who live there where they go. That's where you should go.
Best pizza in Chicago.  If you want deep dish done the right way, Lou's is the only place to go.

Chicago is known for deep dish pizza and so that was what my friends and I were set out to try. Lou Malnati's was recommended by both of my friends as Giordano's was deemed the tourist trap. We got one small pizza (meant to share between two people). I wanted The Lou for that garlic butter crust but my friends wanted the Classic since it had meat. We were able to compromise and get our pizza ordered half Lou and half Classic.

The wait was expected to be half an hour and usually the small pizza is cut up into four pieces but since we were three people, they asked if we wanted it cut into six pieces instead. I didn't have much expectations for deep dish pizza. I had expected it to be similar to lasagna instead of pizza but I was wrong. The thickness was only about an inch deep and it came in its own personal pan but our server helped served each piece on our plate.

THE LOU
This was my favorite simply for those Roma tomatoes. So flavorful with the sauce and three cheeses and the garlic butter crust. If it had meat, it might be even better.

THE MALNATI CHICAGO CLASSIC
This was nothing to sniff at either. It pales slightly in comparison to The Lou in my opinion in terms of flavor but since it has sausage, that brings it back up a notch.

I ate with a knife and fork and cutting into the crust can be a little difficult. During my last piece, I stabbed my pizza and it popped off my plate. Whoops. 5 second rule. I'm not letting that slice go to waste. I'm usually a thin crust pizza kind of girl but Lou Malnati's is beginning to change my mind on deep dish pizza.

pics.caption: Malnati Chicago Classic and The Lou

review.des: Been going to Lou's since the first location opened up in Lincolnwood.  One of the best thick pan pizza in Chicago.  Numerous locations allow the product anywhere.   Ranks up there with many other Chicago places.

I like Lou's! Definitely top two deep dish in chi city. Important to make deep dish your main meal of the day because it is a COMMITMENT. Always a wait for a table as well as the dish itself, so come hungry. The butter crust never disappoints.

Our first Chicago deep dish and it did not disappoint!! I got the sausage with the butter crust - I'm still thinking about it and I ate it two days ago. My husband is gluten intolerant so he got the sausage crust pizza - very unique and delicious!

It was the first time trying the famous Chicago deep dish pizza and I was really really skeptical. We ordered half with sausage and the other half regular cheese and..... it was very good! I would never thought I could like a pizza like that one but it was a very successful experience! The only thing I didn't really enjoy was the crust which tasted a little bit weird and it was really hard to cut. Besides that, it was good!

Absolutely the best pizza I've ever had in my life. Once you get one whiff of their food, you don't mind the long wait. They restaurant's app shows you how far down the wait list you are which makes the wait go faster. The original Lou Malnati's deep dish was cheesy perfection. The service was also phenomenal!  We appreciated Zach's patience with us!  I recommend you ask for him as your server!  Lou Malnati's is a must during any visit to Chicago!

I usually come to eat pizza after gym! I know I shouldn't been eating pizza but Lou is always so attempting. I love love!!! The full appetizer with fried mozzarella, mushroom, and zucchini with red sauce and ranch. I can imagine myself eating it now. The Chicago Classic is the way to go because I love sausage and the crust is crispy as well! I cannot complain. I also got the pasta but they don't have Mariana meat sauce pasta anymore. Thumbs up!!!

Yes, the deep dish pizza here is good.

But is it worth the wait? In my opinion, well, no.

You can do better -- just ask a local.

The problem with tourist traps is that they tend to fill up quickly due to media hype and huge advertising budgets.

This is the case here, folks.

It's like going to Antoine's in New Orleans, or (back in the day) Tavern on the Green in New York City. (Yes, you'll be able to say that you went. But if you want the best bang for your buck? Guess again.)

There are options out there in Chicago, and some of them are VERY good.

I'm not bad-mouthing the pizza at this place, but I'm saying there are plenty of choices in this city that don't require long waits that simply aren't worth the bother.

Was really excited to try out this deep dish pizza spot on our first night in town. Put our names down and were told it would be a 25 minute wait. We "pre ordered" our food and sat down. After 45 minutes of waiting, the front desk realized our name had not yet been called.

Once we were seated the waitress read our pre order in which we said, yes items ordered as correct. We proceeded to wait over an hour (for our personal + small pizzas, the two smallest pies you could get). We noticed that every party in the room had been served and on their way out. It was pretty obvious that our order was not "pre ordered" at all and actually had been completely forgotten. I understand restaurants can be busy but what bothered me most was the waitress looking at us and not once apologizing for the insanely long wait time or error.

We patiently waited and after almost 2 hours we received our pizzas. One of which WAS COLD. Completely disappointed and at this point really nothing else could go wrong with their service. Won't be returning.

If you like deep dish pizza, this is the place to go! Super thick and buttery crust chock full of flavor. I would recommend just getting the original pizza with just sauasage and tomato. Fills you up really well, I can barely finish two pieces of it. Prices are reasonable and overall a great experience.

Keep in mind that waits here at any time of the day are pretty staggering... I guess it attests to the fact of the good food!

Take my vote with a grain of salt because I'm not a huge fan of deep dish pizza. But this is probably one of the best ones I've had!

I've eaten "Chicago Style Pizza" in a number of pizza places over the years. While I'm more keen on New York/East Coast Pizza because that's where I grew up, I really enjoyed the pie from Lou Malnati.  

The wait staff was fab. Service was quick and attentive. The restaurant was clean and in spite of being very busy, we received our dinner in a respectable time. I'd definitely return for pizza here.

Ordered Lou's through Grub Hub and was surprised when our order didn't take forever to arrive at the hotel we were staying at. It came early, still hot and the ice cream wasn't melted. I am always hesitant ordering for delivery but this location didn't disappoint. Props to being earlier than the arrival time given to us.
Food was delicious as usual. Highly recommend.
This deep fish joint was well received the pizza was delicious great tasting crust there maybe a wait but it's definitely worth it

Every time I visit Chicago, I'm on a quest to find my favorite deep dish spot. On my recent trip, I asked my friends for recommendations and they suggested this spot based on the deliciousness of the cheese. Now when it comes to favorite foods: pizza and cheese top my list, so I was excited.

My boyfriend and I split the Deep Dish Malnati Chicago Classic, which includes sausage, mozzarella cheese & a buttercrust. And we were very pleasantly surprised by the deliciousness of the pizza. I think what really stuck out was how they don't skimp on the mozzarella cheese, so if you like a cheesy deep-dish you will be very happy here. And sometimes at certain deep-dish spots, the crust doesn't measure up to the tasty inside, but at Lou Malnati's that buttery crust is delectable.

Had the Chicago classic deep dish and chicken Marsala pata. Both were good.
The Marsala was light and full of flavour. The pizza took about 45 minutes but it was worth the wait.
I am not a big fan of pizzas- I do not like it that much but this was a bomb! So delicious and fresh. The crust was just perfect- buttery and crisp.
Cant wait to go back and have some more.

Took my friend who was visiting me here. Got the Malnati Chicago Classic, the stuffed spinach bread, and calamari fritti.

Before the verdict, two relevant points:

1. This was my first deep-dish pizza in Chicago.

2. We were starving and ready to eat a horse.

So my confidence on the correctness of judgment is not super high. But I loved it! I loved the tons of sausage on the pizza, and I especially loved the spinach bread - so soft and full of melted cheese.

All in all I appreciate how satisfying this whole meal was - at the end of the meal, it was OUR turn to be stuffed.

We waited for 45 minutes because we went at the peak hour on Friday night, but I'd love to come back here when it's less crowded and get another round.

So my wife saw this spot on Yelp and wanted to go try it out on our vacation. The waiter was really nice at first but towards the end I don't know if he was hot (as we had a table outside) or maybe tired, but he seemed like he had a little attitude. We ordered the bruschetta and that was amazing! We then got the deep dish cheese with the buttered crust. I took one bite and it didn't taste like much. It wasn't horrible but I was expecting way more flavor. If you don't smoke or hate the smell then don't sit outside, because people will come outside and smoke right in your face. Street meter parking was $8 for 2 hours. I didn't get a chance to go inside at all so I have no comments on decor.

I understand this place is very busy , I get it 4000+ reviews. I was really disappointed with the front door receptionist or the hosts. People like her are the face of the restaurant. She should be smart and know how to entertain bunch of hungry people . We got there around 1 pm I believe, she took my cell phone number so that she could text us. She said the wait time for two is about 45 minutes. We invited ourself inside to see if we can grab a drink while we are waiting. No luck it was crazy , after sitting for 30 minutes , we noticed people were standing in a different line . My boyfriend asked one of the guest and he said " we are preordering our pizza because it takes 45 minutes to make it". At this point I was mad , how com no one told us? We go to the front door person to tell her if we can order our food because we have a flight to catch , she looks at us lost and she goes to say; oh you are up , your table is ready , I told her never got your text , off course she wrote the wrong number down . We waisted 1.5 hour waiting for Chicago must try pizza. When we went up stairs, I complained to our waiter and he said he is not sure who is up front and that he would talk to his manager. Anyhow he offered that I should get a drink because I was upset . I know he was annoyed by. His face said it all . I won't suggest to come here if you are super hungry and need to leave . Prepare to wait for a long time make sure they get your phone number correct and that you pre-order your pizza while you are waiting. It was okey , and I won't comeback here . Slow service. It is run by bunch of teenagers.

I love love the deep dish pizza here. Every time I visit Chicago this is my first stop to eat. my favorite is the "Lou" and "The Malnati Chicago Classic". The only con is that the line is often long and the wait is forever. To avoid that I suggest you come after 9 pm!

pics.caption: cross section of the Classic deep dish

review.des: This is yummy deep dish! It is probably the best I've had in Chicago (waaaaay better than Giordano's) but - and maybe this is sacrilegious to say - I've had better outside Chicago (I'm thinking especially of Patxi's in the Bay Area). We shared a classic deep dish cheese pizza with their special buttercrust. I loved the tomato sauce - it was sweet and light and had large chunks of whole tomato. It was more like real tomato sauce in Italy than the sauce at many other pizza places in the US. The crust was good too - nice and buttery as advertised. I would return!
David was over the top fantastic, a perfect host. Great food, love the sauce on the pizza too. Great crust, too. Congenial customers, just like "Cheers". Also provided great neighborhood knowledge!

Was a very underwhelming experience. The restaurant itself was filled with screaming children and I later saw there were multiple locations, so had I known, I would've went to the one on Rush. It looked much nicer.

The pizza was very mediocre but maybe that's because I'm from the east coast and have had some amazing pizza in my life so the bar was set very high. The crust kind of reminded me of the ones from a frozen pizza.
The pizza is absolutely amazing! Get Chicago original and you won't regret it! My favorite part abou t their pizza is the crust, it's just unbeatable!
Mouth watering pizza to die for!!! The pizzas tastes great! Anyone who is visiting Chicago for the first time should try this. But do expect to wait at least 45 minutes for your pizza to arrive.

I had eaten pizza in NYC and other places throughout the US, but I had not experienced real Chicago pizza up until I visited Chicago in mid-October.  A colleague and I ended up trying 3 pizza places during our visit, Giordano's, Pizzeria Uno, and Lou Malnati's.  They were all delicious.  Lou Malnati's and Giordano's were very similar, yet Malnati's was a tad better according to my t-buds.  Two things caught my attention, the sauce and the crust.  Malnati's sauce tasted really fresh and had a slightly spicy kick to it.  The "butter crust" was a little crunchier than Giordano's.  Giordano's crust has a pie-like, flakier crust.  Don't get me wrong, Giordano's is the bomb as well, I just liked Malnati's a tiny bit more.  If you're planning to dine-in, I wouldn't recommend going during peak times.  Seating is pretty limited and the restaurant has tight quarters.

Strangely I've found that a lot of Chicago locals don't seem to be fans of deep dish pizza, but personally I love it. Sure, it's super heavy and you can only really get through a couple slices before wanting to die, but how can you not love that much cheese and dough on one plate?

One thing I do not love about Lou Malnati's is the wait, but they do have their system down. They allow you to order your pizza while you wait, and we got some drinks at the (crowded) bar and were able to make due for the 40 minutes or so until our names were called. Once we sat our pizza was already on its way. Pretty impressive!

Though the pizza was piping hot, ooey gooey, and mighty tasty, I was surprisingly also really into the Malnati salad. With olives, romaine, gorgonozola, and an amazing sweet vinaigrette, it was one of the highlights of the meal for me!

With or without the salad, you'll leave absolutely stuffed after your deep dish pizza experience. Just be prepared to feel pretty gross and full for a while... it's worth it!

NY style vs Chicago deep pan can be debated until the end of time. Being a New Yorker, it is difficult to root against my hometown. I have to give props to Chicago. They know how to make a great pizza.

Meh, I've experienced better really nails it. Blah! I mean really! Very disappointed considering so many people think it's THE place to go for deep dish. My guess is that it has lost its mojo since it now seems so touristy. The place was packed for lunch when we got there and we were told that the pizza would take 45 minutes. We were 4 adults and two children and they say us in a round table which barely fit all of us, we were knocking elbows. To top it off it was in the middle of the dining room close to the stairs and the kitchen exit. Extremely uncomfortable!

I ordered, my oldest ordered a plate of ravioli and the server recommended we get the adult version. We did. Turned out that he still got us the kids' version which had 3 miserable and unappetizing ravioli on them. The sauce I'm betting was Ragu or something because I've tasted better from store bought. It was pretty sad. We eventually had to order a second plate of ravioli for my child.

So, as far as the pizza goes...I got the small (thank God!) Chicago Classic with a couple of extra ingredients. My family got the The Lou, the large size for three adults. My youngest got a personal cheese pizza. Honestly, the most satisfied person at our table was our 7 years old. The rest of us were very disappointed with our pizzas. Mine didn't have enough sauce, the other adults didn't like theirs because it had TOO much sauce. The pizza looked like a lumpy mess, kind of those failed attempts you see in the internet compared to the pizza that it was supposed to look like.

I'm sure there are many other places in Chicago to get decent pizza. This is not it.

Everything is good! You can't go wrong with this place. I usually order the Caesar salad and the garden deep dish pizza- both are amazing. Their deep dish pizza is loaded with cheese and toppings, and not too much sauce. The crust is buttery and crunchy! Couldn't ask for a better deep dish! I always grab dinner here whenever I am in the city! No reservations, but you can order your pizza while you wait and it will be ready fairly soon after you are seated!
Deep dish paradise! Order ahead if you have to wait for a table. We waited an hour but it was worth it. The small was large enough for two of us. Amazing sauce. Yum.
Favorite pizza in Chicago. The deep dish has the best crust and the cheese to sauce ratio is perfect (more cheese than sauce).

Visiting Chicago and I knew we had to ha s pizza! Wait was a little long but so worth it! We had the Garlic bread with Marinera, the wings and lasagna to start! ( don't judge or was 5 of us and we wanted to try a bit of everything) which was perfect because the pizza takes awhile and everything was so delicious! We got a large thin cheese and a large deep pepperoni! The buttery crust on the thin AMAZING both of them to die for!

Lou Malnati's is definitely worth the wait. My boyfriend and I waited for about an hour for a table for two. It was very crowded but the atmosphere was good and time passed by quickly by the bar. The pre ordering of pizza saved so much time! It was ready within 15 minutes of us sitting down. Our server was so nice and everything tasted so good! Will definitely be back!
Awesome pizza! Ordered the Malnati's pizza and calamari. Both were good! I feel that one slice is about a pound weight!

Coming from New York, we were really excited to try Lou Malnati's Pizzeria and see what the hype was all about. Unfortunately, the pizza came out COLD and was extremely disappointing. After waiting 45 minutes for our table with an additional 20 minutes after we pre-ordered the pizza, the deep dish should have came out smoking. Crossed it off the bucket list, but I'll never be returning.
Love love love. Some damn good pizza! I knew eating pizza in Chicago would be great but this exceeded our expectations. Sweet staff and great pizza.

Visiting Chicago from Seattle. For some reason a lot of people told me that chicago deep dish is overrated, and not even worth trying.

I think they missed this place. We started with pizza chips and dip, then we split a medium deep dish w/ sausage, pepperoni, basil, and green peppers. The menu and waiter articulated clearly that the deep dish would take 30 min.

The starter was amazing, and all 3 dips were incredible. We asked to keep them on the side in case we wanted to try it with the deep dish as well.

30 min wait was well worth it. The pizza came to our table piping hot. Absolutely delicious. Between three guys we the medium was perfect. I will be educating my Seattle peers that Chicago Deep Dish is iconic and legendary for a reason.

As you're all well aware, I had the distinct privilege and pleasure of dining at Giordano's just one month ago, and I gave the establishment a rave review but noted that I could not comment on the global debate as to which Windy City deep dish pizza spot reigns supreme. As fate would have it, an oncology conference brought me back to Chicago this weekend, and with it, an opportunity to sample another fan favorite. I decided to try Lou Malnati's because, among other reasons, my good friend from New York had spoken at length about the quality and taste, describing with such fervor how she abruptly awoke in the middle of the night many months after going in person, compelled by some otherworldly force to order a stifling quantity of Lou Malnati's frozen pizzas, not at all bothered by the shipping cost to NYC. Based on this review alone, I had to try it.

Unfortunately, I will not be describing any such experience with this sort of intensity. First, the pros - for a Friday night in Chicago, when both 40,000 oncology professionals were in town as well as countless others for a Taylor Swift concert, I was extremely pleased that our party of four only encountered a 15-minute wait. The decor was very authentic, warm, and inviting, and our waitress was very friendly and helpful. She happily split our bill four ways, even allowing us to separate out the alcohol on another check (we needed to do this for reimbursement purposes).

Next, the cons - at one point toward the end of our meal, a staff member who was moving chairs around slammed one into the back of my friend's chair. This gave her quite a jolt, and the staff member did not apologize or even seen to recognize what had happened. A minor issue, but still worth mentioning. The main talking point in this section is the food, I'm afraid. We ordered a large classic Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza, and it arrived only luke-warm. By the time we each had our second slice, the pie was cold. Even with the first slightly warm slice, though, I wasn't impressed. The dough was very greasy and the cheese was too tough, not the nice soft stringy texture I desired. The sauce was more of a diced-tomato topping, which was truthfully delicious on its own, but didn't seem cohesive with the rest of the dish and in fact easily slid off from the rest of the pizza, making it difficult to eat. There was far too much sausage for my liking (I think the entire pie was covered with a uniform layer), and again this caused everything to fall apart. The pizza was also extremely dense and left my stomach feeling a bit upset. Of course, much of what I've said is based on personal perference, and I completely respect those who prefer this over the manna from heaven that is served at Giordano's.

Overall, a quality pizza place that just didn't do it for me. Very happy I tried it, but probably won't be returning. 3.5/5 stars.

According to all our research on Yelp, Lou's seemed like a clear choice when trying our first Chicago deep dish! Lou's was roll your eyes backwards good. I enjoy Patxi's back home in the Bay Area, but Lou's takes the crown here. There crust is so good! Buttery, crispy, and you can taste the freshness of all the ingredients that run through the pizza. We got the Malnati's Chicago Classic Pizza and added extra pepperoni on top. The aroma from the pizza when it hit our table instantly told us this was going to be one of the best deep dishes we've had. It definitely did not disappoint. The crust of the pizza was so buttery, paired with a huge chunk of sausage in every bite. Be careful with what size you order here because deep dishes are no joke, we went with a medium and still had two slices leftover.  Aside from the pizza, we got an order of the Calamari Frites which is always a solid appetizer, no complaints.

Service was excellent. Since deep dish takes a little over half an hour to make, I liked that they let you pre-order your pizza while waiting for a table so that by the time you're seated, you're waiting no more than another 10-15 minutes for your pizza. They also text you to let you know when your table is ready which is always nice! The restaurant was very lively with lots of crowds. The basketball game was on, people were flooding the bar, and the restaurant itself had a home family feel to it.

If you're having trouble deciding on where to go, this is the place to be.  

5/5.

pics.caption: Malnati Chicago Classic w/ added pepperoni

review.des: First time trying deep dish pizza so don't really have anything to compare this to. However, this place offers a great variety of deep dish pizzas.

I'm not a deep dish person, but Lou's pizza is so good! The sausage they use is the best and they put a lot on their pies! What I loved though was how the crust came up the side of the pan and stayed nice and crispy on the edges. We didn't have any salad, but their salads looked amazing and I can't wait to go back and try one.
Apart from long waiting time, the food was amazing. The staffs are so well trained. Even with the whole restaurant packed with people, they are still smiling and served well.

TIP: Use NextMe app or website to place yourself "in line" and call in to order your pizza when the wait time ticks down to 40-45 mins. You will save yourself from eyeing your neighboring table's pizzas and comforting your rumbling tummy.

You see, my friends and I weren't as smart and waited in line for about 45 min, then about 10 min until we were called we realized we could place an order beforehand. So in addition to the 45 min, we waited another 30 or so min at the table for the pizza (Lord, give me patience...)
For 3 people, we ordered the thick crust medium size "Lou" (2 slices/person) which was piled up with fresh vegetables that were cooked only slightly so they still held their form. The crust was super crunchy and honestly, the highlight of the pie. After about 1 slice, we all felt so full. One of my friends decided to take her other slice to-go and my other friend and I decided to tough it out and finish it.

Regarding service, everyone who works here was super friendly and enthusiastic. and HELPFUL. My friend who paid by card, forgot her card there and realized when we were almost back at our hotel. We called and asked them to hold onto it for us past their closing time. They said no problem. We got there ~10 min past 11 pm, and after checking my friend's ID returned it to her. We didn't get the chance to catch their names, but to the staff of Lou Malnati's, THANK YOU!

I strongly believe that Lou Malnati's is as much a local spot as it is touristy. If I lived in Chicago, I would easily be ten times my weight, thanks to Lou!

Eileen L.'s REFVIEW for Lou Malnati's Pizzeria

RELEVANT INFO
* Always a wait at this poppin' pizzeria - we were quoted a 30-35 minute wait, seated within 10.. score!
* Order your pizza at the cashier while waiting for a table
* The Wait App shows your place on the wait list... wowowow!!
* A bar at the entrance/waiting area to help make the wait time go faster and more bearable
* This place does not take full-service lightly: Catering available, and you can order pizza from anywhere in the world and they'll ship it to you! O_O

EXPECTATIONS GOING IN
* Deep Dish Pizzrah!!!

FOOD
* Calamari Fritti ($9.75): not sure why we ordered this while we were in Chicago, but still a solid appetizer nonetheless
* Chicken BBQ Cobb Salad ($9.95 small; $14.95 large): this is perhaps the most Midwest salad I have ever seen... the small is a large facewash bin filled mostly with chicken and bacon tossed in BBQ sauce with a smidgen of greens
* Chicago Classic Malnati's ($12.95 Small): buttery, crispy crust topped with a ton of sausage, pepperoni and stringy mozzarella
* The Lou's Special ($9.95 Personal): the tomatoes... drool...

VALUE
* Super affordable! Enough food for two full meals for the two of us for $50

IMPRESSION OVERALL
* Yelen was so nice, and took great care of us
* Food came out quickly, and nothing disappointed

ENVIRONMENT / AMBIANCE
* The place is rowdy, but when you pay close attention you can hear Motown and Disco music playing in the background

WOW FACTOR
* Classic Malnati's.. classic!

A fun place to go and have deep dish Chicago style pizza with lots of baseball memorabilia on the walls- not just Sox's & Cubs. The Lou and Classic pies are nice as we say in Jersey. The fried calamari is good, not too much oil and tastes fresh. Some say you need to try the thin crust pies. I would agree, but if you are not frequenting Chicago then you have to go with the deep dish.
Of all the pizza I've ever eaten in my life, the pizza I had at Lou Malnati's was among the best. I really can't think of any pizza I've enjoyed more.

I had very high expectations.  I expected the perfect Chicago style pizza.  And I got it!  I ordered the Molnati's Classic with sausage and pepperoni, small size that could feed two very hungry people.  I called it in, and picked it up for takeout -- and they were friendly, efficient, and on time.  I highly recommend using this service.  Its hard to descibe the crunch and flavor of the buttery crust, in combination with the fresh tomatoes on top and tons of cheese going with it.  I have no need to run around Chicago trying the others -- I'll just keep coming here for more.

Great job Molnatis team!  Dont even think about missing out on this place!!

I was skeptical to try deep dish pizza, but I have to admit... I'm obsessed. I am thinking of making a whole second trip to Chicago just to come back here. The sauce and the crust are so original, to die for. Trying this place of course as a local, and definitely as a tourist, is a must!

I walked into Lou Malnati's with a lot of hope for a decent midday stop and bite to eat. Overall, I was incredibly disappointed all around by the service, food and experience provided by Lou Malnati's.

Our pizza took fifty minutes to come out, which wouldn't have been an issue if it were as hot as a pizza straight from the over should be. Our cookie pizza was completely dough and obviously just wasn't done cooking. I had thought that maybe it was just a certain part of the cookie, but the entire thing was mediocre because of the texture being a sloppy mess after the whipped cream and ice cream soaking into the dough. For a $7 dessert, there's a certain expectation that a consumer has. My edible cookie dough just fell short.

I will give the flavor to both of my items great remarks: the taste was totally there, and the proportions were PERFECT for my liking.

Our service was mediocre. Our waiter wasn't very helpful, and elongated our checkout time to the point of extreme frustration. I even asked to pay up front because we were tired of the neglect and have places to visit during our time here. Our waiter showed up five minutes after we sat back down and took our payment, then dropped off the card and receipt without any final remarks.

We won't be visiting again when we come back to Chicago. Hopefully we just caught them at a bad time, because it seems like a happening establishment, but it's pretty hard to advocate that any other visitors should make a stop here.

pics.caption: Cookie dough pizza... no structure to it at all.

review.des: This place is just amazing. The food is so good! The buttermilk crust in the deep dish pizza just melts in your mouth and the flavors are ridiculous. A very homey Italian vibe to this place and you won't leave here without being in a food coma. This is my go-to every single time I'm in Chicago. Even thought the lines are long and the wait times can be rather ridiculous, I'm not complaining because it is ALL worth it. Everyone that works here is friendly and the best part is you can purchase the pizzas frozen and bring them home if you're traveling domestically! They also have their salad dressing for purchase. Everything here is simply delicious!

Ok, so me and my boyfriend came to chicago for my birthday and he's never been before and neither of us has had deep dish pizza. So i took to facebook for suggestions "Lou Malnatis or Giordano's" (majority of people on Facebook said Giordanos). But i trusted my gut and some locals opinions and went to Lou's. And boy am i glad!!! (I am also writing this review after having Giordano's the next day to compare fairly). We ordered the chicago original i think what its called - just cheese, sauce, sausage and of course on their butter crust that is to die for. It is the perfect balance of the ratios of cheese sauce and crust. We even said to each other that we didnt need to try anything else to know which was best. The small size was perfect for me and my boyfriend who definitely likes to eat. They also have great drinks as well. From the pictures and the "cheese pull" videos I've seen, Giordano's does look like it would be better than Lou's... but it definitely isnt!!! I cant wait to visit Chicago again to come back. You can also order these frozen online and get them shipped to you, which I may do!

pics.caption: The Chicago original, just sausage, cheese, and sauce! SO GOOD

review.des: I do like Lous a lot, my favorite is giordanos but this is a good second. I just ordered the deep dish with extra cheese, very delicious!

Every single person who's been to Chicago told me to try Lou Malnati's Pizza. Can't go to Chicago and not order a deep-dish pizza.

The place was just starting to get busy when we came, we were seated quickly. By the time we left there was an hour wait.

We ordered a small pepperoni deep dish and a small The Lou deep dish. Too much food for two people, but hey its vacation and we took it to go (I had leftover pizza for breakfast. I regret nothing).
They tell you once your order is placed it will take 30-45 minutes. Not to worry they serve beer and the wait staff is on top of refills.
The pizza is worth the wait! Comes out hot, they slice it and serve it and it is delicious. The crust is so good, and I am not a deep dish fan. My favorite was the Lou.

Did you know they deliver frozen pizza nationwide?!

[ Food ]
-- The "Lou" Personal Pizza
-- The Malnati Chicago Classic Personal Pizza

[ Ambiance ]
-- Seated right when we got in despite the World Series Victory Parade outside
-- Super friendly staff even though they had a bunch of tables to service (tough job)
-- Warned ahead of time that the pizza would take about 30 min to make

[ Parking ]
--  Street parking, not too many spaces
--  Probably better to park and walk there

[ Size ]
-- 2 adults

[ Cost ] incl. tax & tip
-- $26

As it seems most people are saying, this seems to be the Chicago deep dish pizza spot!  Super excited and the people are incredibly friendly.  We were told the pizza would take awhile because they made it fresh (30-40min).  When it arrived, it was cheesy and the outside crust was slightly buttery which I like!  However, the flavors and amount of meat was a little disappointing.  It seemed as bit bland to me, but maybe it gets better if you get a larger pie?  Not sure, but for me, Chicago has a plethora of food options not restricted to deep dish pizza.

When in Chicago, you gotta get a deep dish.. or two.

Lou Malnati's was our second deep dish stop. We preferred this over Pequod's. The main differentiator is the crust, Lou Malnati's signature Buttercrust is freckin' delicious! We shared a small pan among two people which was more than enough food for us. We had an extra slice to take back which I was really debating on finishing! I might have had to be carried out of the restaurant if I did..

My only gripe is that there was an excessive amount of cheese for my preference. We wanted to experience it 'as is,' but if we ever make it to Chicago again, we're definitely requesting light on the cheese.

I don't usually crave pizza, but I'm drooling thinking about this.

pics.caption: Small Chicago Classic - added mushrooms, green peppers, black olives, mushrooms and garlic, total came out to $24.70
Look at that cheeseeeeeee. Omg. And then there's Shawn C. lol

review.des:
I always wanted to try Chicago style, deep dish pizza and my dream finally came true. We came here around 5 pm on Monday and luckily it wasn't busy yet. I liked the deco, family friendly, cozy, a classic pizza restaurant. Since it was our first time, our server was very helpful to explain the menu. She suggested some appetizers, otherwise, we would be waiting for up to 40 minutes for the pizza. We ordered chicken wings with buffalo sauce, 1/2 The Malnati Chicago Classic and 1/2 The "Lou" for two people. For the appetizer, it tasted fine. I loved the pizza which we ordered tasted amazing! We couldn't decide which one we loved more. I was additive to eat the part with cheese and stuffed very quickly. I preferred thick crust pizza over thin ones because they were much filling. By the time we left, people were line up outside of the street.

The pizza here totally blew off my mind and I wish I could take down more than two pieces a time. First time here but it won't be the last time. I will be back for sure.

pics.caption: Half The Malnati Chicago + half The "Lou"

review.des: Yummy pizza... kids loved the Chicago style pizza! Great sauce, cheese and crust. We also felt the customer service was exceptional!

I mean, there isn't much else to say about Lou's. They are a Chicago must. Giordano's and Gino's east think they have the best, and know they get all of the tourists, so in return you receive s@$* service. Lou's I always receive fantastic service. And not only is their pizza my second favorite in the city, but their salads are the serious sleeper here. Make sure you order a salad from them!

When in Chicago, eat deep dish pizza. I ordered a personal size dish of the Malnati's Classic Chicago Pizza. It was crowded, but I was alone so had a chance to sit at the bar. The pizza takes a little over 30 minutes to cook so they also have a bar to order drinks. When the pizza came out it was hot and fresh. Everything tasted so fresh and all the ingredients tasted high quality. The crust was crispy and buttery, sauce tasted of fresh tomatoes, cheese was plentiful for every bite, and sausage was meaty and fresh. I'm not a big fan of Chicago deep dish in general, I'm more of a thin crust pizza fan, but I would recommend this place!

pics.caption: Personal size pizza! Good portion for one person.

review.des:
Brought the family to Chicago for a long weekend and had to get an authentic deep dish pizza. Someone recommended Lou Malnati's to us...so naturally I looked it up on Yelp and saw a solid 4 stars, but also noticed that it is a chain of restaurants, so I was prepared to be a little underwhelmed...My instincts were off.  This was darn near one of the best pizzas we've ever eaten. We ordered the original deep dish sausage and it was fantastic.
We also had the dip trio with pizza chips...those chips were amazing.  Yeah....I'm a big fan.
Awesome pizza. Excellent service. Prompt delivery every time! Why bother going or ordering from anywhere else.
Sorry but this place and pequods have the best pizza in Chicago. Side note the sauce is a little on the sweet side so heartburn sufferers should be good to go.
Mediocre. Pizza was kind of cold and I've had it taste better. This location needs work. The Lous in Naperville is excellent compared to here. Also found a hair in salad which is beyond gross.

pics.caption: Beware of the hair in the salad. Found it in the salad and it was disgusting.

review.des:
Superb pizza!
Probably the best Chicago style pizza!  
In fact when I have out of town visitors I order from Lou's.
My advice to Lou's :  Keep up the good quality it matters.

The Chicago-style deep-dish pizza we had at Lou Malnati's was OK. If you order a deep-dish pizza, be prepared for about a 45-minute wait. It takes a while for these pizzas to be prepared. The menu says the pizzas take 30 minutes, but our wait was closer to an hour.

I actually had my first Lou Malnati's deep-dish pizzas in Atlanta -- they were shipped to me as gifts through Lou Malnati's Tastes of Chicago (yelp.com/biz/tastes-of-c…). I tried both a pepperoni and a sausage deep-dish pizza and they were delicious. The pizzas I had at home and the pizza I tried in the restaurant were very similar. I don't know if that's a good thing or bad thing considering how terrible I am in the kitchen (even with frozen food).

This Lou Malnati's is located in the River North neighborhood of Chicago. It's a little over a half-mile walk from the south end of The Magnificent Mile (about a 12-15 minute walk). I chose this place for our group for lunch because it had a 4-star rating on Yelp with about 3,000 reviews. I would consider this place touristy.

We showed up on a Monday around 2:30pm, hardly a peak time, and it was still busy. There's both indoor and covered outdoor seating. We were seated in the dining room in the back where there are booths and tables. They've tried to cram as many people in this space as (un)comfortably possible. It was such a tight fit that servers were constantly brushing up against us throughout the duration of our meal. When we first sat down, one of the servers accidentally painfully poked my friend in the arm with a pen. SMH.

The atmosphere is casual. The dining room has TVs playing sports and Chicago sports memorabilia (mainly jerseys) adorn the walls.

The restaurant sells both deep-dish and thin crust pizza. They come in four sizes from personal to large (serves 4). The standard pizzas have simple ingredients: cheese, sausage, and pepperoni. The cheese comes from Wisconsin, the sausage is local (not sure about the pepperoni), and the tomatoes come from California. They have a veggie deep-dish as well as their trademarked "Buttercrust" which you can add at an additional cost ($0.75 per pizza) plus over 10 additional enhancements/toppings if you so desire. In addition to pizza, they have appetizers like bruschetta and calamari; soups, salads, pastas, sandwiches, and desserts.

We went with the "Malnati Chicago Classic," small size (serves 2) for $14.95. FYI, a personal runs $9.45 and a large runs $24.95. The Malnati Chicago Classic is made with sausage, extra cheese, tomato sauce, and Buttercrust. While the pizza was good, it didn't seem exceptional to me. I was actually expecting there to be even more cheese (out to the edge of the deep-dish pan) and I was expecting the crust and cheese to be burnt in places. Instead, the crust had hardly any char whatsoever and tasted rather plain. The Buttercrust was noticeably richer than plain dough though. Admittedly, I think I was expecting more of a cheesy caramelized crust like those served at Pequod's. Overall, I thought the quality of the pizza and its ingredients were fine.

Other items we ordered included a medium Caesar salad with grilled chicken for $8.75 and an order of the "BuffaLou" chicken wings for $8.95. They were alright too. The Caesar was made with Romaine lettuce, lean chicken strips, chopped tomato, shaved Parmesan cheese (a healthy amount), and crunchy croutons tossed in Caesar dressing. Six wings came to an order of the BuffaLou wings (on the apps menu) with celery and ranch dressing on the side. These were basically your standard buffalo wings that were slightly spicy.

The staff was friendly and welcoming.

If you've never had deep-dish pizza in Chicago before, Lou Malnati's is one of the classic places to get it. According to the menu, this location in River North is the oldest (established 1986) of its four city locations. Another place to consider is competitor Giordano's. There's a location about a block off the Mag Mile at Superior and Rush.

pics.caption: Caesar Salad with Grilled Chicken. Romaine lettuce, strips of chicken and tomatoes with Caesar dressing and croutons. $8.75.
The Malnati Chicago Classic. Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. $14.95.
The Malnati Chicago Classic. Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. Small (serves 2). $14.95.

review.des: I love pizza and I believe it is extremely important to have the right crust. If you like a crust that is infused with olive oil and is greasy and hard this place is for you. I am not a fan. We ordered a deep dish cheese pizza and calamari and a few other sides. The price is fine, but I am not a fan of the quality of  pizza. I will not be back. The place is very clean and the waitress was extremely attentive.

Trying a staple of the Chicago deep dish pizza did not disappoint. Liked that the crust was more crispy than doughy. I would recommend sticking to the regular cheese.  We also got the special pizza but there were so many toppings the pizza was soggy.

We were walking the streets of Chicago on a quest to find the best deep dish pie in town, several folks had been asked Lou's was the spot.
Well we got turned around & around and finally called an Uber, good thing too we were way too far away to continue the urban hike. As you would expect busy at 8:30 on a Monday night, 25 minutes ok. Here you order your pizza so it's being made as you wait, ok that will speed things up. We were sat at a sidewalk table ordered our drinks and split the salad, the dressing intriguingly sweet and it worked. The medium pie tasted like spaghetti sauce with sausage on cheese filled not quite pie crust minus the butter part of the pastry. There are no choice of toppings only choices of pizza.
I ate the pizza with a knife & fork, the pie had cooled and we didn't get that stretchy goo of mozzarella. It thought "Italian sheppards pie", the tomato flavor of the sauce was outstanding. I'm not going to say it wasn't good and it wasn't bad but been there done that keep the shirt.
Foodguy-Martin

pics.caption: no time to hang around here

review.des: Great pizza!  There was a bit of a wait for a table, but it was totally worth it!  My family loved their deep dish pizzas, and my gluten free one was one of the best I've ever had. The crust was fantastic, not one of the cheap frozen ones. Great draft list too. Awesome experience, food, and service!!!

Came to the restaurant right when it opened on a Saturday for lunch and there was a line out the door. This was our first time visiting Chicago, and we wanted to try Chicago deep dish pizza. We shared a small order of "the lou". It took 45 minutes which the waitress warned us about. The pizza was really good. good service, good atmosphere. Would recommend.

Really really really amazing pizza. First trip to Chicago and I didn't know whether to try Lou's or Gios I was told by several friends that Lous was the way to go and I'm so glad I listened. The service was outstanding and so was the pizza. We couldn't decide between The "Lou" or the sausage and our server suggested we do the half and half to get some of both!! Genius and so great because my husband wanted the sausage and I wanted the Lou! They tell you it'll be 35 minutes for pizza but I think it was out in about 20 (we were there for lunch). Until my next trip to chi town I'll be dreaming of this pie!!

Lou's was good but the service lacked a little. The proportions need to be accurately depicted by the wait staff. Also, the pizza was good but slightly overrated. Left feeling unfulfilled. However, I am aware that other locations could have been a more fulfilling experience.

Mama Mia the pie is amorè. Thin crust is amazing as well as the deep dish. Fresh ingredients, amicable staff & local neighborhood delivery drivers. Your next pizza pie should be from Lou Malnati's ‍!! !!!!!

I went based on the ratings from Yelp!!! I wanted the best Chicago style pizza I could find!! Now I'm traditional NY style pizza chick, but I had to try it. It was very buttery, thick and saucy, I had pepperoni and was only able to eat two slices!!! Pretty good, I still prefer my NY style pizza tho. I had wings for an app, the blue cheese was better than the wings: they were ok but taste like previously frozen wings. The restaurant was nice, clean and open. The staff was friendly and services was good. I recommend visiting for the Chicago style pizza, butter crust

pics.caption: Pepperoni butter crust Chicago style with garlic, parm cheese and oregano

review.des: Oh man, what a deep dish pizza and what a wait! Be prepared to wait for about an hour and a half but if you haven't experienced Chicago deep dish before then it is worth the time! You will understand once you take a bite into this pizza that requires a fork and knife! Savor each bite! Have a malort shot at one of the local pubs to make the night complete!

As a Californian ... in Chicago we had to try all the most known pizza joints and this one was one of them... loved that buttery crust Lou malnatis have ... we got the original and it was great ... loved the taste... loved everything about it. Definitely will be coming back to Chicago for all of it

I always get my delivery pizza from here, and use the online ordering. I am glad they have the location in Lawndale/Douglas Park where corporate investment is rate. Although their deep dish isn't as deep as traditional Chicago deep,  it's still damn good. I recommend the Lou.

I do like Lou's... I'm still on the quest for my favorite pizza and I could eat pizza everyday!
Lot's of competition out there as well as many types of taste buds.  I'm not a huge sausage fan so maybe that's the 4**** reason.  (That's what they ordered.)  
It is a really good place and if you've never been... do give them a try.  It does get really busy and a long wait so get here when they open.  Friendly and competent service.
Good wings and I love the atmosphere... a very warm feeling restaurant.

My go-to for deep dish because it's close to where I live and they do take-out.  I usually love love love sausage on my pizzas, but I actually think the Lou (veggie) pizza is my favorite here! The Classic is a close second but If i were to eat one pizza the rest of my life, it'd be the Lou.  I don't see a point in even trying to create your own pizza because both of their pre-selected options are delicious.  

There's usually a long line, so I always order delivery or carry out.

I've heard their salads are good but I've never made it past their pizzas...

The food is GOOD here. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was due to the dirty dish rag smell I sensed when I first walked in. I sat at the bar and spoke with the waiter for suggestions. He explained their specialities and suggestions based on our preference (which he inquired about).  My friend and I ordered two buttery deep dish personal pizzas with different veggies, both very very tasty. For an appetizer we ordered the spinach bread...it was AMAZING! Since I am in Chicago celebrating my bday, David surprised me with their homemade ice cream and warmed chocolate cookie. Overall wonderfully pleasant experience!

Went to Lou's on a relative recommendation and I must say it's really good pizza. The place was crowded so we sat at the bar. The staff was pleasant and the atmosphere was fun. We had the 6" pizza with sausage.

I did contact management. He said he was going to send me a pizza, AND FAILED TO DO SO. Doesn't surprise me. (Readers), don't be fooled by their pathetic attempt at customer service on here (after the fact).

My first ever Chicago deep dish pizza!

A bit doughy and heavy for me. But I have to say, I wasn't expecting the slices to be so big, I definitely underestimated this pizza.

I ordered a pie thinking I would eat at least 3 but failed miserably. Oh well, leftover pizza tastes just as good the next day!
Best deep dish pizza in the city, in my opinion! Must stop here when visiting Chicago! We ate here twice on our short trip last year.

It is very good but I like their soups best. The restaurant is very visually pleasing and popular to the local diners. It is not cheap but it is in an expensive area and is very fair for the location.

Pizza 5 stars
House Malnati's salad (family size) 5 stars
Ambiance 5 stars
Service was a little slow because they were so busy, but very polite and enjoyable.
I recommend!!!

Came here as the first stop of a River North food tour. The slice was a simple sample but it didn't lack flavor. I can't give it 5 stars untill I get the real Chicago deep dish! Coupled my slice with a Blue Moon. Coming back for a real slice soon! Great service and good food. Bust spot and worth getting. One lovely lady I sat with during the tour mentioned she had a pizza shipped to Nashville Tennessee! If that doesn't tell you how good it is.. Not sure what Will! Yes, they will ship out of state! Get yours or one for a friend!

pics.caption: Out on a River North tour. This was our first stop. Thus is not the usual gigantic deep dish slice but it does not lack flavor!

review.des: I this is the best pizza that I've had in a long while! Very thick and creamy pizza. It reminds me of lasagna. It's not quite like Neapolitan pizza; more like it's cousin that moved to America and married a Polish sausage cook. This makes Joe's Pizza in New York City looks like a sorry excuse for burnt toast with cheese wiz.

The best and most authentic deep dish pizza in Chicago. Order anything from their deep dish menu such as the Lou, the mushroom pizza, or any of their in house specials. If you are visiting Chicago, you need to try Lou Malnatis, ask anybody else who is a true Chicagoan and they will tell you the same.

They warn you right at the beginning that their pizza takes a long time. The day we went the restaurant was not full but not just the pizza took a long time. The pizza was ok, but it's a trendy place with a reputation.
Most deff. The best deep dish in Chicago. I will be dreaming of this pie for years to come. Plz bring one to nova.

The pizza here is SO good!!! My SIL brought me a pizza when she visited me in Cali so when I visited her in Chicago, I had to bring one back! I Uber'd here and was told when I placed the order that it would be a 45 minute wait. I didn't mind tooo much. Just sat there and waited.. while I was waiting I looked at the menu and say they had already frozen ones ready for the taking so I picked up one of those too so I could take it and bake at home! The place is big but cramped, expect a wait, but if you like Chicago deep dish, this is the stuff!!!

After finally trying Pequod's and Giordano's, I think Lou Malnati's is by far a step above. Easily the best deep dish pizza I've ever had, and up there as one of my favorite pizza joints overall. Crust, toppings, cheese...it's a perfect balance all around. A must try for anyone visiting Chicago wanting to try a traditional deep dish style pizza.

The pizza is a classic Chicago pizza! It is very filling and good! However a lot of meat. The thin crust is just as good. Make sure you add a salad in with it, their salad is very good! And makes the whole meal more enjoyable!

3.5?
Maybe expected too much.
Got the basic pepperoni deep dish.
What am I supposed to be amazed by????
The salad was great and the garlic bread was great as well. Service good.
No wait because we got there slightly before 5. When we were coming out though, it was getting pretty packed.

This place gets packed and for good reason too.  The pizza is amaze balls.  Fret not though, if you have to wait for a table they will let you order your pizza while you are waiting.  I really like this because it comes out to the table at almost the same time you sit down.  They have really got their stuff together on this one.

This is my favorite Chicago style pizza. The Lou's salad dressing is also amazing!! They have a mini personal pizza which is the perfect size if you want your own kind of pizza. Their ranch also pairs well.

We live close to the State Street location and it's our go-to pizza. On our last visit I tried the personal size crustless pizza as a lower carb option and it was delish with a sausage crust and the mushrooms I picked for my topping. I recommend getting it extra crispy so the sausage doesn't get soggy.  The regular deep dish is always good as well. Get the butter crust and don't pick too many toppings. Their signature salad is also one of my favorites.
Waited for 1 1/2 hours due to the long lines of people wanting to get in....it was sooo worth it!!  Outstanding service, outstanding Pizza!!

Homemade salad dressings! Fantastic! Now I've tried several deep dish restaurants in Chicago and still can't find one that beats Windy City (Va Beach, Va) (natives from Chicago).
Sausage is great, but chopped tomatoes on top has no flavor, just right out of the can? Buttery crust was not as flavorful as I was expecting either.
One and I was done. Salads were yummy though!

So this is pretty touisty, but good.  We got the "Butter Thin Crust" which my mate suggested and it was very good.  I would say that I would have done the traditional deep dish next time but overall it had nice cheese, good sauce and a nice crust.  I stil would say I like NYC thin crust better.

Overall a great place, but it very busy and the pre- sit down experience is not great. They give you a window of when you will sit down and you order the pizza and then you get your pizza 20 or 30 minutes after you site down.

I called a Togo order and when they say how long it will take they aren't messing around! It was promptly ready at the time they said it would be. It was my first time having deep dish pizza and it was AMAZING! We had a medium pepperoni and sausage. The place is hectic and very busy! The environment is also pretty loud and close together with the large volume of guests that come thru it shouldn't come as a surprise. Like most popular places in the city there are lines and waits associated with the experience. Keep that in mind when you visit :)

pics.caption: pepperoni and sausage deep dish pizza

review.des:
This is where you get the flu.

Disappointing that the stars dropped down to two soley due to restaurant cleanliness and poor staff. We were given a crusty plate and ask for a new one. We watched the waiter go through about 5 plates before finding one he deemed acceptable to give us. Similarly my mothers fork was covered in greased. We watched the waiter sort through maybe 9 or 10 forks before finding one to replace it with!!

Is this massive touristy chain restaurant using cold water to wash their dishes? There was a staff of 10+ just standing in the back laughing it up. Yet we were given room temperature  wings 45 minutes after ordering them? Our table was still covered in crumbs from the party before us (but i felt embarrassed for asking for clean dishes twice already so I wiped it off with a napkin myself). I will absolutely never return here or any affiliated restaurants again.

Deep dish wasn't really thick but just right and it was nice a crunchy. The wait was worth it. 3 of us ordered one small along with a thin a crust pizza and it was hard to finish. The thin crust was okay.
Haven't been there but wanted to be the 5000th review in hopes of a free pizza when I go tomorrow

Super good pizza! We were excited to try true deep dish pizza that our friends had reccomend. It didn't disappoint on the taste side of things. I was a little dissatisfied with how long we waited for the pizza after we were told the time line it would be ready. We called it in around 3pm and we were told it would be ready in 45min. After waiting 45 min we had to wait another 20... this was a bummer because I had to pay for parking when the plan was to just drop off the hubbs and take the block to pick him back up. (The pie its selfwas about $30) ... the napkin they put on top of the pizza stuck to the pizza and kinda killed the point of making Snap chat friends jealous. The pizza was good though so... 4 stars.

This is purely for food review only. If factor in service, I can only give this place 1 star.

Was looking to try deep dish pizza when planning a Chicago vacation, Andrew Zimmern mentioned about Pizzaria Uno & This place. Decided to try Lou because it was a walking distance from our hotel. We got there around 5:30, the place was busy but we just had to wait for 5 minutes for our table. The server was promptly greeted us almost as soon as we sat down. For appetizer, We ordered fried calamari (5/5)- the Marinara sauce was freshly made. Chicken wing (5/5)- was probably the best wings I have had anywhere. Now for pizza, we have ordered personal cheese deep dish & the small Lou with buttery crust (since according to the menu this was the one made Lou famous). The pizza never came out until about 1.5 hrs after. The server admitted that she had forgotten to send our order in. They comp the both pizza for the mistake. I have to say after the wonderful appetizers we have tried, the pizza was a let down. The Lou (3/5) was just ok, good cheesy and crispy crust but that was probably the best description I could give. I was just bland for my taste. The cheese pizza (3/5) was again very cheesy but nothing that would scream my name to come back for.

First time to Chicago, had to try pizza,  since it's my favorite food,  second only to cereal.  

Well,  pizza was ok and service was friendly but sparse.

Lovely tiny blonde waitress took our order,  warned us pizza  takes 45 minutes to come out, brought drinks and then disappeared after she dropped off the pizza (to their credit it was only 30 minutes).  When we asked for check she asked if we wanted a refill. Yes we did,  ten minutes ago.  

The small pizza,  billed for 2, was  small but filling.  Sauce is acidic and nothing special.  Cheese is abundant and flavorful.  The crust is disappointing; it was beautifully crisp but tasted only of flour.

Not awful but I'd try elsewhere next time.

This place is good but I do prefer other deep dish pizza places in Chicago.
I was disappointed they don't have a beer on draft.
Also, the atmosphere, service and set up of the place can seem a bit like you are in a nicer fast food place, not a really nice sit down dining place.
