Very friendly and prompt on everything we asked for, I wish I would have got her name.  When we arrived at the table we ordered the stuffed spinach bread, it came out quickly and was full of oozing deliciousness.  After the spinach bread I was eagerly anticipating heaven in my mouth when my pizza came out. I had ordered the Lou; it comes with mushrooms, spinach, chunky tomato sauce, and globs of mouthwatering cheese.  I am a pizza lover so for me this experience was orgasmic, it was as if only I and "Lou" existed and boy was it delicious! I literally didn't hear any conversations going on around me and just sat and enjoyed my pizza and beer. Next time I am in Chicago, without a doubt, I will go visit good ol' Lou Malnati's for another pie.

Holy moly the line for this place was ridiculous. The first thing on my Chicago to do list was to try deep dish pizza so I asked around and was told Lou Malnati's was one of the best. When I got there the line went out the door. By the time I got to the front of the line to put my name down I was told my wait was about 30-40 minutes. The nice thing is that they will text you when your table to ready so you don't have to wait inside necessarily. Since I was a party of 1 I decided to take my chances and wait by the bar as a backup plan because it's open seating there. Right when a seat opened up I was notified my table was available. The hostess said that there were no more couples on the waitlist left so they had a table for me. Not sure how I felt about that comment, but was glad I would have a table instead of being crammed at the bar.

I was pretty set on just ordering a pizza but the server told me that it would be at least 45 minutes unless I pre-ordered at the hostess stand. I wish I would've known that. So if you're reading this be sure to pre-order your pizza if you're waiting for a table! I ordered the bruschetta appetizer to munch on while I waited for my pizza. It was both a good and bad thing. Good because it was delicious (the garlic rounds were awesome), bad because it filled me up.

I ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic personal sized pizza... because when in Rome right.. er Chicago.I was warned that it would have a lot of sausage, and they weren't kidding. It was tasty, but I wouldn't say I'm a fan of deep dish pizza. My heart and stomach is with thin crust pizza. Does anyone else feel like they are eating a casserole too?

pics.caption: Malnati Mule - stoli vodka, triple sec, lime juice, and ginger beer

review.des: This was the "must go to place" everyone told me to check out while in Chicago. Everyone raved about Deep Dish pizza the whole time. This place was so packed. Be prepared to wait, it's a very small menu so everything is flowing pretty fast. The pizza was good. We ordered the Lou. It was very filling. Good salads and other items also. Check it out, but it's very commercial-ized. I will opt for a local pizzeria next time. Still very good, and the service was good also .

This is such a classic of Chicago it might as well fight for parking dibs while chugging Old Town in ill fitting jeans and a Bears hoodie.

What really needs to be said? You want your bare bones, traditional Windy City breaking-a-plastic-fork-so-deep dish, this is it. It hits all the spots of deep dish, with rich sauce, gooey cheese, and crust with a nice crunch.

Of course you need a lager to wash it all down. Stay true to Chicago, and order a 312 to go with it.

D' best thin crust pizza in the midwest! Drove from the gateway arch to have a good pizza, and it's worth the 300 miles to try this deliciousness of a round dough. When we arrived the line was also 300 meters long that we just opted to go, and after the first bite I got a taste of mecca decca pizzeria fantasia. And let me correct my first statement, Drove from the gateway arch to have an excellent thin crust pizza.

pics.caption: Avoid the line and order to go

review.des:
If I am in Chicago you better believe I am going to Lou's for some deep dish. My cousin took us to this location which was new to me. We shared a pepperoni deep dish and the salad as usually and as normal, it made me not want to leave Chicago! I cannot express how good this pizza is! It will have your taste buds doing the happy dance.  The also had a great selection of craft beers available. I was able to point my friend towards the New Holland Poet which has since become a favorite beer for him.

There wasn't much of a wait when we went later on a Thursday night. The service was friendly and attentive and the restaurant itself was very clean and well kept. Our order was taken and delivered quickly and was of top notch quality as I have come to expect at Lou's.

If you are looking for some deep dish and are in the area, do not hesitate to stop in and enjoy this incredible pizza!

pics.caption: It doesn't get much better than this!

review.des: What an amazing pizza. Delicious and heavenly. Highly recommend!!!  Suggest pre ordering pizza when you check in
It was a last minute decision to go to this place and I am glad I went. The pizza crust is amazing! The wait is long but well worth it.

We couldn't leave Chicago without the infamous deep dish pizza....Now being a New Yorker I still think the thin slice is the traditional pizza. That said got to Lou Malnati's, parking was easy to find and we got a table right away......Unfortunately the table was right below the air conditioner and thus making it feel like a fridge. I went back to the hostess and requested we swap and that's when the attitude kicked in as I provided more work on her plate. We found another table and just needed a two top for attachment and she made some really nasty facial expressions. That said we finally got our 6 top and began to order. We were hungry so ordered the wings which were great + the spinach loaf + calamari which were outstanding. As for pizza the little one got the personal cheese and we got the medium veg pizza + extra cheese. Man when this came to the table we were excited and couldn't recall the last time we ate pizza with a fork and knife. The wait is long so be prepared as it took roughly 30-40 mins. The pizza was stuffed with topping, weighed about 5 lbs a slice and tasted very good. One slice is more then enough thus we had left overs. Wish I could have tried some competitors while in Chicago but overall your in good hands at this place just be careful of the hostess.......:boo!
Amazing crustless pizza , being on the Keto diet and craving pizza has been a night mare, thank you loumalnatis for saving me from pizza withdrawals
Lou's deep dish pizza was good but not exceptional.  Reason for 2 star, very rude waitress with poor attitude.

Not all it's hyped up to be, wait was over 40 minutes. Waitress kept forgetting to bring out the right order to us. Forgot the salad then brought us the wrong wings, blamed the kitchen for both things then said it was due to Father's Day crowd. Pizza finally came out and it was just ok, wouldn't go back.
Best deep dish pizza in the city.  The sauce is fantastic and I love the crust.  Always order the sausage and you get a sausage in every bite.

I have been to Gino's pizza before , and this trip to decided to change it Jp, and was happy to make that decision.
On a Friday night , placed was packed as expected , they have a good system and the wait takes about 45 mins .
Meanwhile u can wait by the bar .
The food was delicious , had the house specialty , ordered a small, which was a perfect size for my and the husband.
Also had a salad to share and it was delicious,
For dessert had the chocolate chip cookie with ice cream on top. The waiter recommended the large portion, but I think we would Have been good with the small .
The flavor of the pizza was fantastic, the dough was crunchy, and the tomatoe sauce was tasty and delicious ..
would do it over again !!!!

Always a favorite! I recommend the spinach bread and getting the butter crust deep dish! The sausage comes in real large slices which is amazing! Just a tip - - whatever size of deep dish pizza you think you need.... order a size smaller!!  unless of course you want leftovers!!

The best Chicago deep dish. It lived up to the expectations we had. Get there early because the line starts to run out the door as early as 5 pm. We got the cheesy bread which was perfectly flaky without tasting too cheesy and heavy.

We got the 'Lou' which was a veggie pizza with spinach, mushroom, and tomato. The small is a perfect size for two people.

One of the best deep dish options in Chicago!

We ordered for our pizza for delivery. Pizza was yummmmmm. Wish we took the time to go and eat there because I'm sure the pizza would have been even better fresh out of the oven.

If we ever go back to Chicago I would go back and eat the pizza at the restaurant.
Didn't care for it- not a lot of cheese, no taste, greats service and the wait not bad 1 hr. Winds yummy! Wouldn't go back- not sure what the hype is about.

Drove all the way from Dallas to Chicago just for this. Had a really high expectations because I've read and heard good things about Chicago pizza. When we got here, we reserved a table for 2 and pre-ordered medium Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza. its good that we waited only for 20 minutes to be seated, but we still have to wait for 35 minutes for the pizza to come even though we have pre-ordered the pizza before. When the pizza came, the cheese was hard and not even half-melted. We told our server, Jacob, and he was not even trying to do anything about it. Nope. Not going back here again.

We visited Chicago for the first time and stayed at the Hyatt Regency. After freezing at Wrigley Field we really wanted pizza delivery. First time having deep dish pizza so we thought it was great! We don't have anything to compare it to. Very fresh tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese. We got the large pizza and side salad which was fantastic too. Delivery time was as told to us on the yelp app. We are used to thin NYC crust so we didn't really you can only really eat max 2 slices pp. delivery was a major bonus.

Best pizza in town! Staff is always so nice. Totally worth the wait. Wish I could give more stars. I order deep dish butter crust with cheese and sausage pieces. I ask them to be sure every slice has sausage in it.  I do not like the slab of sausage on the pizza.

First time trying deep dish pizza!

Everyone says it's a must try whenever you go to Chicago cause we all know Chicago is known for this. Few of my friends told me it's nothing special so I went in without high hopes. Also because I'm not a big pizza fan :x

The waiter cut the pieces for us the second he brought it over and put it on our plates. Before I even get to take a bite of my own piece, my friends and I found a hair that we pulled out from the cheese from the remaining pizza slices on the pan lol I think it's kinda funny because so far our eating out experiences in Chicago have been terrible.

My friends and I told the waitress. She acknowledged what happened and told the manager. He came to us and apologized - super friendly and understanding. Not once did he blame it on the workers or question if it was ours. He said "No one knows how it got there and things happen unfortunately so I apologize for that." This is the kind of manager we all love working with.

He offered us a thin crust pizza pie to try since we already have the deep dish pizza slices on our plate. We were really full by the time he brought that over. Then he kindly told us that the pizza will be on the house and apologized again. He definitely knows how to make a bad situation better.

Our bill came and we only got charged for the appetizers - calamari and spinach stuffed bread. It came out to be $5 per person only so we decided to tip extra. Gave about 22% tip because of the great service. My friends weren't too crazy about the pizza though. I thought they were okay but we came to the conclusion that Chicagoans haven't tried pizza until they try NYC pizza.

I visited on a weekday night and was a little surprised to see that a Lou Malnati's wasn't jam packed at 7. After eating here I guess I know why.
I ordered the Malnati classic personal pizza, and for some reason what I got that day was not what I was expecting. The tomato sauce did not taste fresh, and the cheese wasn't exactly tantalizing either. The crust was crispy at least, but when the tomato/cheese/sausage are all subpar at best, I can only give two stars. I can't explain why it really just tasted as if the pizza ingredients all came from a can as I've had amazing pizza experiences at other locations in other parts of the city.
The wait was also insanely long, I waited 50 minutes for a tiny personal pizza that was not very tasty. Not recommended, will not return to this location.

My first time trying Lou's while visiting from out of town. Excellent Chicago deep dish pizza and some of the best calamari I have ever had. The tiramisu was awesome. The waitress was very friendly and helpful. Must try if you are visiting the area

I M U S T say that as a LOVER of Pizza, Lou is my new man !!!
I was quite taken aback by the heartiness of their pizza.
I was TOTALLY smitten w/Home Run Inn Pizza in Berwyn, until they
(CLUTCH MY PEARLS !!!) changed the ingredients in the crust.
I went searching folks, yessss, I was out there hoping, wishing & waiting. Then a friend told me to stop swiping right or left and simply to go see Lou.
The thin crust spinach & cheese pizza made me want to take it home. Since we'd just met, I simply had 5 slices and gave the rest to my friend. Needless to say...I am now carrying a torch. Thank you, Lou Malnati's @1235 W.Randolph !!
The holy grail of Chicago pizza - this is as good as it gets! Do yourself a favor and get the buttercrust. Do yourself another favor and get the sausage.

We searched and read many reviews on best deep dish pizza in Chicago and finally decided on this place and are happy we did. Had wings and cheese bread for appetizer and while both were good , the cheese bread was beyond good. Pizza was very good. My husband and I got a medium with sausage, cheese, pepperoni, black olives, jalapeños and we stuffed ourselves trying to eat it all but of course couldn't and that was the only disappointment. We were so full and satisfied, That ended being our only meal of the day.

Quanita was the worst. She was rude and lied multiple times about when our take out order was ready. She and others kept telling us that our order was ready or it was coming up. We had to catch a flight so had to leave without the pizza

Update- after posting this review, I had a nice call from the management. They are taking my review seriously which I was happily surprised about. Next time in town I'll definitely try their pizza, and write a real review :-P.

I'm not a huge pizza person (don't eviscerate me), but I'm already yearning my return to Lou Malnati's. This place gets packed, so get there early. There's a line to put down your name, and another to preorder your pizza (nothing else, the rest you order at your table). It's quite an efficient system, and they text you a link that updates what position you are in line.

We ordered the 'Malnati Chicago Classic' in small and it fed two people comfortably. Never had deep dish pizza before so this was a nice change. There's a layer of sausage hidden beneath the flavorful tomato sauce that satisfies a carnivore's palate like mine with each meaty bite. The presentation itself was not as 'deep' as I had imagined, but I don't care about the aesthetics of food. Overall, easily the best pizza I've ever had and wish they'd expand to Philly.

Oh.. we also ordered wings, but they were whatever.

You Only Live Once- That's the Motto.

I like to consider myself a pizza queen. So being in Chicago, I had to try the Lou Malnati's.
I've been dreaming of this day ever since I was a young child, have pizza so cheesy i could pull it for miles, and sauce so drippy it's like im eating soup.

Chitown, you're a beauty, but my NYC side is kicking in. The cheese is much saltier compared to NYC cheese, I'm thinking they probably soak they're cheese in salt water?
Cheese was pully, but where's my deep dish sauce at? With inches of cheese, the sauce is ignored. One slice is good enough to keep me full for the whole day.

Came to Lou with Zhenni L. and Winnie L., as they mentioned below, a piece of hair was found in our pizza. Spoke to the manager about this incident and he gave us a thin pizza on the house.
I prefer deep dish over the thin pizza. The thin pizza was more of flatbread just loaded on top of cheese.

Glad I got to check off deep dish in my pizza bucket list. Though we had a small incident in the beginning, Lou Malnati handled the situation in a professional manner!

We went for an early dinner here and the place was pretty slow so the service was very good! not sure if they would be as accommodating with a busier restaurant! but I digress we had a bread filled with cheese that was some of the best bread I've ever had!!! Then the pizza came and I was floored! The pizza looked, smelled, and tasted so good! like nothing I've had before! Lou's is a 5 star stunner all day!!!
Wow! There is no way to describe this place. I've always wanted to try "Chicago Deep Dish" so I traveled just shy of 800 miles to try it here. I'm already plotting my return!

Very crowded for dinner. Order your pizza as soon as you put your name on the wait list. The Malnati salad is one of kind delish. The pizza... well you know, it's why there's a waitlist! Best crust I've ever tasted. I had the classic.

We were pleasantly surprised at how serious this place is about its beef; sliced thinly, flavorful, decent portions, and very tender and juicy. Unfortunately, it is lacking in almost all other aspects.

To start, the cheese on the beef sandwich wasn't distributed evenly. The fries that came with it were at room temperature.

Perhaps we're spoiled by west coast deep dish pizza because the toppings here seem liquidy and less flavorful. Perhaps the west coast pizzerias aren't constrained by traditional views on deep dish pizza and can innovate around things like honey with the deep dish crust (which is amazing!)

This would've otherwise been a three start restaurant if it wasn't for the horrible service. Our waiter disappeared for almost the entire time we were there (almost 50 minutes). We had to ask for ketchup twice (the first person we asked seem distracted; he was texting in the kitchen when I was going to the bathroom).

As a final note on the bathroom, no seat covers... not cool.

Disclosure, I'm from New York City, so I have a general belief that deep dish pizza is not really Pizza.  HOWEVER, this place can convert anyone, even me, into abandoning any notion of the traditional pizza pie for the Chicago original version of the original.  You won't be disappointed.  The place has a a fair number of tv monitors, just in case your favorite team is playing.  I'm
a happy tourist here and so will you.  It's a definite out of town must eat joint!
What can I say, this is the best pizza in Chicago, and this was as good as usual. The service was good, and the prices were right. I love Lou's.
love it, def recommend, i must say, it's  better than Giordano's! Just saying.. lol  less touristy.

Not a Chicago deep dish guy. so bear that in mind.

If you look at it as a giant pizza pop tart with a ton of cheese and tomatoes. it's wonderful. I can't call it pizza, I just can't. But I tell you, it is tasty, but in small doses. There's enough cheese in these things to gag a Cheesehead...excellent! The tomato sauce is very nice if a little sweet. The crust is buttery (weird) and a little too much for me.

Again, it's not a pizza. But I recommend you try it once to see if you like it.

Service was fast and friendly and the decor is great (especially the old skateboards), but the pizza fell flat for us: there was little to no salt in the dough, which made it painfully noticeable. It made me feel like I was eating a communion wafer, and I haven't been in church for years. It took me right back to Sister Miriam smacking me with a ruler at Saint Mary's High School.

The sauce was a little plain for us, being just crushed tomatoes. There may have been something else in there, but if there was it wasn't very noticeable.  We heard amazing things about LM's so we gave it a try. We're always excited  to try restaurants we've never eaten in, and this is no exception, but the pizza just wasn't to our liking.

We fall in the minority, and It still sits as one of the highest-rated spots in town to get a pie, but not for us.  I'd give it a shot if you've never been there.

Despite looking like so many generic restaurants in the first floor of a newly built or renovated luxury apartment building, this is still a lou malnati's and it is still excellent. Also, the person on the wall behind the register is either Lou Malnati who looks like Newman from Seinfeld or it's actually just Newman from Seinfeld. ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯

Giordano's has the overall better pizza, but there were a couple elements to Malnati's that I really enjoyed.

1. The sauce - VERY acidic (which I love). I wish it was more of a sauce than a collection of tomatoes, but it was very tasty. I love acid.
2. The butter crust - Beautiful, just beautiful. I'm not a crust person and I didn't eat the crust on Giordano's pizza, but you best believe I ate the crust here. I love this crust.

The things lacking in comparison to Giordano's:

1. The cheese. There's simply not enough cheese on the pizza to make for that stringy, I'm-going-to-drown-in-cheese experience.
2. Giordano's flavor combinations blend together in an irresistible way. You taste individual components on the Malnati's pizza, but they don't come together.

If only someone could combine the two, you'd probably have the most amazing pizza ever...

PS - After we got off the plane, a lady told us that Malnati's has the best caesar salad in the city. So we ordered one. I think she meant that they have the best caesar dressing, because that was effing delicious and clearly made in house. The lettuce, however, was sad and limp. Too bad...

pics.caption: Happy Valentine's day! Heart shaped deep dish :)

review.des: A busy dinner for a Wednesday night, but can't complain about it because that's not something to lose a star over. The host staff was friendly and quoted us our wait time with accuracy to the minute. Our server for the night was helpful and joyful as well as timely. Perceived our needs and met them. Even recommended a few other local eateries and touristy things to do (we are from LA). The calamari with its chunky marinara dip and wings with Gorgonzola cheese sauce  were both cooked wonderfully. We were asked to order our pizza when we put our name in for seating which worked out well. The pizza was amazing!

The only other time I had tried deep dish was at an UNOs years ago which was not good, so I figured I did not like deep dish pizza.  Lou Malnati's changed my mind.. didn't have high expectations but I was pleasantly surprised when I tried Lou Malnati's for the first time.  We ordered a personal classic deep dish to share (as a snack before our dinner reservation elsewhere hahah), which came in four slices and it was crispy and absolutely delicious.  I was raving about it to everyone when I returned home from my first Chicago visit.  However, in my most recent visit, we ordered a few of the large size pizzas which were not the same as the personal size.  This time the pizzas were a bit soggy and the crust was not crispy.  However, the salad was great.  I'll be back for a personal pizza next time with hopes that it will be as good as the first time I had it.

Went there expecting a great Chicago deep dish pizza, I got a over-cooked piece of dough with tomatoes and cheese. Also, no one decided to tell me and my family that the pizza would take 50 minutes to come out. (There is a preorder option but we were not aware of the 50 minute wait) After all the hype for the pizza, we weren't the biggest fans. To make it even better, the sausage was grey and didn't taste like anything. We also ordered a thin crust pizza which had a soft crust. Couldn't even bend it. All in all, not worth the hype.

P.S. - it was very cold in the restaurant.
Have ordered and dined in, the thin is my favorite, but my husband that loves deep dish this is his go too. We love the name sake salad too.

Had my first ever deep dish in chi town ... I was told this was a better location so I went here. I got your standard deep dish, nothing fancy. It was pretty darn good but I wouldn't go back if I wish in chi town again. Of course, when you're in Chicago you have to try a deep dish at least once. It didn't disappoint.

We also got the bruschetta which was decent and a huge portion.

I was in town for a conference and didn't feel like venturing out so I ordered delivery. I loved the online ordering and that I could customize my pie right down to how done it was. My order came earlier than promised and was piping hot. The personal pizza really hit the spot. Prices were spot on, not too high for the food you get. I'll definitely hit them up the next time I'm in Chicago!

I love all kinds of pizza. I really do. And honestly I will eat anywhere someone suggests just to try something new. But if I want to buy my own deep dish/go out for my bday I tend to go to Lou Malnati's. It is just a personal thing. Nothing against any other deep dish pizza place. I've tried them all. They all have their pros/cons. Sometimes you just have a preference.
I am a Chicagoan and love Lou's. I like getting the Lou's at Lou's. I like the salad. I like the dessert. My friends have worked there. I would weirdly love to work there. Just to be around the smell all the time.
The only negative is the wait sometimes. I usually will only go on like some awkward off-time just to avoid the people. Or I order and then pick up. Or just get it delivered. All I know is that I crave this pizza every night for some reason. I just really like the crust I think.

This was another popular and hot restaurant. One hour waiting outside on the street. While waiting, preorder your food, get a drink and wait some more.

Got a classic deep dish pizza, and BBQ chicken salad. Don't trust that you are hungry and can eat a lot pizza. I saw while waiting a couple walked out with a leftover box, handed it over to a young dude waiting to get in, saying they ordered too much and could not finish. Ours was a medium, gosh, it took a great effort to chew down just over half a pie. It was a great pizza, great size and very filling. Not tomato paste, it's crushed tomato and pulling yard long yummy cheese.

Got a leftover piece, keep it or toss it? Should have give it away to a hungry waiting dude.
5 Star Pizza.  Had the Chicago style and it's amazing.  The wings, pasta, and thin crust are on point too.  This is definitely a must try.  I'm from Michigan and we do not have food like this!

Long overdue review- was in CHI for this years lollapalooza

I moved to NYC about a year ago so deep dish pizza is very different - In a great way - and takes a while (~45min) to cook so come before you get hungry lol!

We ordered two personal pies: the vegetarian one had peppers, mushroom, some kind of greens may have been spinach - was bombdigs, crust was nice and toasty/crunchy and the middle was nice and cheesy and filling!
The other pie we got I think was pepp- basic but can't go wrong with it.
So worth the hype- it's different but super yummy!

Amazing food and atmosphere. The salad is soooo delicious. The pizza crust is so buttery and crunch. It's a perfect combination of goodness with sauce and cheese. Very quaint and cute place. Can not wait to return.
Great place came here after a hawks game.  Need food to water down my beer from the game. Staff is always friendly. Good stuff.

This place has the real deal of CHICAGO style pizza! The sauce is fantastic but oh the butter crust makes the dish just that much better!! Their wings are also very good; crispy with good amount of meat.

Brought my boyfriend along for his first trip to Chicago and of course he wanted to try the famous Chicago deep dish pizza. We were between Pequod's or Lou Malnati's, but Pequods had a two hour wait just for a table AND you had to wait an extra 90 minutes for the pizza to cook. We were starving, so that was a no go. Lou Malnati's was our next best bet. We arrived at 7pm on a Sunday and they text you whenever your table is ready. You can also check on your number in line so you can walk around while waiting for your table. It is very crowded inside, so I recommend walking around even though it was freezing cold outside and nothing was really open. Another advantage is being able to order your pizza beforehand. Since it does take 90 minutes to cook, you don't have to wait for your table to order and for your pizza to cook! We waited about 30 mins for a table for four. Not too shabby. We ordered the Malnati salad and the combination platter for an appetizer. Holy malnati, the salad was soo good. My mom could not stop talking about the dressing. They need to release that dressing recipe because it tasted like crack. The combination platter has a bunch of fried stuff, like fried zucchini and mushrooms. Pretty good, but anything fried is good. Our pizza took about 25ish more minutes to come out, and they slice and plate it in front of you. We ordered the classic and added pepperoni and mushrooms (it comes with sausage). My favorite part was the crust, it wasn't soggy despite all of the sauce and cheese on there. I got full off of one slice. Everyone thought it was good, but Chicago pizza just isn't my style. I prefer thin pizza, but deep dish is still good too. Service was pretty good for being so busy and crowded. There was a spill under the table from the people that were previously sat at our table and they quickly mopped it up for us.

Great pizza! But, I never got my cup of spinach tortellini soup. I think Marco was looking out for me. I didn't need it.  It's all about the pizza. The crust was awesome. I didn't even go for the butter crust. The service was good enough, young kid, kind of a distracted waiter situation. I've gotta say the personal size pizza looked small, but doesn't feel anywhere near small in my stomach. Perfectly cooked, great sauce, perfect balance of cheese, great tomatoes, and crispy crunchy tasty crust!

Ate here with a colleague the other night after two straight nights of hardcore ramen.

I thinkbwe just got lucky, but our waitress was a young European lady who was very attentive and courteous, and really cares about the customers.

My colleague got the Malnati's special pizza, which I cannot comment on because I did not try it.

I got a plain cheese with jalapenos.  It was plenty spicy after I unscrewed the top off the red pepper flakes and emptied it on my pie.

The deep crust is nice and buttery, and the sauce is chunky, not the mechanically obliterated fluid we Easterners hold close to our hearts.

Also, if you happen to be from New York, I can tell you that if you try to pick up this slice or even wose, try to fold it, then may the pizza gods have mercy on your soul cause you will be wearing culinary treasure on your crotch like it was a meat hanger.  So swallow your pride and use your fork, just don't let anyone take a picture of you doing it or you will be mocked and ridiculed when you get back to the Big Crapple.

Beyond that I tried the spinach salad, which was OK, although the spinach did look like it missed a couple of trains and ended up on the local.

It can get pretty noisy in here, because the place is really popular, so if you are looking for a place that sounds like an NPR interview go elsewhere.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone interested in sampling the local manifestation of the drug that is pizza.

Enjoy.
A true deep dish Chicago legend. A must try for anyone visiting the Windy City. Get the deep dish Malnati Chicago Classic for a true slice of heaven.

For 4 people at 8:30PM on a Tuesday night, they said we would wait 30 minutes but ended up waiting 10 before being seated! Yes!!

We shared the spinach salad with chicken, a small Lou deep dish pizza and got the pizza cookie for dessert.

Spinach salad: Good, simple but lots of it, great to share.
Lou deep dish pizza: Toppings (spinach, tomato, mushrooms) were good but I though the dough was really underwhelming. On it's own it really doesn't taste like much.
Pizza cookie: I'm going to say it: it's just a cookie in a pizza pan. It is good, warm and gooey but it's a cookie, nothing special about it. It comes with ice cream and whipped cream, which compliments nicely the cookie.

Overall nice place for groups but I don't think that the food was that good.

Ahhhh!!! This is amazing. Although my first deep dish pizza, it was nothing compared to regular pizza. I got a personal pizza with pepperoni and sausage. The malnatis classic. I also got some cheesy bread! Everything was fantastic including our waiter ( Adriano)!! He was super nice, outgoing, and funny as well as making us feel welcome. If you want some good Chicago deep dish pizza, look no further. Lou Malnati's is the place to go!

Oh my gosh. The pizza is insanely delicious. My friend and I split a small classic and had some wings. All the food was delicious. The signature buttery crust is incredible!!!! So glad I went here on my trip to Chicago.

A really great Chicago style pizza. The highlighted original pizza is definitely the way to go and so Chicago. There is about a 45 minute wait. Make sure you read the descriptions on the menu, they are really helpful and accurate. The CRUST!!!! Just really well done, and fresh. The salads are huge, and take up unnecessary space in the stomach that should be filled with pizza. Our waiter was great, and his drink recommendations were fantastic. If you are in Chicago, I would definitely recommend you come here for the pizza. The sausage in the pizza was an explosion of flavor and covered the entire pizza completely. The prices are very reasonable, and the quality of the food is excellent.
Sooooo good man~~ I hate pizza but I love deep dish pizza. My boyfriend and I waited here for 10mins even though we were told to wait 25mins. It's definitely worth it, and it's cheap.
Their deep dish cheese pizza is delicious BUT i can never get enough of their trio dips and pizza chips (specifically the roasted garlic).. Super duper good!!

There are so many other places you can get deep dish pizza from in Chicago!!!

We (group of 6) visited Lou Malnati's pizza yesterday for lunch prior to heading to O'Hare for our flight.

We arrived around 11:15am, so the restaurant was still fairly empty as they had just opened. All of us had our carry-on luggage. We asked for a table for 6, and they took a minute to seat us. The staff decided to seat us upstairs- keep in mind there were clear tables on the ground level- so we all had to carry our bags up to their second floor. Our table wasn't yet ready, so we waited near another table that was set up for 7, and asked if it would be ok if we sat there. The waitress said no, and explained that the table was set up for 9, despite only seeing 7 place settings... and proceeded to seat us at a table in the far back, by a service door, and next to a large group on a food tour.

Waiter took a while to come over, I'm guessing because we were sat so far back in a corner. Assuming this was because we had luggage. He took our order and left.

During the first interaction with our waiter, we explained that we had one dairy allergy at the table. No, this is not someone who decided to cut out dairy, go vegan, whatever. She has a severe allergy to dairy (different to being lactose-intolerant). We explained this to our waiter. Normally at other restaurants when we explain her dairy allergy to our wait staff, they respond quite attentively. This waiter seemed to brush off our statement, and carried on taking the order.

We ordered a few appetizers to share, and our friend with a dairy allergy ordered the bruschetta, again asking for her order with no dairy.

Our first appetizers came, we ordered the chicken wings and calamari. Upon asking the man who was refilling our water if the chicken wings had dairy, he said he didn't know. We had to ask him to check for us, or find our waiter. He never returned to our table with an answer.

Our waiter returned to our table for something unrelated, and we asked the same question: Do the chicken wings contain dairy? He said he didn't know, and we had to prompt him to return to the kitchen to find out.

About 10 minutes later, he returns to assure us that the chicken wings didn't have dairy in the breading. My friend proceeds to eat one of the wings.

About another 10 minutes passes, ironically while she was telling our group of another time at a restaurant they had messed up her order and the aftermath of that day. We then see the manager and our waiter approaching our table. The manager asks "did you eat the chicken wings?" We all knew where this was going and were SHOCKED. We even asked if he was joking. The manager let us know that the wings did in fact contain dairy, AFTER she had already eaten the wing.

It is shocking to me that a restaurant chain would be so dismissive and rude about a dairy allergy. Every staff member we interacted with were unprofessional and dismissive, and we were absolutely not impressed. They offered us a gift card (we gave it away because we don't live in Chicago) and offered to comp our meal.

The manager and waiter offered their apologies, but we left before finishing our food. I would never recommend this place again, especially to those who have sensitivities to food of any kind. I understand these kinds of this can happen, the reason for my review is the combination of lack of knowledge of the menu and attitude the wait staff took with our group when we inquired about whether or not the appetizer contained dairy.

Food was average, but will never return to be talked to or treated that way again! It's a shame because the restaurant on N State St (we were on Wells St) did not share this terrible service.

*side note- as we were leaving, the table we asked to be seated at in the first place (the one the waitress told us was used for groups of 9) had a group of 6 seated.

tripadvisor.com/ShowUser…

It's my first time in Chicago and I was really excited to have an authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. The concierge at my hotel recommended Lou's to me so I gave it a shot... now I'm sadly very disappointed. With tax, tip and delivery fees my large pizza was $40, but the flavor/quality was not good. It's heavy, bland and the crust itself was not very good. I don't even want to eat the rest of it, I'm just going to throw it away. This was a wasted experience. Also, for $40 I could have had a much better outing somewhere else.
I love deep dish pizza and tried a few one but my favorite is the Lou.... really amazing!!! Definitely my favorite pizza in Chicago!!!

Does this place need any more positive reviews?  Got here Sunday night when wait time was reported to be 30 to 45 min.  They let you "pre order" your pizza although my theory is that it really does nothing but keep you from leaving when you get weary of waiting for your table.  Pizza was superb.  I personally don't love deep dish pizza but if I'm going to visit Chicago, I'll do Lou Malnati's.

This place has quite the hype around it but after going, it is totally worth the hype.

We went for dinner on a Saturday so we knew it would be busy but also knew we would wait for a table. We were told it would take 30-45 minutes but we were seated in about 20 minutes.

Out waitress was very attentive given how busy it was and we were happy with the service we got.

Adam and I ordered "The Malnati Chicago Classic" and we were so beyond happy with what we got. Since it is a deep dish pizza it does take a little longer to make but the wait to get or food wasn't too bad and in the end we were so full and had so much left over that it was worth it. The sausage on it was perfect. I loved that it covered the entire pizza and not just crumbled around the pizza, it ensured we got a good amount of sausage in every bite. Also, the sauce wasn't over-powering and there was a perfect amount of cheese. The crust was softer but not chewy and it wasn't too crispy. It was literally perfect.

This place knows what it is doing and I am so happy that it does know, it made coming here amazing. I highly suggest coming here if you are in the area.
I'm a deep-dish queen. Lou's special ends up a little soggy and bland.  Have to say, I prefer UNO's whenever I have the option.

Okay... I am new at this Yelp review business, so I hope my vote counts.  I travel a lot for business, but there is no place like home.  I am a huge Pizza fan, HUGE!  When I go home, I don't go any where else for my PIE!  My favorite on this menu is the classic Pepperoni deep dish, awesome bruschetta, and cold beer.   My service provided is bar none, PERFECT.  

If you are even in town...  I recommend this place again... and again... and again... and again.....

Fantastic!  Ordered the original deep dish and it was delicious!  They suggested an appetizer since it takes 30 minutes to cook the pizza.  I'm glad we did.  The garlic bread was good, but the marinara was amazing.  Next time we would order extra sauce on our pizza!  The staff was friendly and checked on us regularly.

The cheese is THE Best pizza! 2nd favorite... The Lou!
Order ahead of time when you leave your name for the wait list. Really helps!

The pizza was INCREDIBLE!

I liked the efficiency of putting my name on the reservation list and getting a text notification when my table was ready.

It was a little confusing to navigate to order a pizza (it was recommended to order while people wait for their table since the pies take about 30 minutes to make) and when I did, the staff were rushed and not really nice.

I got to my table and didn't get great service from my waiter. The whole operation was kind of like a factory line and not a completely welcoming environment.

When I was leaving, I asked for directions to Ohio St and the employee said they were from the "north side" and don't know this neighborhood quite well...?

4 stars because I loved the food, but the staff experience kept me from giving it the full 5 because restaurants CAN be busy, but customers CAN get good service at the same time.

Fresh ingredients on this deep dish!   This restaurant was recommended by a Chicago friend and it did not disappoint!  We ordered the sausage pizza and added more garlic, basil and tomatoes (not sundried). Delicious!  We had tried another local Chicago deep dish pizzeria and there is no comparison!  Lou Malnati's is a must for deep dish.  Be prepared to wait. TIP: They'll let you in advance,prior to getting your table, so your pizza will be baking while you wait!

Omg!! Definitely worth all the hours of waiting for that truly authentic Chicago deep dish. We went with simple cheese but it was so flavorful and I wanted more and more. I would recommend the location on North Wells St. as the one to go to! They have great staff and awesome service!

best pizza in the city, can also be made vegan (no cheese, highly recommend with fresh spinach)

Truly incredible!!!!!!!

I LOVE this pizza so much! Butter crust heaven. Get ready for a long wait (about 35 mins) for you pizza, but well worth it. Tip: order while you wait for a table; it's also encouraged by the front host.

pics.caption: It was the that good. Yum!

review.des: I have to come here every time I'm in Chicago. It IS worth the 45-50 minute wait. I was pleased at how smooth the hostess was handling the crowd. We added our name on the list along with a number for them to text us when our table was ready. The best part was that there was a little link we could click on when we first got a confirmation text that shows us what place in line we're in. This was perfect because we didn't want to get caught up with all the shopping so it was nice to see. I'm literally writing this review with my mouth watering as I'm yearning for a deep dish slice of pizza from Lou's with all my heart. The Cobb salad I believe it was is heavenly and a perfect salad to share with your table. The next thing we shared was garlic bread with the marinara sauce. The marina sauce that they offer is not your basic sauce from the jar. You can tell this was handcrafted with love because there was something very special in there and it was quite addicting. Next up is the pizza of course. One slice was heavy enough to keep me full and satisfy my needs.

pics.caption: The most perfect slice of pizza I've ever laid eyes on

review.des:
Calamari is 5 out of 5. The deep dish though... not so much. I find it on the bland side despite the amount of cheese, sausage and tomatoes. It lacks basic seasonings for me.
Calamri is lightly battered and perfectly fried. Its tender and not chewy at all. Batter was seasoned well.
Pizza crust is just okay. Alittle soggy in the middle.
The best pizza was the next day when i reheated it. Added salt and pepper and that alone made it a thousand times better.

pics.caption: Meh. Betterthenext day. Addsaly and pepper and pepper flakes.

review.des: Wait was long, but we order the deep dish medium pizza with pepperoni, sausage and cheese and it was all worth it! Love their fresh sauce and lots of cheese. Good service!!

Favorite deep dish in Chicago! We always get the malnalti salad and the classic pizza with sausage! This is my go to place to take any visitors for their first deep dish experience and they all loved it!
Had the Luminaty pizza, solid. Good flavors, with butter crust. Cool busy spot, great customer service.

The pizza was OK. I wasn't too impressed. We got the sampler appetizer and honestly we could have just been happy with that. The crust wasn't my fav... Maybe Chicago pizza just isn't my thing. Service was awesome though.

I had high expectations. The wait was the worse for pizza on a Saturday night. Probably waited about an hour outside, received a text to come inside and wait more. They had me order pizza before going in to be seated because that's how they operate and said it takes time to make the pizza. To order other food that's not pizza, you have to be seated.

Once seated we waited about 40 minutes or it seemed longer than that for wings to come out. The wings were really good and thick, plenty of meat and sauce, but it's weird how they came with no carrots and only had celery.
I loved the wings better than their pizza!

Chicago style deep dish pizza was good but not amazing. The crust was crunchy but hard to cut through since they suggest you eat it with a fork and knife. I like eating pizza with my hand and cheese to be melted or fully cooked but this one was not. The cheese was stretchy and doughy not done baking? The pepperoni was weak on flavor and not many toppings. I'm just really surprised or not use to this type of pizza. I ordered half Lou and half Malnati and they almost tasted identical. Everything was excess cheese which is too much for me but that's not bad. I was expecting the pizza to be thicker and deeper as I've seen on television and YouTube research. The pizza arriving to the table was another hour wait after my appetizer of wings came which is horrible wait time for a small order of pizza!! The waitress even said "your pizza will be out in 2 minutes", liar. I'm just being nice with 3 stars because I really liked the wings.

pics.caption: Half Lou, Half Malnati is what I ordered Chicago deep dish style

review.des: Great pizza! The sausage has a distinct flavor not overpowered by the sauce and cheese. Crust is buttery, and you can taste the flavor of being baked in a well-seasoned pan. Great portion and reasonable price. A must when you visit CHI city!

The deep dish Lou is the best I ever tasted. It has garlic crust and fresh veggies . The delivery time is on point. There wings are also hot and good. I ordered there about 10 times already. My wife loves it.
Hadn't had them in over 3 years because of new food allergies. Didn't realize they had a gluten free option and order with no cheese. IT WAS AMAZING. One of the best I've had.

For how much hype this place has I unfortunately wasn't terribly impressed. Getting a name on the reservation list was a feat in itself there were so many people around and it was so disorganized I had a difficult time even getting my name down. It took at least an hour which isn't surprising for how popular it is but there was nowhere for people to sit so we walked around. Once we got our table we got our pizza. Just a heads up you have to order your pizza when you get put on the waitlist if you want to get it within a reasonable amount of time after you sit down. The pizza was yummy but the atmosphere was crowded and noisy and once again disorganized. I wouldn't recommend it based on the atmosphere

What a great experience. I came here at around 5pm on a Monday evening. It was right before the dinner rush so I got a seat at the bar and waited for the bartender to ask what I wanted to eat.

He was very informative about the menu and what to expect when ordering their deep dish pizza.

Words can't describe how delicious it was. I ordered the Lou Malnati personal pie. 10/10 for sure.

Highly recommend. The food was great and priced extremely well.

This was an amazing pizza!!! I had a bad taste in my mouth from the first Chicago deep dish at another restaurant but had to try one again at a different restaurant. This is the place. Make sure you get the "butter crust". Simply awesome!!

Great staff and service also.

I'm incredibly happy that Lou Malnati's offers gluten-free pizza. Thank youuuuuuu! For all of you out there who are gluten-intolerant or have an auto-immune disorder like me, their pizza is the real deal. They serve the pizza small/thin crust which makes for a perfect individual serving. Thank you very much for your kind consideration to us who have dietary restrictions Lou Malnati's!

pics.caption: Thank you for making gluten-free pizza - and you make it incredibly good!!! Thank you Lou Malnati's!

review.des: Having travelled much of the world and tatsed that vast majority of it's pizza offerings I feel qualified to rate Lou's as the single best pizza you can eat anywhere. This is the French Laundry of pizza.

The Malnati Chicago Classic is the best pizza in Chicago. I would love to debate you in the comment section if there was one. Pro tip. Ask for extra parm packets. It's good cheese, not that fake stuff and if you don't use it will be great on a salad or bowl of pasta next week.

How about that sausage layer and buttery crust!
Lou, I'm yours. The wife and I indulge often.

1st time in Chicago.  Had to try Lou's and the other one that starts with a G.  Lou's wins hands down!  Probably due to preference, but I love the crust.  Will be one of our first stops the next time we're in town.

We live near the original Lincolnwood, Illinois location. We have eaten in the restaurant and also pick up frozen pizzas to bring home. The pizza is wonderful no matter where you eat it. The sausage tends to be a bit greasy, but I prefer vegetable so It is not a problem for me. An issue with a frozen pizza bought and stored  frozen by us for later use was replaced without question. The ambience in the restaurant is typical of an olderChicago pub-lots of dark wood and sports/entertainment industry memorabilia. There is a bar with numerous seats for those waiting for their party or their pizza, or those who just want a cocktail. Casual atmosphere and friendly, competent staff.

For dinner on my first night in Chi-town, I knew it had to involve pizza. Deep dish pizza. I've heard the saying that only tourists seek out the famous Chicago-style pizza, but this spot looked like a local's favorite. Lou Malnati's looks like a tavern or pub and has a welcoming vibe. Very patriotic with their sports team memorabilia decorating the walls. The staff is great: super friendly and attentive.

The chain restaurant of Lou Malnati's has traditional dishes you'd normally find at an Italian restaurant - with the exception of the pizza. We ordered the fried calamari as an appetizer and the chicken pasta and cheese deep dish pizza for our entree. All enough to share between four people and have some leftovers. The calamari was good - not greasy or overly cooked to the point of overly chewy, just the right amount of chew and crunch. They came with a cocktail dipping sauce. The chicken marsala pasta was delicious: rigatoni pasta covered in a creamy, white sauce mixed in with chunks of chicken breast and mushrooms and topped with shavings of parmesan and slivers of basil. It felt homemade, which is what made it better. The pizza is allotted a certain amount of cooking time which it tells you on the menu, so hopefully you're not in a rush. Either way, it's worth the wait. We ordered the large pizza and only six out of the eight slices. They're thick slices of pizza. Crunchy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside with a hefty amount of cheese and sauce; you'll be happy you waited thirty minutes. Their dessert menu did look enticing, but we were so full from dinner that we could not fathom eating a chocolate chip pizza or tiramisu. I'm sure it was fantastic.

You have to check them out if you're craving really good Italian food.

This was the first stop when my friend and I arrived in Chicago. Literally, we got off the plane, put our luggage in our hotel, and then walked here. This place is an institution in Chicago, so we knew we had to go there. We got the Lou Malnati's deep dish, and while it was good, it was a little disappointing. The crust was just ok, the toppings were a little sparse, but the marinara sauce was great.

The service was excellent, though!

First time in Chicago and we were told Lous was a must! So glad we went, the pizza was amazing!!! We had stuffed spinach bread to start and the Malnati Chicago Classic for our pizza! We might make one more stop before leaving

My girlfriend had never had deep dish pizza before so I wanted her to come try Lou's for her first time. We ordered the Chicago Classic with the butter crust.  The sausage was nice with a good amount of fat and the tomatoes cut through the sausage with its perfect acidity. The balance was great. I do wish they had more varieties in their deep dish, we wanted a supreme style deep dish but you have the option to build your pie if you'd like. If you are in Chicago and have not tried deep dish then this is the place I would recommend.
Best deep dish pizza ever. Too bad I live in WI otherwise I'd eat this every week. The three dip platter was awesome too.

Had fried calamari appetizer (a little tough) and house salads (the lemon garlic dressing is to die for!) to start. House salad was really good sized, and had a lot of stuff in it. Had the Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza, in a small size for the 2 of us. It was really good, with not too much sauce (a problem with a lot of other "deep dish" restaurants). Very flavorful, with the meat and cheese. And the crust! Wow, delicious - reminded me in a good way of the homemade pizzas my mom used to make with biscuit dough!

pics.caption: House salad - included cucumber, tomato, onions, croutons.

review.des: This is probably my favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago. Be prepared for a long wait as it always full, we arrived at 5:00 pm and the waiting was 30minutes. The deep dish pizza take  an hour to serve. Service was impeccable . Strongly recommend this restaurant if you visit Chicago .
I would have to say best deep dish pizza I've had so far. I was recommended this place by 2 locals who say it's amazing and they were right.

Great friendly vibes and loved the sports memorabilia  that decorated the walls.  The staff was prompt, friendly and made great recommendations on sizes/portions for the group. Now let's get to the pizza...One of my favs for Chicago deep dish.  Good ratio of cheese, crust and sauce.     Recommend getting there early to help with the wait as it is very very popular.

I can't stop obsessing about this place! I seriously recommend Lou's deep dish pizza to everyone that's in town. This quaint little restaurant is filled with so much history and delicious smells lingering all around. The locals love it, so you know it must be legit. Get ready to wait a little since it always gets packed but as the saying goes, "all good things come to those who wait". Don't make this your quick lunch stop, you're bound to spend at LEAST 2 hours in here. Enjoy the experience. Take it all in.

While looking for a spot to grab pizza, we found that Lou Malnati was able to fit us in on a busy Mother's Day with very little wait time, and what was even better was that we could order while waiting! After about another 15 minute wait we got both the classic deep dish meals and the crusts ARE SO BUTTERY ITS AMAZING. pair any one of the classic deep dishes with a coke and you have yourself and excellent dish. Don't be fooled by the sizes of the pizza either, the combination of cheese, meat, crust, and sauce is incredibly filling.

We tried to do our own pizza tour this trip. Pequod's vs Lou's. Maybe it's cause I'm from the Heartland where pizza is a food and not a way of life, but the dough at Pequod's didn't do it for me. I know this is blasphemy to Chicagoans, but Lou's was better as a whole. Same basic elements except Lou's sauce had salt and seasoning (Pequods was just tomato, very natural, a tad sweet), more gooey cheese, and a better crust (more common to me). The elements just came together better for a more gooey, garlicky pizza that wanted to be a lasagna. Lou's was our winner.

pics.caption: Yum! The Lou with added sausage

review.des: Probably my favorite deep dish in Chicago. I love the Malnati Chicago classic. Their salads are also delicious and their appetizers. Really can't go wrong eating at Lou's
Put in an order via yelp for take out and it went incredibly smoothly. Got Lous classic sausage pizza and it was fantastic. Yelp gave me a pick up time and the food was ready a few minutes early.
When I Chicago, you must try deep dish pizza. I did even though I prefer NY style pizza. Its pretty heavy so I probably won't eat it again but it was good.

A Chicago staple.  

Solid pie!  

Great value!  

Great service!

....But I prefer Pequods.

Glad I was able to finally check out Lou Malnati's Famous deep dish, boy was it scrumptious. Came on a Thursday and it was really packed, waited about 35 mins and was seated and greeted by our server. Server was very busy with the crowds that swarm in at all times, as I was told they are always busy.  Ambiance is nice and resembles your typical Pizzeria, this place was packed so people watching at that point. We were really starving so decided to order a family salad to hold us over before the Big Kahuna of Deep Dish was to be brought out.

Holy Moly this Chicago Classic style pizza was hefty & mouthwatering all in one bite!! The flavorful buttered & flaky crust was the bomb!! Truly a staple of a Pizzeria if your ever in the Chicago area one must visit Lou's for Deep Delectable Damn Good Deep Pizza.

pics.caption: Lou's Hefty Deep Dish is Damn Good!

review.des: Order pizza ahead of time at the counter while waiting for your table. Best deep dish.

While I don't like deep dish pizza in general, this place was better than others I've tried.
What I like about this place is that you can get the pizza crust on the bottom crispy and add a butter glaze to the crust (which you absolutely must otherwise it will be a  disgusting soggy mess!). We put an order in for an all cheese deep dish with a the crispy crust/butter glaze and half of it with pepperoni and then waited about 10 min to be seated. We can around 5:30 so it wasn't packed yet but by the time we left there was a huge line.
Since we had to wait 40 min, we got the house/green salad in the individual size and it was perfect for sharing. The pizza came out pretty good, again, I don't really like deep dish, but it wasn't soggy like others I've tried and it wasn't as thick. It was way too saucy so next time I'd ask for less sauce.
The only part that could be improved is the pre-seating service. When we first came in the host seemed completely lost and just stared at us for a few min. Then once he put our name down he told us to go pre-order the pizza. That went smoothly but when we were called to sit down, the same confused host started walking towards the back (we followed him), then he turned out and got menus, handed them to use and told us to go upstairs and someone else will seat it. I'm not sure why we had to go back and forth and why it was so confusing for an employee who probably seats many people a day to tell us right off the bat on where to go. Once we got upstairs we were quickly seated and from there the service was fine.

This is my first time here in Chicago and I was looking for a good pizza joint that served to locals. No I'm obviously not a local, but if it's good enough for locals to eat it's got be good for me.

I made it a point to have my first pizza experience here. And I'm glad I did. Pizza was tasty and hot. Just like I like it.

Pizza is good, and liked the cheese used. Make sure to get your crust buttered and garlic'd. It's the only way to properly enjoy their pizza.

If you have a chance and want to get good local foodie info from the #mostfunceo, this is what the waitress calls herself lol.

We ordered the medium cheese and pepperoni deep dish and the sausage and cheese small deep dish.

Came here on a recommendation from our hotel and I wanted to try a different place then we had done before.  
The service was great, our waiter explained everything in detail, had suggestions and answered my questions perfectly.  Our appetizer came out in a decent amount of time which was about 30-35 minuets.  It was a perfect deep dish pizza and served piping hot.  Our waiter served the first pieces of pizza and the. It was up to us to eat this amazing pizza, the cheese was melted perfectly layered with tomato sauce and pepperoni.  The crust was perfect, golden brown with a nice butter taste and could be a meal on its own.  I love pizza and this deep dish was everything I wanted it to be and more.  So worth the wait and the time it too, to eat it.  Yummy!
We also ended with the deep dish cookie dessert which was very good too, served in a deep dish pan with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream.  If you are not a huge fan of whip cream like me I would recommend ordering it without which I forgot to do, but after scooping it away the dessert was still good.  
Service, food and over experience was perfect.  I will return when we are back in town.

Its ok !
We ordered the sausage and the basic pizza.
If you like a sausage patty squished at the bottom of your pizza you will be a fan ! Lol !
We found the sausage chewy and this is comparing to other Chicago landmark pizza places and pizza in Phila & NY.
As far as service we would rate the location as a 1 . It was difficult to get drinks, refills and any attention from the staff. Again comparing to other Chicago locations and other large city busy pizza places.
I would definitely try the other main stream pizza joints first before heading to LMs , this after being there many times and having tried them all !

This place was highly recommended to me from a native Chicagoan, now a New Yorker. And I never forgot the name and what a cool one, Lou Malnati. Sounds like a gangster's name. But in this case, the gangster of Chicago deep dish pizza. Being that I live in NYC, I have so many pizza spots to choose from. $1 pizza, my favorite pizza place, vegan pizza, neopolitan, the classics(Joe's, Ray's, Artichokes, Bleeker etc..)pizza chains--and this is just a small fraction. I came to Chicago with my nose-to-the-sky knowledge on pizza and was ready for what Lou had to offer. I was sat at the bar as soon as I arrived, 935pm. I had intended for the restaurant to be mobbed, but as far as I can see there was enough space on the floor to perform The Nutcracker. I'm just glad that I don't have to wait for seating or have to sit outside--has been humid lately. An expressionless bartender asked me if I wanted to start on a drink. Nope, just a Coke. I had already skimmed the menu and knew I wanted to start on the mozz. sticks. 10 seconds later, I said I might as well put in my pizza order. And he said, might as well, it DOES take 40 minutes. But he said it like a jerk would say it. Like if common sense should have taught me this. I immediately developed a bad taste in my mouth. I couldn't let the bartender in his lonely island take away from the hype. He did mention getting the butter crust and I was later glad I did. You see, optimism. My 7 sticks came out about 10 minutes after ordering. They were gone just about as soon as they were presented to me. I like them hotter(temp) than served and the tomato sauce accompaniment was nice and chunky. And not 40 minutes, but in 25 minutes  my personal deep dish pizza with pepperoni came out. Given to me briskly and with no eye contact. It was an interesting wait though. Got to see the staff do a lot of dancing, and dancing with whipped cream in their mouth, and play patty cake, and dance some more, and the bartender likes sandsurfing--I overheard. BUT THAT PIZZA!!! Boy, was that a delicious circular and singular sensation. I felt weird having to use a fork and knife coming from the land of slices. But I got a personal so I was able to still use my paws. I asked the bartender to go light on sauce as well. Yummy, and buttery and a taste that was so satisfying and that lingered. Each bite had the promise of a happy ending on my palette. Boy, was that a great piece of doughy heaven with poking pieces of pepperoni. I wasn't savvy on the pan sizes until after I ordered. But I think I could have easily took down the next size(for 2). I know I will be back. Maybe at this location, or maybe at another. I need to experience the greatness of this pizza once or twice again. Hope there's friendlier service next time.

Lou's is a staple in Chicago. While it is my favorite go to in the city I wouldn't say it's my favorite. It's up there and the price point is a large reason why I get it as frequently as I do.

They're known for sausage which is a full layer of a sausage patty, but I prefer the classic pepperoni!

First time having deep dish pizza, did not disappoint. So glad for the system they have, little confusing at first but it really sped up the process bc the wait was very long. Definitely come back every time in Chicago

My husband and I were in Chicago last week. It was his first time in Chicago and he wanted some authentic deep dish pizza. I'd had Lou Malnati's before on a prior trip so brought him there. We shared The Malnati Chicago Classic which has lean sausage, extra cheese, tomato sauce, and crispy crust. We added mushrooms. He said it was the best pizza he's had in his life and it lived up to what I remembered from before. We ordered a bigger pizza so we'd have a couple pieces leftover and they held up well until the next day and the crust didn't become soggy overnight which was nice! Great pizza!!

My favorite deep dish pizza in chicago. Get the Chicago Classic it's amazing!!! Cheddar cubes are definitely worth starting with and the cookie dessert is awesome. Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Definitely a must for visitors.  Go Lou's!!!!!

When in Chicago here is the place to go for deep dish pizza! The butter crust is the bomb and their sauce is the best. I really love their salads as well and they are huge. The service is great each time I have been here when visiting Chicago, even when they are extremely busy. I highly recommend Lou Malnati's for pan pizza. I'll keep coming back each time we're out that way as there's no other place like it I've found!

2016 Review #85

I can't believe that the delivery person, knowing they were delivering to a hotel, would not bring utensils and condiments. When I asked, she said "Oh, the hotel has that." and left. Of course I called the location, there is little or nothing they can do. I am disappointed, because my last experience with Lou's was awesome. Also a delivery, but that person had it together.
WOWW the pizza was so good and the fetuccini chicken alfredo and the cheesy bread was to die for. I recommend this place! make sure you come hungry and with time.
Love the crust  but not enough tomato sauce and the cheese was on the dry side for me.

Lou Malnati's ....  I think their deep dish is too much dough and super heavy too much bread.  Taste wise is pretty good, I love pizza, but Lous zza is too much for me. I remember wandering streets of NYC and getting slice of peroni from street vendor, and that was so delicious.  Not here.
Their thin crust is the REAL Chicago pizza.  Lou Malnati's is a classic.
Great pizza. Bar tender was nice. Definitely recommend the spinach and plain pizzas. The only thing worth noting is that the wait is usually long, so be prepared to wait or eat at the bar.

I was traveling around the US and got the opportunity to stop in Chicago for a night. I knew the one food I wanted to get was deep dish pizza. Having lived in NY tje past 3 years im pretty used to great pizza but have yet to have a deep dish I enjoyed, untill going here. This was one of, if not the best pizzas I have ever had. The crust is not so deep that it is ober powering like normal deep dish in other places. It was a normal sized crust, perfectly cooked. Then it was pilled with an entire layer of sausage, then a layer of cheese, then finally a layer of tomato sauce that was amazing. We got a small size and it was perfect between the two of us and im a big eater. We also got the bruschetta appetizer and it was delicious. I have never had bruschetta like this or with fresh parmesean cheese and basil. We also got a family size chicken cesar salad and not only was it good, it was huge. If you are traveling through chicago you need to make time to stop here and get some of this amazing food!

Butter crust is D A N K. Sauce is also really good. I would recommend coming here for any non Chicago resident as soon as you arrive and get the classic deep dish pizza. Also get the coupon for a free cookie/appetiser from the mega bus pamphlet.

Um yep this place is awesome!  From that buttery crust to the lean Italian sausage to the homemade tomato sauce on top, Lou Malnati's is the standard upon which I judge Chicago deep dish.  The service here is top notch and the servers are spot on with their recommendations.  Loved the spinach cheese bread.  It was called something else but basically it was spinach with tonnnns of gooey cheese baked in a delicious flakey crust.  I recommend the baked cookie dish with ice cream and whip cream for dessert.  Carb overload but totally worth it!

pics.caption: Being cool in front of the Lou :)
His first Chicago deep dish.  Think he approves!

review.des: I was super excited when I read the reviews about lou and wanted to give it a try during my visit last month to chicago. My party and I ordered a vegetarian deep dish pizza, we were eagerly waiting to have our first bite of the well reviewed deep dish, only to be disappointed. I have had my fair share of pizza all around the country and I would naturally expect the pizza to taste good, all of us at the table were very disappointed. The crust was unevenly cooked, marinara tasted bad, there wasn't enough marinara on the pizza nor enough cheese, too much crust and we had to order extra sides of marinara to be able to eat. Couldn't send the order back as we would have to wait another hour to be able to get our order. SO we just left disappointed. I would never go back if I ever visit chicago.
Pizza was good but the Malnati salad was to die for! Could have eaten an entire family size salad all by myself.

Expect a wait!!!

Don't come here when you're really hungry because that hunger will turn into hangriness.  It's deep dish pizza so it'll be about 30 minutes before your meal arrives.  When you arrive it's suggested you order before being seated so that your wait time diminishes a bit.  If you arrive before 6:30 the wait won't be terribly bad.  

When I touched foot in Chicago this was the first deep dish pizza place I tried and I was expecting the crust to be extremely thick, but it wasn't as thick as I thought which was nice.  I love pizza so I eat the entire pizza and the crust wasn't bad.  I tried the pepperoni and cheese and the Chicago classic.  Both pizzas were good, but I really liked the Chicago classic.  I loved the different toppings especially the sausage.

I was seated in the back table and I get a little weary sometimes because it's easy to be forgotten about, but thankfully the servers weren't like that here so plus on service as well.
Great deep dish. Good service. Went as part of a #sidewalkfoodtour Yummy way to enjoy a taste of true Chicago pizza.

While in town, we had to try some deep dish!  This was the first place.  We started with a salad while we waited, and that was very good.  We got "the Lou".  A small for two people, which was more than enough food with the salad.  And it was delicious.

Lou Malnati's has been my favorite since the first time I visited many years ago.  The ingredients are fresh, the crust is perfect and the flavors melt in your mouth.  This is the place to go for authentic Chicago pizza thin and deep dish.  Oh and the Salads are delicious!

Sorry Chicago, we tried, but we aren't deep dish fans, it tasted like a common franchise pizza brand that we won't name. Maybe because we ordered the vegetarian version, as I heard the other pizzas on the menu are much better.

Waitress never came to check on us and kept passing us to check on the table behind us. Had to ask another server for a drink refill and never got extra napkins.

Oh well, at least we tried it.
All I can say is great food , service everything .You can not go wrong dinning here

Errmmm, I honestly don't think it's worth the hype. The staff is awesome and very patient. But apart from that I can't think of any other reason. Drinks selection is limited and there is nothing special about the deep dish.

Being from Seattle I order calamari often. This was the best calamari i have EVER had! Perfectly breaded, fresh and with a great sauce. The deep dish pizza is off the chart! No one can compete. Well done, i will be back next trip to Chicago for more

I was so excited to visit for my first slice of deep dish, but unfortunately chose Saturday night and was pretty well forgotten by waitstaff. We were a table of 4 and were there 2+ hours for salad and classic pie (which was not hot when it arrived). After waiting for our bill for 30+ mins I approached the manager on duty and was given prompt service. Unfortunate that our server was terrible, but pizza was also less than desirable. Total bummer.
Doesn't get any better than Lou's. Best deep dish - no debate. Love that the offer a keto option with their delicious sausage crust.
Always long waits, but my favorite deep dish in Chicago, hands down.

Liked this even more than their north side location. Same excellent pizzas but better vibe. I was there early in the day - around 5pm and I managed to sit down. After 6:00 on a weekend - forget about it. Great experience.

Can't go wrong with Lou's...used to be a to 10 favorite pizza place around Chicago, but over the last two years, it's our number 1. We have always had a pleasant experience no matter the day or time. The app also works very well. If you have a choice, I would go with Lou's over any other deep dish pizza in and around Chicago

We were staying at the Fairmont and phone ordered for delivery.  An hour and twenty minutes from time of order to delivery, which they tell you when you order.  $4.50 delivery fee added to the bill was really reasonable.  Arrived on time and piping hot.  My wife got the personal size cheese deep dish.  I got the small classic deep dish and added the spinach mix.  We shared an individual house salad with reduced calorie ranch dressing.  My wife's pizza was a miss.  Didn't seem as deep, not as cheesy or as saucy as the one I had.  Mine was excellent.  Terrific, fresh tomato sauce and the spinach mix with basil and garlic was the perfect addition.  Very cheesy.  The salad was your basic house salad, nothing fancy about it but good size and crisp lettuce.

You can get the Restaurant Quality but you need to learn the art of PCR.  That being said Lous is the ONLY pizza you can re-heat two or three time and it just gets better each time.  That dense Wisconsin Cheese is unlike any pizza ANYWHERE. Regarding PCR See below:

Now that Lou's  is popping up all over Chicago - we now have the luxury of having it delivered right to our door.  Our standard - Lou's Deep Dish Butter Crust - UNCUT with a Lou's family style salad IT'S A MUST!  with the sweet vinegrette.

ATTENTION WING FANS  GET THE BUFFALOU'S -  I dont' know how they season the wings but they are awesome just on their own - sauceless  if you get delivery DO THE THE SAUCE ON THE SIDE - otherwise you get a steam room version of them and they don't hold the crispiness you get table side at the restaurant.

REGARDING DELIVERY - Well...I'm still giving Lou's 5 stars because well it's the best deep dish in the country.  But the delivery of this Chicago Icon does require some PCR - Pizza Crisping Rehabilitation.  I wouldn't recommend the pre baked because unless you have a commercial oven - it's not the same as their blast furnace pizza ovens.

1. Have your oven heated to 500 and invest in a pizza stone and get that sucker HOT. Most likely if your delivery driver is not driving like Mario Kart your pizza will be in tact.

2. Realize they build their pizza with the sauce on top with no cheese to swaddle it - and it's  - essentially seasoned crushed tomatoes that are fresh and delicious but VERY JUICY.  So once you get the pizza - slide it into the oven for about another 10 minutes and that juice should evaporate or settle into the pizza.  If you're in a hunger delirium take 2 paper towels and gently lay them flat on the pizza - DON'T BLOT it - just lay it on the pizza and tap the towels a little and  the extra juice will absorb enough to make it puddle free.

3. NEVER order it UNCUT - you're liable to get something that looks like a car accident victim. You won't be able to cut that with anything but a pizza cutter the crust is a hearty foe.

4. Finally - just understand that cardboard likes buttercrust and because of that you will not have that firm crust as crispy as if you have it in the restaurant.  But on those cold winter nights - if you invest a little "rehabilitation" and some safe harbor by taking your UNCUT pizza out of the box and giving it some PCR (Pizza Crust Recrisping)...it doesn't get any better than Lou's for deep dish.

While the restaurant is still the best way to experience Lou's with some PCR you can enjoy your Lou's without the noise the bustle and the travel.  Nothing better in the winter than a good night home with family with a good movie surround sound and surrounding a Lou's Deep Dish Pizza in your pajamas.
