i work close to this location but have not been here in sometime.  i forgot how great malnatis is.   its deep dish but not overly so...great sauce and the personal pan malnati is really great lunch option.  sat at the bar and collin c was bartender, server.  really nice, respectful guy who makes friendly chat in best way possible.  really enjoyable lunch...ill be back with friends again soon...and thx collin c.  great job!

i was back and as promised with a friend.  even better than last time just because ive been reminded how delicious and was craving like mad.  do yourselves a favor...go again people.  my friends said thin crust equally delicious in different way...its on the to-do list for sure!...and david at bar is perfect host!!

This is some of the best pizza I've tasted. So good.

I was staying a couple of blocks away and the hotel suggested I arrive early because the restaurant was small and fills up quickly. They were right. I walked up about a half hour before the restaurant opened and there was already a line. The restaurant did fill up quick and probably not even ten minutes after it opened the bar and all of the tables were full and there was a wait.

I sat at the bar and not only did I enjoy a couple of local Chicago brews, but I took the bartender's suggestion and ordered some garlic bread to tide me over until my pizza was cooked. It does take a bit to cook deep dish, I think I waited about 40 minutes, but it was worth it.

I think you'll find that it's worth it too.

I've had veggie pizzas delivered on a couple of occasions. Food is always consistent and fresh. Phil is always very pleasant on the phone. This place is a Chicago staple you have to try at least once.
Worst deep dish in Chicago. I have no clue how they get voted best pizza. They hardly have any toppings to choose from.
Great deep dish Chicago pizza and good service!! The deep dish Lou with sausage and pepperoni highly recommended!!

pics.caption: The Lou Pizza with sausage and pepperonis!! Sooo good deep dish pizza!!

review.des: I really don't discriminate against any kind of pizza, so I tend to think that all pizza is good. Lou Malnati's went above and beyond what I thought good pizza was and now stands out as my favorite pizza place. "The Lou" is just incredible and the thin crust cheese pizza is exactly what you need alongside it. So delicious.

Not sure how I feel about this pizza place or if it's just deep dish pizza in general.

Came here STARVING so good thing we ordered appetizers since they told us the pizzas don't come out until like 45 minutes later. We ordered one order of the flatbread that came with 3 different types of dip. This was able to feed our party of 6 - Portions are huge. The dips were good. There was a garlic one, a cheesy one, and one that looked like hummus (It wasn't hummus but couldn't tell what it was). After eating this, I was already full.. haha.

The menu said a medium sized pizza only feeds 3 people. Therefore, we ordered two medium sized pizzas. Little did we know, we didn't even eat the second pizza. One medium pizza was enough to feed a party of 6. We ordered the Lou (which is the veggie one) and the Malnati (sausage). The one we actually ate was the Lou. Even though it was veggie and had no meat, it was just so heavy and just wayyyy too cheesy. Definitely felt a little uncomfortable after eating this meal because of the grease. We togo-ed the pizza we didn't touch. After about an hour, the pizza was a hardened rock of cheese. We sadly didn't end up eating this pizza.

Also, it is super cramped inside. Very friendly staff though.

Honestly the wings are the only thing worth getting here. The service and food are subpar. They're not bad but they're just ok. If you're visiting Chicago and looking for good deep dish pizza, try Giordanos.

My Uber driver recommended Lou Malnati's as the best deep dish in Chicago. I'm glad I took him up on this recommendation!

The restaurant was full, but luckily I did not have to wait too long for a table.

Calamari - I had high hopes for this appetizer, but unfortunately it fell short. For starters, there was barely better breading. It was also a little rubbery.

Chicago Classic Pizza - Very tasty and balanced. Their crust was crispy and buttery, and the deep dish pizza wasn't just full of cheese and sauce. The sausage is laid out in larger chunks, which was interesting! In all I was satisfied with this pizza.

The service was decent, and the prices reasonable. I'd definitely come back.
Very good garlic bread. Had to wait 20 minutes for just 2 people at 6pm but other than that great food.
Great pizza here with a very convenient location, I was here on a business trip and when in Chicago it's the way to go. The staff was especially friendly here and a pleasant overall atmosphere.

Our favorite Chicago deep dish pizza HANDS DOWN! They have multiple locations throughout the city and suburbs, but we tend to go to the Lincoln Square restaurant. They almost never have a wait and have tons of indoor and outdoor seating.

Very good pizza! You have to wait a good 45 minutes because the pizza is thick and made to order. Totally worth the wait. We got the 3 cheese garlic bread... Delish!!! 2 of us went and got a small we were only able to eat 1 slice each. I could of had the other but didn't want to be in a food coma. Mad I didn't get to try the dessert like I wanted. We're here for a few days definitely going to try to make it back. Plus the wings look bombbb!!!!

Their deepdish was definitely one of the best pizzas I've ever had. Me and my friend had chicago classic and the lou as a personal size and both were amazing! It was cheesy but at the sametime didn't taste greasy at all. Malnatis classic pizza had bunch of meats on it which was delicious and lou(which I prefer more) had a huge tomato in it which was juicy and OMG so gooood. I usually get tired of pizzas after having two slices but here I finished the whole thing. Btw personal size can be smaller than you expect it to be!

We were expecting an hour wait but when it grew longer, I was on the verge of angry.  Our waitress was sweet but slow.   BUT then we ate the salad and pizza.  We got the Lou Malnati salad, and the two main deep dish pizzas.  So delicious.  Worth the wait?  I'm glad we got it before we left Chicago but next time, I would go at an off time.

No wonder there are always lines! This was our favorite pizza when we visited Chicago. We got the Chicago original and a small cheese and loved it. We also had a skillet cookie with ice cream that was our favorite as well. The wait was a little long, but it ended up being okay because they have customers pre-order Chicago Style Pizza because it takes a while to cook.

3 stars for the Decent service

I've had better pizza in a mall food court. 30 min wait, 40 min wait for the pizza and the house salad wasn't the enjoyable part of my dinner.

Super soggy bottom, as if it were sitting in water for an extended period of time, crust was nothing special.

Ill have to try Giordano's (sp?) but I'm keeping my expectations low.

Great Chicago deep dish pizza. They also have many locations under the name Pizanos. If your after  a moderate Chicago deep dish and dont mind the homogeneity of chains than sure, I drunk order it all the time.

The flavor is really good, the crust is delicious yet the cheese is not that good. flavorwise this pizza place has better sauce than Giordano's however, the pizza is a little boring, once again not cheesy enough.
First stop we make when in town. Love it so much we have it overnighted to Texas. Best pizza hands down.

I always recommend Lou Malnati's! Normally, I'm not a big fan of deep dish pizza, but the crust here is so good. It's crisp and the buttery crust I highly recommend. There's usually a wait, but they take orders while you wait which makes it seem faster. If you're in the area try it! I prefer Lou Malnati's over Giordano's hands down.

For visitor's to Chicago looking for classic deep dish pizza, I would recommend going for Giordano's or Piquad's over Lou Malnati's. If you do find yourself here, I advise against the Lou Malnati's classic... unless you like the idea of a solid 2 inch layer of greasy sausage across your entire pizza.

It was our first time trying Chicago deep dish pizza. The staff was very friendly and efficient. I like how you can go ahead and put in your order while waiting to be seated. We ordered the classic deep dish pizza (sausage and pepperoni) and it was super filling. It was delicious. My only complaint was our drink we ordered was made incorrectly, ginger ale instead of ginger beer. Other than that, it was a yummy meal!

pics.caption: Individual Chocolate Chip Pizza Dessert ... Delish!

review.des:
The pizza takes forever to cook (standard for deep dish), but they don't let you order ahead like the other deep dish options in Chicago. Personal pizza preference aside (I prefer Girodano's), the staff here are inattentive, and the beer selection sucks.

Sorry I'm not sorry, Lou's is overrated.

Really great! Cheese blend made the pizza. We got the small "Lou" and were impressed with the freshness of the ingredients. Olivia, our sever, had superb service and suggested an awesome local beer. Thanks!

Lou Malnati's is great!! Coming from NY, I was skeptical of deep dish but it surpassed my expectations by a landslide! I also really enjoyed their salad! Uncertain what made it so tasty but the dressing was definitely special and the staff was friendly!

I went here to try my first Chicago deep dish pizza and was very disappointed. I tried the Lou's: the crust, cheese, and toppings had no flavor--very bland. Service was good though. Sadly, my local friend said that Lou's is the best she's eaten.
This looks like a small restaurant, but it's really the best deep dish in Chicago.  Go ahead and walk in - they have plenty of space in the back.

Best deep dish buttercrust pizza in Chicago!!
Also the warm chocolate cookie pizza with ice cream is not to be missed!!!

Minus half a star.

Two reasons for a half a star
One: is the host/hostess will give astronomical times for a wait.
Two: there are sections where the a/c vent blows on you constantly.

The pizza however is amazing.

Now I'm from the east coast and I'm well aware of what NYC style pizza is. I mean I have been to Lombardi's on several occasions.

Deep dish like this is a totally different monster.

The pizza is excellent.

I was expecting some kind of greasy oily after taste and there was nothing but exceptional flavor of sauce cheese and pepperoni with the slightest hint of the buttery crust.

I have new had deep dish like this and feel lucky to live 2.5 hrs away where I can take the trip and get a pizza like this

I lived in Texas for nearly 3 years and their idea of pizza is comical at best.

I will be attending this establishment again in the near future. Amazing.

pics.caption: The pie. If you have never had Chicago deep dish. You haven't had deep dish

review.des:
Good deep dish pizza and open late!  Not too crowded if you come in late, but man, I was surprised how many people were walking into the restaurant at almost midnight!  And they kept letting people in, which was pretty cool

MOZZARELLA STICKS: terrible.  awful.  stay away.  It tasted like they barely made it out of the freezer before getting on the plate.  I think the appetizer menu exists only because the deep dish takes ~45 min so they want you to have something to munch on, even if it's awful.

DEEP DISH PIZZA: the pizza came out a little underdone.  I would have liked the dough to be more cooked, but it came out a little doughy and floury.  The menu does say you can request the pizza your way but I didn't know what standard was but if I knew it was undercooked pizza i would have requested it be well done dough.

Loved the sausage topping.

The Small doesn't give you as much a feel for deep dish since it's really only 4 pieces.  It's not a stuffed pizza though.

Ask for ranch dressing.  Well if you like it, but dipping the crust in ranch dressing is so good.

Liked this place way better than Giordano's.  One thing Giordano's had going for it was that you can order your pizza as soon as you check in, so even if you wait 45 minutes, your pizza is starting to get fired up so when you sit down, you don't have to wait as long.  Giordano's has more of a "stuffed" feel to it and way cheesier, but the flavor for Lou Malnati's was better for me.

Went late at almost 10:45pm and waited maybe 7 minutes to sit down.  It wasn't a long wait at all but I was surprised that almost all the tables were full!

This has to be the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. We ordered a medium spinach mix and mushroom deep dish pizza with the butter crust as well as the Malnati salad. Both were absolutely delicious. This was more than enough food for 2 people but we managed to finish it all with no room to spare purely on not wanting to waste any of the deliciousness.
Best Chicago deep dish pizza! Definitely better than Giordanos. They will also deliver but takes 45mins at least.
You can't go wrong with Lou malnatis!! We always order theDeep dish butter crust spinach and pepperoni pizza! Even just cheese is great. Best Chicago pizza by far.

As good as it gets for Chicago style pizza. If you want the Chicago pizza experience try a Lous location throughout the area. Some of the spots have a better sit down area than others but if taste is what you want- Lou's is the best!

*Update 1/4/16: I want to thank the business for their great customer service. Their social media person and store manager both followed up with me even though I had given them 4 stars! Also, the store manager offered my a gift card for our troubles. Very nice of them. I look forward to trying you out again.

I was determined to eat some Chicago deep dish on my most recent trip. Our shuttle driver said that Lou Malnati's was the place to go. I also overheard a fellow conference goer talking about his experience and he recommended to go here. I was originally planning on a different pizza shop, but changed my mind after hearing this place recommended twice.

My mom and I walked over from our hotel and it was quite a nice walk. It was not busy when we arrived, but quickly picked up by the time we were being seated. They gave us the option of ordering our pizza in advance so we would have less time to wait at our table. Note: you only order the pizza, not additional items such as salads.

We were seated upstairs after about 15 minutes. Not bad. Our food came out very quickly. I find it odd that the employees need to cut up and serve the pizza. We could have really done it ourselves. I think this slows down service quite a bit. More on that later. The salad was fine. The pizza was pretty good. It wasn't as deep as I expected. Also, it didn't seem to have as much cheese as I am used to with deep dish. We thought it was good, but not spectacular. We both prefer the deep dish in my hometown.

The major issue of our visit came with trying to get out of there! Our waitress took forever to get us our bill. We were just sitting and sitting. We see her delivering pizzas and taking others, but completely neglecting us. When she came with the bill, I had my card in hand for her to take cause I was worried about how long it would take for her to get back to us. Oh man. We were both very disappointed with the time we had to wait.

Ordered The Malnati Chicago Special deep dish and a Caesar salad...  The pizza was delicious!  Huge amounts of sausage atop the pizza with a huge amount of cheese and delicious tomato sauce.

The salad came quick and was also great to tide you over for the wait!

Now the best part was the service.  Our waiter was super friendly, on top of soda refills and just made the experience fun!

Loved it!

Location is conveniently located for an office lunch or if you are staying downtown at a hotel in the Loop or River North.  Colleagues visiting from out of town wanted classic famous Chicago Deep Dish pizza and a Deep Dish Lou did not disappoint.  Have taken many visitors here and even after they return home still talking about the buttery crust pizza.  Great selection of beer and wine to pair with the meal.

My second visit to Chicago and had to go back to Lou's. This was just like I remember. Fresh tasting mozzarella and chunky tomato sauce. We were a party of four so we ordered the large and a large house salad. Salad tasted fresh and the dressing was just right. "Maybe" I'll try a different pizza place next time I come back to Chicago.
Tomato sauce is sweet and hearty. Many try to compare to Giordano's but I believe they both stand on their own. Must try both when visiting Chicago!

Came on a Friday evening. There was a long wait. You get in line to put your name down and they text you when your table is ready. After you put your name down, they give you the menu so you can pre-order your pizza. We ordered a small Chicago style pizza, Buffalo wings, and the minestrone soup. Surprisingly, I liked the wings best here. The soup was average, I've had better. I was super excited to try Chicago style pizza (even though many people have told me it wouldn't be as good as New York's pizza). I was a bit disappointed. The tomato sauce was really tasty but the cheese was too heavy and hard. It wasn't melted at all. There was a big layer of it on top of the crust. I don't know if that's how all Chicago pizza is made but I wasn't a  fan of it. Next time I'm back in Chicago I'll give the pizza another try.

The wait was of course super long. For a party of seven, we were 36th in line. However, they did give us the option to pre-order our pizza in advance so that the wait time is shortened when we get seated. The ambiance is very nice, and the upstairs level resembles an authentic Italian restaurant. We ordered two medium pizzas of The Classic and the Lou, and we didn't even get to finish! The pizza was AMAZING!! I loved it even without pineapple (and that's saying a lot) Our waitress Jessie was also awesome and funny!

Slightly different from what I thought is Chicago deep dish pizza, but still good pie (is what I'd like to call it). I actually liked their thin crust better.  Call me crazy? I like the environment and tiramisu of this place a lot.

Do not order from this place!! If you have any sense do not patronize such blatant discrimination! I called this place for a delivery and was told that the boundary was Talman. I asked to speak to a manager since I am only a  block west. Some stuck up condescending punk named Sebastian had the nerve to tell me that they "don't go anywhere near Humboldt Park.. because they care of their drivers!". Apparently, they don't service 'the hood'..just 9 blocks away. Very rude and classless!

Order from Jets pizza instead, they are better! While they are a little more east, they do actually service the 'poor people'.

I'd give them 0 stars if it were an option.

Best Pizza in Chicago!
Buttercrust is a must for Deep Dish (Thin crust it's automatic)!
Malnati Salad is delicious! Fried mushrooms are a hidden gem!
I'm hoping for a location to open up in Andersonville!
My preferred locations are Lincolnwood and Lincoln Square.

The hype is warranted. I grew up in the Chicago area ("da Region," Northwest Indiana) and have had and loved Edwardo's, Gino's East, Giordano's, and the original Uno but this was the best deep dish I've ever had- a small (feeds 2!) with sausage, just too much to dream. That damn crust, ohhhhhhhhhh.....

Go somewhere else. We were not pleased. The other food ( not pizza) is flavorless. The pizza was nothing special and very hard on the bottom. Definitely not Chicago style deep dish. Very disappointed.
Amazing food and amazing services! First time in Chicago and I was blown away with the quality of pizza highly recommend it.

Went here looking for gluten free pizza on the advice of friends and family who had lived in Chicago. The regular pizza looked amazing but the GF version's crust was barely edible. The toppings and sauce were good and fresh, but this is NOT the place for Gluten Free dining. I would give one star for the GF but raised it to three because the house salad was very good and a Texas sized portion.

You have to come to eat here!  The house pizza was amazing!  This is a very popular place so call ahead or make reservations if possible or know that you will have to do some wait, but it is worthwhile.
The service was also great, very friendly staff
Thank you Lauren for great customer service + recommending us the best two options for pizza! It was simply the best pizza I ever had, literally!!

pics.caption: Blue Moon & Spinach stuffed Bread- reallllly goood
Half orders of The Lou and Chicago Classic, best choice I had

review.des:
Despite nothing about a deep dish seemed like a good idea to us, my husband and I couldn't let ourselves leave the city without giving one a try. We chose Lou's for its consistently positive reviews. We came in for an early dinner with two friends and shared a medium sized Malnati's special.

The pizza was made to order and took about 30 mins to be served. The Malnati's  special consisted of lean sausage, fresh tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and buttered crust. Other had claimed that the buttered crust was what made Lou's stood out from the rest of deep dish chains in the city. From our tasting, I thought the crust tasted like stale, crusty corn bread. The filling was fine. Sausage was sausage, sauce was sauce, cheese was cheese. Definitely not worth wasting an entire meal for this. I will eat my papa john's, Pizza Hut, dominoes over Lou's any day.

Overall - Chicago deep dish way overrated. NY style all the way.

The pizza was so good!!! Definitely did not disappoint. I have been wanting Chicago Style Deep Dish and I was very impressed! The wings were also good. I loved that the place had a bunch of sports jerseys on the walls. I definitely recommend eating here!
Excellent butter crust pizza and freaking delicious meatballs!

This pie was.sad. Ordered carryout and couldn't wait to dig in at home. Opened the box and it was pathetic. For $25 you would expect a gooey chewy plethora of goodness. Wrong ! They skimped so bad on the ingredients, there was a good half inch from the crust to the fixins. The cheese was so miniscule...I couldn't tell where the cheese and bread met. And mind you....I ordered the Lou special which was supposed to have extra cheese. I dont know whether it is a profit margin thing due to this being a newish location in pricey downtown Oak Park or just not caring. But, there are better venues within striking distance and I definitely will rethink my association with Mr. Malnati's establishment.

We ate pizza 3 out of the 4 nights we were in Chicago and Lou's was by far the best one! I've always preferred thin crust, so I wasn't expecting to like Chicago-style Pizza, but Lou's left me wanting to go back. I just might order one to be shipped to a me in Dallas because I can't stop thinking about how delicious it was!
Beware! A real deep dish pizza takes 40 minutes to bake! Either pre-order or arrive with people you don't mind talking to for a looooong time.
Great pizza, and never had a bad experience (we've only ever done delivery). Every time my mom comes in she asks us to order the salad because it's her favorite that she's had anywhere.
The deep dish pizza was amazing. The margarita, not so much. They use all that processed  mixer crap. But overall a nice experience.
A lot of hype here. Pizza is probably amazing if you live out of town but if you live in Chicago it's not the first choice.

It's tough to compare Lou's to Giordano's because I feel that they're almost different types of pizza. I tried Giordano's first, which I was very impressed with. But I kept having people suggest I'd try Lou's so I was expecting it to be way better or something. The pricing is a bit cheaper here and there are more size options, which is nice esp if you want a deep dish to yourself.

My bf and I decided on a medium (6 slices, which is equivalent to a small at Giordano's). We did half of the Chicago classic and half of the Lou's special. The waiter warned us that the wait would be about 35 minutes for the pie to be ready, but I'm sure it took almost close to an hour. The tomato sauce here is a little more wet and the crust is definitely not as thick.

I liked the Chicago classic better than the lou's. The fresh tomato on the lou's special made it a little more tangy. The butter crust was very tasty and easy to eat. I honestly can't decide between the two after trying them each just once. Therefore, I'll be back again!

pics.caption: Half Lou's special, half Chicago classic

review.des: Heard about this place before we got to Chicago.  Definitely worth the hype.  We got the three cheese bread, deep dish cheese pizza, and half "Lou" half "classic maltnati".  I preferred the classic maltnati but everything was really good.  First time having deep dish pizza and I'm glad I got to try it in Chicago where it famous.  We got carryout since we have kids and read about the wait being really long and the wait for deep dish to be 40-45 min.  So glad we did.
Good deep dish, bad thin crust. Horrible service! Waitress never came to the table till she wanted to drop off ticket. She was so rude!

Let's put it this way:  Lou Malnati's is one of the reasons I'm moving back to Chicago from stupid Los Angeles.  Their deep dish is so good I order them frozen and have them shipped here just to get a taste of home, and even those are better than any "fresh" pizza in LA.  

Why?  I'm no expert on their secret, but my guess is their particular choice of fresh ingredients and the perfect cheese to toppings to seasoning to crust ratio.  Looking forward to once again living within minutes of freshly cooked Lou's!

Every Lou's restaurant has the same high quality pizza. No matter where you are in Illinois this is a place where you can't go wrong. Try "the Lou" if you like the works on your deep dish. I have a theory their butter crust could create world peace.

Average to slightly better than average Chicago style deep dish pizza for the time it takes to get it! The wait to get in on a Thursday at 7 pm was about an hour. There is no room to have a drink while you wait so go across the street to The Bottled Blonde where the selection of brew is extensive and the "scenery" is spectacular ;-)  Lou's will txt you when your table is ready.
Beer selection could be better at Lou's. They only had one IPA and they had run out of it.
Despite ordering our food when we put our name on the wait list, it took about 45 minutes to have it served.  Probably why we didn't have to wait for the pie to cool down some

Had to try deep dish pizza as a traveller in America . Once you go deep dish you will never go back. Lol. Had to take my other SA friend to try it and she loved it to. We sat and had wine and pizza what more could a girl want.

First time trying a deep dish pizza at Lou Malnati's : great spot ! We decided to be kinda healthy by sharing the Malnati's salad - with Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, salami bits and gorgonzola cheese with our Sweet Vinaigrette and romano cheese. It was delicious, fresh. Nice blend of ingredient. Then we ordered a small deep dish pizza (way sufficient for 2 people), with half of the Malnati Chicago Classic ( with Lou's lean sausage, extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrus) and half of the Lou pizza. The pizza was very tasty, very cheezy, yum ! The Chicago classic was my favorite. The space is pretty typical of deep dish pizza places in town, with some jerseys on the wall. Service was great as well. Overall I prefered Lou Malnati's compared to Giordano's.

pics.caption: Deep dish pizza ( Chicago style and Lou)

review.des: We never skip Lou Malnati's when we are in town! Having lived in Chicago 20 years ago, we tried all the local pizza shops and Lou's is our favorite. This time we brought the kids. The kids, being from NY and being accustomed to NY style pizza, found the pizza quite foreign. But if you love Chicago style, check out Lou's!

Don't hurt me but I am not a huge fan of deep dish.
I came to Lou a few years ago and was deeply sadden about the quality of my pizza. Went back recently and the quality was much better. But I am still not a huge fan.
None the less, the food was fresh, flavorful and tastey.... still like my nyc pizza

Went on the Wendell river boat tour and our tour guide was saying that Lou is a must try place for deep dish pizza. Hands down delicious deep dish pizza we ever had!! The crust is so buttery and crispy with every bit. I wish we had a Lou Malnati's pizzeria in Vegas!! Definitely visiting Chicago again so we can eat here!!

I don't think I have been to a LM  bad  location.  Food  quality is always  consistent.  LOVE  the pizza.  Ordered a carry out recently, and they suggested  to not cut it ahead of time - cut it at home!  Who knew! Helped the pizza travel better  and maintain  its  quality!

I was not impressed with the deep dish pizza here. I heard a lot of good things about this place, but the pizza was just ok. The sauce was very watery, and the crust wasn't that good. I would recommend Pequods instead, but this could just have been a bad order, who knows.
If I could give ten stars, i would. So much better than giordanos. Easily the best deep dish in the city

We came out from Boston and the wait was crazy long literally over 50 min BUT soooooooo worth it. The customer service is amazing and the food fantastic!!! This place would surely be on my "will go back again.

pics.caption: Absolutely delicious!!! Must have! Trio of dips and pizza chips.

review.des:
The deep dish is the best in the city in my opinion. The crust is to DIE for, and there's a perfect balance of sauce and cheese.

My only complaint is the thin crust is not as good as many other places. But it's more of a deep dish restaurant anyways, so stick to that and you'll be fine. Also the Malnati salad is worth a try as a split appetizer.  

I also know quite a few people who work as servers here, and because of this I know the company treats their employees very well and most enjoy working here.
The deep dish needs a little more sauce in my opinion but I liked the crust more than other Chicago spots. Bruschetta was good. Service was ok.

We were visiting Chicago on business and of course wanted to try pizza. We asked many folks before heading there and since most mentioned Lou Malnati's we headed to one close to the hotel. It was quite busy, but they take your order for pizza ahead of time at the counter and I guess fire it up once you are at your table so you don't waste time ordering it at the table. We ordered the classic with the sausage and cheese. We started with a house salad which was tasty. I also had their italian style margarita..which funny enough tastes JUST LIKE the italian margarita at olive garden. Figure someone from OG must have visited a LM and tasted the margarita and decided to "borrow" it..who knows..quite funny.

So for the pizza..since this is our first ever chicago pizza, we cannot really compare it to anything else. Well..up in San Francisco Bay Area in Petaluma, there is Old Chicago Pizza Co that has chicago Style. We LOVED that pizza..it was made in same style with sauce on top, but the thick  crust had cheese tucked in it and the cheese was oozy and stringy...yum!  So for Lou's...the toppings were quite..hmm..solid? The cheese was not gooey at all. It wasn't bad..just not what I am used to. It was tasty enough..but was surprised the ingredients were more "compressed".

All in all a good meal. Glad we had some pizza while in Chicago!
Went here for a food tour and was able to sample the deep dish cheese pizza! Loved the buttery crust and it was absolutely delicious!
Hands down best pizza place. I like it here more than giordanos! Love coming here. Staff sometimes isn't the best but still come here.

I didn't think the dip dish pizza here was that good, not sure if it was just the kind we ordered (Chicago classic) or what, but it was just average. So, I don't understand the vibe. I liked the service and the inside considering it's a very casual place but the food is not something I'd crave or want to try again.
Thin crust pizza accompanied by their special salad is what I come here for. Always satisfying.

I just don't know how you can consider canned tomatoes on a pizza good. Cheese isn't the best quality either.
I'll pass on this pizza.
Amazing pizza. The garlic and spinach mix is my favorite. Lou's is my go to spot for thin crust pizza.

I am not from Chicago, so I wanted to try some famous Chicago deep dish pizza that everyone raves about. I really enjoyed Lou Malnati's hot wings, yummy! The restaurant is really nice inside. There is a long flight of stairs to climb to the extra seating on the 2nd floor.
The pizza was good, not great, but I was comparing it to Giordano's which I had tried the night before (Giordano's dough had more flavor to me). Trying it once was good enough for me :-)

My favorite Chicago style deep dish of all time. Their incredible tomato sauce is what separates them from the competition in my opinion. My go to is usually pepperoni and spinach, but they have other excellent options. Not a fan of the chicken sausage, but that's not a big deal. Great salad and appetizer sampler as well.
Deep dish Chicago pizza and it didn't disappoint. The guys at the bar were great, place was packed. Worth the trip if you're in Chitown.
So good! The best Chicago style pizza in town! The salad is very tasty and portion is big too. Will come back just for the pizza!!

When in Chicago, one must deep dish.  I should mention that I absolutely detest deep dish pizza.  What's the appeal?  It tastes like a fancy quiche with too much tomato sauce and not enough cheese.  I would rather get a thinner slice (I lurve New York) with double the cheese and  a little less butter (at least noticeable butter).

I was expecting this to be a disappointing Friday night experience, but I heard that this is one of the better popular deep dish spots in town.  While waiting for our table to be ready (a one hour wait), we decided it would be best to order the pizza 30 minutes into the wait (that way it would be ready relatively close to when we were seated).  Ordered the vegetarian deep dish (forget the name because I was definitely tipsy at the bar by that time).

It was surprisingly delicious!  I loved the garlic bread too.  For two people, you are better off getting the small and splitting (it's a thick and heavy slice of pizza).  Anyway, I had a good time and although I'm not a fan of deep dish due to two poor experiences in the past, this has slightly changed my perception.

Attention GLUTEN FREE people! I've been gluten free for almost 4 years (Food Allergen not choice). Lou's has the BEST GF pizza I've ever tasted. It's deep dish and absolutely amazing. If you're looking for a decadent, rich and flavorful gf pizza, look no further - try Lou's, you won't be disappointed.

Furthermore, we had a larger group (13) and her great service, quick refills and had a great time. There's a great casual atmosphere that makes you feel at home even if it's your first time there.

Pricing is moderate. My personal gf pizza was about $15, which I consider it well worth it

The only con I can give was the sangria. It was priced well at $30 for a pitcher, but it tasted liked watered down wine. Definitely wouldn't order again.

Overall, great place, vibe and food. Check it out!!!

pics.caption: Gluten free pizza with pepperoni, spinach and mushrooms. My new favorite!

review.des: This place is large and one of the top tourist spots to get some deep dish. I came here with a group of 8 and enjoyed their pizza. We got a veggie pizza and the classic with sausage. I actually liked the veggie one over the sausage. The veggie pizza had more flavor and taste, and the sausage was a tad dry.

Good pizza! But was rather disappointed when the Sheffield location doesn't have mozzarella sticks or bacon as a topping.... I mean it's a pizzeria and it not have this?? They said some locations do but they don't. I think the brand name should follow throughout it's restaurants and include all menu items for all stores....not one and not the other.
It was a who cares. Not good, not bad but such a so what. Sorry to all the fans. We were very excited to have a pizza bonanza. We had a few different pizzas and they were all simply okay.

My first deep dish in Chicago. Wow. I mean I'm from the real pizza capital of the US, New Haven, but Chicago deep dish is a whole different game. This isn't your chain pizza (at least across the rest of the states like Dominos, Pizza Hut, etc). It was a great atmosphere and place to eat a pie and watch the important sporting event of the day.

I had the Malnati Chicago Classic™ and boy was the Lou's lean sausage good with the extra cheese on Buttercrust.™ You must get the Buttercrust. That being said, I'm still not sure how nutritional facts are not a part of pizzas across the US, but that's the pizza EMPIRE striking down any regulation.

Here are the nutritional facts for the LARGE(ST) pie I ordered: Serving Size (g): 271, Servings Per Container: 8, Calories: 730, Calories From Fat: 390, Total Fat (g): 44, Saturated Fat (g): 17, Trans Fat (g): 0.5, Cholesterol (mg): 90, Sodium (mg): 900, Carbohydrates (g): 50, Dietary Fiber (g): 1, Sugars (g): 2, Protein (g): 35.

HOLY CRAP. Each SLICE is 730 calories. I had four of the 8 the large came with ... yeah, that's 3600 mg of Sodium. 200 g of Carbs. At least I got my 140 g of Protein? Haha, yeah just some side commentary on the lack of nutritional facts on pizza. No wonder we're so fat as a country.

I digress, check out Lou's. I too love pizza regardless and per some recommendations Lou's was great and Pequod's should be the next I check out.

Cheers!

Lou Malnati's was recommended to me by several people when I arrived to Chicago and trust me, it won't disappoint. If it's a cool summer night the outside sitting is perfection. Their menu holds a large selection of items ranger from appetizers to dessert and each one sounding equally as delicious. We decided to get the bruschetta and a deep dish pepperoni pizza. The bruschetta was so refreshing and fresh that we almost ordered that as our meal. A few minutes after the pizza came out and I must say, there wasn't much of a waiting time. We were also really entertained by the people watching and the awesome service that time kind of flew by. Note: the Chicago style deep dish pizza has the sauce on top and the cheese on the bottom. Kind of different from your typical pizza and very filling.

pics.caption: Deep dish pepperoni Chicago pizza with butter crust.
Deep dish pepperoni Chicago pizza with butter crust. Small: Two slice per person but like I said, very filling.
Yummy bruschetta!!!! Definitely enough for two people.

review.des: Tasty, but too much sausage for me and I am not fond of the crust. I am a New Yorker, so not my thing, but can understand the quality and uniqueness to Chicago.

The wait was rather long for okay food. We ordered personal pizzas and back home in California personal pizzas are rather large, but the pizzas we drivers were the size of pizzas served for kids. Still not converted to deep dish

It takes a very long time for the deep dish pizza, be prepared to wait for 45-60mins. The customer service is good and typical to most dine in place. We also ordered the bbq chicken salad which was delicious. Would consider for repeat next time we are in town.
Classic institution. I guess it's really good at what it does. Service was good. But overall food was average.

Not safe for celiacs!  I am not super sensitive to cc right away, but I was sick within an hour of eating here.  Sick, sick, sick.  Still sick the next day.  Definitely got gluten, and based on my reaction, it was more than just cc.

Review of food before illness - the crustless pizzas (sausage crust) was not very good.  Too much sausage, cheese wasn't melted.  I left most of the crust on the plate and ate some of the toppings only.

If you aren't celiac but just choosing gf and wiling to risk this place, go with the gf thin crust.

Celiacs avoid!

My gluten-eating companions said the regular thin crust was not good and the thick crust was good, but not great.  Not worth the hour wait.
Lou's is the best! Joe the bartender is the best! He cuts my pizza the best! My drink was the best! He's the best!! I think I'll marry him!!

We had a pretty bad service experience with our waiter but the manager came and made it right by bringing us complimentary food and ensuring that our pizza finally made it out to us. I appreciate him taking ownership of the situation and turning what had been a very bad experience into a more positive one.

That being said, all of the food that we ate was delicious! The deep dish pizza was one of the best that I've had!! We also had the malnati's salad and bruschetta and both were delicious. I would go back and order the same food again.

We went here on a Thursday night around 8 and there was no wait. We ordered calamari for appetizer and a medium famous deep dish with sausage and mushrooms. The appetizer arrived shortly and it was delicious. The pizza took about 25 minutes (on the menu it says it'll take about 30 mins), and it was definitely worth it. The pizza was really cheesy and meaty and really filling. I love pizza and could almost eat a whole pizza by myself but only 2 slices of this pizza and I was full because it was so packed with cheese and sausage.

I would definitely recommend this place and plan to visit again. They also have outdoor seating and I plan to being my puppy next time.
Best pizza ever. Deep dish that is. Always consistent and has the same taste as every time I come in here b
This is a commercial staple of Chicago. I have been eating here since a kid. This is a one of a kind pizza that will never get old. I love it. Top three pizza place in Chicago.

HORRIBLE WAIT TIME!

Arrived at 9:15 pm on a Sunday evening. We utilized yelp to help us satisfy our deep dish urge while visiting Chicago. We already knew what we wanted to eat, so we pretty much ordered right away. The server changed right after we ordered (not sure if this is where the communication failed?) we were told it would be 35-40 mins for our 2 small deep dishes, both with 2 toppings only.

Being a restaurant owner ourselves, we hold places with over 3k reviews and 4 stars to a certain standard. It's obviously good, in fact we were able to watch over 6 tables sit, order, eat, pay and leave. All the while we were still waiting. I would say around 50-55 mins after ordering our server, nicely apologized and said there was a confusion (not really giving us an excuse) and that it would be 10-15 more mins and the 2 small pizzas would be on the house. We were satisfied with that, figuring we already waited this long. Although, this info coming from a manager would have been better business.

Easily another 30 mins went by, I had to order a salad, to hold me over. At that point the server said 10 more mins.
Again, watching people order, eat and leave...we were at our breaking point. We decided to leave. Asked for the manager on the way out.

The manager seemed like he knew that there was a ticket time issue, but didn't know we still hadn't gotten our food. He tried to make it right (the only way he knew how) by offering us a drink at the bar. What we wanted was our almost 2 hours of life back so we could enjoy it somewhere else. We understand that issues happen, but as a manager you don't have your staff rectify situations, you handle them yourself.

We will never go back, we will not recommend it to anyone that asks for deep dish. We will simply find somewhere else that has great yelp reviews and enjoy some real Chicago deep dish pizza.

i visited here this past weekend with some friends, my first time in Chicago ever! it was a PACKED st. Patty's day Saturday and boy was the wait pretty long. Nonetheless, we got a table an hour later after being given a wait time and preordering pizza. The bummer was, I'd forgotten to add on pepperoni to the "Lou" pizzas I ordered!
Our waitress Tina and another lady whomI assumed to be the manager of the store that night were quick to make the adjustment to our order despite the GIANT amount of orders they were enduring.
Tina, who was swamped with 10+ parties, was zooming around the floor with the biggest smile on her face. Polite, attentive, and efficient. I was blown away by the service, the food and the happiness of the staff despite the store busting at the seams with people.
Overjoyed with my first deep dish Lou Malnati's pizza experience. I highly recommend this place for your first as well.
Bravo!

Deep dish pizza is a must when visiting Chicago. Decided to try this place because of the great reviews on Yelp. The trio of dips with pizza chips was great! Hummus, roasted garlic and spinach artichoke dips were perfect with the crispy pizza chips.

The portion was big enough to share with 3 people. I was so full after the appetizer that barely had any room for the main star, the deep dish pizza. The Malnati Chicago Classic had a crunchy crust but the sausage patty tasted alright. It was a huge thick sausage patty which lacked some flavor.

Deep dish pizza is a must have when visiting Chicago, especially for a first timer like me! And of course we had to eat at this renowned establishment.

Came to Lou's on a weeknight at 530pm so we could avoid the long wait. Friendly servers and a nice ambiance. By 630, the place was filled with people.

I love me some pizza, but I don't think deep dish is my style. 30-40 minute wait for the pizza to be made fresh & hot, yet when the pizza arrived it was rather cold. We ordered the "Lou" and "chicago Classic". Solid choices, but found that the pizza fell apart quite easy.

Deep dish is a classic Chicago must have, but I prefer New York style pizza or just pizza that doesn't fall apart easy. We also ordered wings and salad (way over dressed) and they were just average.

Forget any other pizza place in Chicago and ONLY eat deep dish from Lou! The service is always great and the pizza is unparalleled! Order a salad or app while you're waiting for your pizza (remember deep dish takes up to 40 minutes to cook). Hands down best pizza

Likely some of the worst pizza I have experienced.
A large pizza with 2 dirk sodas and tip should not be $50.
Unless it is awesome.
Although it arrived early, that was the end of the good experience.
The crust fell apart. The pizza wasn't cut all the way through. Taste was marginal at best.
Hey, the sodas were cold. That's a good thing.
We love having them cater for our meetings. There pizza is awesome, but it doesn't transfer as well out of the restaurant. However, their salads are amazing!

Although the place was packed, they have a good system  and our wait wasn't long.. the pizza was amazing ! I recommend starting off with the cheese bread ! They give u two large pieces of bread covered in cheese with a bowl of marinara sauce to dip!!  Great place.  Staff was very nice and the beer was cold !

In Chicago, everyone has their favorite. I'm a Lou fan. In fact, I like Lou's so much that this is my standard Christmas present to my east coast relatives. Chicago is the king of pizza, and Lou is the king of Chicago pizza.

While the buzz is the deep dish, I actually like the thin better. Better just to get both.
Best Deep Dish Pizza in Chicago & Bar-B Lou wings! All locations are amazing. The Lincoln Ave location is very nice. Not too busy, just right.

If you're lactose-intolerant or dairy-free, I'm sad to report that they do not carry non-dairy cheese here. It's probably the norm in Chicago, but I thought I'd mention it for similarly unfortunate souls looking for Chicago deep dish that won't make you shit your pants. The crust is probably dairy-free as long as it is not Buttercrust--duh. I did not ask for a vegan crust as I'm not allergic to dairy, so I don't know if they'll be able to accomodate the request.

My friend has historically disliked deep dish, but he thoroughly enjoyed his Malnati order. Like him, I disliked this style of pizza back home on the West Coast because it always felt like eating a bottle of Prego was dumped onto a loaf of bread. I tried a personal sized Classic with no cheese here and enjoyed the hell out of it--I wasn't even eyeing the cheesy pizzas at my table with envy while I ate my delicious monstrosity. The crust, sausage, and tomato sauce still make for a great Chicago deep dish experience. The personal size pizza servings are equivalent to about two small slices.
Nice deep dish in Chicago. We ordered pizza "Lou" and it taste really great and full.

Best deep pizza in Chicago.. thin crust is pretty good as well.  When ordering in, for deep dish, I find it to be a good idea to request that they not cut the pie-- the crust won't get overly moist during the delivery journey if it not cut.
Amazing pizza and I absolutely love ordered here the meatza without the crust. I ordered it with sliced tomatoes and spinach and it was perfection. Great option if you are grain free!

My deep-dish was fantastic.  Its crust was like butter, its cheese was slightly browned, and its sauce tasted fresh and fruity.  I sat at the counter at the bar and my bartender was energetic, happy, and provided great service.

Unfortunately had really bad customer service - were told we'd have to wait 15-20 mins for a table after 30 I went to check and was sent to a different person to ask who pulled up the screen and from what I could tell from the screen he clicked on they'd tried to text and it hadn't gone through (no call out though when we were seated there? No apology for the mishap?) From there we were seated straight away but became the forgotten table - no knives, had to ask twice for them and took ages to come, no water which we had to ask for even though every other table for it. The service was fine but at the end of the night our check was just thrown on the table as she walked past. It was so rude.

The food was good, pizza a little bland but fresh tasting at least.

Wish it had been better!

So delicious. So so so flippin delicious, and a great cozy atmosphere. This is a great place to have some beers and pizza and kick back, while getting great Chicago vibes! Definitely one of my favorites for pizza!

Arrived in Chicago armed with ample pizza recommendations and 9 out of 10 suggested Lou Malnati's, so I had to experience the hype for myself.

There was a 25 minute wait for a table (which was fair), and we were given the option to place an order before we were seated so we'd only wait 20-25 min before our pizza was done (which was brilliant).

We were able to snag seats at the bar where I ordered a beer. The wait went by pretty quickly (I hadn't even finished my beer), and we were then seated in a roomy and rustically-decorated upstairs area that I absolutely loved.

The reason this place lost 2 stars for me was that the pizza came out on the colder side of lukewarm. We had ordered extra cheese and when the pie was cut, the cheese cut like a block. There was no stringy goodness as my slice detached from the rest of its comrades. That should've been a red flag.

My first slice was a volatile bag of mixed emotions. I would be torn between disappointment and mild satisfaction as I bit into various parts of the pizza that were still warm versus parts that were now room temperature (and the room was cool. The AC was GOING...summers in the midwest are no joke).

However, it was my second slice that sealed the deal. The slice was now completely room temperature and the cheese had the texture of greasy rubber. Not cool. I did not know that cold deep dish pizza was the epitome of human disappointment before that moment.

Maybe it was just a one-off for Lou Malnati's, but seeing as I was visiting from 1700 miles away, I highly doubt I will be visiting again for a second chance when there's so much good food in Chicago.

TL;DR: Cold pizza. I've had pizza arrive hotter from the Papa John's delivery guy.

Hands down best pizza in Chicago. Consistently amazing. Favorite menu items are the classic deep dish with butter crust , spaghetti and meatballs, and the warm chocolate chip cookie. I always take out-of
town guests here and I have also shipped pizza and cookies to friends across the country. It's THAT good!

Out of the big 3 deep dish joint (Giordano's & Gino's being the other two), I would say that this is my favorite. I find the sauce to crust/ topping ratio to be just right. They have plenty of pre-made options but finding your own combo is what I'd recommend. Lou's doesn't do anything crazy with their pies but that's not what you're looking for when you want deep dish anyways...

Like all reviews below, this pizza is AMAZING! Being from California, I never had deep dish pizza like this and don't think I can ever go back to eating "deep dish" where I am from bc there is no comparison!

I came here on Friday around 4:30pm and had no wait bc we were early. We got half cheese half half Chicago Classic(sausage). It took 1 hr to come out once we ordered. The butter crust - amazing. Cheese - super cheesy and gooey without being too much. The sausage was a whole entire thin layer on top so every bite had sausage. The tomato sauce - so flavorful, not a strong tomato taste.

I highly recommend going here if you are a tourist - it'll be worth the wait! :)

pics.caption: Medium half cheese half Chicago Classic

review.des: Yum, yum and yum.  Order the deep dish classic and allow 45min for pizza but OMG so delish! The butter crust on this pizza is incredible.

My 2nd time here. And I have to seat I wish I went to Pizanos. The veggie deep dish was bland, the crust was a bit doughy/not crispy. The mahlnatis special was good but the crust was too hard on the edges and doughy in the middle. Hmmmmmm

We ordered the Chicago classic and The Lou. It was mind blowingly good. The wait time was long but it was definitely worth it. Our waiter, Jessie, was awesome! She was so nice and provided us with the best options. Great vibes and great pizza. Come check it out.
The pizza takes a long time to cook, so be prepared for that! Otherwise was pretty good, I am personally not a big fan of the buttercrust type we got.
I would give it a so so for pizza. I know this is a Chicago staple, but maybe I'm just not a fan of Chicago pizza. I went to the one downtown about a year ago and the ambiance is super cool.

Had to have deep dish pizza while in Chicago and this was by far the best! The crust, sauce, the cheese it was all so good. Not a huge fan of deep dish compared to ny style.. but still tasted delicious.

BE PREPARED TO WAIT. We waited for probably an hour to sit and then some for the pizza as it takes awhile to be made. Luckily they allowed us to put in our order while we were waiting to be seated.
very long wait but so worth it, you have to try the fettuccine pasta, out of this world cheezyness!!!!!
Ok meat Lovers....how about the crustless pizza!!!!! Full of flavor and MEAT! ABSOLUTELY delish

There is a lot of discussion as to which pizza is superior - Lou Malnati's or Pequod's. Having now eaten at both, I would give the edge to Pequod's for the ambiance and a slightly superior pie.

We got a small Lou's Classic, which is the perfect amount for two people. I really like the sweetness of the tomatoes, which balance out the sausage. The crust and cheese aren't so crispy, which I don't prefer but can still enjoy.

The atmosphere is a nicer sit-down, but a little touristy for me. I would rather spend my time at Pequods, but if you can only choose one you won't miss out either way.

Best pizza in chicago
Love the veggie but others in the family are meat lovers and are happy too

If this review was for Texas I would give it a 5 star.  Lou Malnati's pizza is one of the best pizza's in Chicago.  The deep dish pizza is not oily, has a crisp bottom crust and the sauce is perfect.  The choice of Mozzarella cheese is terrific and the sausage is blended with just the right amount of fennel seed, not over bearing with just the right amount of seasoning.  The pizzeria makes some intelligent choices like allowing you to order while you wait for a table.  As everyone knows, a good pie takes about 40 min to make, so enjoy.  Chicago has some really good competition.

PRICING: It's easy to overspend here. Like you think your bill might be $50 because you aren't paying attention, and then it turns out to be $75. Just be careful. Or just don't be me. Whichever is easier.

PIZZA: The pizza here is really good. I mean, it better be, right? The crust is delicious. A browned buttery crust that really handles that rest of the flavors well. I much prefer Lou's crust to any other pizzeria's, though I like the sauce at Gino's East better.

SIZE: If it's two of you, just get the small. Don't do it to yourself in getting the medium. You can't do it. I don't believe in you.

OTHER FOOD: I also got some mozzarella sticks, which were a bit redundant with the pizza, next time I would try something else.

Would recommend.

This is my favorite pan pizza, and that's saying a lot when you live in Chicago!  My go-to is the Malnati Chicago Classic, which features lean delicious sausage and extra mozzarella cheese topped with vine-ripened chunky tomato sauce, all on a buttery yet crunchy crust.  That Pizza, by itself, would make anyone happy as can be.  But take my advice and start with the Malnati Salad (Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, Volpi salami, Gorgonzola cheese) and for God's sake, DO NOT forget to slather on the Sweet Vinaigrette, made special in house.  It will blow your hair back, knock your socks off, and satisfy the bejeezus out of you.  Enjoy!!

We asked a friend of our for the best pizza in the city and he told us to go here. So we had pretty high expectations going in being in the middle of Chicago and all.

While it wasn't the best Chicago style pizza I've had, it was exceptional.

First of all, it's nice that even when it's busy inside, they let you order before you get a table because of the long cooking times for the pizzas. Secondly, they told us that we would have a long wait time however we did not experience that. We got there during the dinner rush on a Saturday night and we waited 15 minutes when they said it would be 45.

When we did get our table we noticed that is was hectic but our server was experienced and was very good about checking in on us. He cut our pizza for us at the table and served us our first slices which felt nice.

We were very pleased with our experience, we had a lot left over. We wanted to keep it but we decided to talk to a homeless guy on the way home and let him have it. All in all, a fantastic night!!!

My friends got the fried calamari which I don't generally like but I had a couple pieces and it was crispy well-seasoned. I always get an appetizer here because if you're wanting deep dish it means you're hungry but deep dish takes 40 minutes.

We got The Lou instead of the classic since I'm a vegetarian. Despite not being stuffed with sausage, the two guys I was with said it was delicious and very flavorful. I really liked it as well. I'm not a deep dish fan but once in a while it hits the spot. The crust was thick and crispy which is great; I like it over thick bread-y pizza. I think we got the medium for three people and we couldn't finish it but we tried to.

We were seated promptly before the rush of dinner service on a Saturday and saw the entire door area filled with people who were waiting and eyeing our food. Get there by five!

We went to dinner here while visiting Chicago for Spring Break. It also happened to be my husband's birthday. He is a huge pizza fan and always wanted to try this place.

We were told it would be a 45 minute wait and encouraged to look over the menu so we could order in advance since the pizzas take about 40 minutes to make. We had almost decided on our choices when we got the text that our table was ready. It had only been 10 minutes at most.

We got the family salad and the three cheese bread to start. Both were great. I had a mule which was pretty good. The pizzas were fabulous. The crust was rich and buttery and the sauce was slightly sweet. I had a personal size "The Lou". Perfect.

Our server (I think her name was Jelena) was quick, friendly, helpful, and attentive. It was a bit loud and almost rowdy for a Tuesday evening, but that just added to the fun atmosphere. I really don't think I can say one bad thing about this place. Our entire experience was wonderful and I would definitely go back.
The Food was delicious and I really enjoyed the service! By far my favorite chain for deep dish pizza! I will be going back for sure.
I'm 100% a Lou girl. The Lou pizza is the most amazing pizza on this planet and that's coming from someone who used to live in Italy. Lou Malnatis is the only pizza to eat in Chicago.
Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm. Been a family tradition for years to get a sausage & garlic pizza and they never fail to deliver
Phenomenal deep dish pizza and very convenient, located minutes from our hotel. Waitstaff was quite friendly as well; would highly recommend for Chicago natives and visitors like myself.
Great food but not for big groups. Also make sure to place you order shortly after you're check in with the hostess.

We got here before they opened, and there were already a line. We had a party of two, and we got seated promptly.

After sitting down for not even a minute our server promptly took our drink orders and gave us suggestions since it was our first time: Spinach bread and a "small" Classic sausage deep dish. Additionally, we had plates that were dirty, but the server took care of it. Another minor complaint: the two-person booths had really hard seats, it hurts after a while. Maybe it's a sign that I need to workout more for a bigger booty.

The Spinach Bread came first. It was mostly cheese! it was so dense that it felt like a whole meal. The crust was nice a fluffy, and it had a nice garlic aroma.

Then, the main show, the deep dish pizza came. Right off the bat, it definitely taste better the than NYC pizza. Chicago wins end of story.

Great pizza, good staff. Get there early to skip the lines!

pics.caption: Spot for many pizza before haha

review.des:
This is CHICAGO NOT DEEP DISH pizza. I would've rather went to UNOs for a deep dish pie. Ask any Chicago native, Giordano's or Pequods are the only places to go.

Do not waste your time with this gimmick, Mickey Mouse chain if you're in search of the real deal. Was put on hold 3 times only to reiterate why I was calling only to be met with rude service. They want your credit card in case of reservation no shows? Who do they think they are a 4 star Mechlin restaurant? I think I'd rate Olive Garden over this nonsense. Service was slow, dumb and all of our pizzas came out flat and undercooked. Only thing you'll be walking away with from here is a night on the toilet thanks to the raw sausage and chewy dough. Overall bad pizza, not high thick or cooked even after I sent it back after already waiting 40 minutes.

What a shame. You've been warned!

Very disappointed order wrong. Apparently call taker is in such a noisey room they said pepperoni when we never said that. Asked for sausage got cheese. Both pizzas not cut thoroughly and we are in a hotel! Worst Lou's experience ever

I grew up in the small town of Roselle and we had The Pizza Cottage that was quite popular at the time, but we would also drive to Addison and have pizza at John's.  It became my favorite pizza at the time.

My family moved from Roselle to Buffalo Grove in 1976 and one night my mom asked me if I wanted to join them for pizza and I asked her if we could go to John's.  She told me that we were going to try a new place that their friends had recommended to them.  I asked where and when told Lou Malnati's my first thought was "what the heck is a Lou Malnati's"?  

Well, after that night we never again returned to Addison for pizza.  I have been eating Malnati's ever since.

I don't consider myself to be a food critic or a pizza snob in any way and in fact I do enjoy other pizza so long as it's tasty.  Maybe one has a crust that I like, or a sauce that really tastes good.  And I think that's fine.  But Lou's pizza is my all time favorite, no doubt.  We have ordered both the thin crust and the famous deep dish and the butter crust is to die for.  It is particularly flavorful when the juices of the tomatoes soak in, at least to me.  It gives the butter flavor such a richness to it that I really enjoy, and Malnati's pizza is one of few that I kind of consider the crust to be an actual ingredient rather than just something to hold the toppings on.  It's magic!

A few years ago I had a procedure done that limits the amount of food I can take in and these days I choose a low carbohydrate diet which is rich in protein.  Lou's has me covered there, too.  They offer a "crust-less" pizza that features the big sausage patty, cheese and tomatoes and it's also a butter crust pie.  It really succeeds at conveying that butter crust quality.  The only thing missing is the crunch.  I just love it.

Over the four decades that I have enjoyed eating Lou Malnati's pizza I have taken girlfriends, friends, relatives and now my own family to enjoy this delicious pizza.  It's always fun to see the look on a person's face the first time they take that first bite.  The expression is just precious!

Hey, it's Chicago Deep Dish Pizza at it's finest. I love Lou Malnati's and have been there countless times.  The sausage deep dish pizza is a classic, and one I gladly recommend to people visiting Chicago who want to try those "Chicago-Style" pizzas that they've heard about.

I cannot think a bad word to say about Lou Malnati's, and I doubt that anyone can. It's good eating that will satisfy any lover of deep dish pizza.

From New York and love my traditional pie but this was my first deep dish experience and I wasn't disappointed. It was perfect amount of sauce and cheese. A small was the perfect amount of food for 2.

Stuffed spinach bread is honestly the only reason why I come here. That and the bartender Chris who makes a damn good Moscow Mule. Family friendly chain establishment. Not a fan of the pizza so much as there are other favorites I prefer over Lou's. Nevertheless worth a try if you visit Chicago.
Solid. Good. There is a reason it's been around since like 1729. It's very good and an institution. Do I even have to say this??!!
Great pizza, great ambience, highly recommend on a trip to Chicago for deep dish pizza!

A colleague and I were in Chicago on business and we had to have Chicago-style pizza. Our hotel suggested this place as it was right around the corner from the hotel.  We were seated right by the window at a high-top table.  We shared a salad and pizza.

We started with the Malnati Salad - Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, salami bits and gorgonzola cheese with our Sweet Vinaigrette and romano cheese.  I loved everything in it.  And it was huge.  The two of us could not finish it.

For our pizza, we had the Malnati Chicago Classic - Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. Super thick and gooey.  Loved it.  Definitely a knife and fork pizza and very filling.

If you are looking for authentic Chicago style pizza, this is your place.  Its a fun atmosphere with sports on the TV's.  Definitely will be back the next time I am in Chicago.

After trying specialty pizza, and pasta we left extremely disappointed. The pizza was ok but nothing to brag about and there was a taste in the pasta that was absolutely awful. I took 2 bites and was just about gagging. After hearing this place was the best we were super disappointed. The best thing we had was the cheesy garlic bread as an appetizer and the service was good.

This pizza was really good. It was my first experience with deep dish pizza and I especially loved the crust. However, I think the ratio of sauce to cheese wasn't balanced. Too much sauce in my opinion. But, would definitely recommend because overall, the pizza had good flavor.
First time having Chicago deep dish and it did not disappoint! I did not expect to have that much sausage on one slice!

Stopped in on our weekend trip to Chicago. We came around 6:30 pm and were able to pre-order our pizza right away. The wait was around 35 minutes which wasn't bad for a Friday night. We ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic. The crust was buttery and delicious, and there was the perfect amount of cheese and sauce. I could have done without the sausage as there was way too much of it. I think it would taste better with pepperoni. The edges of the pizza were slightly over cooked but overall it was a good deep dish pizza.
Amazing pizza, great service. Jovana was quick, so sweet, and super helpful!! It was our first time to this restaurant and we had an amazing experience and walked away so full. 10/10.

We are in town from Orlando and stumbled upon a Lou Malnati's and fell in love. Everything was fantastic, pizza, wings, pasta all of it was awesome and we wish there were some in central Florida. Really awesome pizza place and we will stop in everytime we are in town!!

Choices choices... When you are in a city for only a certain limited amount of time, it's hard to narrow down places you want to eat. So many places to eat. So little time...

Lou malnati came highly recommended via YELP and as YELP has never steered me wrong, I decided Lou Malnati's will be my Chicago pizza experience. As I walked up to the much anticipated pizza place, my heart sank... There was a mob of people waiting already... Boo boo... Ok... My fault for going at prime dinner time 630PM...so, I put my name on the wait list and grabbed a drink at the bar. The bar is not big but it is sufficient. The beers ranged in variety from local brews to domestics and the prices are good...
Thankfully the wait was supposed to be over an hour but we were seated much earlier than anticipated. Now... On to the food!!!

We ordered a salad that had candied maple bacon. Yes please...More please... One of the best salads I have ever had! We also had the calamari which was battered perfectly and was still moist and juicy unlike most places where the calamari is dry and stringy.

Oh the pizza!!!! We had the sausage pizza and lemme tell you... I can usually do damage on pizza, averaging 4-5 slices. However, this pizza... after two slices I was stuffed and couldn't move. It felt like each pizza slice weighed about a pound of yumminess. They certainly aren't stingy with the sausage. Instead of sprinkling morsels of sausage, it's like a a blanket of meaty goodness cooked to perfection. Also, as most people commented, the butter crust... Ridiculously good. It was so buttery, crispy and not greasy what so ever. I could just sit there and eat the crust... All day.

A must try if you are in the area!

pics.caption: Side profile of sausage pizza. See the blanket of sausage? Yummmmmm

review.des: The pizza is amazing. Service is fantastic. Best bruschetta (sp?) I've ever had - practically melts in your mouth. Signature cocktails are ridiculously tasty. Will definitely come again next time I'm in town.

Our first time in Chicago and of course we had to try the famous deep dish pizza.   It's was worth the 2 hours (1 hour wait for our table and another hour for the pizza).   Excellent pizza.   We also ordered calamari (it was ok but the sauce was good) and buffalo wings (it was also ok).   Anyway, we went there for the pizza.   Next time no more appetizers, because the pizza was humongous!   Their Bloody Mary was also very good!

pics.caption: Should not have ordered appetizers!  So much leftover!

review.des:
I absolutely love Lou Malnati's! Among most deep dish places I've tried, I've loved the flavor and simplicity of Lou Malnati's. I get the sausage and mushroom. YUM.

The service takes a while (maybe 45 minutes to bake) so don't come starving hah. Otherwise, when your pie comes...enjoy the smells, take a bite and enjoy the deliciously flavored marinara sauce and cut into the sausage patty the pie has. The crust is just a perfect thickness. SO SO good.
Great pizza always the best deepdish anywere

After an rough experience at the West Loop location, we were thrilled to have such a great experience at this location.

We arrived around 4:40 - and were pleased to find that the joint was already jumping. After our initial experience at West Loop, we were relieved to see that their bartender was already working - and working hard, shaking up some delicious margaritas. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and welcoming.

We had a spinach salad with goat cheese and strawberries - YUM! For pizza, we shared the Lou, and it was delicious and filling.

The food was great, the service was great.

The beat pizzeria in Chicago..
Thin crust with Pineapples and bacon is my favorite. Any pizza, oops "I mean pie" is great choice.
Great food. Our waitress was very friendly and interesting. The line can be slow, but it takes a little time to prepare it, but it's worth the wait. Excellent experience.

Overall: classic Chicago deep dish. Good for tourists and for being unhealthy

Food: for tourists reading this review, Chicago deep dish is basically in a deep pan with dough lining it. The inside is filled with sauce, cheese, and other toppings. It is just as unhealthy and delicious as it sounds. Bring friends.

Lou Malnatis was my first exposure to deep dish and boy did I take a... Deep dive. The menu is pretty simple, with salads, apps, and of course, deep dish. Each pie takes about 30 minutes to bake, and seem to go longer on busy days. And it was busy the entire time we were there. I got the vibe that the waitress wanted us in and out when she constantly offered to take our plates. Oh well, I guess Chicago just moves faster.

This place is worth checking out for the experience of authentic Chicago.
Tomato sauce was a bit too much, but the rest was fantastic. I probably never enjoyed a pizza like I did here last night.
A bit long of a wait, but definitely worth it! Definitely the best deep dish is Chi-town. If you love meat, just get the meat lovers -- don't even think twice. You won't regret it.

Well, thanks to Lou Malnati's, I now understand why people love deep dish & also how so many places fail at making it taste good. This absolutely changed my opinion on something I hated every time I tried and the only reason I went to Lou's was due to the urging of a dozen or so friends.

It is well worth the 30 minute wait for this crispy delicious pizza. It's not bready, it's not even thick, it's just AMAZING. I had to go back a second time in less than 24 hours & I expected not to like it.

100% the best pizza in Chicago.  Hands down.  I've tried it all and Lou's has the most consistently delicious pizza in the city!  Our favorite combo (if you can handle the heat) is pepperoni & giardiniera peppers!  Their bruchetta and house salads are a great add-on as well!  Enjoy!!

Chicago friends encouraged me to visit after hearing my love for Gino's East.

I was not disappointed. Chicago classic with add on mushrooms and green peppers delivered. Loved the butter crust. Next time, I plan to try pepperoni instead of sausage. The layer of sausage was a bit too much for me, but overall this deep dish has a slight edge over Gino's. And that is high praise.

Loved this place! Since I was solo, I sat at the bar with no wait. It was a very chill atmosphere, one tv at the bar. I was greeted by the bartender, my bad for not cleaning my ears out, he had to repeat everything, although the music wasn't too loud. I pretty much knew I was going to order a personal pan deep dish, went for the Lou Manati classic.

Even the personal size comes out in 20-35 min (i wasn't counting, but was warned) I enjoyed every second of that pizza! Crispy, but not overcooked, juicy from the tomatoes, and the meat made it super filling! I enjoyed my two Goose Island wheat beers, paid in a flash, and left. I think there was an upstairs and curbside seating.

Very family friendly place. Great deep dish pizza!

Very slow service. The pizza was okay. I got a thin crust pepperoni. We were going to order a cookie thing for dessert and the waitress said to wait to order it because it takes less than 10 minutes. We ordered it later (per her suggestion) and she said "okay but it's going to take 20-25 minutes". When she brought the bill I gave her my card and didn't even look at it and told her we were in a hurry. She stopped at three other tables on the way to run my card and one table on the way back. I know that we were not her only table but she was taking forever with everything. We were the ones on the back burner.

Ordered to go and good thing I did, this place was jumping.  I wasn't overly impressed with the pizza itself.  I am format of town so maybe its just not what I'm used to?!?  Tried  different pizza place last time that I liked better.  The Buff a Lou wings though are great!!!

#3,499? seriously? the fact that this many people take the time to write reviews - testament to the excellent pie they make..day in...day out.

Walking distance from my hotel, The Gwen. healthy walk about 20 minutes but worth it. I knew this location woud be crazy - perfect storm of the National Restaurant Show in town, a Friday night and the BEST pizza, hands down. Four deep at the bar.  I began stalking the people at the bar so i could snag a seat. Ordered my thin crust pizza and a cold Corona as soon as the bartender could see me (smiling).

perfect timing: 20 minutes later, my pizza arrives as I was able to sit down and watch the Cubbies drop one game (but oh..my Cubbies!!).

This is a very healthy sized individual pizza and I make no apologies for eating the entire pie. It's not often I can get to Chicago and eat at Lou's. This place is incredible.

The bartenders work very very hard - wish they could enlarge the bar area though.
LOVE this pizza.

Huge fan of deep dish, visiting from California I had heard nothing but good things about Lou's! So happy I had a chance to make a trip. I had their pepperoni and pineapple deep dish and it was SO cheesy and crust buttery and crispy! Can't wait to return.
Great Chicago deep dish pizza!  Loved the ambiance the prices are reasonable.  This is a must when visiting Chicago.

Buttercrust buttercrust buttercrust! Deep dish and thin crust are both absolutely amazing! Salads are gigantic, we get the side and it's enough for four of us. Delivery is cheap and super duper fast! I always order our pizza well cooked and uncut, it keeps the crispness through delivery that way! This is our neighborhood go to pizza spot!
Delicious, fun, a little crowded - but we ended up taking our pizza to go to enjoy the beautiful outdoors!

Who doesn't appreciate Chicago style Deep Dish Pizza?

I LOVE Lou Malnati's and have missed it ever since I moved away from Chicago. Had the opportunity to order a Classic Pizza while staying at Marriott downtown. Very convenient as they delivered it right to the lobby.

Delivery guy was great and attentive.

If you haven't had Lou's, you are missing out!

Wow!
