It was really busy and it seems like "it always is" busy but was on our "while in Chicago list" so we put our name on the wait list and preordered our pizza pies as directed. .after about an hour and I could have chewed my arm off..was so hungry!  When we were guided upstairs was surprised how busy it still was (about 8:30pm) but waitress was good & Lou's house salad was delicious with tangy dressing & olives, our party dug in!  Soon the deepdish pies arrived (The Lou, and Pepperoni).  Now we were feeling better,  very happy with company and even more so with dinner!  Our fave was The Lou..there was such a good amount of cheese and veggies & full of flavor that didn't even notice there was no meat on this one. .both good with thick buttery crusts.

Staff was very busy but beverage glasses weren't ever empty & plenty of leftovers!

Pizza is definitely 10/10, however, I felt extremely unwelcome at this location. The front person was not very nice and seemed bothered that we needed help since it was our first time here.

Here's the kicker, I'd come in a few days prior to ask for a pizza box to take a picture with it in front of the Millennium Park bean. They wanted to charge me $2 for an empty box. I exclaimed shock at the price to which they responded "do you want us to charge you more?" I stated I'd prefer if they didn't charge for empty pizza boxes. It was pretty audacious of them to have given me such a hard time for an empty pizza box but I thought I would give them the benefit of the doubt.

I came back with a group of 4 to share the Lou's experience with them. Again, the employees were very cold and you could very much feel that they disliked tourist.

pics.caption: Lou's expensive pizza box at the Bean

review.des: I prefer other deep dish crusts and didn't like the salad options. Probably wouldn't go back.

The pizza came cold and watery. The hostess was extremely rude when we explained that there was water dripping from the slice and explained that there was nothing we could other than wait 45 mins for a similar pizza before walking away. Very frustrating experience
Order the Lou or original deep dish or crust less if your on a Keto diet and prepare for an instant classic. I use their website to order and set a delivery time in advance to avoid issues with wait.

Loved this deep dish!  So much food!  There was 3 of us and the medium was way too big!  All the flavors worked so well together and the crispness of the crust was amazing.  The cheese tasted so fresh.  It was super hearty.  This was my first deep dish and it was great!

We also got the tiramisu - all the ingredients were perfectly balanced and it just melted in your mouth!
My favorite deep dish hands down!!! Butter crust is a must. Don't you dare google how many calories are in a slice!!

Pretty solid spot! While I think I still love NY pizza more, this was some delicious pizza. I came in on a Thursday afternoon and it was a little dead so grabbed a seat at the bar. The bartender was great, we talked for quite a bit and he gave me some solid Chicago tips and what to order there.

I ordered the stuffed spinach bread to start, it was delicious and very filling! It could have used a bit more spinach but overall the flavor was fantastic. I would definitely consider getting this if you come in.

I ordered the Lou Malnati's special which is a large piece of sausage instead of chunks. It was fantastic, and also filling (personal size). I felt it could have maybe used a bit more sauce, and it really didn't feel like extra cheese but I think that was just perception vs. reality. As everyone mentions it takes 30-40 minutes so get an app if you're hungry. I enjoyed the service and the food and if I was back in the Windy City I'd probably come here first for my deep dish craving.

Weirdly enough walking in, sitting down there is a giant Babe Ruth cut out on the wall. Something I didn't expect, but the Malnati's were from NY. Just a fun piece of information.
Best deep dish pizza I've ever had hands down. I would come back again for sure. The best welcoming to Chicago I could have ever had.
The first deep dish I received was ok but I decided to give them another try. The second one was much better.  I'm going to chalk the first one up to a mishap.
I honestly did not see the hype about this pizza. Perhaps I am too used to NY pizza, but I fid not find it to have great oils and taste.

Not impressed, taste wise and texture wise. Our CPK pizza is actually a lot better. I guess maybe how Chicagoans like pizza but not us. In addition, the service is slow and bad, with water not being refilled, no plate and folks on table until food brought out. I think tourists better go to CPK for better food and service.

Not recommended!

Maybe I'm just a New York pizza girl through and through, but this was my first experience with Chicago pizza and I think Lou's is overrated.

We arrived for an early lunch at 11:30 and were seated immediately but it was 15 minutes before a waitress came over and acknowledged us. Thus, I had a bad impression early on. We decided to get a small "the Lou" pizza to split between two people. This is a veggie pizza with spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes. Since we knew the pizzas took a while, we wanted an app and decided to go with the stuffed spinach bread. This bread was amazing and was the highlight of our meal...super cheesy and delicious. However, we were disappointed with the pizza. The crust was bland and definitely not buttery considering that they call it their "buttercrust", and the cheese and toppings were just alright. Nothing to write home about.

The atmosphere is casual, with TVs both upstairs and downstairs. Prices are reasonable considering how filling the pizza is. Maybe Chicago pizza just isn't my thing, or I should try one of the other well known spots for it to see if they do it better.

Samantha and Sarah were so informative and enjoyable. The Classic pizza and dad were a perfect end to a great day.

The ranch dressing is house made and it made my mouth water. And I hate ranch dressing.

Must must must eat here n

I'm not a huge fan of deep dish, because well it's basically a casserole - but if I'm in the mood for pizza casserole I'm going to have Lous. The classic cheese is my go-to, you've got the perfect combo of buttery crust and gooey cheese to feed your soul during the winter. Oh, and do yourself a favor and order the Calamari Fritti! SO GOOD.

Obviously being from New York City, we had to try the deep dish pizza. There's a great spot in NYC called Emmett's which is a Chicago based bar with deep dish, but I need to try the real thing.

We started with cheese bread before we ordered our pizza. I did think it was a little too much to have right before eating more bread and cheese after, but the pizza takes about 40 minutes so we wanted to nibble on something. It comes with a marinara dipping sauce and was very good.

We ordered a pie with sausage and pepperoni. I would have to say I do like NYC pizza better than the deep dish in Chicago. The best part though about deep dish is the meats. Each bite was covered in meats. The crust was also very tasty. It's definitely a more filling feeling you have when eating this type of pizza.

Overall, was a great pizza experience and I would have no doubts that deep dish will help my pizza crave we all suffer from.

pics.caption: Deep dish with pepperoni and sausage

review.des: Count me in anytime. Lou's in my opinion is the best deep dish in Chicago. Nice crust, not too doughy and a nice combination of sauce, cheese and sausage. I've gone to several locations. Oak Park, Gold Coast, Lincoln Park, Lincoln Square and the original on Lincoln near Skokie and they are all consistent. I even pick up the frozen ones from time to time to eat at home.
It was good. Comfortable seating, excellent service but I think I like a more "bread-like" style on the crust.

Went to this location for the first time around april of this year and it didn't disappoint. We've been going to Lou Mal's for about 20 years. Even though we live in San diego now it's always one of the spots we hit when we're in town.

If you go there get the Deepdish Buttercrust pizza.
Visiting from  L.A and was recommended to eat at Lou Malnati's and I'm glad I did it was delicious and service was excellent.  I would highly recommend it.

I wish I liked deep dish pizza more than I actually do. I bet I would really enjoy this place a lot more. This restaurant was suggested to me by my friend who is a local here and I can see why. We came around lunch time and the place is super homey. Lots of sports stuff on the wall and the service was great. We had the veggie deep dish and the meat deep dish. I enjoyed the veggie one more, but I definitely did not finish my single slice. It was overwhelmingly deep for me: lots of red sauce and lots of cheese. I just think I prefer a substantial equal proportion of cheese, sauce, and crust. We also had the pizza chips and dip. Why did I get pizza chips if I was going to order pizza as an entree, you ask? Yeah, I'd question myself too, but I thoroughly enjoyed it! I liked all the dips and we were still snacking on it after our pizza. Def something I recommend!

However, I'd say the winning factor in this whole meal was the Malnati salad! I know, another odd comment, right? Yes, I am saying the salad is my favorite at this pizza joint. But you gotta believe me, this is one of the best salads I've ever had. I would come back here just for the salad! I did contemplate it while I was visiting Chicago. With the right amount of sweet, tart, and savory, it's a hit!

So good! We stopped here a few months back on my husbands first trip to Chicago & he had to try Chicago style pizza. I love Chicago & have been to Uno & Giordano's and Giordanos is my fav... I think they still have a slight leg up on Lou Malnati's (first loves die hard). We arrived shortly after opening bc we had an architectural tour early afternoon (again, hubs first visit so we had to do the tourist stuff). We ordered a salad which was large enough to share for two. We also ordered a small deep dish pepperoni. Good thing we didn't get anything else. We were so stuffed after a piece each! I felt so awful leaving behind our leftovers bc it was so good! It's a bit expensive, but it's Chicago so everything is. It's a great spot!

I left my stint in the Midwest about 17 years ago, but remember the Chicago deep dish pizza fondly.  I've never been a huge sausage pizza fan, so instead of the Classic I always ordered the pepperoni in its place.  My husband and I turned to Yelp for a local pizza recommendation and found Lou Malnati's has nearly 3000 reviews and still pulls in 4 stars, so who are we to argue?  

My hubby called in the order and the woman taking the order made a helpful suggestion for pizza size (small was enough for both of us and we have a small piece left for a midnight snack).  He FORGOT the butter crust, sigh.  But it was still amazing!  The crust was crispy, the cheese gooey and the sauce had chunks of tomato in it, giving great tomato flavor.  

Hubby brought the pizza back to our hotel room.  Packaging of the pie was perfect, with a thin plastic covering protecting the tomato sauce from the cardboard box top.  The little Parmesan side was slightly less than what we needed for our taste, so if you like Parmesan ask for extra!

Best Pizza in Chicago. The Sausage Deep dish is truly amazing, the crust is delicious. The service was excellent, attitudes, responsiveness, all 10/10. I couldn't recommend any other pizza place more than this one.

The location is superb, seating perfect, why are you still reading this? Go! And Enjoy!

WOW this place was amazing, The place is big and I didn't have to wait to be seated. I ordered cheese bread for appetizer which wasn't anything special just average. On the other hand the pizza was amazing, the only negative about the pizza is you are gonna have to wait minimum 45 minutes for your pizza to be made. So be prepared to wait and yes it is definitely worth the wait. Overall great food and i will be back

I came with a group of friends that had never had Chicago style pizza before. The four of them decided to get the Malnati Chicago Classic. Since I don't eat meat, I ordered the Lou's personal pizza. I feel like my review might be higher if I had tried the pizza in the big pan versus the personal one. The personal one doesn't come in a pan, and it honestly is a bit pricy for what you get! Flavors were ok, but wasn't wow.

The rest of the group, however, enjoyed the classic!

I believe they do half and half, so do that if you can!

Finally tried this after trying most of the other "best deep dish" places in Chicago (Giordano's, Gino's, etc.) I must say, it was pretty good. Tourists flock to all the good places, and Lou Malnati's is no exception.

Pro-tip: Always remember that deep dish takes at least half an hour to 45 minutes to prep, so make sure that you don't have any impending obligations less than an hour away, or call ahead. It also might be worth getting a few appetizers while you wait for that long.

We got the original Lou's (roma tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, cheeses), and the Malnati Chicago classic (sausage). The crust was pretty good, with a bit of a tart, sourdough taste, which complemented the rich toppings. Both were very good, and left all of us stuffed, with a few slices to spare. We ordered two mediums for 6 people, and the stuffed spinach bread as an appetizer, which was more than enough food. Service was a little spotty, but not enough to be a problem. The prices are actually pretty good, in my opinion, as each of us only paid around $18, including a 20% tip.

Overall, not to be a deep dish hipster, but I still think Pequod's is still my favorite. Screw it, I relish being a deep dish hipster. That being said, Lou Malnati's has stood the test of time, and rightfully so. With so many locations, the convenience factor is there, and while they're all mostly tourist destinations, you'll likely get a good, consistent, deep dish pizza no matter where you go.

pics.caption: The Lou: roma tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach and cheeses

review.des: Love this pizza! Ordered one for every family member this past Xmas. Even being some first timers it was the best they have ever had. Best pizza Chicago has to offer in my opinion

Frankly, I don't know a damn thing about Chicago style pizza. This was my first time in Chicago, and damnit, I just felt like being a tourist for a little minute, so I ordered the famous pie. Ive had the contender too many times to count, but your not going to find Chicago style pizza in Charleston, so I took advantage of it while here for work.

I ordered delivery with no time to venture out and find it, and thankfully, there website is clean and efficient. Ordering a pie was super easy. No registration or signing up needed, which is smart because I would have skipped ordering from them.

They also provide a time that the pie will get to you which was very helpful because then I could plan accordingly to be upstairs when it arrived. Remarkably, it actually arrived within the time frame that was listed when I purchased it. Check check.

Take the handoff, and was not prepared for how heavy the thing was. This medium pie weighed some pounds..I couldnt help but laugh that I felt I was about to eat pounds of pizza. Open it up, its bulky, thick, heavy...its a lot. I ate a sliver of it, but honestly it didnt wow me. I really dont know what else to say about it. It was good, but not remarkable. I will say I am thankful they used real mushrooms and not canned--that is always worth noting. Im just going to chalk this up as the beginning and end to my Chicago pizza experience. It was also $30, so it is was coming back to South Carolina with me. For $30, I dont care how eh' it was, it was getting finished!

pics.caption: This little pizza probably weighs close to 6/7 pounds. I see thousands of downward dogs in my near future.

review.des: All I can say is AMAZING! this place was incredible. The pizza, with the butter crust, melted in my mouth. I am so glad we went and the pizza was just delicious. Whenever I am in Chicago, I'm going back to Lou's!

Whether you like deep dish or thin crust, Lou is a great pizza place to choose to eat at. My go to flavor is pepperoni! My family also loves the house salad and mozzarella sticks. One of my favorite pizza joints in Chi!

Had to try deep dish pizza while in Chicago. We were seated immediately outside, super nice evening. Our server was great! Friendly, helpful, made it an enjoyable experience. Tried chicken wings, delicious! A little crispy, perfect amount of sauce, yum! Also shared a small deep dish pepperoni. Very good. So filling, we only had a slice each. Glad we tried this place.

pics.caption: Patron shot & IPA to go with our pizza!

review.des: My time favorite deep dish! The sausage is great. We even buy & send for Christmas gifts to New Mexico because they don't have anything like it and our Godchildren look forward to getting them
Best calamari ever! Seriously.  Get a thin and deep dish (smalls) so you can taste both.  Worth the wait!

One of my favorite pizza places in the Chicagoland area. Both thin and deep dish are good. Plain cheese or the Lou are good. Cookie skillet pizza is good. It's just all sooo good. I've been to many locations and it's consistently good for dine in, take out or delivery. If you're in Chicago and haven't tried it yet, it's a must.

It's a Chicago classic that I bring visiting family and friends while touring downtown. It's pretty busy on weekends and during peak hours, but service is always nice and there's always a friendly and energetic vibe. Can't go wrong with the Malnati classic deep dish with the sausage baked right in. The vegetarian version isn't bad either. And something that is delicious and unexpected here is the calamari. YUM!
Great service and delicious food. We wanted to try the classic deep dish pizza chicago is known for, and we were not disappointed.
You will definitely need a bigger jean size, because the Lou and The cheesy Deep dish pizza is the #1 thing to eat. Once you The Lou, you never go anywhere else

I really wanted this place to be great.
Yelp hasn't disappointed me before , but this time sorry to say more recent non flattering reviews are spot on.

I don't like writing negative reviews , but I was so disappointed in the pizza .
We were two people , we ordered a thin crust buttery cheese pizza with basil.
45 minutes later still no pizza .
The place wasn't that busy . After talking to the manager he said sorry your pizza got burnt we have to make another one.
Due to our mistake-  pizza on the house .
Ok cool , that was very nice of them .

The pizza arrived . It didn't even smell like I normally smell of pizza that makes you want to just dig in.
It was bland , crust was like cardboard , tomato sauce tasted like out of a can and just really nothing special .
Even for free I barely finished one small piece , and I normally eat  3-4 pieces of pizza .
We left a tip for the waiters cause they were really nice.
But honestly the pizza just wasn't good.
It's really too bad cause the people who work there were all really nice .  
I just don't get why people think this place is so amazing .
Am I missing something here ? Or maybe it is just me ?
But a few other reviews described exactly how I felt , so it isn't just me.

Food here is good, as with any Lou Malnati's in the city.  The service, however, is lacking.  We got seated fast enough on a Sunday afternoon but it took almost 10 minutes for a server to come by to take drink orders. While I totally understand the time it takes to cook the pizza, the servers did not come by to cut our second slices and getting the check and paying the check took a long long time.  Advice to management - please have more servers or have them check in on tables more often.
Their pizza and salads are superb!!!! The thing that gets me is the price; seems a bit steep, all things considered. Still worth doing at least 1-2 times a year!

Wait time was about 45 minutes, pizza was was ok - slightly cold - didn't notify server - did not want to wait another 45 min for a pizza. Had to preorder pizza before getting the table.  Service was good, table cloths need to be replaced - so many that were torn.
Their thin crust is wonderful but if you are looking for a true Chicago deep dish this is not the place to go.

First stop for Chicago Pizza has to be at where it all started and was created.

I have seen Lou Malnati's on all the pizza food shows and always wanted to try it.

Pepperoni Deep Dish, small - $13.65 - The crust is amazing. Thick and buttery with a nice crisp. Loaded with a ton of cheese and pepperoni. The red sauce is so simple but full of flavor.

Great way to start a pizza journey.

pics.caption: You know your big when you have custom colored pizza boxes.

review.des: This place is great! Definitely a tourist trap (but not in a bad way). When you come to Chicago you HAVE to try this place at least once. The pizza is really good, traditional deep dish! If you eat it with a knife and fork, you won't get any weird looks. Make this a destination!

While visiting Chicago for work I knew that I needed to try an authentic deep dish pizza so I turned to Yelp to find recommendations near my hotel. Lou Malnati's had a number of good reviews so I made sure to add it to my list. I've never had deep dish pizza before so I have nothing to compare it to. I ordered it to go and it took about 30 minutes for my order to be ready, which I had been warned about. At first glance the pizza seemed a little small to feed one person but listen to the recommendations! It was the perfect size and maybe even more than enough for me. I'm not sure how the crust should taste so I feel that I can't adequately comment on that. The quality of the cheese seem to be of a lesser quality than what I'm used to. Most striking to me was that there is no sauce but rather crushed tomatoes over top of the cheese. Overall, I want to say that my three star review is not a reflection of Lou's  pizza but rather a reflection that my preference is not for deep dish pizza. Sorry Chicago!

This is my favorite deep dish in Chicago.  Never went to the restaurant, but ordered it many times.  The sausage crust is the best feature of course, but everything about this place is great.  The calamari is some of my favorite too.  Delicious.

This is a must visit when we are in Chicago.  Full food service at the bar if you can find a seat and the bartenders are always excellent.  Expect a 45 minute wait for deep dish.  Dont get pissy at the bartender because you didnt know that.  Get an appetizer and drink or two.  

The personal size is fairly small.  I get the small which is marked as serving two, but if you are hungry go for it.  Add extra ingredients.

Was visiting from Toronto and wanted to try Chicago's well known deep-dish pizza!

I went on an off day with my friend (Monday around 12-1pm) so it wasn't crowded at all. No line up and seated right away. The pizza does take about 30-40mins though, so if you are short on time..schedule it accordingly. We tried the Chicago classic Medium size ($20) and a penne pasta lunch special. I would skip pasta and just do pizza.  The pasta didn't have much flavour to it, just felt like I was eating pasta and cheese. For pizza, I would suggest their Classic or Sausage version (we tried sausage a few days before at a food event where Lou's was at too). Both are good!

Service was okay, decor was interesting. You can see jerseys of athletes hanging on the wall. We were in a booth that sat right below a Cubs jersey. Lol.

Restaurant is good for all ages and families.

pics.caption: Salad that came with penne pasta special

review.des:
A great place to grab some pizza! But expect to wait at least 40 minutes for a table. That was the only exception but the wait was well worth it. The bar was quite small. When we got seated, we ordered a large thin crust cheese pizza and a half cheese half sausage pizza. I have to say it was the pizza in Chicago. Especially, you are going to run the Chicago Marathon.
It's a great place to store up your energy food.
The server was quite friendly. I highly recommend this pizza restaurant while in Chicago. I give it two thumbs up! Enjoy! #SeñorFood

pics.caption: Large thin crust cheese and deep dish

review.des:
THIS IS FOR ONLINE ORDERING ONLY!!!
I have not been to this place but have heard so much about it.
I live in LA and ordered a couple pies-- something was lost on the ride out here.
I still have one in the freezer and not overly excited about it. I found the pie's small for the price and ok in flavor

"Best Layover Ever" started off here at Malnati's Pizzeria. My wife and I were seated promptly upstairs in their dining area. The place is nice and clean and the atmosphere was exactly what we were hoping for. A lot of people our age were there and grabbing a bite on this Sunday afternoon. We were glancing over the menu, taking our time...waiting...waiting...about 15 minutes went by without anyone coming to our table. Major bummer, cause I was really hungry and I thought they were better than this. Eventually after making an obvious glance at one of the waitresses, she helped us with our drink order and we eventually got our pizza order in as well.

Now for the good part! We got The Malnati Chicago Classic and it was pizza heaven. Tons of delicious gooey cheese and the crust isn't too hard and full of flavor as well. As an appetizer we got the Malnati Salad to share and it's pretty big! That might have been one of the best salads of my life though. Couple that with a local Chicago IPA and this meal turned out really good. Don't miss out on this authentic Chicago pizza!

pics.caption: One of the best salads of my life. Get it as an App!
The Malnati Chicago Classic, halfway gone because we grabbed the other half too quick!
Close up of The Malnati Chicago Classic. Yes, yes!

review.des: I came to Lou's for a first taste of deep dish pizza and was very happy with my meal! While it definitely seemed like a tourist spot, I think that it was good food for a food price. The service was excellent, and I believe that the non-alcoholic drinks had free refills. As an added bonus, it was a beautiful walk over the river from the Loop.

Was lucky enough to check this place out on a recent trip to the city.  

100% will come back the next time I visit.  This pizza is the stuff dreams are made of.  I never know how decadent pizza could be.  I want more, and I want it now!

When in Chicago, you must get deep dish pizza! Lou Malnatis did not disappoint. We got there early, around 6:30pm and didn't have to wait for a table. We did wait a little bit to get a server though. By that point we were ready to order since we knew it would take a while to get the pizza.

The 3 of us started with a family size spinach salad with chicken. The salad was good, strawberries were ripe but there was not enough of them. Also not enough chicken in my opinion. Thankfully the same was the case with the dressing, but I hate salads that are swimming in dressing. The salad would have served 4-5, so we probably should have done the regular size.

Once the pizzas (finally) arrived, we were all happy. I ordered an individual size cheese with spinach and green pepper. I ate half and was full but not stuffed. My coworkers shared a 2 person pizza which ended up being 4 slices total. They were pleased with their selection as well.

The wait is worth it.

pics.caption: Individual size pizza with spinach and green pepper. Perfect size for 1 person!

review.des: Went here because all of the hype and was let down by the overall experience. I had the butter crust deep dish with crumbled sausage and it felt like a kids pizza. Just gobs of cheese with no real flavor there sauce is good just not enough of it and the sausage was gross. Spinach bread was ok. And it took the waitress 30 minutes to refill our drinks.(that how long the pizza takes took cook). My girl got the thin crust and hers had barely any sauce and the cheese had a snap to it like it was microwaved.

Had a 55 minute wait wasn't too bad because it was  such a nice night. They told us we could order ahead of time before we were seated because pizza takes 30 minutes in the oven. We ordered early and also wanted appetizers but they said we had to wait to order when we sat down for that because they are way faster than the pizza. We're seated about 10-15 minutes after that, ordered our apps waited a good while and the pizza ended up coming before. Wouldn't have ordered the apps if we knew the pizza would come before because none of them compare to the main dish and none of us were hungry for appetizers once we had a slice down but the wait for the pizza was worth it!!! Get the buttercrust pepperoni deep dish! Soo good

pics.caption: Lou's twisted lemonade- I loved it!!! Malnati mule- I'm not a fan of ginger but my friend said it was good!

review.des: I am definitely in the minority, but I do not like this pizza. The tomatoes are overpowering. The sauce IMHO should be a backdrop to the toppings. Massive chunks of tomatoes just get in the way!

This was my first experience with deep dish pizza and it was exceptional! I loved it! My husband and I split a small Malnati Chicago Classic and it was definitely enough to share. He thought it was really good but said he has had better deep dish pizza so I will stick with 4 stars. It was definitely worth visiting!

On my first night in Chicago, my friends and I decided to get some authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. We were lucky we were staying only a couple of blocks away so it was very convenient walking to Lou Malnati's.

After a very short wait, the hostess seated us in the back of the restaurant and we ordered right away. (We were just about to pre-order our pizza when we were called to get seated. If there's a wait when you're there, just go ahead and place your order as you wait for your table since it takes awhile to bake.)

We decided to order the Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. We were starving by now and thought the 3 of us could finish a large. (Note: a large is meant for 4 people).

Now the long wait begins... it took over 45 minutes to an hour for our pizza to arrive at our table. The waitress said it was due to the size and because they wanted to make sure the sausage was cooked thoroughly. Now, the sausage is not the usual small pieces you get at your regular pizza places but large, slices of sausage. I'm not usually a fan of sausage, but their blend of sausage and seasoning sure makes this kind pretty tasty. You really do get your bang for your buck here.

I've had deep dish pizza before in California but this was amazing. The crust was delicious and the toppings were so fresh and flavorful. BUT, you really can start getting full after a slice... and we made the mistake of ordering a large. We should have opted for a medium pizza that was meant for 3 people. While we were so full from 2 slices, we were determined to finish the pizza... this came at a price though. We probably didn't want to see another pizza for awhile after stuffing ourselves with this pizza.

Lou Malnati's does offer other options besides pizza on their menu, but why come if you're not going to have the pizza? This place will definitely be on my list of places to return to whenever I make it back to Chicago.

pics.caption: Slice of the Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza
Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza
Slice of the Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza

review.des: This place is so good! I loved their fresh ingredients. We couldn't stop pocking at it!
By far my fav pizza place and best deep dish!

I tried coming here Friday night and the restaurant was packed (should've known!). We went somewhere else instead because we didn't want to wait. However, we returned on Sunday night for dinner because we were not leaving Chicago without having deep dish pizza! ;)

My friend and I got there and were seated right away. Even for a Sunday, they were pretty busy. Our food came an hour later - they tell you upfront that it will take about 45min to make the pizza. The food was was pretty good, but the wait kinda sucked :/
Great pizza.  Very busy but worth the wait.  Decor is a little dated and could use a refresh but it is really just about the pizza.

Sorry, Giordano's. I seem to like Lou's better. In the 20 years I've lived here, I've never taken the parental units to Lou's. Like me, they're not fans of deep dish and prefer thin crust. And they're usually not in the mood for pizza whenever they are in town, until their most recent visit. I made the mistake of taking them before Memorial Weekend began. Wait time is as can be expected and I shouldn't have been surprised. Plus, this location is smaller, even with the second floor. The hostess suggested ordering while we waited (25-30 min approx.) so by the time we sat down, our order would likely be ready. It's a great suggestion but doesn't always work out. Expect about the same time frame when seated. But it all worked out because my parents left satisfied. Also, a small size pizza is good enough for at least 2-3 people. I didn't think it would be, and we ended up with leftovers.

If you can't handle the stairs, mention that up front. I didn't notice an elevator, but the hostess was able to seat us on the first floor, making it easier for Mom A.

My review mostly comes from all the hype around this place.  Everyone kept saying how good this pizza was and stuff, so my girlfriend and I finally decided to pick up some deep dish pizza since we were in the neighborhood.  

The pizza was good, no complaints.  But it was just that.  To be fair, I did pick up the pizza to go, so perhaps when I go back and eat at the restaurant, my review might change.

Overall, its a place worth checking out!  Lou's is a safe choice.

Deep dish pizza is a must when you visit Chicago. My recommendations are the "Lou" or "The Classic." The crust is crispy yet the pizza is very thick which was a good contrast. The spinach cheese bread is also amazing. When ordering a salad, just be aware that a single salad could feed probably 3-4 people. The family size was huge and was good enough for our table of 12 people. The spaghetti was alright but nothing out of this world. Pizza is the way to go.

This place gets packed. Luckily, we came in just before the lunch rush. Be prepared to wait in line. Rain or shine, patrons are willing to stand out the door for their pizza.

pics.caption: One slice each of the Lou and the Classic

review.des:
True deep dish Chicago pizza is not just a meal, it's a way of life.

Okay enough for cheesy lines (see what I did there?).

We waited an hour or so around lunch time to eat inside. The pizza took a while to come once we ordered but once we got the food, it was incredible. It was some combination of anticipation and hunger and the fact that it's PIZZA, the greatest thing on the planet, that really drove the experience home. Deep dish is the best pizza hands down and my review is a reflection of that bias. We ordered the Malnati Chicago classic. I'm not one of those people who doesn't eat the crust and, to me, the butter crust was excellent, one of the best I've ever had.

Service was good. It was a busy Saturday, so for me there was no expectation of fast service or anything like that. Even so, our waiter was friendly and asked us where we were from and chatted a bit.

All in all, great experience. Better pizza. (No, this is not meant to be an ode to the Papa John's slogan).

Wow wow wow! I'm a Texan who wanted some real Chicago style pizza. It absolutely did not disappoint. The single was the perfect size for one person and I had the Chicago style. Fresh, yummy, and I will definitely be back!

Huge fan of the staff and service, but I was a bit disappointed on the pizza. As a New Yorker for the first time in Chicago this was my first stop by popular suggestion, and it was just OK. I liked Giordano's better, but my boyfriends preferred Lou's.

We especially like the crustless pizza!
And now that they've opened a New Location at Lincoln & Montrose (much closer) GREAT!

Deep dish pizza again?  After a very disappointing pizza at Giordano's, I didn't want anymore pizza for a while. Hubby wanted to try Lou's so off we went. We got there early and missed the big crowds who showed up at 7 PM.

Our server, Sara, was very nice and made sure my water glass was always filled. The tap water in Chicago tastes good, unlike Southern CA water.  She checked to make sure we were OK during the 40 mins wait for our pizza to cook.  

We started with a house salad. Plenty for 2 but can be shared by 3.  The pizza was worth the wait.  The crust was so much better. We got the Lou's Chicago which had a crispy, buttery crust ( I really couldn't taste that much butter) with sausage and delicious tomato sauce topping. The small was more than enough for us and we even had a slice to take back.  This is one of the best deep dish pizzas I've tried.  

The tables are not too closely packed together but we could clearly hear the conversations of the tables next to us. One was a daughter with her elderly mom and the other couple talking up business , possibly someone trying to get hired.  

Would recommend this place for your Derp dish pizza.

My life has changed. I didn't know all the delights of deep dish until now. The small is incredibly filling, glad they specified that it serves two. Ambiance leaves a bit to be desired but that's to be expected for its price point I suppose. Worth the visit for sure!

If your looking for the Chicago deep dish pizza this is by far the best. Went on a quest at all the places here. Unfortunately I started here so everything else was sub par and I regretted spending the calories on. This place is worth the wait and you will wait. But be patient. It's the best in town

pics.caption: Best pizza place in Chi town!

review.des: Their deep dish is good, but that thin crust is where its at. So buttery and flaky... sausage and giardiniera is the way to go.

ANY time is a good time for pizza.

what i ate:
- malnati salad: romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, salami bits, gorgonzola cheese, sweet vinaigrette, romano cheese. honestly, this salad kind of blew my mind. it hit every flavor note and texture note you could think of. sweet, tangy, salty, crunchy, savory. it was really refreshing after walking around the city on the warm spring day.
- large sausage and pepperoni deep dish: yes yes yes! the cornmeal crust was amazingly crispy. the meat was meaty. i have to admit, i ended up eating 2 slices (oink oink!) and a few bites of the very last slice. no leftovers!

pros:
- pizza!
- large location. there was plenty of room upstairs and downstairs. we came in on a busy saturday afternoon during lunch time and were seated within 5 mins.
- price was right

cons:
- service was slowish. he forgot my beer. he wasnt around when we needed the check. slow
- small bathroom, at least downstairs. it's only a single stall. we all made the trek upstairs to the larger bathroom, but by larger i meant 2 stalls.

would i come again? sure
best deep dish in the city.  fresh ingredients... twist on the crust... garlic spinach is a wonderful combo.  Fresh salads, nice delivery radius... also nice to eat in.

I came here on a Friday evening around 5 pm with one other person. We were told it would be a 25 minute wait, but we were seated about 5 minutes later. We had the option to preorder our pizzas before we were seated, since they take about 30 minutes to make. The personal size was sufficient for each of us. I got the Malnati Chicago Classic; the buttercrust was really good. The cheese and meat slid right off the crust when I cut into it, which made it kind of messy, but it was still very tasty. The service was good although we had to wait a little at first because it was already quite busy. Our server was very nice. When we left around 6 the place was unsurprisingly packed.
Delicious. My first chi town style piZza. I gave it a 4 because the menu is limited. Deep dish is where it's at. Love the cheese directly on the crust and sauce on top.

We were seated quickly which was nice considering how busy they were. The waitress was polite but entirely helpful when explaining dishes. We had personal deep dish pizzas, and they were good. The crust is interesting--not a typical dough. It is a boisterous atmosphere, so don't expect a quiet meal.

The pizza was good, I'll give you that.  I've never been one to worship at the altar of thin-crust pizza; I like a thicker crust.  So, on that score, Malnati's deep-dish was already ahead of the game -- I needed no convincing.  It was tasty, and very filling.  On food alone, they would have earned 4 stars.

The wait staff was nice.

But 40 mins from the time you place you order until they bring the pizza?  That's ridiculous.  And this was during a non-busy time on Sunday just before noon.

The night before, we had gone there for dinner -- a 40 min wait, plus pizza-making time.  Time to take out? 40 mins.  Time to deliver? 1 hr 45 mins.

The staff was up-front about it, to their credit.  But this is not some one-of-a-kind restaurant...  It's not the cronut, or tickets to Hamilton.  Sheeeesh...

In NYC, they would have figured out a way to get you your deep dish pizza in under 40 mins.  Or they would have been out of business.

So, three stars.  If you want appetizers before your pizza, this is a fine place.  Or, if you want to finish those last 80 pages of James Joyce's Ulysses in a setting in which you won't be disturbed for a while, this is fine.  But otherwise, go to Portillos and enjoy the char-grilled sausage with grilled onions...   It won't satisfy your pizza craving, but you'll be on your way to your next stop a lot more quickly.

Yummy pizza, salad and beverages we had delivered for our staff and it was hot, offer rewards for return customers and delivery service has been accurate and hot. Thin crust the most loved here with authentic sauce and all the fixin's for  a great lunch.When pizza is good it does not take a lot of words to express it. we will be back.

So we asked so many people while we were in Chicago where to go for pizza.  This was the answer or Giordona's so we landed on this one. We waited for a minute and were seated. Our server was busy but took our order.  We got our pizza and it was good. Not great but good. And I do really think it is about personal preference for sure. I personally like more sauce and a thicker sauce which this was not. The crust was good.  I would've liked a hotter(in temperature) pizza but we ate it and left. Small pizza. Two pieces per person for two of us. Might return. Might try others.
Trying to decide who has the best deep dish. This one was good, but more expensive than Pizano's and not as cheesetastic. I had it delivered and it came with everything I needed.

pics.caption: Personal size - mushroom, onions and green peppers

review.des:
The best pan pizza in Chicago!  Don't forget the butter crust when ordering..You can preorder to reduce the wait time too. I prefer the Lincolnwood location. Reasonable pricing and family friendly.
They have hosted a graduation part for us and did a phenomenal job.

Came here on my first night in Chicago. It was a Friday and the wait was so long. It was pretty frustrating because we were only 2 and we saw lots of tables outside that were empty. They were not very efficient at seating people, which for a busy popular place that has texts for when your table is ready and a way to order your pizza ahead of time you'd expect them to be on top of turning tables around. They do allow you to place your pizza order before you get your table. Then when you sit down they put it in the oven to finish cooking. I guess that helps a bit, but when you've already waited an hour for a table, another 20-30 for your pizza feels like eternity. We even ordered to go mozzarella sticks to eat while we wait. They were very average. The pizza was good, but I wasn't a fan of the sausage. The crust isn't as deep as the deep dish pies I'm used to, but it was still filling. I much prefer Pi Pizza in St. Louis as well as my own recipe.

Being new to Chicago, I asked the front desk of my hotel for a recommendation to a great Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. I was led here by the front desk representative (Shout out to him for recommending this place).

It's in middle of downtown so it was a short walk for us. At a great location and the outside patio looked amazing. We were welcomed in and they quickly got us a table. We didn't know what to get, so we were recommended the Malnati Chicago Classic Pizza and the chicken Alfredo.

Before you order the pizza they always warn you that it'll take around 40 minutes for a pizza. Even though the wait for the pizza was long, every single minute was worth it. The cheese and the flavor was just on point! My favorite part was the crust(me being a crust guy!). The bread was not burnt neither undercooked. It was just crunchy and chewy at the same time. I would recommend this place to tourists who are visiting chicago that wants to taste the classic thick deep dish pizza from Chicago!

I was super excited to try a true deep dish. So we came here based on my friends and everyone elses recommendation. Ordered the sausage. Staff super friendly even worned us it would take awhile for the pizza sat down watched some soccer and waited. The pizza looked awesome. Nice crispy toppings thick crispy crust. Then the bite. I felt like it was mostly just cheese and dough no sauce or toppings. The crust was way to buttery for me and it was stacked with grease. I really wanted to love deep dish but it's just a little to much of the dough and cheese for me. If its your thing though this place does everything else for you.

Can't believe I forgot to make a review for this place after my trip to Chicago! I must say--this place has the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. I went to three different deep dish pizza places, including this one, and I must say this one is the best. What's so memorable about this one is their amazing, crunchy crust, and I normally hate eating the crust of a pizza! The crust had a garlic-like seasoning of its own and the pizza sauce was just out of this world--it was definitely an awakening of the ilLOU-MALNATI (did they do that on purpose or it is mere coincidence?). The tomatoes were freshly chopped and oven-baked onto the deep dish pizza while the mozzarella cheese toppled all over this hearty and savory pizza pie.

We were hungry so we also ordered their spinach cheese bread--wow. The cheese oozed out of the bread and the dipping sauce contained freshly pureed tomatoes.

I guess the only minor issue is the lack of meat--the sausages specifically, but because I'm more about the sauce-kind of person, I let that slide!

This place has changed my perspectives in deep dish pizza and it's honestly a go-to when visiting Chicago
I really enjoyed their deep dish! I prefer it over Giordano's. Their crust is more on the crispier side. The marinara sauce and sausage tasted delicious!

I went to Chicago for a conference and this place was a must. Of course I had never tried deep dish and so my daughter and I stood in line for almost an hour to eat on one of their street side table, which we thought was nice to take in the city views and people watch.  It was really delicious and one huge piece filled us up right away. We did a half pepperoni and half 'Lou', which is a spinach mix, mushrooms and sliced roma tomatoes covered with blend of mozzarella, romano and cheddar cheese on garlic Buttercrust. I got the minestrone soup because we were hungry and had to wait another 30+ mins because it took longer to make our custom half and half pizza. Next time you're in Chicago you must try it out.

Delicious but heavy ! Definitely bring your stomach!  While the food was great, it takes awhile to get your food. I  came around 3pm and we ordered food at the pre order place, but it took an hour before the food finally arrived. When we asked about the status of our order, they told us " it'll arrive when it'll arrived " so that was unhelpful. Also the calamari was good but it's different - the breading is like fried chicken in feel.
Other than the slow service, the food is pretty good- if you're not used to heavy food with a good amount of carb, meat, and cheese, it may take some adjustment!

I usually love me some Lous but lately the quality has gone down. Last night I ordered from the old Irving store and my pizza was incredibly salty. The time before the pizza was cold and the taste was not up to par.... not sure what's up but hopefully they improve soon.

After just moving to Chicago, I was recommended to try a couple of other pizza spots around town. It wasn't until I was made aware of Lou's that I found out what the Chicago Pizza Fuss is all about! Do yourself a favor and go STRAIGHT TO LOU'S!!!
Pizza and beer was good. Authentic Chicago pizza makes me happy. Had the Lou pizza and was delicious.

I'm an "out of towner" and don't have anything  to compare it to; but the pizza was good. I wish I would've got a small instead of a personal; but I didn't want to be greedy.

Note for newby's...it was beyond crowded. Idk if it was the World Series or not; but the wait for 1 was about 40 mins, with an hour to cook the pizza. It was nice that I was able to put my pizza order in so that it was ready close to being seated.

Next time I'm in Chicago, I'll try another location so I can compare!

Our first pizza stop in Chicago!!! Yep holy deliciousness!! (can you tell this was my first time to Chicago?) Make sure to order the deep dish FIRST because it takes about 30-45 min to cook- in the mean time, the bruschetta was sooo good and for sure of course amongst the top 5 I've had!!! Would highly recommend not only for the food but the service was phenomenal. Will definitely be coming back next trip to Chicago

We got to the restaurant on a weekend afternoon around 5:30p and boy was that the right choice! There was no line, no wait, and our order came out within half and hour! (as rumors have it that the thick crust takes a while) Service was great and the food was even better. Our waiter offered to pour our wine for us, dished out our salad servings one by one, and offered to plate our slices of pizza to each of us. The food was hot and fresh. The deep dish was steaming hot inside and out. The crust was buttery and delicious. The thin crust was soft and chewy but still held a great flavor. I usually don't like pizza but I definitely feel like I have been left out. If only I had tried Chicago deep dish pizza earlier!! This will be a memorable place for me during my visit to the beautiful city of Chicago.  love love love*

First Chicago pizza from a place that I was told is one of the best in Chicago. Sorry but I was not impressed. Crust was a bit hard, tasty but hard. Positive: Service was good and our server was really nice, but foodwise, not worth it. If you live in L.A. or anywhere with a BJ's, it will do if you like deep dish.

pics.caption: Got the Chicago and Lou's to split with a coworker.

review.des:
Very cool place.  Waitstaff was great.  We ordered the cheese cubes for an appetizer. They were out of this world.  

We wanted to try authentic Chicago pizza so we ordered the classic with the butter crust.  It was very good.  

Its not the best pizza Ive ever had and its the only Chicago pizza place I visited so I cant compare.

The deep dish at this location was over-the-top and yet managed to be entirely forgettable. One does not simply slap a ton of red sauce onto some dough and call it a deep-dish. The other Loop location does a far better deep-dish.

Our first visit while visiting Chicago and we came hungry.  The wait for a Sunday night was 60 minutes  but I think worth the wait.   I suggest for long wait to preorder your deep dish.   We ordered a large Malnati's Chicago Classic deep dish, BuffaLou wings, spinach bread, calamari and kids spaghetti.   Enough food for my family of 5.  Food was fabulous but customer service was NOT.  Everyone seemed rushed and were quite unfriendly.  We had to track down someone to refill drinks.   Our waiter came to our table a total of 3 times; to take the rest of our order, drop the food off, and to deliver the check.
Good Chicago pizza. Better than Giordano's, but not as good as the small businesses. Pizza takes an hour to come out, so be ready for the wait. Good place to take your family from out of town.

I tried to dine in last night as I walked in everything seemed great until I went up to a host in which she kept talking to me in a rude way when I asked for the wait which I was completely fine with because I looked forward to it I then asked the process of pre ordering and she rudely said "it's exactly what it sounds like " I asked for a manger and she rudely said she'd get them when she had time I asked a young man who also worked there for the girls name he informed me her name was Jailine and since she never got me a manager I decided to write this review . With that attitude she gave us , We most definitely were not going to dine in there and as soon as I found out her name I left I hope the management team can pick better employees . WOULD NOT RECOMMEND !

I'm not a huge fan of deep dish pizza, but with it being a staple in Chicago, I definitely wanted to try one of the more popular ones.

The place was crowded, but we were seated relatively quickly. We ordered a deep dish pizza, which was quite good. It wasn't too cheesy and the tomato flavor wasn't too overpowering like other deep dishes I tried.

We also ordered a pasta dish. It wasn't bad, but definitely not a must try. If I'm ever back in Chicago, I would definitely visit again.
BEST deep-dish pizza in Chicago. Butter crust is incredible... A must. Fun atmosphere with the patio at this location.

A trip to Chicago must include at least 1 deep dish pizza, especially when its my first time in the city! After searching on yelp, Lou's seemed to have the most positive reviews out of all the contenders.

We arrived and got seated promptly. Our waitress was super friendly and help us decide on a half Lou's (vegetarian) and half Malnati classic (sausage). I've never had Chicago style deep dish so this was a great experience. I was expecting a thick bready-type crust and bottom, but instead, the deepness was filled with mostly cheese, sauce and toppings. I loved the sausage on the Malnati classic, it was like a huge sausage patty. The pizza was so good that I decided to buy a frozen one to take back to LA for my parents to try! And they loved it!

We couldn't visit Chicago--with some CA friends--without going to Lou Malnati's! Lunch time was a good time to go--not too crowded but still full of hungry hungry hippos.

We started with the Malnati salad, which was WTF the best salad I've ever had. The dressing was perfect--didn't coat the salad too much, but enough to give it a nice flavor. Easily our favorite part of the salad were the salami bits--crunchy, not chewy. I could eat that salad all day, every day. The calamari was also great; not too much breading but enough to coat the calamari to give it some crunch.

Our pizzas of choice were the Malnati Chicago Classic and the Lou. First off, the Chicago Classic was easily the best sausage pizza I've ever had. Mainly because there was sausage in every. single. bite. We liked that it was an actual layer of sausage vs chunks spread all over the place. Good call.

The Lou was delicious--nothing to write home about, but we weren't disappointed in it. We expected more from the buttercrust on both pizzas; it just didn't wow us. I'm a fan of deep dish, but our friends were more into New York style. But overall, it was a satisfying lunch for a bunch of first timers!

pics.caption: The Lou to the left, Malnati Chicago Classic to the right.

review.des: Best deep dish in Chicago. No contest.
I'll settle the debate - Lou's is the best deep dish in Chicago! A must try if you're visiting.

I took a day trip to Chicago and wanted to maximize my experience of Chicago and what better way to do that than with some deep dish pizza? I decided on Lou Malnati's due to suggestions from friends as well as raving reviews on yelp and I was not disappointed!

Arrived about 10 min before they opened on a Sunday and there were already a few people other than myself waiting to get in. Ended up ordering the spinach bread and the Malnati Chicago Classic and both were amazing! The spinach bread is a smaller sized loaf of bread filled with cheesy goodness and a little bit of spinach as well. The pizza with the butter crust is amazing as well! Took about 30 min for them to make the pizza but it was definitely worth the wait. The crust has a really nice crunch to it all around and every bite was filled with ooey gooey mozzarella goodness and Oh my, they definitely do not skimp on the sausage! Instead of bits of sausage, it seemed like they had sausage on every inch of the pie! A small pizza and the spinach bread were more than enough for two people and I would highly recommend the deep dish pizza here to anyone!

pics.caption: Lou Malnati Chicago classic deep dish - small

review.des: they make a great pizza, I am kinda in love with the sausage crust pizza. Service was great, delivery was on time. great job!

As visitors to Chicago, this seems to be one of three main pizza places that both locals and visitors enjoy visiting,  We tried two of the three and this was our least favorite of the two.  

Now we know, people's opinions vary on the deep dish pizza subject in Chicago; however, this is our opinion.  

Compared to the other place we tried (see our other review) we found this pizza to be lacking in so many departments.  

First of all, what did we enjoy?  We enjoyed the fact that you could order ahead and then pick it up.  When we arrived at 8:15PM for our pick-up order on Saturday, September 3rd the wait was over 2.5 hours.  Not only was the sidewalk blocked creating a safety hazard; however, people were ordering to go and then sitting on the sidewalk outside and eating, creating a mini camp of sorts.  It was really weird.

Anyway, we picked up our pizza (a small) for two and then took a Lyft to Navy Pier and ate there.  

We found the crust to be plain (compared to the other place we reviewed), we found that there was virtually no sauce, and we found the pizza just to be rather plain and not that great tasting.  

Again, our opinion; however, not impressed.

On my first night in Chicago, my friends and I decided to authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. We choose this spot becuase it was only a couple blocks away from our Airbnb so it was very convenient to go here and the reviews were pretty solid.

We walked in on a thursday night and got seated immediately. We decided to opt in for the Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza with Lou's lean sausage, olives, and jalapeños.

I thought the pizza was ok. Or maybe I'm just not a big fan of deep dish pizza because it's way too cheesy for me. The sausage is not the usual small pieces you get at your regular pizza places but large, slices of sausage. I'm not usually a fan of sausage, but their blend of sausage and seasoning sure makes this kind pretty tasty. You really do get your bang for your buck here.

I've had deep dish pizza before in California and I feel like they all taste the same to me. The only thing that's different was the sausages and crust wises.

I think I still prefer NYC pizza over deep dish, though. BUT you gotta at least try 1 authentic deep dish spot while you're visiting Chicago

During my first night in Chicago wanted to try Chicago style pizza and chose this s place for the high reviews.
At arrival we were welcomed promptly by the hostess and put us on the waiting list and were told we could be sat at a table or bar.
We decided to have something to drink while waiting and headed to the bar, where a stool was available. Two guys were behind the bar,  one was the bartender and one barback, assuming this since the second wasn't even looking at the guests at the bar.
We finally ordered beverages and a second spot got available at the bar. Asked hostess if we could seat there and she replies is first come first served. Lucky us, in general we prefer to eat at the counter.
Ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic and ten minutes later pizza arrived and bartender served us the first round (of pizza, of course).
As my first ever experience I thought it a was a bit could but believed it was the way it's supposed to be and didn't mentioned to my girlfriend. Few minutes later she mentioned to learn we were having and below serving temperature pizza, with firm cheese.
The stuff behind the bar were too busy to even ask how was everything, and it wasn't until we finished our meal that the bartender asked us if we wanted another drink...

OVERALL: Friday's are busy and if you focus in quantity over quality you're not doing things right.
My first dinner ever in Chicago in a place a chose and trying a "classic" dish was bittersweet, lacking the sweet.

pics.caption: The Malnati Chicago Classic (or its almost-cold version).

review.des:
I was so excited to try the infamous Chicago Pizza.
We ordered the stuffed spinach bread which was good. We got the Chicago deep dish pizza. Truthfully, I was a bit disappointed with it.. The pizza is not as thick as I thought. The cheese is a bit weird, but service was good.

Chicago is the best place in the world for pizza.  I have several "favorites" but Lou Malnati's is at the top of my list.  I truly think that it is a matter of preference at this level but I am always interested in a Lou's.  They have a unique blend of spices in their sauce which is always plentiful (how I like it).  They  don't skimp on the cheese (how  I like it) and I love their sausage.  I am also a big fan of their pepperoni --- YUM.  I usually get ttheir deep dish.  However, one of my favorite pizza's is a thin crust, half pepperoni and spinach and garlic.  
Finally, if you want something other than pizza, they have a great menu.  I especially like their Malnati's Salad.

Classic Chicago deep dish.  The Malnati salad is the best salad in town, both in the restaurant and take out / deliver.   My favorite is the Malnati Chicago Classic.  My wife is gluten intolerance and her choice The Crustless Pizza.  

No bad options here.

Same quality at locations around city.

Malnati's is only the second deep dish we've had in Chicago, the being Uno. However, after our visit to the Wells St location, we see no need to go anywhere else. We chose to sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table, and the bartender was very attentive. My wife had not been a fan of deep dish, but that quickly changed after we had "The Lou" specialty pizza with pepperoni. Just the right balance of cheese, sauce, and ingredients, and the crust was perfect, not too thick. A small was enough for both of us. Just right. We will be back!

After living in Chicago for four years, today I finally had my first slice of deep-dish Malnati's. One of the managers at my office ordered in several pies for a lunch meeting. Such anticipation! I expected something sublime after hearing people gush about the place. So I took my first bite, and...bleh. What a huge disappointment. First of all, it seemed like it was only half-cooked. I like my pizza sizzling, with big beautiful crusty bubbles of cheese, and this pie was mushy and covered with very wet, sloppy tomatoes. Second, it was so bland; it badly needed salt, and some oregano and basil wouldn't have hurt either. Third, one slice seemed like a pound of food; it was way too heavy and sodden.

So next I tried the thin-crust plain cheese. I liked that even less. It was tasteless! One of our out-of-town attendees asked me if I could get the salt shaker out of the kitchen, and he was right. The crust is completely tasteless. Blech.

Pizza is a very personal thing; just because I didn't like this doesn't mean you won't. It's worth a try. But for me, if I never eat another piece of Malnati's, that's just fine with me. In the Giordano's/Malnati's face-off, put me on the Giordano's team. On the plus side, the delivery person was very nice!

Over the years there has been a TON of hype about Chicago style deep dish pizza. My family along with myself got together and went on a family reunion slash vacation to Chicago. One of the things that excited is the most was trying true deep-dish pizza. Honestly we were and are truly disappointed about what was put in front of us. The canned tomato sauce that was on top of a artificially butter flavored limp crust was watery and the whole thing lacked any depth of flavor. It was a true letdown. However while at this place we discovered the classic chopped salad. It was to die for! That salad is the only reason that this is above a one star review. We had a similar experience at giordanos--great salad terrible pizza!!!

Came here for lunch because it was recommended by folks back home. I liked the decor and the prices. The lunch special was 8.95 and includes a soup or salad, a personal pie and a drink. The food was good but not the best pie I had while in town. And it still took 45 min. So it was nice to have a fresh pizza.

Its ok. I think the crust is too brittle and I have only had the sausage pizza. But the sausage that is a flat circle on top of the dough, so it covers the entire pizza, is a good idea, but too much for me. We tried the sausage with bits of sausage spread around the pizza,  and it was way too sparse. We took it back it was so sparse. So.... happy medium?

Came with a friend who was visiting Chicago for the first time. We had decided our first night would be classic Chicago Pizza. I have my own favorite, but ended up trying this based on the hotel concierge's recommendation. Long story short, I don't like to give 1-Star reviews. And this is not based on the food because I did not ever get a chance to eat it. Arrived and put our name in and there was a 35 minute wait. No problem and no worries. Certainly not a surprise. Pre-ordered the pizza at the counter as instructed. Seems logical. Got our table. Then waited and waited. We waited for over an hour. Tables all around us who had arrived and had not pre-ordered a pizza were happily eating. Our waitress, who was lovely, kept giving us the same excuse that there was some problem with our particular pizza and that she was working on it. Finally got up and left and tried a more efficient place for dinner. Look forward to returning to my favorite pizzeria tomorrow.
Some of the best pizza in Chicago. Try the "big Lou" not many people get it. Or even the thin crust with sausage and a side of ranch. Promise both will blow you away.

I'm really struggling to know how to review this place - I mean it was actually a pretty good experience and our waitress was super friendly, but I think deep dish pizza is something I'll stick to as more of a novelty as opposed to my normal day to day pizza routine...

Really packed, I tried to get in on the Saturday night and no joy so we headed back on a Sunday afternoon and only took 5 mins to wait and grab a table in the back.

The beer selection was ok and the personal pizza was tasty enough - but so much crust, felt pretty buttery (my poor heart...) and crumbly as hell.

If you're a deep pan fan then go here no doubt, but thin crust will always be the winner for me.

pics.caption: Personal pizza for one - not bad to try, think I'll be sticking to thin crust in future though

review.des: Caveat: this is from the perspective of a tourist. If you don't call ahead, be prepared to wait about 30-40 minutes for your pizza, but it's well worth the wait. I had a house salad which was fine, but nothing special, but the sausage deep-dish pizza was amazing! Decent prices, and the service was good.

My first deep dish pizza in Chicago was about 2 years ago. I thought it was just alright, but I felt obligated to give deep dish another try since I'm back in Chicago. We came in on Wednesday night around 9 pm and we were quoted for a 30 minute wait. Since we were rather tired after a long day of sightseeing plus all the positive reviews on Yelp, we decided we would just wait here than go to a different place.
We put in our order while we were waiting to be seated. It is recommended to do so because it takes a while to bake the deep dish pizzas. We ended up ordering two personal size pizza to share - the Lou and the Malanti. We also got a house salad to share.

We actually got seated in about 15 minutes rather than half an hour. Our salad came first. I ordered it with dressing on the side, but when the salad came the dressing was no where to be seen. We were sitting in the corer by the window so it was hard to flag down a waiter to get dressing. However once we got to our waiter, he brought us the dressing soon after. Even though we preordered the pizza, we still waited for a some time for them. It's just the nature of the dish, so I would definitely recommend preordering the pizza.

Neither my sister nor I are fan of deep dish pizza after our meal. We definitely prefer thin crust. I never thought I would say no to extra bread. However, the pizza crust isn't very flavorful, so the extra crust makes the pizza rather bland. To me the cheese, sauce, crust ratio is off for deep dish pizza. Too much dough!! I'm still not a fan of deep dish and I think my next trip back I won't be going out of my way to try deep dish pizza.

The best  Chicago style pizza available, from my perspective. Awesome tomato suace and highly recommend the sausage Pizza. As they have many locations - be careful to choose the right one so ss ro not wait too long in a long line

After viewing all the competition for best deep dish pizza in Chicago, my girlfriend and I decide to try Lou Malnati's. We went here on a Wednesday night around 6pm, so it wasn't too crowded. However, around 7pm, all the booths and tables were filled, so try to get here early if you can. The booths are extremely comfortable and the service at Lou Malnati's is quite good because the waiters are attentive and even slice the deep dish pizza for you. The GF and I ordered a medium sized Malnati Chicago Classic and the chocolate chip pizza for dessert. In regards to the deep dish pizza, the Malnati Chicago Classic was amazing, it came loaded with sausage and the crust was out of this world. The cheese was well melted and extremely flavorful. Initially, the medium size pizza looked too small for us, but after consuming that beast, it was a total hunger buster! My only complaint about the deep dish pizza at Lou Malanti's is that it is a bit oily (also the 30 minute wait for the pizza to be freshly prepared), but other than that this deep dish pizza was out of this world and I would come back to Chicago just to eat here again. Lastly, the dessert was also pretty good, we got the larger portion of the chocolate chip pizza and it was loaded with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. I would tell them to go easy on the whipped cream because it was an overload. However, the chocolate chip portion was warm and soft, which complemented the ice cream very well. Overall, I highly recommend trying Lou Malnati's if you want some high quality deep dish pizza at an affordable price.

pics.caption: Medium size Malnati Chicago Classic. Highly recommend getting this deep dish pizza!
Chocolate chip pizza. A bit too much whipped cream, but still amazing!

review.des: Went there with my wife on Black Friday for lunch...the place was jam packed with long waiting lines, but they got us in in less than 25 mins. The place from the inside was classic, the service was very good and the waiting time they gave us to be seated and get our pizza was accurate. Deep dish pizza takes about 40 mins to get ready. We had the veggie deep dish and we both loved it. Their dough was excellent and had a significant taste to it compared to other deep dishes I've had in Chicago and other places, which is why I gave them 5 stars. I'll be visiting this place whenever I'm in Chicago.
Not my favorite deep dish in Chicago. Lacked garlic. Perhaps next time we will add some extra. Fast take out, and pleasant counter staff.

Good service and good food every single time. I've been here twice, once for pick up and once with a party of 6. We were happy every time. Reason for the 4 stars is the ambiance can be a bit cramped. I was not as comfortable as I would be at a different Lou's location. Other than that, highly recommended you're in River North.

Our son and daughter-in-law highly recommended this restaurant as we were in for several days visiting Chicago. They previously lived in Chicago. So this past Sunday evening, July 8th, my husband and I, along with another couple, went to the Wells St. location at 7 pm. The hostess told us it would be a 20 minute wait. Turned out to be 35 minutes. The worst part of the evening turned out to be the waiter. He was rude and disinterested. My husband and I ordered a medium pizza. The other couple ordered a pan pizza and one chicken marsala. The chicken marsala was brought to our friend (the husband) long before the rest of us received our food. In fact, our friend finished the chicken marsala way before we received our food. Approximately 20 - 25 minutes after he got his meal, we got our food. Several of us had asked the waiter why he would bring out the marsala way before the rest of the food. His response? "The pizza takes longer to make." He also said he didn't realize we all wanted to eat together. SERIOUSLY!! We asked him several times to check on the pizzas. Each time he said he would but he never came back to the table to tell us the status- not once!! He never refilled our waters. Our pizzas were very good- the chicken marsala contained tough chicken and was presented in an odd way. One of the worst dining experiences we have ever encountered.
We arrived on a Friday at 1:30pm and there is no line. Service is great. If you are used to a doughy pizza, this is not the place for you. Their crust are crispy, a little too stiff for my liking.

Best pizzeria if your looking for something quick to eat. Amazing prices for such a good quantity of good quality of food. Food comes out really quick, within 10 minutes; and the deep dish pizza coming around at a later time. Service is cool, everyone is really peaceful and nice to you if you ask any questions about their food. Overall, I would 100% recommend this restaurant for a quick and easy place to eat or to hang out with your friends and crack a cold one with the boys ;)

My friend won a gift card to Lou Malnati's and so we stopped in to the carry-out location on Damen. We walked it home, and then made a salad so it was just a touch cold when we finally sat down to eat. Definitely need to eat it hot! It was good, but not OMG my mind is blown good. Just typical Chicago-style deep dish. I've been eating left-overs the past couple of days and it's not any better the day after.

The girl who checked us out at the front desk was very sweet and had our order ready to go right away. If you need to get something fast to feed a crowd, this is a good way to do it!
Best deep dish pizza I've ever had. Not usually a big fan of deep dish, but it was as good as the fresh ingredients on top of the pie. My Pizza soul may have been converted.

I usually don't crave deep dish pizza but recommended it to my friends to try it due to the high ratings on Yelp. We ordered the The Malnati Chicago Classic. I have to say that the amount of sauce, cheese and sausage was perfect. All the ingredients balanced each other well and didn't overwhelm each other. I'm also a big fan of sausage and glad that Lou Malnati's was very generous with the amount of sausage that was on the deep dish.

It's been a few years since I've been to Gino's and Giordano's but I appreciated that Lou Malnati allows you to put an order in while you wait to be seated. It definitely made the wait less longer since we already waited about half an hour for a spot during a mid-Saturday afternoon. I'd definitely recommend and return to Lou Malnati's!
Best pizza in Chicago! I know it's a chain but it's so good. Between the buttery crust and chunky sauce. Get the Malnati classic with the sausage patty. You won't regret it.

Keep in mind I am not a fan of deep dish pizza.

WAIT: I called around 6:30 pm and asked how long the wait was for 7 people and they said 30 minutes.  We come back around 8:00 pm and find that the wait has tripled to being 1 hour and 45 minutes! You give them your phone number and they add you to an app that tells you what your number is in line.  Since the wait was too long we decided to get the pizza to go and eat at our hotel.

ORDER AHEAD: Most people tell you that you should order your pizza ahead of time.  What this means is if you are waiting for an hour, you should order your pizza at the kiosk next to the check in area 30 minutes beforehand so when you sit down the pizza will be ready.  The pizza itself takes about 30 minutes to bake so plan ahead! Unfortunately, you cannot call ahead and order but you have to be physically present.  

For take out, they tell you to check back in 30 minutes to see if your pizza is ready.  If you're in a rush go earlier to see if it's ready because most likely it is.

FOOD: The large has 8 slices while the medium has 6 slices.  Each person ate about 1 1/2 slices so plan accordingly.  

Chicago Classic - This has cheese, tomato sauce and sausage.  For being the meat pizza it actually was the one with the least amount of flavor.  The "buttery" crust was a little hard on the bottom and not as crispy on the edges.  Definitely need a knife and fork for this one.  They didn't overdo it on the cheese, which was good and it also wasn't overly saucy.  This of course could be because we took it to go and ate it when it was slightly warm but still.

The Lou - all vegetarian, but very flavorful! I actually like this one better than the classic.  The crust was a little softer too.

Malnati Salad - the dressing was a slightly sweet balsamic with fresh ingredients (the family size fed all 7 of us), mushrooms, peppers etc. I would recommend this to help cut through the grease of the pizza.

Overall, probably worth trying once for chicago deep dish style pizza but still didn't blow me away.

Okay,  I'm a huge Chicago pizza lover and  sorry, the pizza here was disappointing. The dough was very hard and what happened to the sausage patty that covers the entire pizza? The staff was unconcerned about customer service and the place needed cleaning. Maybe it's the location or the time we visit but, I want visit this location again.. Disappointing and the only reason 3 stars because I know they typically has good food and service.

As expected, there was a long line of wait. We got seated pretty quickly since there are only 2 of us and early in the evening (5:30pm) The pizza was good but it wasn't as pipping hot as other tables..I think my pizza was sitting around for a while. Overall, I definitely think peaquod pizza is better.
Excellent pizza! Ordered it through their site and got it next day packed well in dry ice.  They are personal pan size pizzas and taste very good.  Highly recommended.

I was in Chicago only for a week but Lou's was so perfect I returned three times.
