The butter crust is to die for and the cheese to sauce ratio is perfect.  Lou's is an absolute Chicago Pizza staple for visitors and residents. Quite frankly the best pizza I've ever had in my entire life. You will not be disappointed that is a promise.
Best deep dish pizza period, the sausage CHICAGO Mankato classic with butter crust is always the way to go

Trendy spot with decent service.  The pizza tasted yeasty and undercooked.  The outer crust was amazing and buttery.  The meats and sauce were delicious.

The appetizers were average.  It's fine for out of towners I suppose.  Our waiter was on the ball and we enjoyed our stay.  

Frankly,  it was a let down given the hype.

Probably the best pizza I've ever had outside of New York.

I ordered pick up since I heard it's hard to get a seat. When I arrived to pick up the wait was 45 minutes long.

I ordered a deep dish The Lou--never had anything quite like it. There's so much to this pizza you shouldn't carry a conversation. Just try to figure it out and you'll have an extremely good time!

I ordered a large because I got greedy. I couldn't even finish half of it and I'm 207 lbs. A large itself weighs like 3 lbs!

I'm hungry just reviewing this. Would be a very frequent customer if I lived in Chicago. To open one in Shanghai would be very smart.

Overall experience: 4.7/5

pics.caption: The Lou, visual of its deep dish
The Lou in all its beauty

review.des: Take your time with this place. Great pizza doesn't miraculously happen in 10 minutes. You can go to pizza hut for that! This pizza is so yummy and gives you the Chicago deep dish pizza experience you have been looking for. The sauce is fresh and full of flavor. The sausage is tender and flavorful, and the cheese!!! The crust is buttery and nice and thick. The service is also very friendly and the energy of the place is great for tourist and locals alike.

My family of four shared two small deep dish pizzas - "The Lou" (vegetarian) and a cheese.  Both were excellent and we were all full without any leftovers.  I especially like The Lou after I jazzed it up with some parmesan and red pepper.  The restaurant was visually interesting with all of its historical and industrial decor.

Probably the best pizza I have ever had!! I am from LA and my God Lou Malnati's isthe best. My buddy and I took a trip to Chicago recently and Lou Malnati's was on our list. We tried it on our second night being in the city. It was our second time trying Chicago deep dish and this was the best we had. We liked the whole concept of ordering when you get to the restaurant and having your order ready when you take a seat. The wait was definitely worth it!! The cheese on the pizza was probably the greatest cheese a pizza can have. If youre headed to Chicago, Lou Malnati's is a must try!!
Great pizza.  I thought I wouldn't like the deep dish being Chicago is a pizza hub but it was pretty good.
Disappointed. The vegetarian pizza was better than the house pizza.... appetizer disappointingly sad.... in  Chicago on business, expected better quality food.

This is it. You want deep dish, you go to Malnati's. As a semi-native (I left the Midwest young, but visited often), Lou Malnati's was always my #1.

They ferment their dough for a bit so it takes on a sourdough flavor, which I love! I personally always go for the classic, which has a layer of sausage along with the hearty helping of cheese and sauce. The Lou is great too with cheddar, tomatoes slices, sauce and more mozz. But really? Just order the classic. You'll be satisfied.

I've gotten takeout here and also have eaten in. It's often packed so be prepared for a wait. I came with my boyfriend one year and we chose to just sit at the bar, which only adds to the experience. Pizza must be enjoyed with a beer.

Either way this place is history. You have to go and try it. One must learn to love deep dish pizza. It also should be eaten with a fork and knife. That's just how it is.

I loved the pizza here!  I got the deep dish pizza with jalapeños on it and it was so good!  We got in fairly quickly even though there was a wait.  Our waitress was very sweet and more than happy to help.  I would definitely go again the next time I'm in town.  If you love deep dish pizza, this is the place to go!

I wanted to love it.  I had so much hope for Lou Malnati's.  Ultimately, however, I have come to conclusion that it might not even be deep dish.

I'm no expert.  In fact, this was my first EVER experience with deep dish, which is why I'm so disappointed that it was bad.  We read every review and weighed about 5 different pizza places, ultimately narrowing it down to Lou Malnati's and Giordano's.  We picked Lou's because everyone said to.  We called up friends who are from Chicago, we read reviews that said that Chicago natives all seem to prefer Lou's.

The crust was crunchy, not soft at all, anywhere, and a little bit mealy.  (This was the butter crust, ordered "just right").  It also tasted somewhat of baking soda--it had that off, objectionable taste I get when I try, and fail, to make homemade dough.  Despite the fact that we ordered extra sauce, what we got was basically nothing (and I'm not suggesting they forgot).  It tasted of nothing but stewed tomatoes--no flavor or seasoning almost at all!  The cheese was good, although there was too much of it in relation to the sauce.

Worst of all, the entire pie altogether was only about an inch thick at most.  If that's what deep dish is, I suspect I prefer New England greek-style pizza--but I'm holding out hope for a better future, when I'll come back to Chicago and order Giordano's or something.
the pizza was pretty good but being from new york i'm preeeettyyyy biased and particular about my pizza

My sister, who's a local, got me into Lou Malnati's so when we recently traveled with some friends who were new to Chicago, we had to bring them here.  I heard this location was popular so we ended up coming after 8PM on a Thursday.  Wait time was about 40 minutes so it wasn't too bad.  At least you can put in your pizza order while you wait.

For the 4 of us, we ordered a medium Sausage & Mushroom Deep Dish with a butter crust, Lou's Bruschetta, and a family size Malnati salad.  Wait time for the food was a little longer than expected.  

When the salad came, it was a lot bigger than what we expected.  I wish our server would have informed us that it would be too much as that was enough for 8-10 people!  We ate as much as we can, but most of it unfortunately, went to waste.  The bruschetta was pretty good.  Nothing fancy, but still tasty.  

The pizza was definitely worth the wait.  It was delicious!   I had one slice and it was just right. I wasn't stuffed like the last time I came.  Last time, I had the Malnati Chicago Classic so the pizza was caked in sauce and cheese which was heavy and overwhelming, but this one was just right so I highly recommend ordering the Sausage Deep Dish.

Even leftovers a couple days later was still good.  I will definitely come back again when I'm in town!

We got the Lou. This is the first time I've had Lou's in about 15 years. I wanted to double check my latest opinion that Giordano's was better. Last time when I had Lou Malnati's the group ordered sausage and I wasn't a fan of the huge patty of sausage on the pizza. A bit too much for me. This time getting the Lou, which is all veggies I enjoyed it much more.
So, I think it comes down to this for me... Giordano's has thicker cheese and thicker and softer crust. If you like less cheese you'll probably prefer Lou's if you like lots of cheese you'll probably like Giordano's better. In my experience, Giordano's also has more sauce on their pizza...so if you love or hate sauce, that could make a difference too.

Being a New York/Jersey native, I'm used to that classic style thin crust pizza. If there's one thing that always brings a smile to my face, it's a slice of delicious pizza. So when I heard about deep dish pizza, I kind of cringed at the thought of mountains of bread and cheese on a pizza. Until I came to Lou Malnati's.

Grabbed a seat at the bar and got the run down from the bartender on how they concoct this child size pizza. You can either have a pre-made pizza which is ready in about 10 minutes, or have a pizza made from scratch. I went for a small pepperoni deep dish made from scratch, which takes 35 minutes to make...

What came out after 35 minutes changed my view on pizza forever. From the first slice, which is cut and served to you by the bartender, I was taken to a happy place. The best part of this pizza is hands down, the sauce. There's an abundance of it and it taste as if someone spent hours putting it together. It's about as perfect of pizza sauce as you can get.

There is a massive amount of cheese and bread, causing most human beings not to be able to finish a small pie. I was able to get through three out of the four slices. But those three slices were absolute perfection. Everything mixed perfectly. And just when you think it can't any better, you get to the crust, which is crispy buttery goodness that is seriously almost as good as the pizza. I'm not a crust guy at all, but this crust is amazing.

Not much else to say here. I now understand the hype around deep dish pizza, and I've seen the light. I also understand why Chicago locals vote Lou Malnati's as the best deep dish pizza in the city, because frankly, I can't imagine it getting much better than this.

This place was highly recommended for deep dish pizza. It takes 40-45 mins to make so we started with the bruschetta appetizer, which was quite good - fresh cut tomatoes and basil on garlic bread. We had the Chicago classic deep dish with tomato, sausage and the butter crust but we were a bit disappointed....the tomato sauce and sausage was good, but there was so much thick cheese...not melted soft cheese but very thick mozza which I found difficult to eat. It wasn't bad but not mind blowing and maybe my expectations were too high. Overall there was good service and free wifi.
Great place to take the inlaws when they come in from out of town. Food is always good and it gives them the "authentic" chicago style they are looking for.

I placed an order from their Taste of Chicago menu for my family as Christmas gifts. I placed an order online for two of there 6 packs of Pizzas, and then added an extra 2 pack. Making it a total of 14 Pizzas to give to my family and friends who are all from Chicago, now living in South Florida. After placing the order online I found it strange that I had not received a confirmation email. So a few days had passed and I was concerned. I then called Lou Malnati's to confirm that my order was placed. The woman I spoke with said she did not have an order for me in the system. I immediately panicked as I was concerned if I replaced the order, they would not be shipped out in time for Christmas Day. I asked if I could place the order with her over the phone and she said yes, and that they would make it in time. I went ahead and placed the same exact order I thought I had previously placed online. A few days later I received confirmation that my order had shipped. I anxiously awaited it. A few days later I received the order, but then realized I had not received the complimentary cheesecakes that I was supposed to receive for ordering so many pies. I noticed that I had an email with another tracking number from Lou Malnati's which I figured must be for the cheesecakes. When I looked at my bank account I saw that I had been charged twice. Each order was over $280. So, I called Lou Malnati's again, and they told me that I should only be charged once because they only had one order for me and that it was probably just my bank. I waited to see if it was a bank error and would clear. Sure enough, the charges were removed the next day. The following day I received the order of what I thought would be just the cheesecakes. My bank account was once again showing cleared transactions for TWO orders. What I received was a whole other order of the same stuff plus the cheesecakes. I contacted Lou Malnatis AGAIN, spoke to the SAME representative AGAIN, and she told me that nothing could be done.  She said that because the order shipped that I had to pay for them. I couldn't ship them back because they would spoil. I explained that I had spoken to her several times before and that she was the one that told me she didn't have the first order from me, which is why I placed the second order over the phone. She apologized, and her consolation to me was to send me a $50 merchandise credit.

I now have 28 pizzas, I have been charged over $560 to my bank account, and I have a $50 merchandise credit that has to be used within 48 hours, and nothing on their site is equal to $50. The only reason I am rating them 2 stars is because I really do love Lou Malnati's pizza, but customer service needs some SERIOUS help!

** Update: I received a message here on yelp (See reply below to my review) from a manager at Lou Malnatis, in regards to my situation and this review, to fill out a survey and that I'd be contacted by the management team, in regards to the issue we had. I filled it out and completed the entire survey/ questionnaire, and that was almost a month ago. No one has contacted me, nothing has been done. It almost seems as if the reply on here was a way of them covering for my terrible experience and trying to appease only as a facade for anyone reading my review. Therefore, I stand by my previous claim that customer service needs some SERIOUS help! It's not right that companies with high volume of sales can get away with things like this and be unscathed by rightfully unhappy customers.**

Um I'm not really a fan it's fine for a last minute go to place because they are open later than normal places but I've had better deep dish and better service for sure . Would recommend going on a weeknight the servers are more friendly than on the weekends .

Amazing!  Crust was buttery and crispy.  Toppings were spot on.  Sauce was vibrant and fresh.  Ingredients were outstanding!  Could not get enough of it.  Service was fantastic but lacked the ambiance of Uno.  Easily the best we had in Chicago. If you're only going to do one deep dish place. This is it! Just keep in mind the sauce is not pizza sauce, just the freshest tomato sauce you will try.   Sausage flavor is truly unique.  We will continue to orders their pizza delivered to Oregon forever!

Classic Chicago deep dish. I'm not from Chicago and had never been before, so I figured I had to try this classic famous chain. It was okay. May be that I'm just not that in to deep dish in general, but the pizza was very saucy and cheese was kind of hard and not melty. Would probably try another place for deep dish next time.

pics.caption: The Lou personal pizza with spinach, mushroom, and tomatoes

review.des: The pizza was outstanding and the salad as well. The atmosphere was great.  One of the best Chicago style pizza in town highly recommend it. A bit pricey but the pizza is well worth it.

Lou's is my favorite deep dish in the city. I know Todd and Brian don't like it but that's okay with me. Also, let's be honest, Todd doesn't even like the Beatles! So I'm not sure what to think about him. I know what I think about Lou Malnati's pizza, it's a 10/10. I love the sausage and pepperoni deep dish.

Lou's is , in my opinion, the BEST pizza hands down. Some may differ.. but growing up in Wilmette, Lou's has always been the #1 choice in our family. The lake location in Wilmette seems to have the most consistently awesome za. However, i reside in river north now so i frequent the Wells street location.   It tends to be hit or miss with this store. Not sure why. Sometimes I'll get a za to DIE for. And others.. meh, not so much. It's always good but when they get it on point, it'll knock your socks off. I am a deep dish cheese and spinach girl. Sometimes I'll get crazy and order sausage also. But i am usually return back to my old faithful, cheese & spinach. The thin is pretty good too.

This review is a joint rating of the 5 people in our group. All 5 gave it the full 5 stars. Lasagna, Penne Ala Manalti, bruschetta, deep dish lou classic with pepperoni and cooked well done. We all shared and we all loved everything. I highly recommend!

The marinara sauce is to die for :)

pics.caption: Take home box of our medium deep dish lou classic with pepperoni and cooked well done.

review.des: Best deep dish in the city. Yeah, the prices are a little high but their deep dish pepperoni is worth it

I've been meaning to write this review.

I did it. I FINALLY had authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. Only took me all of my life. And let me just say, I am a fan.

Order an appetizer, as the wait for the pizza is a little long, but so worth it. Loved the sausage deep dish here. It's a lot of food, so maybe go with a big group and order a few different ones so there can be more of a sampler.

So so disappointed. I really wanted to love this place, and deep dish pizza in general. There was a long line out the front and inside for a table on. Saturday evening. We were told the wait would be 45 mins but it was only about 20 before we were seated upstairs. We order a Malnati special pizza (medium) which is suited for 3 people according to the menu.

When the pizza finally came out it was lukewarm. We ate a slice each while discussing if we just plough through eating room temp pizza or whether we send it back to be warmed up. We asked our server to have it warmed up in the oven. It came back 10 mins later lukewarm again. Arg!! We asked our server whether deep dish was usually served at room temp and she apologised and replied that no, it should be piping hot. She bagged the remaining pizza for us and told us we would not have to pay since our meal had been so disappointing. Such a shame. Oh well, back to flat Neapolitan style pizzas I guess. Wood fired and always great.
Excellent deep dish pizza. One of my best pizza experiences ever. We tasted the Lou and the malnati pizzas. Both were amazing. Can't sleep now because I over ate!

It was our first time in Chicago and we had to try the deep dish pizza. We waited for an hour on a Saturday evening and pre-ordered our pizzas. We ordered the personal size Malnati Chicago Classic (for the husband) and the small "Lou" pizza (for us to share).

My husband really liked the Malnati since there was a lot of sausage pressed in the pizza. He said that the sausage did not have fat in it either.

I liked the Lou as it was a vegetarian pizza with spinach, mushroom, and tomatoes. The pizza was heavy on the cheese with mozzarella, romano, and cheddar. The deep dish crust was thinner than I expected, but the overall flavors were delicious.

Service could have been better since it took a while for our waitress to welcome us when we sat down at our table.

I wish the restaurant had more bathrooms. There was one women stall for the first level of the restaurant.

It's all about the first today, first visit to Chicago, first day here, so first things first, we hit Lou's for their deep dish pizza!  Did not disappoint!  First, we enjoyed a couple of drinks at the bar, strong drinks and friendly bartender.

Moved on to a table for 2.  First things first, ordered a bottle of Pinot Grigio from Italy to enjoy while we wait for our food order.   Fried calamari came out hot and crunchy served with a side of marinara sauce.  We ordered the Lou's special, 3 kinds of cheese, Roma tomatoes and mushrooms (all the basics we love) and added anchovies.  It comes with a butter crust and boy was it yummilicious!!!!  I loved it!  Pizza had the right amount of sauce (I like my pizza saucy) and loaded with cheese and tomatoes.  LOVED the butter crust, so light and crispy!  

Our waitress was very attentive and friendly!  Great service and great food, would definitely come back!

pics.caption: Delicious Lou's special!!  3 kinds of cheese, mushrooms and Roma tomatoes.  Must add anchovies!
Husband ordered their house minestrone soup.
Fried calamari came out hot and crunchy

review.des: They hang up on you when you call to place an order; go elsewhere! When you call back, they are unapologetic. Don't waste your time. Go elsewhere!

YUM!
In town for a girls weekend and of course we needed to get some deep dish pizza!
Went to Lou Malnati's and it was great! The pizza takes about 40 minutes to cook so order as soon as you sit down! Certainly worth the wait, we upgraded to their crispy butter crust and it was delish! I would certainly visit again!

When in Chicago, you deep dish. In all my years visiting Chicago, I had never been to Lou's (I was told I can call by nickname that now that I've been). I always stick to what I like, which is Gino's, but I stepped outside the box during my last visit. I thought the feel of the restaurant and menu were very similar to Gino's, but I never thought the pizza would taste so different! In comparing the two, I thought Gino's was saucier and had a better crust, whereas Lou's was cheesier (fine by me) and didn't have as flavorful of a crust.

Even though we were 6 starving girls, we probably would've been okay with one medium pizza (we ordered one medium pepperoni and one medium cheese due to the menu per person recommendation). But, the extra food just meant leftovers, which I had no problem taking ownership of...
Don't waste your time. It's easily the worst deep dish in Chicago. If you want good and authentic, I'd go to Pequods.
Not what i had expected it would be. Thick crust with loads of cheese. Not sure anything else after that and was wishing there was something more i could say about it.

When I booked my trip to Chicago I knew I had to try some deep dish pizza. After reading up on different locations of establishments claiming to have Chicago's Best Deep Dish Pizza I settled on choosing Lou Malnati's and I am so happy I did.

We were greeted by our waitress Laura from the minute we walked in and asked us if we were first timers. I assume being such a popular establishment that is usually the first question to ask. Laura explained the menu to us and even added on an informative tip of it taking 30 minutes for the pizza to be made. With that in mind we started off with ordering the garlic bread for an app. Garlic bread was delicious. It was perfectly drizzled with just the right amount of garlic and olive oil. Good choice.

Now the deep dish pizza. I must say I am bias towards my NY style pizza and still prefer getting a slice versus a personal pie. However this deep dish pizza did not disappoint. The crust was extremely fluffy and soft and included the right amount of sauce and cheese. The pizza came straight out of the oven so it was nice and hot. After the second slice I was completely stuffed and satisfied.

If you're looking to try a Chicago style pizza I would go to Lou Malnati's!

pics.caption: World famous Chicago-style deep dish pizza

review.des: The pizza at this restaurant was nothing short of delicious. We ordered the small pizza for two people to share and it was more than enough. We could not find room to finish it all. The waitstaff was super friendly and helpful. I'm glad that we went here, it did not disappoint!

overall amazing deep dish pizza... but you have to take into account that waiting time around 30-40 min so better to order some appetizers as well!!!
Lou pizza with spinach and mushroom was soooo delicious!!! we also ordered three type of dessert but it was or not so good, or probably just too much...

pics.caption: delicious as well but really too much

review.des: Best deep dish I've had. Service is cool and pizza is worth the wait. Must-stop when in Chicago!

We were recommended to try this place by a friend. I had never had deep dish pizza before and was very eager to try it. We came on a Thursday evening and the place was packed. However the hostesses were very service minded and they had a great system for writing down your number and text you when your table was ready. We waited in the bar and was seated within 30 min. We ordered one deep dish pizza with pepperoni and one with sausage. It was good but nothing amazing or impressive. I will stick to my thin pizzas.

You know you have arrived at a tourist place when there are suitcases by the waiting area of the restaurant.

My friends and I went to Lou Malnati's on a Friday night and the place was packed. We waited about 25 minutes which was not bad at all. The upstairs seating was looked nicer and more comfortable than the seats downstairs. This place is huge.

We ordered a salad, a chicken sandwich, and the deep dish with the sausage. I really enjoyed the deep dish, although after eating I could tell it was really heavy. The buttery crust was really nice though. It was a good thing we ordered salad because it balanced out the heavy pizza. It was really good, but I think I can only have it when I am really hungry.
Great Place to Eat & watch a Game. While friends were at the Christkindle market.

This is my favorite pizza in the Chicago area.  Have eaten at many of the "famous" pizza places in the city, but still haven't eaten any that I like as much as Malnatti's.  Plus, sometimes buy frozen ones at Chicago grocery stores to bring back home to southern IL!
Buttercrust is out of this world.  I love the crunchier crust and the sausage pizza is a sausage layer so every bite has sausage.  I highly recommend  the Chicago classic.

Ok. Not as good as Giordanos. The pizza needed more tomato sauce. And the butter crust that everyone raves about was bland and under seasoned. Not bad, but there are definitely better choices in Chicago!

The service at Lou Manalti's was incredible! Our waitress was extremely helpful and served us all our slices individually, and would constantly come check up on us. This was my first time trying deep dish pizza, and I guess my expectations were different? The flavor was decent but i guess i wasn't too much of a fan of deep dish. and the thin crust pizza tasted like something i could make myself at home. their lasagna was really good though! i got a spinach based one and it was delicious and very flavorful! also, their garlic bread was okay. it wasn't anything too special, like I said something could be made at home. I see why this place is famous since deep dish pizza is unique so i recommend trying it if you're new to or visiting chicago, and maybe you'll like it :-)
Good Chicago style pizza if you like deep dish. The servers are great and welcoming, making this place a great stop. The starter platter and the garlic sauce was the icing on the cake!!!
Pizza is a big deal in Chicago, you pretty much draw a line in the sand and state your preference. Lou's is mine, for the best deep dish this is where I bring people.

So this was pretty much the best pizza and bruschetta I'd ever had in my life...This was my first time having real Chicago pizza, and it did not disappoint! I loved the butter crust. It was like a pie crust, but not crumbly. On top of the crust was a thick layer of melty cheese. On top of the cheese was a layer of REAL tomato sauce (with some chunks) and sausage. You could taste the quality of ingredients! I was very impressed! And the bruschetta! Oh man...the tomato/onion/basil mixture was sitting on garlic bread slices! What was there NOT to like??? Made me wonder why I hadn't thought of that myself at home...the service was fantastic and we had a great time overall. If we are back in Chicago we will be returning and bringing all our friends and family with us.

After having take out my husband and I decided to come in for our last meal before traveling home to the east coast. The servers were so attentive and friendly. We started with the chip trio! If you're someone who loves bruschetta as well as dipping sauces this is for you. Every bite tasted fresh and delicious. We would definitely
Order this again. For our main meal we ordered the Chicago special (deep dish with sausage and fresh tomato sauce, not your normal sauce). Every bite was amazing! You'll most definitely need a fork and knife for this. Absolutely one of the best pizzas I've ever had!
My go-to for thin crust in the city. That buttery crust ... deep dish also great but pequods better in my view.

Thanks for making my deep-dish pizza experience a great one! My colleague and I were in town for a convention so having a Chicago style pizza was an order. We dined here on 3/9/17 and though this is my first deep-dish pizza experience, it is save to say that their pizza is bomb based on the quality of the crust, sausage and the sauce. Beware that they make the pizzas to order so you'll have to wait 30 minutes for it to come. We occupied ourself with a house salad (the single order is plenty to share between two people) and we also ordered the deep fried calamari for app and it was tasty, the batter was crunchy but the squid itself was tender (yay it wasn't a frozen calamari that comes in a bag!) I'm more of a thin crust pizza person, however, Lou Malnati did their job of convincing me that there are other ways to have your pizza! :) I'm craving their pizza just from writing this review

BEST PIZZA EVERRRRRR

I came to Chicago for a concert on St. Patrick's Day, and you know how when you're traveling people suggest places for you to go? Well I'm fucking glad I listened to my friend and actually went here.

Now let me just start by saying, I'm from Ohio. We don't have shit. If you want decent pizza you have to order from Papa John's or some other low key shit chain. I also hate pizza crust.

This place has the best pizza crust I've ever eaten. I don't even know how to explain it, but it's fucking phenomenal. My group ordered the Malnati pizza, and I'm so glad we did. Best shit I've ever eaten. So good. 10/10
best deep dish in chicago. no one can tell me otherwise. lou malnati's forever. but really i probably tell people everyday that lou mal's is the best and make any out of town friends eat here.

3.5 stars!

Coming to Chicago I knew I had to get some deep dish pizza. At first my friend and I were going to try Giordanos, which I guess is a competitor of Lou's, but last minute we changed our mind and came here. What a great decision!

We shared the Lou's small pizza and oh my gosh was it the best pizza I have ever eaten. It had spinach, onions, garlic, mushrooms, and we added sausage. And Of course we got it with the butter crust, because well, why not? After we ordered the server asked if we wanted an appetizer or salad because the pizza would take 45 minutes. We decided against a starter and I was regretting it about 20 minutes into the wait, but once the food came out I was glad we had decided against it! Deep dish pizza is SO filling!

My only complaint was that the hostess sat our party of three at a two top booth. I asked if we could have a table that properly sat three people and she just moved us down to another two top booth. So, elbow room lacked when we were eating which was annoying, but the food made up for it.

pics.caption: Best pizza I have ever eaten!!!

review.des: So we're in Chicago for the weekend and of course you have to do the touristy thing and try the best Chicago style pizza. So I hit up yelp for recommendations. Lou's apparently is the place to go, and his father is one of the original creators of this pizza masterpiece. But wait, why would a masterpiece not receive 5/5? Because it is a pizza joint that only serve 6 beers. Because its a pizza joint without the pizza joint vibe. Because the pizza was lacking. No spicy or even richness to the sauce. No well seasoned toppings or crunchy, chewy crust; it was too flaky like pie crust. To be honest I am not sure if I went to this location or not, but considering this is a local chain and a local favorite this is applicable to all of them.

On our first evening of a short Chicago trip, we wanted to experience deep dish pizza.  So after some research on the best-reviewed places, this branch of Lou Malnati's proved to be within a short walk of our hotel.

They don't take reservations or do call-ahead seating, btw.  We arrived around 5:30 p.m. on a Saturday.  There was about a 20-minute wait, but they do let you place your pizza-order when you sign in (given, apparently, the long cook-time required).  So we hung out in their small waiting area for 15 minutes or so and got seated.  There are seating areas on both the ground and upper floor.  Both floors were full.  The noise-level was high, if that bothers you; it was okay for us.  

Service, once we were seated, was fairly prompt.  The food came out in another 10 - 15 minutes, and the pizza was very good!  I think we ordered the house special (cheese / sausage / buttermilk crust).  Even the medium is a lot to handle and we had leftovers from 3 of us (which were eaten over the next few days at the hotel).  

I wish Lou had a branch in Atlanta.  Highly recommended.

Between Pizzeria Uno, Gino's East, and Lou Malnati's, this is my favorite. Get the classic with tomato sauce, extra cheese and sausage. Ordering system for those dining-in is a bit different than other pizzerias, since these deep dish pizzas take so long to bake. You order your pizza at a counter and are then seated. If you order take-out, it takes about 45 minutes. My pizza was ready right on time.

About a month before leaving for Chicago I started to ask some natives in my hometown for their recommendation on the best pizza in Chicago. The only other time we were in the Windy City we were told to go to Uno and we were sorely disappointed. It left the proverbial bad taste in our mouth (pun intended!). Out of a dozen friends, 10 said to try Lou Malnati's. One of the locations was just 3 blocks from our hotel so off we went. The restaurant had a 90-minute wait so we decided to take out. We ordered the Lou Malnati and they had me from the first bite. Our pizza was easily the freshest and most savory I've ever had. The crust melted in your mouth and the toppings tasted as if they had been harvested in the previous hour. Pair it with a Caesar salad and 10 out of 12 former Chicagoans were dead solid perfect in their recommendation.

I had the classic personal size deep dish. I think it's so much better than Giordanos. The crust is crunchier and not oily or soggy. The only downside is the wait time for pizza. Keep in mind, I'm from NY. 45 minute wait for anything is just unacceptable. But since I'm in Chicago, do as the Chicagoans do! But seriously, waiting for this pizza is like waiting on line at Six Flags-45 minute wait and ate that $hit in 1 minute!

I heard from everyone how great Lou's was for their pizza. However, we were shocked to find that it didn't live up to all the hype. The crust was clearly not fresh and probably premade or frozen. Ordered two deep dishes and two flatbread. The deep dish was among the least favorite I've tried while in town. The flatbread was one the better flarbread in the area. However compared to the pizza I have back home, there is no comparison and it just doesn't cut it.

I'm a huge fan of pizza to begin with, but the pizza here is to die for. As someone from out of town, I will certainly be dreaming about this place until I make it back to Chicago. If you're looking for a good pizza fix, this is the place to be!

Love this pizza ! It's different from most chicago pizzas because of the fresh ingredients and they offer a butter crust which is outstanding . Choose thin or deep dish try their special the "Lou" and save room for their chocolate chip cookie served hot in the pan

First time in Chicago and I couldn't leave without authentic Chicago deep dish. This did not disappoint one bit! Be prepared to wait a bit to get in and then another bit after you order your pizza because this deliciousness takes time. Waiter was great. Good bar with everything you could need including some good local choices on tap.

Can't visit Chicago without trying an authentic Chicago deep dish pizza!! Researched for a good pizza spot and Lou malnati's kept coming up. So many locations, we happened to be close to this one. We had a medium size malnati classic. It was more than enough for two people. Came out perfect temp, hot, cheese melted perfectly, crust was delicious. Definitely comfort food! Great for any occasion!

Wow is this good pizza. Expect to wait about 45 minutes for your pizza, but it is so worth it. This is one of my favorite pizza places in Chicago. The deep dish was awesome. I went with some friends here on a pizza food crawl, and I'm so glad we stopped here.
Sooo much food! Pizza was outstanding. Bar needed an update on televisions but the service was great!

Lou's is a Chicago staple.  They are number 2 on my list of best deep dish pizza's in Chicago.  Definitely a great place to check out if you are visiting from out of town and want to try Chicago's famous deep dish pizza.

The wait was long, but we could order the pizza and have it cooking while we waited. There is a text messaging system that updates you on how long your wait is!!! Amazing, loved that. Even when we finally got seated, there was still a wait so we got salad and breadsticks. We totally over ordered but we were hungry. The sausage pizza was amazing in that it was a confluence layer of sausage over cheese. Yum! The veggie one was not that way so not as good. Would try other places just because of the wait.

We heard that this is the best pizza in Chicago. We shared Bar-B-Lou wings with honey barbecue sauce, a Malnati salad, and a Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza (lean sausage and buttercrust).  Everything was great. I have no complaints.
We just finished a thin crust pizza from Lou's In Lincoln Square.  I thought I was eating the cardboard that it was transported in. Absolutely no flavor.  Zippo.  Nada.  I am going back to Bartolis.

Lost my deep dish - ginity to Lou. Literally. The Lou came LOADED with spinach, mushrooms, sliced roma tomatoes, and three types of cheese. Would I ever do it again? Probably not. But it was a great one time thing.

My friend described this pizza as a casserole. It's extremely thick with too much "stuffing", which in my opinion ruins the point of a pizza. It was a heavy dish in every way. The bottom became too soggy and droopy to be eaten without a fork and knife. I'm all for folding my pizza in half and eating it by hand, so this was a no no for me. But again, if it did and had all the things I liked then it wouldn't be a deep dish. For what it is, I think Lou Malnati's did it justice.

Also ordered the same pizza but with a thin crust. Basically, a NYC pie. Crust was thin and crispy. Toppings weren't as overwhelming. It was good, but I wasn't able to take more than two bites because I was already stuffed from a slice of deep dish.

For appetizers, I had the calamari and spinach stuffed bread. Calamari was soggy and the breading was coming off. The bread was delicious and you should definitely order it!

Apart from the food, the service was stellar. One of the nicest bunch of staff I've ever come across. Had an incident with the food but the waitress and manager were so cooperative about it. Ended up covering the pizza bill. That itself deserved the 4 star!

Great experience overall. Would recommend people coming here if they never had deep dish before and wanted to give it a shot.

There was nothing deep or good about this Pizza. Great service and staff though. The wait is ridiculous, plus 20 minutes once seated for your order. I expected a traditional deep dish, but was informed by the manager that thats their signature deep dish style compared to the other popular deep dish styles around. After the long wait we were super hungry and ordered the soup of the day, which far exceeded my expectations than the main dish of the house. For me the pizza lacked flavor and was not worth the wait. Willing to give it another shot as it was a super busy night!

pics.caption: Not worth the wait :( so disappointed

review.des:
I am a believer.

After waiting nearly an hour, had to get my fix at a Chicago classic. Sorry to say I am not a sausage fan, but that's ok! The menu insists you should get whatever toppings you want. Either way, I couldn't resist getting the buttercrust.

Since the pizzas take ~45 minutes to bake, they suggest you pre-order and have it ready by the time you sit. Pfft. My friend and I took this as: we're giving you ample time so you might as well order some appetizers and enjoy. We decided on the pizza chips and dip, which came with thin slabs of dough and a nice assortment of dipping sauces. My favorite was the garlicky one.

When my pizza finally arrived, I was delighted at how stringy the cheese was as the slice pulled away from the pie. That buttercrust is no joke. It's crispy on the outside but somehow the crust also manages to maintain a good amount of bready chew inside.

Verdict? Worth traveling 2,000 miles for.

Pizza is amazing! We got the large, deep dish pepperoni, and had trouble finishing it between 3 people.

They also have a gluten free pizza crust, which I believe is made in-house, so it isn't Udi's or anything. My girlfriend has Celiac's disease and raved of the crust.

They also have a "crustless" pizza, which I believe is made out of sausage. It sounds good, though my party didn't have that.

Our server, Jason, was probably the best server I've ever had in a restaurant. Very friendly, personable and great sense of humor. He came back multiple times to check on us and make sure we had everything we needed, even though he also had a huge table to deal with as well.

The pizza takes about 40-45 minutes from the time you order it, but it is WELL worth the wait. Don't get any appetizers, because you won't be able to eat much of that huge, delicious pizza.

I moved to Chicago recently and have always loved Lou Malnati's. Whenever we have people come in from out of town it seems like people always request deep dish so this is one of our go to places to get our fix. I recommend the Malnati Classic.

Maybe it's just me and my hubby...but we had no idea what the hype was all about.  Maybe we're not a fan of Chicago pizzas?! I know..I know...blasphemy, but we just didn't like it.

We arrived at 7:30 on a Friday night and we KNEW that there was going to be a wait.  However, it was a rather chilly May evening and everyone tried to stay inside and therefore made it very difficult to get to the hostess as well as find a place to stand and wait.

We finally got to the hostess and we were advised that it's a 45 min wait but we could go ahead and order our pizzas so that it'll be ready by the time we're seated.  We were totally excited about this.  So, placed our order at the counter and had to fight the crowd to get outside.  Man, did I regret going outside.  It was freezing, there was no place to sit and I tried going back inside, but there just wasn't enough room.

Finally, got the notification that our table was ready.  We sat down and placed our orders.  I thought that our pizza would be ready, but nope...we had to wait an extra 20-30 mins.  With that, we just decided to order the wings.  Now, the wings are delicious and we were excited to eat our pizza.  The pizza came out and I was SOOO exited.

However, once I pulled out a slice..I noticed that there was TONS of cheese just oozing out of it.  Normally, this would be very exciting to me since I'm  a little obsessed with cheese.  BUT, there was just WAY too much cheese in here.  It was like bread and melted cheese.  It was too much.  We actually couldn't even finish one small pizza.  I was totally bummed.

I'm giving this place 3 stars for the excellent service our waitress gave us and for the wings.  But, that's pretty much it.

We went here the night after having Giordanos and I must say this place is far superior. The sauce is excellent and fresh, the sausage is tasty and the atmosphere is better, and also their text messaging system to let you know your table is ready actually works unlike Giordanos. I would say this is a must have for any pizza lover visiting Chicago
Lou's is ok. Have had their pizza since I was a child. I prefer the thin crust because I'm not a deep dish or stuffed fan. Not a huge fan of their sauce, just a personal thing.

We were only in Chicago for 9 hours and had a few priorities. 1) Chicago Cubs game 2) Chicago pizza
When Lou Malnati's was recommended by local friends, we had to go. Our waiter, Collin was very attentive and recommended everything we ordered. It sooo delicious! I definitely recommend the spinach artichoke bread and any deep dish pizza. It will not disappoint!! Also, high praises to our server. Collin was awesome and we really appreciated him.

One of my friends came into town and she's never been to Chicago/had deep dish pizza. I had the daunting task of deciding which legendary Chicago deep dish pizza to show her. I chose Lou's, because I grew up eating Lou's, and figured it's the most well known.

We chose this location purely because of where we had finished our little walking tour of the Loop/central downtown.

For 6:00 on a Friday, I was SHOCKED that our wait was only about 20 minutes. This location is a bit smaller than what I'm used to, but they use their space well and have a really efficient wait system. It uses modern technology (an iPad and texting) and they encourage you to order your pizza(s) while you wait so it cuts your wait time in half once you get to the table. Very efficient. Loved it.

They also make the waiting atmosphere thiiiiis much better because they have complimentary thin crust pizza while you're waiting! Score!

We ordered a small pep and a small Lou's, perfect for 3 people, and we even took a couple "slices" home. Pizza was perfect as usual. My out of town friend loved it and asked if we could go back for more tomorrow.

The only reason this Lou's location doesn't get 5 starts from me is because of where we sat. There are about 5 or 6 high top tables right by the front entrance, bar, and waiting area. This is where we sat. Now, I'm sure on a normal day (not a cold-ish Friday night), sitting there is fine. But there was a swarm of people basically on top of us and we felt a cooooooold breeze every time the door opened.

Other than that, a near perfect Lou's trip.

pics.caption: My friend indulging in her first deep dish experience with a slice of "The Lou"

review.des: Not that great. Weirded out by the really yellow crust. Not my favorite deep dish pizza. I think people rave about this place too much for no real reason.

Ah the wifey had a business trip in Chicago. I requested some pizza to go since we don't have Lou Malnati's in Indianapolis, but we do have Giordanos (don't get me started on this)... Lou's needs to expand to the Indy area too!

Anyways since I wasn't in Chicago she got a deep dish pie to go. The key is to request it half baked so that you can bake it again at home. We got the The Malnati Chicago Classic™, which has  a buttery crust, extra mozzarella cheese, the pizzeria's own sausage. Honestly it held up pretty well and I was happy it re cooked at home. Probably one of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicago, personally, I am more of a NYC slice person. But every so often I want some deep dish.

pics.caption: The Malnati Chicago Classic to go "parbaked"

review.des:
I went to Lou Malnati's couple years ago, but I am fairly new to Yelp so I'm choosing to write the review now. The closest one to our hotel was this location. We put in out reservation and got seated after about an hour or so. It was a Saturday night so it was very busy.

The restaurant itself is really cool. As a sports fan, it was cool to see many old jerseys hung up on the walls. The brick has a certain uniqueness to the restaurant, making it feel more authentic.

We ordered the Pepperoni deep dish pizza, and after 30-45 minutes it came out. It looked incredible. The service was excellent, as they cut the pizza in front of you and then plate your food for you. I've had a lot of pizza from a ton of places, but this was the best pizza I've ever had. The cheese stretched like it was straight out of a video. The sauce tasted amazing, and the dough was as fresh as it gets.

We then decided to get the chocolate chip cookie pizza. It was the vest version of the cookie I've had to date. Pizza chains and other restaurants make this dessert, but Lou Malnati's perfected it.

A lot of research went into choosing the best pizza place to go to on our trip. There are many rivals in Chicago, where people claim X has THE best pizza. I took a chance on Lou Malnati's and it did not disappoint. I'm sure you can't go wrong with the majority of deep dish places downtown, but you can't go wrong here.

Great service and amazing pizza. Get the butter crust! I know it's famous but I could have had less sausage on mine. Just personal preference. When in Chicago and looking for authentic pizza, check out this place.

This was my first real Chicago deep dish pizza and I must say it lived up to all of the hype. We had the Lou and loved every bite. The Caesar salad was excellent as well. The only thing I didn't enjoy was waiting 30 minutes to try to pay. Service was really lacking at the end, but the rest of the meal/experience was great.

Had a personal pizza delivered to me. I don't know if my expectations were too high, but I just didn't see what the big deal about this place was. The fillings are tasty, but the butter crust was a bit weird.

Lou Malnati's Pizzeria satisfies every time.

On my last trip out to Chicago I was lucky enough to try the big three of deep dish pies and must admit that Lou Malnati's was a serious contender to Giordano's while Pizzeria Uno was a distant third. Malnati's has a polished if not expected touristic feel to it but the staff is friendly enough and considering each pie takes 45 minutes to fire, they do a good job of keeping the masses flowing. Their menu is extensive but my play was the obvious: I am here for the Pizza and Pizza only.

The "Lou" was what I opted for, a whimsical affair featuring spinach mix, mushrooms and sliced roma tomatoes covered with blended Mozzarella, Romano and Cheddar cheeses on a thick, yet flaky garlic "Buttercrust". This Pizza is very good. No, scratch that... it is excellent. A perfect cheese to tomato ratio and the crust is doughy in the inside but does not overwhelm the other flavors. The meats follow through in the finish along with a hard hit of Garlic. One piece had me feeling pretty full but I went all in on a second slice since we simply do not have pies like these out west and I walked out feeling like the Michelin man.

The small will feed two at $16.00 and is a great value in my mind. I will most certainly be back next time I visit the windy city... After I have already had Giordano's that is.

Good deep dish pizza... but the Malnati salad was delicious!!  Our server recommended it and I was hesitant, but am really amazed how delicious it is.  

Pretty good menu and beer list here.  The atmosphere is casual but nice.  It's a really big space with a bar and seating downstairs, and additional seating upstairs.
I absolutely love there deep dish pizza. I have order multiple times from the one on Wrightwood in Lincoln Park. It has always been on time and piping hot.

We checked out 3 deep dish pizza places during our visit to Chicago for the weekend... Peqoud's, Giordano's,  and Lou Malnati's...

Lou Malnati's definitely did not disappoint. We had the stuffed spinich bread for apps, which was pretty decent. The pizza was our first experience at Chicago deep dish pizza and it was really good. I think the crust might have been slightly better at Peqoud's  For dessert we had chocolate chip pizza, and damnnnn, was it really really good.

Let's just say it was so good, that one night we are at Peqoud's for dinner, but we came back to Lou's just for the chocolate chip pizza for dessert...

Of course it's the best! My only complaint: my wife and I are vegetarians and ordered a mushroom pizza. It came with sausage underneath the cheese-which is delish, but I didn't want to complain because we were having a great night and it's 45 minutes for deep dish.

So, we heard that this was Chicago's best deep dish pizza. I cannot say it is the best, but I can say that it is the best I have ever had...it is the first!

We waited 45 minutes for our specialty pizza to be delivered. The server came out with it in potholders, warning us that it just came out of the oven and was HOTTTT!

Not at all.  In fact, it was room temperature, at best.  
BUT NOT ALL WAS LOST or a DISAPPOINTMENT!
The kitchen management took full responsibility and brought out a brand new one with apologies.  It most likely was someone else's because it only took 10 minutes, but nevertheless...Mistakes happen so making it right for the customer gives them a 4star!

I was disappointed. Last time I was in Chicago I was pleasantly surprised by Chicago pizza being a New York girl.  Make sure you ask for the butter crust. I failed to do so and I think that was based on the crust. I had a great time talking to other tourists at the bar. The place gets packed on a Saturday around 1pm. But Giordani's is better!

BAD FOOD
I had "The 'Lou'" deep dish pizza and it didn't taste good: the dough was pale and had a raw taste, cheese was to thick and too chewy instead of smooth and with a pleasant chewing, and the combination of ingredients didn't come together.
I also had the "Malnati's Salad" salad and it was okay.

BAD SERVICE
The waiter had a bad attitude. Because salad dressings usually have wine vinegar and I'm pregnant, I asked the waiter whether the dressing had alcohol, and he replied saying that I wouldn't get drunk with the salad dressing, so I proceeded to clarify that it was because I'm pregnant that I was asking, to which he reply, "it won't hurt the baby." Very impertinent and condescending. He is not a doctor and because of such he shouldn't make such a comment. He also made a mess when serving us the salad and didn't clean up. He got my utensils and napkin dirty with the salad and didn't apologize or offer to bring a clean set. Very rude and bad service.

I have tried deep dish in Chicago from two different restaurants, and both were disappointing. I'm from CA and the deep dish pizza here is so much better than Chicago's. Ironic. The Yelp rating for Lou Malnati's Pizzeria is really off and I'm very disappointed that it turned out this way.

Sadly a bad experience at the River North location. I usually enjoy Lou Malnotti's, but everything about this visit was bad to worse. The wait was well over the hour I was told, finally received the "text" after it seemed like an eternity of constantly refreshing the web address to see what number position we were and then seated outside. Ok, I admit I said outside was fine....but, that was almost an hour and a half ago, now it's cool out that it's nightfall and you see I have two kids in tow. Whatever, just want to eat and go. Corner table outside, closest to where the group of guys are smoking...are you effing kidding me??!!! I address this to our server and she kindly tells the guys no smoking there, ok, great, Thanks!
Place our order for the kids menu, because of course they ask you to pre-order your pizza for faster service...nope, still a half an hour after seating did we get the Medium, thin crust, half pepperoni and half basil/onion...Yes, not the deep dish, but a pretty basic and general pizza, why did it take so long???!!!! Best part is when that pizza arrived...
What a hot mess!!!! The basil/onion side literally had HUGE chunks of onions I had to scrape off if I had any intentions of speaking to anyone else last night, cheese was scattered and uneven throughout, I mean Wow, how in the hell do you screw that up??? Believe me when I say the Giordano's in my freezer looked 1000% better than that thing. Last part of this useless trip and waste of money, after all of this, we go to the bathroom and there is ONE STALL.
Are you kidding me???!!! There is a wait of over an hour and a half, I am somewhere in the 40 position, meaning 40 effing parties ahead of me, its RIVER NORTH busy....and you have ONE STALL in the LADIES ROOM??!!! UNBELIEVABLE!!! ‍
ON TOP OF THAT, ITS A FRIGGEN PIGSTY??? Ugh!!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!
Moral of the story...should have gone to Gino's East on LaSalle

What a disaster going

The wait is ridiculous! They need to find a better way for seating people...like using an online reservation system like most restaurants do. It is so unproductive to have to put your name on the list in person, to have to wait in the small cramped area in the front with 50 other people waiting for that magic text that says "You are up". They recommend that you give your order to the cashier as you wait so that when you are seated your food would be ready. After sitting down we still had to wait an extra  30 minutes for our food to be ready. The pizza tasted rushed and the waitress was clearly overwhelmed. Sighh...

pics.caption: The pizza was rushed in the oven:( It wasn't done

review.des:
I believe this restaurant is always busy! My friend and I got there at 19h30 and was on waiting list. They took our phone number for them to text whenever the table was ready. They also gave us the menu to preorder pizza only. Appetizers and salads can be ordered on the table.

By 20h00 our table was ready, so we waited for 30 mins! Apart from pizza, we ordered MALTANI SALAD and it came in 15 mins! It was DELICIOUS! The salad was sweet yet has savoury taste from salami bits! Sooooooo gooooooood omg definitely worth to try! Then our pizza was ready 35 mins after we got our table! We ordered small MALTANI CHICAGO CLASSIC and it tasted AWESOME! Cheese was sooo gooey and the toppings were delicious! However we couldn't finish the crust tho....

Just like any other famous touristy restaurants in Chicago, their service tends to be really quick, yet friendly!
Overall, it's definitely worth to try!
Good deep dish pizza, great crust. The cheese is really good but a little too much on the pizza for me. Our server was nice and quick with refills.

Good deep dish pizza. I enjoy coming here. The pizzas are very cheesy and loaded with toppings. They use vine ripened tomatoes from California and Wisconsin cheese. These quality ingredients make a difference.

Definitely my favorite deep dish in the city! I recommend Lou's to anyone visiting Chicago that is looking to try amazing deep dish.  Get it with the butter crust and extra cheese.  You won't regret it!

The first time trying this 'famous' Chicago deep
dish pizza. I ordered
an all mixed up and low on cheese and heavy on oil and
and.... it was FANCY! I would never thought I could
like a pizza like that one but it was a very successful
experiment The only thing l didn't really like was the wait and cost!

NOW when I went there for the first time with chaps it was anofher story...
The floors, restroom, even tableware disgusting!
Manager said the floors etc, 'no matter, on the house! '
had just been refinished.

I recommend finding delivery with them and coupons or making sure using a GOOD CREDIT OR CHARGE CARD FOR CHARGEBACK! STILL 4OUT5
Great food, good service. I would say it's a little tight in space but the pizza is always great :).
Honestly I really liked the place, staff was one point even tho it was busy. We got the pizza (of course) and a salad with their speciality dressing. Everything was great.

Chicago locals will tell you Lou Malnati's is their favorite deep dish place. Even my Uber drive agreed! And the crowds on a Friday night didn't lie; this place is popular. Packed with a 50+ minute wait on my visit.

It was worth the wait. I got the Lou's Deep Dish, in going with my policy that a dish good enough to name a restaurant after is probably a safe bet. This was one delicious pie! However, the surprise favorite of the meal may have been the bruschetta appetizer. It is everything you want in a bruschetta: perfectly crunchy garlic bread and fresh flavorful tomatoes topped with delicious parmesan cheese and herbs. Just perfection. Great food all around.

One of the better deep dish pizzas in Chicago. However, we got quite a few toppings on our pizza (the veggie classic pizza) and then added sausage, and it made the whole pizza kind of soft and soggy. I was a little disappointed. I would highly suggest limiting to one or 2 toppings at most.
Calamari Great, Salad Great, Pizza Great (Recommend Extra Sausage, Extra Garlic), Wine Great, Dessert Great, Staff Great.  Notice the theme...Great!   Cheers!
Hands down the BEST deep dish pizza around! Went do Chicago (from wi) just for the pizza!

The best Chicago style pizza. Get a deep dish butter crust and don't think about he calories, because it's deep dish pizza for crying out loud. They do a gluten free option where the crust is sausage, which I did not know until recently. My mom loves the Lou's Salad.

The best deep dish pizza in Chicago!  After many years with other pizzas, Lou has converted me!  There are many options in the city but make the effort to stop at any of the Malnati's locations for their deep dish.  I prefer the Chicago Classic - give it a try!

I went here and got a small deep dish pizza. The crew was very nice, ordering easy, but... I was not happy with the finished product.
- My pizza was barely luke warm. Maybe because it was smaller than the rest? The larger ones didn't seem to be an issue.

Lou's fares the least favourite when it comes to the deep dish, which is really confusing since a majority of its locations has numerous reviews. I had the personal pizza when I first tried the deep dish; it lacked overall flavour and was a really small size for a personal pizza. The second time I tried a larger deep dish with a group of friends and we all agreed that it lacked flavour and the crush had no taste at all. It seems as though the deep dish crusts in general have a lack lustre when it comes to taste, perhaps something needs to be done! We also didn't like the bruschetta either for the general lack of flavour. After trying many different restaurants, I don't know if I would have a deep dish here again. Although, I am curious to try the regular pizza for comparisons.
This place was awesome! Food was unbelievable and service was perfect! Mark Wells was an amazing server, made great recommendations and was spot on and personable!
Great pizza. Mediocre service. If you need your Chicago pizza fix, go here & eat it here. It gets soggy in a to go box!
This place is amazing!! Ceaser salad and deep dish pizza is to die for!! The staff were very friendly and knew how to keep up with us Scots

The pizza was very good. The cheese was fantastic and the sauce was great but there wasn't enough of it in my opinion. I wasn't happy with the way the sauce didn't taste fresh and it didn't taste like fresh tomatoes even though there were huge chunks. We opted for the Classic Chicago deep dish stuffed pizza. I ordered from the hotel BEFORE we arrived at the restaurant to make the wait shorter, we arrived, clearly the order had been submitted but we still waited 35 minutes. Our server was "meh" at best and when I had to ask him about my order that was placed BEFORE we got there...he realized we had been waiting a long time but never checked on anything until I asked. Customer service was pretty lousy but the pizza was very good. NOT great but very good.

Never had a problem. Came with my parents and my bfs parents on a crowded day and we had a polite wait and were seated eventually. Waitress was great. Deep dish was superb. Mm that crust. Leftovers. Hurrah. Lou Malnati's is solid. And their waitresses don't take shit.
Didn't enjoy the pizza I got. The sauce was very sour and did not sit well with me right away. I will be sticking to Giordano's but at least I gave it a try.

This is the place to go for Chicago style pizza, if you ask the locals.  I am not a fan of the deep dish, but here, I can vouch for the crispy butter crust and the ridiculously rich and bright tomato on top.  I hesitate to call it sauce because it's so flavorful, it's almost like a reduction of vine ripened gorgeousness.  That said, I didn't love it.  We had the Classic, which has a layer of hammered sausage which was way too much blanched boingy meat for me... but my husband loves it (although he says he doesn't need another of these for 10 years, so yay) and too much cheese (sacre bleu!!) but not enough of the tomato.  For me, I appreciate that this is the best of its genre ... a genre of which I'm not fond ... if I had to do it again, I would do a build-your-own with extra sauce (the Classic has extra cheese) and I think the ratio would be better for me, who likes regular pizza.  THEY ALSO HAVE REGULAR PIZZA which we did not try.  We had a salad and split it, a couple 'o beers and oh yes did I mention we were there St Patrick's day around 4pm and only waited about 25 min for a table so GREAT service and organization. Dude at the bar was fun and jocular and not stressed even though I would've wanted to kill everyone around me, so wow they were great people in there.  I'm not dreaming of the food, but it's the best of the thing that it is and I'd definitely go back next time I'm in Chicago.  Deep dish, I don't love you, but at least now I get it.

Seating is always faster than expected (usually told there will be a 45-ish minute wait, I've never waited much more than 20 minutes).  I'm a deep dish fan and it's up there for my favorites in the city.

This review is strictly on the quality of the food that we had delivered to us (it's about half a mile away). Originally we planned to dine-in but when we got there, the place was crowded and they said the wait time would be nearly an hour (and this was on a Monday night). We opted instead to have the pizza delivered to our hotel and relax with a movie since we weren't up to deal with the noise and figured the pizza would get cold on the walk back if we got it to go. We ordered "The Lou" and the combination platter and it took about 45min which was fine.

I was excited to try the butter crust that everyone has been raving about but I found the crust plain and doughy rather than flavorful and flaky like people had described. The cheese was not gooey and stretchy; instead it felt like I was gnawing through a block of cheese. I'm not a fan of marina so that's why we got the Lou but were disappointed with the lack of flavor - we might as well have gotten the original just for the flavor aspect. The combination platter was alright - you can't really go wrong with breaded and deep-fried foods dipped in ranch - but nothing spectacular.

For all the hype, we were not impressed especially for the price (come to around $40 with tax and tip). My sister had just had Giordano's the night before and she said she preferred that to this place. It may be a different experience if we had dined in and got to enjoy the food fresh out of the oven/fryer but in the case of delivery, just.... don't.

I'll be honest, I wasn't really a big fan of their deep dish here. We got 2 larges for 8 people and it was more than enough. They say one large feeds 4. The butter crust had good crunch, but was a bit bland. And the pizza was just oddly layered. The meat and cheese were each their own layer and it was like biting into a cracker with cheese and meat stacked on top of it rather than a pizza as a whole with its ingredients combined. I don't know, it's hard to explain but the pizza just didn't feel right when I ate it. Maybe I came on a bad day but I definitely preferred Giordano's deep dish. I'd be willing to come back and try it on another day or maybe get their thin crust, but I definitely was not impressed on my first visit.
First night into Chicago and strolled in. Service and food was really good. I ordered the classic while it didn't meet expectations it was very good.
GF pizza is good. Husband likes the gluten full.  Salad might be the best...
Service was great, the pizza was good but I felt it wasn't hot enough when it got to our table , however still good pizza . The salad was amazing , and a great portion.

Pizza was really good and so was the service. Came in and was quickly seated in the back and was advised on the wait time on the food. The hype lived up to the food everything was top notch. Got the regular pizza added garlic and light on the sauce . Not a huge sauce person. Would highly recommend this place if visiting from out of town.

I can't say enough about this delicious pizza. I was here from Maryland to attend my niece's graduation.  My husband decided to go to this restaurant for a late night dinner.  When he brought the pizza back to our hotel, I instantly woke up after being up for about 20 hrs (with traveling included). I couldn't get enough of the pizza, the taste was awesome.  We had the pizza with the layer of spinach on the bottom and fresh tomatoes on top.  I was only in Chicago for a very short time, we left the next evening.  I kept talking about this pizza on my job. When someone from my job told me that THEY DELIVER........omg, it was on! I ordered six today to be sent to my home in Maryland.  Can't  wait to bake them in MY oven and enjoy!  THANK YOU for the exerperience Lou Malnati's Pizzeria!
If you want to experience one of Chicago's best deep dish pizza don't miss  Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza. This is a Chicago experience you don't want to miss on your visit to Chicago.
We came here on a recommendation for the deep dish. They let you know it's ~30' wait for a pizza but it's worth the wait.

This pizza place was recommended to us by several people.
I'm really not sure why!! If you like fake bacon bits on your salad and velveta cheese in place of cheese curds for the fried cheese appetizer, then you may like this resturant. They are extremely slow, so plan to spend the whole evening there . The waitress dropped the pan holder on the floor and and just picked it up and reused it, with out cleaning it. If you want good Chicago style pizza , skip this place and go to Giordano's. You'll be much happier , and they'll feed you real foods , not fake processed ones .

The food here is great. This is the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. The salad was great too. Honestly this could have been a five star restaurant but the process of getting in was too difficult.

First, we were quoted a wait time of 45 minutes. They also let you preorder your pizza (since they take a while to cook) so that was a plus.  Meanwhile, we waited almost 90 minutes (outside on the street with two hungry kids - never fun).

Once inside the process of getting to your table is difficult and the service is friendly but not great.

I really liked the food and I'm glad we tried it but if we come back to Chicago we would probably try a different pizza place.
The deep dish pizza of my dreams! Was there around 6pm on a Sunday and the place was packed. Prepare yourself for a wait, but it's worth the wait!

Fabulous Chicago-style, deep-dish pizza! Went for the special, and wasn't disappointed. Ordered a medium, which was too big for two people. On the positive, I brought the leftovers home the next day to bring a taste of Chicago down south to family! Could highly recommend for a tasty pizza!

pics.caption: Brought leftovers home for the family!

review.des: not really a big fan of deep dish pizza but figured I would give it a try since I was in Chicago. Ordered for carry out and overall it was decent. Nothing to rave about but personally too much cheese to my liking.

This the best pizza place I've ever been. The hubby and I were recommended this spot from an uber driver. We were visiting from California and we were heading to a different restaurant and when the uber driver started to describe the pizza and how it's his favorite place we decided to skip on the plans we had and headed to Lou Malnatis Pizzeria instead.

We ordered "The Lou" with pepperoni and sausage! It was delicious that buttercrust was amazing. Just thinking about it right now I want some. Must try with sausage and pepperoni. If that's too much meat just try it with the sausage.

We also ordered the stuffed spinach bread and buffalou wings with a little kick as appetizers!! Everything we ordered was perfection!!! I wish I lived closer. We went twice during our visit and had the same order.

pics.caption: The Lou with sausage and pepperoni.

review.des: For a first timer in Chicago, hearing so many people rave about this place.. I'm not gonna lie. I was very disappointed. It may be the location, but thinking the one that has the most review should be the best out of what, 13 locations.. We ordered the Chicago Classic, we are guessing that they probably just used a half baked one and popped it in the oven or whatever.. Pizza was cold, cheese was not gooey just hard, crust was stale.. I couldn't even finish one slice. Jason, our server, didn't really like his service.. I ordered a Coke and two water. My coke was never brought out.. Just the way he cut our pizza, I really didn't like it.. He didn't even check up on,  us, not even once.. Just a horrible experience. I thought I can end my vacation on a good note with really good deep dish pizza. Sorry Lou Malnati's, you're not authentic Chicago pizza and just hyped.

Lou Malnati's is my favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago. Great atmosphere and good service. Deep dish isn't my go-to pizza style but you gotta try them all. Prices are comparable to other area Chicago deep dish institutions.

A definite must if visiting Chicago.  There are several locations but I always end up at Wells.

The za here is absolutely phenomenal! In fact, my friends and I still talk about how delicious it was months after we visited Chicago for the first time. I have never had a better slice of pizza before in my entire life. The ridiculously long line is most definitely worth the wait. I would wait in that line a thousand times over for another taste of Lou Malnati's! If you're visiting Chicago and looking for a true deep dish pizza experience, then Lou Malnati's is THE place to go!

Decent for a first deep dish experience but tastes very franchised and chain-like.

The cheese is very stretchy and does not taste fresh. The sauce is warm and delish but tastes a bit canned. The crust is dense and oily - sinfully delicious but on the heavier side.

Try to not cut the pizza until right before eating because the bottom of the crust will get soggy from the tomato sauce else wise...

So this is kinda crazy, but we came here for the pizza and left raving about the salad! Don't get me wrong, the pizza was amazing...everything that I wanted a Chicago deep dish pizza to be! (Make sure you get the butter crust!) But we shared a Malnati salad before our pizza came out and it was the best salad I've ever had. I wish I could eat bowls of it every night!
Pizza was worth the wait. It was so delicious and we even took the rest home and tasted even better at home. Just amazing we had the sausage and pepperoni deep dish.

Average pizza, long wait, okay service.  I'm definitely not a fan after having to wait this long for a pizza that wasn't too good.  Thankfully I found better pizza after a few more visits to Chicago.  Only eaten here once, so take the review as a one time experience review.

This is one of my new favorites for Chicago pizza. I've never tried anything but Pizza but its never let me down. Keep in mind, this pizza is SUPER FILLING. I find that we order 1/2 of what we would elsewhere. If you get extra sausage, know you're getting a manhole-cover size disc of sausage over your entire pizza. Two pieces and you will be stuffed!

delicious deep dish pizza
one of my favorite in chicago
highly recommended
if you're visiting the windy city
If you do not mind waiting 2  hours to be seated ...than eat here. Very delicious pizza. Never had real deep dish and enjoyed it very much.

My first Chicago deep dish pizza experience. Other than the fact that I had to wait about 40 minutes for my pizza, it was an amazing experience. Even though the best pizza (overall) is in New York, I get why Chicago deep dish has its fame. Lou Malnati's proved how deep dish pizza should taste... I really like it. I'll visit again on my next trip to Chicago.

My friends and I came here for lunch last Saturday since everyone had raved about this pizza in Chicago.  The wait was about 20 minutes to sit outside.  We were instructed to order the pizza before we sat down, as this will make things more efficient.  We ordered a caesar salad to start, which was good, but the tomatoes in it were a little odd, and a personal pizza of one of their specialties with sausage in it, and a medium sized cheese deep dish. The pizza was such a disappointment. It was not what we were picturing.   No flavor inside the pizza, just stuffed with cheese.  Not to mention the birds outside were EVERYWHERE.  A bird laded on our table 3x and practically sat in our pie on the table.  Needless to say, we did not eat anymore.  This is definitely a tourist trap.  I will stick to my NY-style pizza.

pics.caption: Deep dish stuffed cheese pizza and the small one in the background is one of their specialties with sausage inside. Not impressed

review.des: Awesome pizza for deep dish and thin crust. I often get delivery and it's inexpensive and usually pretty quick
Sorry. Just called 10 mins ago and they state no wait. Then as we checked in it is now a 45 minute wait.  Clearly not worth it and disappointed that they would say this over the phone when not true.
My experience that does not live up to the hype. Many other great Chicago pizza places and at a lower price point.

Awesome food!! We had to wait like 1 hour but Alice, manager, was beyond nice, professional and very attentive. She found a way to make my family feel good and like at home. Service was exceptional and food was amazing!! Definitely, a must to visit place in Chicago

A must in Chi-town.. Love the ambiance in the place, you really get a feeling of Chicago.

Make sure not to over order, just know that you will probably be full after 2 slices of pizza, so don't go overboard haha.

This place delivers as well!

For suburbanites only. Nobody actually eats this garbage except for little league teams and your parents when they come to visit. If you enjoy more cheese than Wisconsin, and more calories than a Cinnabon. By all means eat these saturated and soggy pies.
The crust was way too hard. We got the thin crust and I felt like Red Baron was better. Super disappointed to pay over $20 for bad pizza.

Want to know the place that all of the locals would like to keep secret? The one that wins their vote for Chicago's best pizza... You found it.

We arrived on a Sunday around 1pm and were sat by the nice hostess immediately. It took awhile for the waiter to acknowledge us and then take our orders. He seemed a bit discombobulated, perhaps high on pizza or in a food coma. Either way, he sucked... it was a good thing that I was wow'd by the cheese.

I'm not a huge pizza fan, and I'll disclose and consider that. I chose the personal deep dish lunch special which was $8.95 and included side salad and a soda or unsweetened tea. Since unsweetened is my tea us preference, I was in luck. But if you prefer sweet tea, you'll have to add your own sugar. The side salad came on a tiny plate, piled high of greens, tomatoes, etc. They really should considered a bigger plate. I was a fan of it, but made a mess as I tried to keep it between my mouth and the plate.

The pizza, oh the pizza! The sauce was chunky and topped the pizza. The depth of the pizza was mostly cheese. The cheese was the best part... stringy, gooey, excellent cheese.
