The crust wasn't as thick as you would think, nor was it at all doughy, as some deep dish pizzas are. My husband and daughter split the specialty Malnati Chicago Classic, made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. I tried their pizza, which came with sausage slices. I actually liked their sausage pizza more than my pepperoni pizza, but I didn't taste the butter on the crust. The crust was my least favorite part. We all sort of picked around the crust. My second least favorite part, was the sauce. I wasn't a fan of the chunky sauce, but my daughter fell in love. I scooped the sauce off and she scooped it off of my plate and on to hers. Yeah, love will make you do strange things.

pics.caption: The Lou (it's much better than the signature pizza) we requested a couple of additions to it though

review.des: Amazing!! This pizza is perfection. Flaky buttery crust filled with delicious sauce, tasty sausage and cheese. You will not be disappointed!

This was honestly such a disappointment...after reading all of the reviews raving about the pizza, my friends and I decided to try it out. What a mistake. It was over packed and they told us the wait would be 1.5 hrs, which was pretty true. However the wait was not worth it at all. Upon being seated, they asked us what we would like aside from the pizza we had ordered at the cashier's...we ordered the calimari upon their recommendation. This was the first mistake. It was flavorless without the cocktail sauce they provided on the side. When the pizza came out, they cut it for us and served it for it. The bottom of the crust was extremely hard and did not even really cut with the knife...the flavor was honestly just salty. The cheese stopped being hot really quickly, almost immediate after they served us... so it just turned hard. It was lacking in so many areas..I really was looking forward to Chicago deep dish pizza, but...this was so disappointing. We will give deep dish pizza a try elsewhere.
Good pizza! Incomparable to Giordano's, this place is better. I wish they had the option to add chicken, however, since I am not a fan of sausage or pepperoni - hence, the 4 stars.
Always satisfies. The staff is always nice and friendly, even when dealing with difficult customers!
Always so delicous! SService is great. Simply a must when in Chicago.
I was visiting from San Francisco and I must say hands down this was the best pizza I habe ever had nothing can top Chicago style deep dish pizza
After a long day walking and shopping we were exhausted ,so ended up getting delivery from Lou Malnati's. It made everyone in the lobby and elevator at the Wyndham jealous. Fantastic pizza!

This pizza is the key to my heart. By far the best pizza I've ever had in my life! Sausage, pepperoni, and onion deep dish, well done & uncut is our favorite order. But, the thin crust is phenomenal too!

The deep dish pizza I had was undercooked.  The dough was a tad raw for my taste.  What was cooked was delicious.  For the wait, I'd skip it all together. Their waiting list is a horrible mess.  They claimed to have called me several times.  I was inside and listened carefully.

Update:  Shortly after this review was posted the restaurant attempted to call me back to remediate my not so positive experience.  I appreciated the effort not the attitude and lack of resolution when I returned their call.  My name is not Nicole.
The restaurant was packed but it didn't take the 45 minutes to get sat as informed by the hostess. I tried the deep and dish and it was very good. It is worth a try.

If I reviewed this just on the pizza, I'd give three stars. Sorry, this Chicago-style pizza casserole just isn't my thing -- not a fan of giant chunks of watery tomatoes on top of my pizza. And I like mouth-blistering melty pizza, and this was almost room temperature. But, if you visit Chicago, I think a visit to Lou Malnati's is worth the wait and the money. It's a Chicago experience.
Good pizza great service. Pre ordered pan pizza - everything tastes good esp the Lou salad!

So it was my first time in Chicago and I had to try the Chicago deep dish. Looked up this up and decided it to be the best to try. I was not disappointed at all!
First, make sure whenever you sit down make sure you place your pizza order. It takes about 40 minutes to make.
Second, go ahead and order yourself the cheese bread. It's half a loaf of garlic cheese bread that is a great filler, especially for the price, while you wait.
The pizza itself was delicious I loved every bit of it. It's definitely more of a pie or cake, which is to be expected since it's a deep dish. The layers of meat and cheese and sauce keep you coming back bite after bite. Before you know it you've had two slices and are like geez... I still have another slice left and I'm stuffed.
Deep dish wouldn't be something I would order every time I order pizza. I prefer Sicilian or NY style pizza, but if you want a great deep dish pizza with great cheese bread go ahead and stop in.
Lou!  This pizza is crazy.  It might just be my favorite food.
Amazing pizza, quality waiter. It took a bit of time to get our food but that's to be expected with deep dish.

The buttery crust is a fan favorite and deservedly so, but what makes Lou's so delicious is it's minimalism, a paradoxical assessment of deep dish pizza.  They limit your pizza toppings and it's the right direction.  Savor the quality ingredients instead of sensory overload of too much cheese (Giordanos) or overwrought tomato sauce (Pizzeria Uno).
And the shit just keeps on going.  The most inconsiderate assholes in the neighborhood WHERE THEY DON'T LIVE.
Good deep dish, extremely filling and tasty.  The pizza  takes 35-40 min to cook because that's just the way deep dish is. Service was just ok!!

Being from Queens, NYC...I am really hard on "Other People's Pizza," I am not down with "O.P.P" but since I was in Chi-town, I decided to peep out their beloved Pizza. And I must say, it was really tasty-like a nice twist on the concept of pizza. The service-accommodating and friendly. The decor-nice brick structure with historic art on the walls. The Pizza-really flavorful, hot and cheesy.

**Note: If you are dating a pizza lover then this place is a great introduction to Chi-Town, its history and its deep-dish style pizza.

So, check it....I ordered a peperoni large pie, some rolls and a drink. The rolls were tasty and the pizza was really fulling, you will need a fork the eat this pizza but it's full of flavorful sauce and cheese. I wish that they sold a slice of pizza to try 1st but they don't sale slices because it's made in a dish, which means that if you come here alone, you will be having leftovers-unless you are hungry as hell and can eat what is like the equivalent of two regular pizza pies. So, if you are visiting Chi-town, this place should be on your list of places to dine at.

pics.caption: Tha Yelp Daddy was here! This pizza with the pepperoni is so good!
Nice on a chilly Chi-town afternoon!

review.des: It's everything is in Chicago pizza should be. We had the butter crust. We had 10 crest. We had a deep dish with fun ingredients. Pictures of beers cocktails is a fantastic experience always start off though with a salad or something cause a pizza takes 40 minutes but it's worth the wait.

Lou personal and Malnati personal, ordered!  I thought that the Malnati was better with the sausages.  The Lou with the spinach and mushrooms, made it relatively moist for the pie deep dish.  It watered down the tomato sauce of the pizza.

I do like their buttery, thin and flaky crust!

Service was top notch.  Our server came around plenty of times to see if everything was okay.
My favorite pizza place in Chicago! We've even gone so far as shipping their pizza to family and friends for special events and baby births!

Very good deep dish pizza and desert here! The proportions of the pizza are reasonable, so when you take a pizza for 1 person you can actually finish it! They have good beer and good service, and the price is reasonable.

I don't know what these people are thinking! Had one of the named special Lou pizzas I think and it was just bland and blah and un appetizing. Wow disappointed since people say this is chicago best. I'd rather eat a frozen pizza. Yea I said it. Go somewhere else and try and find something with flavor
My Science! So good! The calamari was legit! The deep dish was amazing! Good ambiance with that classic Chicago charm.

As a traveler on vacation...who planned on enjoying Chicago pizza...this place is meh. I have had Ginos and that was so much better. Definitely not coming back here. Next Chicago vacation trying a different place for really good Chicago deep dish pizza!

This was my first time eating deep dish pizza in Chicago! My friend and I spilt a small pie. Two slices was more than enough to fill us up! I cannot comment on the restaurant location, since we ordered delivery.

Great Chicago Pizza. Well worth the visit and experience.
Very attentive wait staff.
Each pizza takes about 35 minutes to prepare, so I would recommend getting a small salad or something light in the interim.

Tip: to avoid the constant long wait times, I would recommend arriving around 11-11:20am to be seated.

Very friendly and busy place. They know what they're doing here.

Big shout to server Hector. He was very knowledgeable about the business and quality of the food here. This made the experience all the more worthwhile.

This is one of the best deep dish pizzas in the city.
As a native Chicagoan, it's a better option than the others that you hear of around the city.
The salads, butter crust and drinks are all rather delicious.
If it were possible, I'd sleep inside their deep dish sausage pizza like it were a tauntaun in midwinter.

#128
Knowing that most people expect the Giordano's experience when they visit Chicago, I wanted to treat my friends to something different.  I remember Leona's from when I was a kid in the North Side off Belmont, but things have changed in the last few decades, so we thought we should try Lou Malnati's Pizzeria--and it was a great choice!

The line was a bit long, but I always say, "This is a great sign that the food and service are good..."  And, once again, I was right.

The pie was so thick and delicious.  I am used to Zachary's and Star while in the Bay Area, so this reminded me exactly what Chicago deep dish is all about.  Thick, thicker, thickest...

The pie comes so steamy hot that it almost looks dangerous to eat.  The sauce is piled high on top of the multiplicity of cheeses underneath the mile high other toppings.  One piece is really a full meal.  My group ordered appetizers to start and I thought this might be a bad idea, as I remember how filling these Chicago pizzas can be.  But, alas...hungry people with BIG eyes.

Everything was super amazing--but all I really remember is the pizza.  I will dream about that pie for years to come.  

Thank you so much Lou Malnati's for making my trip complete with that PERFECT DEEP DISH.

Stephani Smiles for Lou Malnati's Pizzeria ;)

pics.caption: serving us a slice of true chicago heaven
Looking for a good deep dish pizza here is your place! Hardcore Chicago style

review.des: Im from California, and I have to say this pizza was soo good! The portion was big! I shared a Medium one with another friend and we had 3 more slices left over. It was so good, I ordered a personalized portion and brought it back to Cali for my husband! He loved it too. There is a long wait, but it's worth it!
We went original and were not disappointed. Plain deep dish with cheese. They accommodated our large group (12) as well.
I've had this place and Giordanos, and lou malnatis is hands down waayyy better! The pizza is juicer and the crust is amazing! Get the small pizza, it's perfect for 3 people.
What can I say?  Chicago deep dish at its best.  Waitstaff accommodating, knowledgeable and friendly.  Sausage pizza awesome!!!

Seriously the best pizza I've ever had!  Husband agreed.  We got a slice of cheese pizza as part of our food tour and it was deeelicious!  We tried to go again while visiting Chicago, but it was 1.5 hour wait.  Will try again next time we're in town.

You hear about how Chicago is the home of Deep Dish Pizza.  Chicago has a variety of places to choose from starting with the original Pizzeria Uno, to Gino's East, Giordano's, Chicago's and a whole bunch of others.  When it comes down to the best deep dish, I have to say hands down my favorite is Lou Malnati's!

One of the best attributes to a deep dish pizza from Lou's is its butter crust.  This is definitely what separates Lou's from the rest.  The beer sausage on the sausage pizza only enhances the experience as well as the cheese that covers your favorite pie.

The other night, I was feeling like pizza but not feeling deep dish.  Decided to try their thin crust sausage pizza.  To my amazement, the crust was the same used on their deep dish but just thinner and less cheese.  So if you're thinking about thin crust at Lou's, I would definitely vouch for it.

Lastly, their Lou's salad is definitely the way to start off your meal. Lou's definitely got their mixture right when they created this salad!

A friend of mine from Chicago once shipped me frozen pizzas from here after discovering that I'd never been to Chicago. The frozen cheese pizzas blew my mind so I was pretty eager to try the "real" version. They recommended the chicago classic, which I got (switched out the sausage for poultry though). It takes 45 minutes to come out of the oven (oy) so I opted to get a soup too.

Soup was pretty good. Service was so-so - unimpressive considering how few people were actually at the restaurant. Then out came the pizza in all its glory. I have to admit that I was far less impressed with the classic than I was with the plain old cheese. The crust and dough was absolutely spectacular but the ingredients themselves overpowered the pizza (which by the way is really heavy). I'd recommend sticking to 1 ingredient to really enjoy the flavor.

I love pizza crust (arguably more than the pizza) and their crust was mouthwatering. Worth going just for that! This was the only pizza I had in Chicago so I can't compare but it is worth visiting to try and taste for yourself!

Started with the calamari AFTER we reminded the server we ordered it. Lou Mulnati's is just ok. It comes with cold marinara sauce. You may want to ask for it to be warmed. Pizza is flavorful but I definitely prefer Giordano's over Lou Mulnati's. The salad with creamy lemon garlic dressing was unique. It was the bright spot of the meal.

Part two, the food runner that brought our food to the table spilled my drink all over me. Accidents happen so that is not the issue. The issue is the spill was left on the floor until we were finished eating. The server, Samantha, even came back to the table and didn't say a word or get it cleaned up. The guy at the opposite table slipped. Then the buser came to clear the table and looked at me like, how did I make such a mess. Final straw, they didn't even remove the drink from the bill that was dumped all over me. Horrible,horrible, horrible, customer service with mediocre deep dish pizza.

Very delicious! We came to compare it to Giordano's. Verdict: Giordano's in Navy Pier is better.  However, I did really like this place. I would still come back. We got a free appetizer since we joined their email club, which was awesome. The pizza was less expensive than Giordano's. I would so come back. Service was great. Wait wasn't that long for a table at 8pm on a Sunday evening.  Must try both everyone!

I've heard so many great things about Chicago deep dish pizza but was met with disappointment at Lou Malnati's. I simply didn't see what the hype was about and the flavoring of the pizza wasn't all
too different from say Pizza Hut or Domino's. I really wish this restaurant lived up to my expectations...

We also ordered wings as an appetizer and they didn't blow me away either. Remind me again why there is such a long wait for dinner at this place..?

(Maybe I don't understand the deep dish love?!?!)

We were in town for the weekend and couldn't leave without Chicago-style pizza. Everyone recommended Lou's, but didn't particularly mention a location to hit up. Fortunately, enough we happened to be in the River North area.

We came with no reservations and was anticipating a line. However, we were coming at the end of the lunch rush on Friday afternoon - just as the restaurant started to turn for dinner. We were able to have a peaceful late lunch looking seated next to the upstairs windows. I guess we kind of got lucky with that.

Our eyes were definitely bigger than our stomachs. We ordered the garlic bread appetizer and a medium Malnati's Classic. We had more than enough food for 2 people. Despite our waitress warning us that the pizza usually serves 4 people, we figured we were that hungry. The garlic bread good as greasy, but tomato dipping sauce helped even it all out. The pizza was absolutely delicious and best eaten warm with the ooey-gooey cheese spilling over. I wished we ordered a salad, just so we would feel better about our gluttony.

Packed up the rest of the pizza in a box. Unfortunately, by the time we got back to our apartment the pizza slices had formed into a layered pizza block. Put in the fridge and surprisingly it was delicious cold as well the next day on my flight back. Even if it was cold, it was better than any airport food I could have bought.

What does a girl do when she's in Chicago for a day, but hasn't had a chance to try deep dish pizza?  I stopped by Gino's first and they only served four slices -- taking 40 minutes to make.  I had to catch a flight, so I really wanted a quick deep dish.  Luckily, Lou's was there for me!

They have a personal size (practically a meal) for $6.  It took about 20 minutes to make, which was pretty quick.  It came in piping hot.  I was eating it on my way to the airport in a cab, but it didn't make it any less delicious.  It was cheesy, with chunks of tomato and a crunchy crust.  I highly recommend if you're in a rush.  It was also not that messy, able to eat with a fork if you tried.  Also -- loved that crushed red paper flakes and parm cheese was included.  Thank you Lou for being my first real deep-dish pizza experience in Chi-town!
In Chicago had to try the pizza.  Lou Malnati's does not disappoint.  Service was good and pizza was great.

I don't understand the appeal of Lou Malnati's pizza. The crust is blah at best, the sauce just so-so. It's something that I've been served at corporate events a number of times and always come away wondering why they didn't get one of a number of other local chains instead. This definitely isn't my style of pizza.

Lou Malnati's did not disappoint!! Everyone we spoke to recommended this place to us!! The butter  crust was sooo good!! Ordering the pizza when you check in helps on the wait time. Even on a Saturday night we didn't wait all that long. We will definitely visit again when we come back to Chicago.
Best deep dish I've ever had. The crust is buttery. The sauce is great and the cheese was plentiful without being overwhelming. 10/10 would eat again.

Fairly good pizza, but I don't understand why people make such a big fuss. I like Giordano's quite a bit better, but Lou Malnati's isn't bad either.

To be honest, I prefer deep dish pizza in San Francisco (Patxi's, Little Star) because of the cornmeal crust. Lou Malnati's crust just tastes bland.

This is My girlfriend and my first time in Chicago so we had to get the infamous deep dish pizza. This spot did not disappoint- we had the traditional Lou malnati deep dish pizza added with pepperoni on top. Delicious. Highly recommend this place 5 stars well earned.
I can say the staff were really nice and also I would recommend the buttercrust. The waiting time was 0 mins I would recommend to go on a weekday after 130pm. There was no wait to get in.

Visiting from Ohio & meeting a local friend for lunch, we suggested Uno's for the kids but my friend said no - that's too touristy and not authentic Chicago pizza- he suggested Lou's. So glad he did!
We had the Lou's and a half cheese-half pepperoni and they did not disappoint- loved the buttery crust. The pleasant surprise of the meal? The house salad! My friend ordered the family side for all of us to share, and the home made dressing was amazing! I'm not a big salad eater but I could have filled up on that! Definitely coming back!
Is over 2 hours for delivery acceptable. Unfortunately. Not. Great pizza and product. Horrible delivery system.

This place has fans all the way from San Juan Costa Rica, Cali Colombia, and Mexico City.  Needless to say when family or co workers are visiting from abroad , they are introduced to The Lou. Cust is crispy, ingredients are plentiful, and the favors just blast in your mouth.  Best pizza in town!
The wait was supper long (hour+), and the food was sub-par, would never come again. It took 10 minutes for the waiter to bring the check alone. I would give lower than 1 stars if i could

So I came here after already having a first dinner at a nearby Japanese restaurant.
Why? Because when this LA boy is in Chicago, that means a local shortage of pizza is about to happen to the local market.

Here there was a wait of about 20 minutes or so for a party of one. Big crowd is a good sign!

I took a seat at the bar and the guys behind it took real good care of me. If you're in there, sit at the bar if Justin and Joe are working they give great service, have awesome tips for local places, and are all around goodfella's.

I was chatting up some good friendly local regulars at the bar and laughing a bit louder and longer than I would in LA, thanks to the anti-hero beers, (look for the draft with the green fist tap handle), when my pepperoni personal sized pizza arrived right at the bar for me.

Heaven followed! I mean real taste-bud, eye rolling, temporary loss of consciousness culinary heaven kids!

The tomatoes on top are fresh, not canned. The texture of freshly chopped tomatoes is unmistakable. Yup turns out they use fresh globes for the pies.
The cheese and crust are perfect! Ooey-gooeyness meeting crunch in absolute harmony.
It was a filling dinner for one (not counting my previous dinner only an hour before).

Ladies and gentlemen I've had pizzas from all over the world. When it comes to pizza "pies", Believe me, this place does it the best, and gets a rock-steady, blues harp jammin', sweet home Chicago wailing 5 stars from me.

A Chicago must!

Excellent service and attentive servers. My personal recommendation/favorite is the "Lou" and don't forget to add pepperoni. It compliments the veggies perfectly. The Malnati Chicago Classic is good too but the sausage patty can be a bit overwhelming. They even have the option of ordering half and half of the different kinds of pizza.

4 stars because there's a 45-minute wait for any deep dish pizza. Also, the waiting area is extremely small and often blocks the entrance of the restaurant.

If you're looking for traditional Chicago deep dish pizza, this is the place! Not only is their pizza good, but they have a beer called the 312. Being a Californian, we enjoy the 805 beer. The 312 holds it's own. It's a wheat beer that's easy drinking. The place filled up quickly, service was great, and atmosphere is loud and family style. Perfect Chicago evening spent here!

This place was recommended to me from someone who grew up in Chicago.  He nailed it, this pizza is unbelievable delicious.  I have celiac and was not sure, but the gluten free, thin crust pizza was amazing and I had no side effects.  The wait was ridiculous long-but worth, check in, provide your cell number and preorder your pizza.  Don't forget to check out the Malnati's salad- delicious!  None of the desserts are gluten free, but you won't have room for it anyways.

It was my first time in Chicago and this location had the best review on yelp. It looked very warm and welcoming. The customer service was great wish I could say the same for the food. Wouldn't recommend or revisit.

Sadly this pizza did not live up to my expectation. I visited Chicago with friends we went on a Friday night.

I ordered a small Cheese deep dish, regular crust and added the poultry sausage.
First negative, the poultry sausage was a flat layer of sausage over top the cheese... This was, hmm different and unexpected. I thought it would be sausage pieces.
Second, I felt I got cheated of cheese on a cheese pizza! I guess I had to order extra cheese? I felt there was barely cheese, didn't fall off the spatular and was actually a little cold.
Lastly the dough was too thick.
I did try my friends pizza, she got the Lou Malnati Classic. More cheese on hers!

What I did like was that you can pre order your food. Because there was an hour wait. The pizza was not there waiting on us but I suppose it expedited the process of ordering and waiting.

And the size of a small was defiantly more than enough for one person.  

We ordered margaritas, not strong just fruity.

Really great pizza. One of Chicago's finest establishments. I've been going to Lou Malnati's since we moved to Chicago.

It doesn't get much better than Lou Malnati's. As a matter of fact, I don't know if we've had better pizza than Lou's.
Amazing pizza and excellent customer service. Order the sausage and mushroom deep dish- best in town!

This was such a disappointing experience. A trip to chicago requires deep dish pizza. All that ooey-gooey cheesy goodness!  It's the stuff dreams are made of! Amiright!?

When your salivating pizza desires are crushed with mediocre pizza, it can nearly send you into a depressing downward spiral. That might be a bit dramatic, but only slightly.

Let's start with the crust. I feel like Chicago pizza crust has hopes and dreams of stardom, but our crust somehow settled for middle management in a polo shirt.

Our pizza lacked saucy goodness that demands you eat it with a fork and knife. If asked I'll deny this, but I actually picked it up in my hand and ate it like a regular piece of pizza. Gasp!!!

This is merely speculation, but I am pretty sure our pizza was frozen. We ordered a sausage, pepperoni, onion, and green pepper pie. Our server said it would take extra time to cook with the extras on it. We didn't care. (We're wild and crazy) When our pizza arrived the pepperoni, onion, and peppers were cooked on top and the sausage inside. The sausage itself was one thin patty and the diameter of the pizza. It was weird, to say the least.

Such a let down. If you are looking for good pizza, you can do so much better. Skip the touristy chains and go for the real deal!!!

Deep dish pizza was on my mind before I even hopped on the plane from Vegas to Chicago. Just like in New York, Chicago is no exception when it comes to pizza joints battling out to claim themselves as the best pizzeria for deep dish. Fortunately, based on the helpful suggestions of several locals, my friends and I chose Lou Malnati's as our culinary introduction to Chicago.

We came here on a Sunday evening when the pizzeria was bustling, and we placed an order in advance for "The Malnati Chicago Classic."

A half-hour later, we were seated upstairs in a windowless dining room along with 30 or so other diners. It's not the best ambiance, but the service and the food make up for it. I was expecting our pizza to be ready by the time we were seated, but we had to wait an additional 20-25 minutes -- what was the point of placing an order? To prevent ourselves from becoming hangry, we requested a few appetizers.

Caesar Salad with Chicken: Tomatoes on a Caesar Salad? Odd, but judgments aside, this was a good salad to start off dinner.

Calamari Fritti: Fried deliciousness, and not at all chewy! It was a hit at our table.

The Malnati Chicago Classic: Worth the wait! The sauce was perfect and didn't have that prominent acidic flavor. Not being a fan of sausage toppings on my pizza, I digged the sausage on ours. The cheese was nice and stringy, and the garlic Buttercrust was perfect and not hard to bite into.  

Service: As busy as the evening was, our server did an awesome job.

Overall: Having been a first-time visitor to Chicago, Lou Malnati's made a lasting impression. From a tourist's perspective, it's definitely a pizzeria that I'd recommend to others who are staying within the area. You can't go wrong.
It was ... okay. I love deep dish pizza, so I was a little disappointed when I had this after being told they're the best,

A few weeks ago, I took my first trip to Chicago.

From all of my friends, I heard that Lou Malnati's was the place to go for deep dish in Chi-town.

I must say, it did not disappoint. The first night there, upon arrival, I picked up the "Lou" and took it back to the hotel. It hit the spot and was a great midnight snack. It was a slice of pizza heaven.

So, the second night, we ordered and had the "Lou" delivered to the room.

Finally, on my third night, I figured it'd be good to have it fresh so enjoyed the "Lou" at the restaurant and had an order of wings for good measure.

So, so, so good.

Deep dish pizza is one of those things you HAVE to try when you're in Chicago! I heard this is the best deep dish place in the city so we decided to try it! My husband and I came here for lunch and got super lucky by getting seated right away!! Literally 5 minutes after we got seated, a crazyyy rush of people came in and their wait time was about 45 min to an hour.

We shared a small Malnati's Chicago Classic pizza which comes with lean sausage, tomatoes and cheese. We also added garlic for an additional charge.

It takes about 30-40 minutes for them to make your pizza since each one is made fresh. I can't imagine having to wait that long to get seated, and then waiting that long AGAIN for your food. Geez, I'd be HANGRY! I think they might have some option to pre-order your pizza though?

This is definitely a fork and knife kind of pizza. My husband really enjoyed the pizza (he is a total pizza fan) but I, on the other hand didn't really like it too much. The cheese, once 10 minutes or so passed, had a super rubbery texture and it was hard to chew. The crust/dough was also not good at all! Way too hard and flavorless. The pizza is also VERY filling since it's so thick. The small is definitely more than enough for 2 people to share. Overall, this pizza was just A-OK in my opinion. Not something I would crave or want again, but you have to try it at least once if you're in Chicago!

AMAZE-BALLS!!!! My first ever Chicago Deep dish pizza was incredible. Not only did the we get the classic deep dish but we ordered the bruschetta...fan-freaking-tastic!...and the BBQ chicken salad....knocks your socks off!  If you're in chicago you need to go here!!
I like to get my Chi-Town Deep Fish fix when ever I'm in town. I can only handle 2 slices!! The better of the 3 major Deep dish chains in the Chi.

A must when you're in Chicago.

The difference between Lou's and gio's is that Lou's is a thick piZza with toppings on top whereas gio's is like lasagna essentially with all the toppings in the middle. Make sure you get the butter crust!!!

Pizza takes forty five minutes to cook.

Lou's salad is delicious. The thin pizza is also really delicious too!!!

Butter crust!!!!!

Tasty pizza, but terrible service. The wait for pizza was an hour plus, so we decided to get a drink at the bar. My buddy was denied a drink, despite being sober at totally in control. The rest of the party was also denied drinks based on this. Bartender Bobby was not at all accommodating and resulting in an overall very negative experience.

Go elsewhere if you want to be treated like a human...

I'm from out of town.  Wanted some Chicago Deep Dish.  I ordered the small Chicago classic.  It was okay, nothing to rave about.  I've had better deep dish in Dallas Texas.  Ordered the small, ate three slices.  Felt okay when I left, but about 20 minutes later my stomach felt as if I ate an entire large.  Decided to take a hour nap to sleep it off.  Woke up later with a bad headache and stomach still hurting.  Had to throw up to relieve some of the pain.  Terrible night.

Best Chicago deep dish pizza I've tried in the area. I've tried deep dish pizzas from other restaurants as well, but their butter crust ones are still the most delicious. I have ordered takeout from them multiple times, and I've dined in as well. I've enjoyed my pizza every single time. Definitely worth the wait.
Even though it's a chain they don't mess around. This is some great pizza. Family owned! Excellent ingredients. The sauce is awesome.
Brilliant Chicago style pizza in a place with a great vibe.  Looking forward to going back - loved it.

Very disappointed!  I could have gotten the same or better pizza a Pizza Hut. I ordered a small personal size pepperoni pizza. The pizza literally had to be patted with a napkin to remove all the water, I assume from the tomatoes and I had a hard time even finding the pepperoni. Crust was so dry it fell apart when cut. Definitely would not recommend or go again.

I'm from California so I was excited to try my first ever Chicago deep-dished pizza. After doing some intense research on the internet, Lou Malnati's seemed like the #1 place to go to. However, I wasn't too impressed.

Food: Pizza orders take about 30-40 minutes to make so you definitely want to order an appetizer if you're hungry. We ordered the 3 dip appetizer. I liked the spinach artichoke the most out of the roasted garlic, spinach artichoke and hummus. As for pizza goes, I ordered a personal Lou pizza (spinach, mushrooms, roma tomatoes) and added pepperoni. I felt like my pizza was a bit too greasy and the crust was really hard, making it difficult to bite into.

Service: Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. He constantly checked if we needed anything (food/order wise). We also asked him about the night life in the area and he was kind enough to write us a list of suggestions of where to go!

Service included, I would probably rank Lou's with four stars but the food itself was okay (The ranking I gave was purely on the food because that's what Lou Malnati's is famous for =P). I tried Giordano's the next day and I liked Giordano's pizza a lot more. But overall, I really don't know what the hype for deep dish pizzas is all about.

I was visiting Chicago for work and figured it was only right to try deep dish pizza while in Chicago. So I found a Lou Malnati's near by and went in for dinner. It was packed!! A very long wait, luckily there was one seat left at the bar. I had drink and ordered my pizza... overall really good pizza but I went in with what I think was unrealistic expectations for my deep dish pizza and was expecting something out of this world. Don't give me wrong, it's really good deep dish pizza but I thought it was a doughy and not the best I've had.
So overrated.   Soggy pizza and crazy long wait.  I've had much better pizza in Chicago. Service was so so.

After trying Giordao's, I have to say that this pizza didn't wow me. Lou Malnati makes a thinner deep dish, which means less cheese and sauce. If I want a thinner deep dish, then I would much rather go for an authentic Italisn pizza. But for a deep dish pie, the deeper the better.

I rarely give 5 stars,but this has place has amazing food and great customer service.   I mean they do always mess up my order but always take care of us after.  It is tough waiting 2 hours for pizza. But their service at this location makes up for it. Just hoping we will less mess ups for the remainder of football season.
It's a toss up between Gino's east and malnati's for me. I think I'd go personal deep with Gino's and large deep to share with malnati's Uno's was my first love, but it can be hit or miss.
Deep dish deep dish, you never disappoint! Thanks for a delicious pizza and I must say I was surprised, the service was very good! Didn't make you feel like a pizza restaurant. Will be back!
This may very well have been the best pizza I have ever had. It was like eating an authentic Italian meal on crust.

So called "the best" Chicago pizza in CHICAGO. We sat and waited 25-30 minutes (after pre-ordering) and another table that got here 10 minutes after we got here just got their pizza. That's just plain RUDE. I brought it up to the waitress and she didn't have anything to say. We only came here because friends told us to. This place is hyped up and is not what it is expected to be. Bad service and a long wait is what you're getting yourself into. Sorry, not worth it.
Service was attentive and helpful!!! But, about the testy of pizza and soup, it is not good as some people told me!! Maybe it was the kind of taste that I don't like - sausage!!!
They have the best crust!  So delicious and buttery, and while I don't usually like sausage, theirs is great.

After some careful consideration, I have dropped down the number of stars this place deserves from four to two.  There are many reasons for this, and I will elaborate.  

The GF and I came here at a not so busy time; after lunch, but no quite time for dinner.  We were seated in the back room with two other parties, despite plenty of room in the front.  Our server greeted us and took our drink orders.  We looked at the menu and decided on the spinach stuffed bread and the small pepperoni and mushroom deep dish pizza.  Our server told us the pizza would take 45 minutes to bake.  At first, I thought he was joking, but soon realized he was serious.  45 minutes for a pizza to cook is a bit excessive.  It is a really good way to get customers to order more food though.  By the time they finish eating all the appetizers and salads, they will be too full for the pizza.  

The stuffed spinach bread came out in less than ten minutes.  It tasted great, maybe because we were so hungry.  The bread was soft, and as you ripped a piece off, cheese oozed out.  It was seasoned perfectly, and was devoured in a quicker time than it did to bake the thing.  

The pizza did in fact take nearly 45 minutes to make its way to our table.  By now, the dining room had filled up quite a bit.  The pizza tasted good, but the amount of time waiting, really hyped up my expectations.  The expectations fell short once reality hit.  It was just an average tasting pizza once the high wore down.

For dessert, we shared the chocolate chip pizza.  We decided to tell our server to put the order in while we were still eating the pizza for fear that it would take forever to come out.  Good thing we did though, because it did take quite a bit of time.  The heat from the cookie paired perfectly with the cold ice cream.  

In conclusion, I clearly did not enjoy waiting 45 minutes for my pizza even when there were hardly any other patrons dining.  I just can't seem to fathom that it actually takes that long for the pizza to cook.  It is absolutely mind boggling.  They were pretty stingy on the toppings too.    As my first deep dish experience in Chicago, this place was a let down.  One up side of our experience was that the service was great, and our guy was super friendly and helpful.  

I would recommend going to Pequod's Pizzeria instead, which we tried the next day.  Their pizza was hands down the best pizza I have ever had.  It took less than half the time for their pizza to make its way to our table.

I had my Lou's delivered and it was fast and fresh. We got a large deep dish and we where able to eat off of it for 2 days. It reheats great. The crust along the top was crispy and there was plenty of cheese. The flavors are amazing. We just had pepperoni but it tasted like the world was on it. You must go and experience for yourself.
Had the "Lou" pizza with spinach, mushroom, garlic, and tomatoes. Pretty darn tasty. Cool vibe.
My favorite deep dish pie in the city! Buttery crust, great sauce and high quality cheese and toppings. I wanted to have my wedding rehearsal dinner here, but they don't take reservations.
Any location works for me!  Love their deep dish and famous Malnati salad.  Prices are reasonable for the awesome food!

A quintessential Chicago pizza experience. While we had to wait a while (Monday night), the pizza was incredibly delicious and affordable. Well worth the wait, and the money. We each (4 of us) had two pieces - both vegetarian and meat - and were full.

Well I finally tried the famous deep dish pizza of Chicago!!! I loved every layer of it; sauce, toppings inside the pizza, cheese, and crust blended perfectly together every time I took a bite. I ordered a medium sized pan but was full after eating two slices.

Another dish that people should order are their barbelou wings!!! One of the best wings I've ever had. It was cooked with just the right amount of tenderness, crunchiness, and sauce.

I came here during lunch on a weekday but didn't have an issue getting seated or difficulty with service. My waitress/server was very helpful in giving us suggestions and was willing to have a conversation with us despite it being a little busy. Lou Manalti's you guys are awesome.
Had them deliver to my hotel room. Delivery was pretty quick. There is even a tracking. The pizza was on point. Anyone coming to Chicago should give it a try.

In terms of deep dish pizza, this is pretty good. But I am not gonna lie to you, I haven't had much experience with this type of pizza. I am more of the nyc thin slice type of gal. The butter crust here really puts it over the top for me. I am not the biggest fan of the wine menu though so -1. Also, I heard other places are better. But I have yet to try them. I will compare to other Chicago deep dish places at some point and let y'all know.

This Lou Malnati's location is spacious and looks like a classic family style restaurant. The walls are adorned with Chicago sports memorabilia, really giving it that hometown flare.
As for the pizza, it was delicious. No argument about it. We ordered The Malnati Chicago Classic and added some onions and hot giardinera to it. Everything complimented itself in this pie, and the crust had a solid doughy bite. I would have wanted just a little more sauce though.
Because I had not tried any other Chicago style pizza at the time I tried Lou Malnati's I felt it wasn't fair to give it the full five stars. Plus, the server waiting our table was not as attentive as he could have been. Other than taking our order and bringing our food, he checked on us maybe about one more time. It was somewhat busy and I understand but I noticed other tables were getting just a little more attention than ours.
All in all, this is one pizza chain everyone should try. There's a reason why people wait around to get a table.
No really sure why everyone goes crazy for this place. The pizza is not great and its very touristy af.

I've dreamed for YEARS about what my first Chicago deep dish was going to be like. After carefully browsing through yelp, I narrowed it down to Lou Malnati's. The pictures looked fantastic, reviews were good, I had a friend confirm its authenticity - I was sold.

But when the pies came out... I prepared myself for disappointment... which was confirmed after taking my first bite:
1) It was not as thick as I had expected - thus, lacking in the sauce and cheese department
2) Their famous "buttercrust" was actually pretty bad... I remember I just picked off the top and discarded the crust

Now, you might think I just don't like deep dish pizza. It's actually the exact opposite. I wanted to like deep dish pizza SO MUCH I gave it a second chance after this first failure. And thank god I did, because Giordano's deep dish was the best way to end my weekend in Chicago. It was exactly as I expected, the sauce was tastier, meats were better, and I actually ate the crust hah.

I want to add that maybe I had a poor experience because I was brought upstairs to a weird/shady area of the restaurant instead of in the main area. There was also a separate kitchen catering to the top floor. 2 of my friends found weird stuff in their soda too... So maybe just avoid going upstairs at Lou's.

pics.caption: why does mine look so thin??? i ordered deep dish =X
combo platter appetizer with mozzarella sticks, mushrooms, zucchini, cheese balls

review.des:
Just your typical chain pizza.... but it kills.
This pizza makes me cry (deep dish), only bummer is the wait time.

TRY THIS. Super touristy but so worth it!

45 min wait for pizza.
Wrong Pizza comes not cold but not too far from it, with an explanation that waitress didn't hear us well,  we had to take it due to wait time or wait another 45 min for a different pizza. Asked for forks for a different dish I ordered since pizza came with things I don't eat and waitress forgot about it so we shared forks.
Not a good experience at all.

It was Wednesday night and we got our name and number down. We walked around the city for about an hour and a half before our table was ready. The pizza was good and pretty cheap, only $20 to share between 3 people. It was filling enough for us. I would have liked the cheese to be more melted, but everything was solid and sturdy. Another place that I'll be swinging by if I ever come back to Chicago. Lots of other pizza places that I'll need to try as well. 1 pizza in the 4 days I was there wasn't enough.
First time having the original deep dish and I love it! The service was great and the Italian margarita was delicious.

Very good deep dish pizza. Personal size looks pretty small but it's filling. My boyfriend got the small (larger than the personal) and he was pleasantly stuffed, as he's a huge pizza fanatic. He says it's great pizza and he's from NYC, so I think it's opinion holds some weight. If you want some Chicago deep dish, you can't go wrong here!

pics.caption: Small individual cheese and garlic pizza. Missing a piece to give you an idea of the depth.

review.des: We are visiting Chicago from Florida so of course we had to try deep dish pizza. Everyone recommended this place. I had the Lou's (which is the veggie option) & my husband had the classic (it was the meat option). The personal is really small. You'd need two of those to be satisfied. So we ordered a small on top of that. I gotta say, I had my hopes up too high because this tasted like ordinary pizza. Nothing special about deep dish pizza. At least not at this place. And we paid $70!
Very good food if you like Deep Dish Pizza.  Otherwise, just decent.

What I got:
Malnati Chicago Classic
The Lou's

What I thought:
Rated as one of the top (if not the top) deep dish pizza joint in Chicago so it's a must try.

I came here with a fairly large group so we ordered 2 medium sized deep dish pizzas and it really hit the spot! Flavors were definitely on point and serving sizes were perfect as well.

The Malnati Chicago Classic is made with their Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on a butter crust. This was probably my favorite of the two. Can never go wrong with a classic meat pizza.

The Lou's is more of a veggie style. I believe it had cheese, spinach, and mushrooms? Not bad either, but I'm a meat on pizza kind of guy so it wasn't my favorite.

All the toppings tasted fresh and the crust was crisp as can be. One thing about Malnati's is that even though it is a deep dish pizza, it holds together very well. I've been to several other deep dish pizza places where the entire pizza just falls apart when you eat it, but at Lou Malnati's the pizza is well composed. At other places, don't even think about picking it up and eating it with your hands, you need a knife and fork, but at Malnati's you can pick it up perfectly find and the crispy delicious buttery crust holds everything together like a champ!

There's a few locations down in Chicago, so if you get a chance swing by and grab a bite of their famous pizza with that buttery crust!

Each time I've been to Chicago we make a point of having pizza at a different place.  I've been to 2 of the Gino's East and had thin and deep dish, Uno's and another place who's name escapes me right now but I have to say my favorite is Lou's.  

If you've never had a deep dish in Chicago then I'd have to say try this place first.  Overall the quality of Lou's is in my opinion just better than the others I have tried before.

You have to kind of keep in mind that some of these places can get pretty busy with lines and when you do get seated you have to be prepared for a wait depending on the type of pizza you order.  Some of the larger pies can take upwards of 45 minutes to prepare before they are brought over to your table.  In fact, your server will probably warn you so you are aware that preparing made to order pies take a while.

We ate outside because it was a nice day.  I was facing south so I had a view of the EL and the Merchandise Mart.  

I had ordered the sausage deep dish.  The crust was perfect.  It was right up the side of the pan like a wall to hold in the goodness.  Lou's sauce is my favorite as well.  They put the right amount on top and the consistency is just right.  That is important to me especially because my wife doesn't like sauce that is too acidic.  

Basically if you want to tour Chicago's deep dish restaurants, variety is a nice way to go but personally I prefer this place above the others I've had before.  I will eventually try more places but this one so far has been my favorite.

Visited Chicago for the first time a couple weeks ago, we were told Lou Malnati's was the best place to go in the area we stayed. It was right up the street from our hotel! (We ate here twice over a 3 day weekend).

Service was great, pizza was delicious and dessert was the perfect ending to our trip. We can't wait to return!

THE BEST PIZZA EVER!!!  We had an awesome deep dish one night, and went back the next night for an equally awesome thin crust.  The deep dish pizzas take nearly an hour to make, so they have you order your as you check in.  Smart!! We didn't have their dessert pizza, which I understand is some sort of chocolate chip cookie and I'm told not to be missed. Oh well, next time!

We took a city tour where our guide dissed Lou's and said this other place by the Willis tower was the best in town (don't remember the name now, sorry).  After we visited the tower (tip: go there early to avoid huge lines!), we stopped by for a drink, and the place was not that busy, and the deep dish looked so so.  I suspect that our tour guide was getting a kickback to plug the place to visitors.

Lou's is ALWAYS packed!  What does that tell you?  I've also heard locals say that it's the best.

This review was written based on the Gold Coast location, it's much larger and more modern than the original location, but either way, deep dish or thin crust, their pies ARE NOT TO BE MISSED!!

One star for the worst service! We put our name in and "pre-ordered" our deep dish. We waited about 45-50 minutes to be seated. We were under the impression that the pre-order meant the pizza was timed to go in the oven while you wait. Not the case! They don't put the pizza in until AFTER your seated. This saves virtually no time. On top of it all, they gave us the wrong pre-order ticket and got our dessert order incorrect. The table next to us had the exact same problem. As for the food, the deep dish was disappointing. Cheese was too thick and didn't love the flavor. UNOs is better and I can get that back in Boston. This was a no-go for me

This was our first real deep dish pizza experience. We had the stuffed spinach bread - chewy and cheesy, the "Lou" and the Malnati Chicago Classic™. Overall, the bread was awesome but the pizza was OK. I was not a fan with the crust (very hard) and preferred the New York style thin crust. Later, I found out that you were not supposed to order the personal size.

Staff were very nice. Since we came during the off-peak, we were able to be seated very quickly.

The one time that I tried this place while staying in Chicago, I personally liked their pies a lot. Having grown up on NY style pizza, it took a bit of a mental adjustment to accept this. The way I got around this psychological block was by not thinking about this as pizza. Instead, think of it as what it is: a savory pie.

My wife (a true New Yorker) had trouble making this adjustment, so she wasn't super amused by this Chicago treat. I, on the other hand, found it quite delicious, although the crust was definitely a bit too hard. What I've been told by a couple of Chicago buddies is that when you order the personal sized pizza, the crust tends to be a bit more firm. I was able to confirm this at two other places after this one, where we got the sharing-sized pizzas.

I must also mention the stuffed bread appetizer. It was good in so many ways. Packed and oozing with delicious cheese and spinach, surrounded by a buttery crust...I could come back here just for this.

pics.caption: Stuffed Spinach Bread. Just get it. Do it!

review.des: The pizza here was amazing. The deep dish was so good and the Italian sausage (very authentic). A hostess accidentally gave our order to the wrong table and they reciprocated by giving us a free pizza in regards to waiting for another one. Now that's CUSTOMER SERVICE!
Best deep dish pizza! Never had a bad pizza from Lou's. I like the cheese crust is excellent lots of cheese and crush tomatoes. Would highly recommend.

I came here with my mom and sisters after hearing good things about it while in Chicago from locals. We had tried Uno the day before. I personally liked Lou's better than Unos, but both were delicious.

The wait was so long and we were starving by the time we sat down. Even though we put our order in at arrival we had to wait almost 45 minutes for our pizza. They were busy of course.

Definitely go if you have the time, but don't go super hungry because you're going to have to wait!

Locals may not eat deep dish pizza all that much, but our local friends in Chicago took us here.

I'm craving that pizza as I write this review. The deep dish pizza we had was absolutely delicious. I liked that the crust at the bottom wasn't soaked with grease as it has been at some other places. The pizza arrived steaming hot and delicious.  We took some slices home and they heated up very well!

Thin crust pepperoni  Holy pizza Gods  
The most delicious, buttery crust, heavenly slice you will put in your mouth! I promise! Definitely getting it again...THIS WEEK!
My very first authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. Fork and knife are needed but I just used my hands. So yummy. I am a fan of this place! you will need to share it with a few people.
Not a fan. Feel no difference with frozen pizza that I can get from any store. Waiting for more than an hour which is absolutely not worthy.

Meal 1 in Chitown deep dish pizza......duhh.

My thoughts... solid tasting pizza just not what im used to. Eating NY style pizza for nearly 30 years will result in quite a bias. To me deep dish is Sicilian or pizza hut. Now this is much better than pizza hut im sure even though I was probably 10 the last time I ate pizza hut. The beef I have with this style pizza is 1. it just seems super rich an unhealthy and 2. you cant just get a slice. In NY when your running low on time, rushing to catch a train or what have you, being able to just grab that slice and go is key. Also a classic NY slice will run 300-350 calories. One of these baby pizzas will cost you over 800.

Still giving four stars here though. It was delish and service was friendly. I will just stick to my roots.

As a native New Jerseyan, and frequenter of NYC, I feel confident in my knowledge of proper pizza. That being said, Lou Malnati's was the absolute worst pizza I've ever had in my entire life. That honor used to belong to the Little Italy section of Cleveland. I have no idea where these positive reviewers are from, but they clearly don't know pizza. Don't waste my time with "But it's Chicago style." No. Just no. I was given a plate of crust with a cheese and sauce swamp on top of it. To top it off, it had no taste whatsoever. This putrid pie was complimented by tremendously slow service. I occasionally wake up in the middle of the night with PTSD episodes of this horrible horrible pizza.

This is a tourist pizza stop for peeps that are "non-residents" to Chicago. I have had my fair share of trying mom n pop spots and prefer them over LM. Their pizza is good but I've had better. The service was great but I would probably suggest checking out other pizza joints in Chicago.

We stopped by this location as it was in the area close by the Doughnut Vault to pick up a small 9" pizza for two, which consisted of 4 slices of pizza.  It took 30 minutes to make from the moment you place the order, so we were lucky to have one person in the car (street parking is $2 per 30 minutes or so) and the other person waiting for the food.We chose to sample their Chicago's Classic Small Pan deep dish with butter crust for ~$16 and thought the toppings were just A-OK.  The crust definitely won us over, but the presentation and toppings did not blow us out of the water. We picked to have lunch at the Millennium Park close by, so maybe if we dined in next time our opinion will change.

pics.caption: Hi! I'm in front of Lou Malnati's store front :)

review.des:
Such high ratings for this place... But i wasn't super impressed.

I called the order in advance, which was super easy and the guy was super nice. That was the one really positive note.

I got there a little after 1pm. It was busy but not crazy in the restaurant. But the staff still seemed frazzled. (maybe lunch rush was crazy right before) I waited at the cash register about 10 minutes with only 2 other people waiting and 3 staff standing by the register talking. 2 or 3 more people come in and were a bit more pushy and the hostesses helped them over the couple of us already waiting, which wasn't super fair.

I ordered The Lou - since vegetarian. Based on the description of spinach, mushroom and mozzarella, I expected this to be more like a creamy alfredo or blanca pizza. It wasn't at all what I expected. The buttercrust I thought would be airy and light.. it was crisp and crunchy. There wasn't very much sauce on the pizza (good because it wasn't soggy by the time I got back to the office, bad because I didn't taste too much pizza sauce). The cheese was mostly cheddar. I didn't taste any garlic.. Honestly this pizza reminded me of when I was in grade school and use to take english muffins with canned tomato sauce and cheddar cheese and pop them in the toaster oven for a bit... tasted about like that... It was okay.. but I definitely don't think it is 5 star pizza. And I really don't think my personalized size pizza was justified for the $10 price tag on it. It was just so-so.
Best pizza in Chicago. Everyone is getting good pizza when they come out here. Good beers and a friendly team. Highly recommended!

It was my mom's first time to Chicago, and we knew deep-dish had to be part of the agenda. I had been to Gino's East before, but thought maybe I'd try another of the popular joints. This wasn't too far from our hotel, so my mom and I dropped by for lunch. We ended up waiting about 15-20 minutes, so not bad. In fact, you can pre-order your pizza at a counter so that it's baking while you're waiting/getting seated. I was STILL in line when we actually were seated, so I didn't even get to put in my order.

We ordered the spinach salad and the Lou's special, which has spinach and tomato. Spinach salad was delicious - came with lots of freshly sliced strawberries, goat cheese, and a balsamic vinaigrette.

The pizza was super disappointing. The crust was yeasty and underdone, I believe, and not as buttery flavored as I would have imagined it would be. It was pretty bland and actually...quite healthy tasting. Normally I have one slice of deep dish and that is ENOUGH. My mom and I ended up finishing a small pizza.

Maybe we ordered the wrong thing. The fact that there was no sauce made this literally cheese, spinach, tomatoes, and crust. It wasn't very well seasoned, so perhaps a more traditional pizza from here would be better. However, it's not helpful to call something a special if it's not very good.

We ended up going to Gino's the next day and that was definitely a much more delicious pizza.

pics.caption: Previous customers had used sugar packets to make it level. Actually, a screw was loose so I used my hand to tighten it a bit.

review.des: Realllllllly long wait, we expected it though. Pizza was good, our server was nice. We preordered our pizza so that we didn't have to sit as long once we got to our table.

When you visit Chicago you have to have real deep dish pizza! That is not up for arguments or question. Lous gave me exactly what I was hoping for in a chicago style pizza. My boyfriend brought me here on our last day in the city and I was not disappointed. The building is rather average and seemingly small. Once inside it expands into a back room as well so it offers more space that you would expect. But due to high demand if their oh so gooey pizza it's pretty packed with tables and a full bar.
The place was hoping when we got there so we had to wait for about 15 minutes before we were sat. Which was fine. But once sat our sever was Kady and she was great! So busy but was definitely on her toes and was keeping up well.
My boyfriend and I ordered a glass of wine each and decided to split an order of fried cheddar cheese balls, on my request. They came out nice and warm served with marina sauce, and they were very good! A good option other than just motz sticks. We ordered our pizza, a small deep dish with sausage, onion, spinach, garlic, basil and tomato sauce. It came out fresh out of the oven and was sliced right at our table and plopped hot and oozing with cheese onto our plates for us! If this wasn't Chicago style deep dish then I don't know what is? This pizza was so good and very flavorful. I'm a crust lover and boy did their buttercrust make me happy. Crunch and semi salty and butter, couldn't have been better!
If you're looking for awesome Chicago style pizza this is the place to find it!

pics.caption: Ooey and gooey and so good!

review.des: Great deep dish pizza! No reservations so you need to leave your name and wait. They'll text you when you're tables ready. You can also pre order your pizza which is smart. Good customer service too. Highly recommend for first timers in Chicago!

We waited an hour for a small pizza in which we devoured it in less than 15mins, but it was worth the wait even tho we were rushing to John Hancock for our ride at the tilt....I dunno what promotion they had that day on July 5 but we got a small deep dish pizza (chicago style) for only $9 including tax, what a friggin deal!!!!!!!

The pizza wasn't as saucy and gooey as I expected but it was still delicious and I loved the carmelized cheese on the crust

A small was good enough for 2 people

Very good authentic Chicago deep dish. Solid pizza menu with basic salads. Service can sometimes be hit or miss. Deep dish is the winner here, thin crust is not noteworthy. A tad on the pricey side for the portion size.
Gram, Papa, Gavin and I had the deep dish pizza!  It was well worth the wait.  Our waitress was great too!

My first order of business when landing in Chicago was to eat a Deep Dish Pizza.  I was given the tough decision of choosing which place to try a deep dish in a city where everything is the "Best Deep Dish in Chicago!" and decided on Lou Malnati's based off of the overwhelming amount of positive reviews.

I was not disappointed! For a starving group of 6, we were seated within minutes (around 4PM on a Wednesday) and decided to get two of their most popular deep dishes, the Chicago Classic and the Lou. I will warn you, the large is LARGE. We had originally ordered both of those pizzas in a Large but after taking a look at the neighboring table's humongous pizza, we decided to change the Lou to a medium. In hindsight, we should've just ordered both as a medium but the leftovers do make a good midnight snack.

They warned us that it takes about 45 minutes to make; big SIGH as we were so hungry after our long flight, but it is well worth the wait! The crust that they use is delicious and has a sweet flavor to it and both the pizzas hit the spot, but after eating just 1 slice of the Chicago Classic, I couldn't finish the second Lou slice.

Definitely would recommend the pizza here and was one of the best meals I had in Chicago!

pics.caption: A slice of The Malnati Chicago Classic.

review.des: It's been around forever because it is the absolute best. Always consistent, always perfect. The pizza shop that in fact, puts New York to shame.
Best deep dish in Chicago - love this place!!! They have great booster seats for kids or infants with car seats; I was impressed! Service is great - try the salad also - it's a winner!

Upon visiting Chicago, Lou Malnati's was the highly touted deep dish spot that we wanted to try. I don't know what it was when we went.. If it was too busy, they were understaffed, or for some reason that escapes me, but our experience was less than par that left a sour taste in my mouth. The wait was expected, but what wasnt was the seating of multiple 4 tops before my party even though we clearly put our name down first. It was only until I went inside and ask the hostess about it was when we finally got a table. Maybe it was really coincidental that our table just came up when I decided to ask, who knows.

Next our server took an exceedingly long time to take our order. Now my qualm is not with her service, but the speed of the service. She herself was extremely nice and helpful, but it seemed that she was second guessing and taking her sweet time despite the rush. We put our order in before we were seated per request of the hostess in the beginning, and was told by our server that it would take 15 minutes to come out. IT TOOK AN HOUR. Tables around us got theirs before us, and to top it off, it was WARM. It was cooled to the point that I was able to pick up the metal pan with my bare hand and the inside most of the pizza was cold. They reheated it for us and gave us a free dessert, but by no means did it compensate for the time we lost waiting for a table and our pizza. We didn't account for the extra hour that we lost instead of exploring Chicago's secrets.

Maybe our experience was a bad one, and I hope no one else has to wait that long for anything here. If you do go, set aside an ample amount of time for the waits.

My family and I are visiting from Ohio. We ordered a couple of pizzas through grubhub, and when the delivery person came there was only one. As soon as a manager at Lous found out, they called me to say that they're making a fresh pie for us, and even called grubhub to have them refund the missing pizza. The service was wonderful, and the pizza even better!

This place changed my mind about Chicago style deep dish pizza!
The wait is extremely long but the service, pizza, atmosphere are outstanding!

Omg.......... Amazing pizza.. Long long wait with a great solution of ordering before you're seated. Beer on tap. TV around the bar. Lots of seating and great for families/ parties.
This pizza was highly recommended and it did not disappoint. Two pizzas.. 4 beers ... $50. Such a great deal.

After a business meeting today, settled into my hotel room and order the pasta dish Penne Ala Malnati and specifically asked for butter/olive oil for the bread that accompanied the meal.  Meal arrived an hour later to my hotel room without butter, without utensils, without napkins and if there were 1/4 cup of sauce on that pasta it would have been a miracle.  NEVER AGAIN!  Awful meal.
It takes a lot of effort and talent to remove the flavor from pizza sauce for mozzarella cheese and from Italian sausage but they manage to do this somehow
BORING TASTES LIKE THE BOX! Without tourists, suburbanites or hungover millennial's it's a wonder they stay open......

Their pizza is the best in Chicago. The buttery crust is so delicious. I tried both Lou Malnati and Giordanos and this one beats Giordanos no doubt. The crust was buttery, had the right amount of cheese, the sauce was flavorful. I would come back to Lou Malnati's the next time I'm here. We got the sausage with green peppers added to it. Next time I will probably do Pepperoni based on the other reviews. The only reason I knocked off a star is that their cutlery was dirty and when we told the server she didn't apologize and she almost seemed annoyed at us for asking her to get us a new plate and fork. There was sauce stuck on it! I'm just glad the pizza that came made up for it! We had it with a spinach salad as well. Ps. A small is more than enough for 4 people to share unless you are very hungry!

pics.caption: Yummy goodness - Sausage and Green Peppers

review.des: A good classic Chicago style pizza. Great atmosphere and location. Just be prepared the deep dish takes like 40min. But the spinach bread appetizer can hold you over! Must visit in Chi!

This pizza was just ok. As expected it took a long time to arrive, even though I ordered while in line. The butter crust wasn't very special and the sauce hadn't really soaked into the dough... I enjoyed the slice I had at Art of Pizza instead.
Simply. The best. My Favorite pizza :) Get "The Lou" with pepperoni-you won't be sorry.
Lou Malnati's is THE place for Chicago deep dish. Excellent butter crust, well proportioned toppings and the sauce tastes as it should.

I made it a point to try Giordano's, Pizano's and Lou Malnati's and I have to say Lou's was my favorite Deep Dish out of all 3 pizzerias.
I ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic it stood out to me because I could taste the various ingredients put into the pizza. The sauce was not too over powering and the buttery crust was delicious I didn't leave any on my plane and I am notorious for leaving my crusts behind.
We also ordered their Caesar salad and the small bowl can feed about 4 people, it's huge!

Best pizza ever, I recommended their specialty one just as it comes. It was the best clean straight forward flavors, the tomato sauce taste was superb, the sausage had a great flavor the whole thing was amazing. Ordered (3) individual for the two of us and it was more than enough.

My friend brought me this place and said this is one of the best pizza place in Chicago. We are ordered the trio drip with chip, one medium classic pizza and one medium the Lou. The trio drip is a good pick and the garlic drip is my favorite. The pizza is big and filling. Between the two I like the classic better than the Lou. The classic has a big flat sausage and cheese on the pizza that is my favorite. We are in a group of 5 guys and we have one slice each left from the two pizza so beware that the portion when you are ordering.

Definitely a great spot for some Chicago deep dish pizza! The cheese just melts in your mouth. And the crust that they're famous for was mouth-watering. We also got their buffalo wings--they weren't the best I've ever had, but they were still really good.

We ordered ahead for carry-out, knowing the wait would be about 45 minutes. I guess that's the standard for pizza around here? When we got there to pick up the pizza and wings, it was packed! Even though out pizza was already ready, we still had to wait a bit because of all the customers that were in line and waiting.

Overall, I had a good experience with their pizza. I'm glad we didn't have to wait there because that was a serious crowd! But I see why this place is so popular and why it was recommended to us.

pics.caption: Deep dish pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms.

review.des: Went for the classic deep dish with the butter crust of course. Added two extra toppings and it was amazing. We got a small for the two of us which was plenty especially if you want to save room for dessert! Definitely needs to be a place on your Chicago wish list!
Best pizza on earth...period! I've had pizzas shipped to San Diego to show my new friends here what's up!

Came in on a Saturday night and there wasn't a wait at all. Our server was wonderful and gave us some suggestions since we'd never been here before. She was juggling a lot of tables but still managed to check in on us often and made sure our cups were always full. We got the  original with pepperoni minus the meat sauce and it was out of this world!! Will definitely be back when we are in Chicago.

First let me mention that I am NOT from Chicago. But on a recent trip there I wanted to try the best authentic deep dish that the city had to offer. There were several names that repeatedly surfaced after a few minutes of research, Lou's was one of them and it happened to be the closest to my hotel.

This place was good. It felt authentic inside. Had that quintessential red and white tablecloth feel that is necessary for any down home Italian joint.

We ordered the deep dish and were cautioned by our server that it would probably take about a half hour. We agreed and that would have been great but it took a full hour to get the pie.

It was good. It was not any better than Uno's deep dish though which is a big ol' national chain and available just about anywhere. That took the uniqueness off of this experience for me but that's just as much the result of the fact that Uno makes a pretty great pie.

I have to confess, I never has a "Real" Deep Dish Pizza till now. And having it at Lou Malnati's might have set my standard from now on a lot higher when I am eating one of these pies anywhere else.

We shared:

Malnati Salad - Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, Volpi salami bits and gorgonzola cheese with our Sweet Vinaigrette and romano cheese
- Since it takes awhile for the star of the show, our pizza to arrive, we decided to sharea a salad!
- Even the salad was so so good... love the cheese and more cheese with the house made dressing!
- Family Size is good enough to feed 5 of us!

The Malnati Chicago Classic - Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust.™
- The crust was so good, I didn't realize that it was a "buttercrust" till now but definitely worth every single calories and fat content!
- Sausage was well seasoned and moist and went so well with the cheese, cheese and cheese... and the sauce was tangy with a good bit!

Family style is the way to go! So get your friends and families and your love ones and just share some love and be fat and happy together! :)

I can still remember that buttery crust... Now I know why Pizza is call a pie!
Assembly line pizza. Most over rated pizza in Chicago. Doesn't seem like they take time is preparing the pizza for the oven. Crust is never consistent.
Not as great as I thought it would be, would was ok overall. Service was slow!

When in Rome... eat Roman pizza. In the city for a conference and lacking any real knowledge of Chicago haute cuisine, I do the tourist thing and seek out two things: Chicago dogs and Chicago pizza. Having accomplished the former, I turn to Yelp to search out a reasonably well-rated place within walking distance of the conference. And thus I find Lou Malnati's, on whose shoulders I must place my entire opinion of Chicago-style pizza.

But I was not alone. I brought with me a friend from Russia who was also attending the conference, and I had the unlucky task of trying to explain this odd beast that vaguely resembles the Platonic ideal of pizza. "The sauce is on top." "But why?" "Who can explain the mysteries of this earth?" Fortunately, Malnati's provided an excellent example of the red-topped step-child of the pizza family, as our "Chicago Classic," topped with sausage, tasted fantastic and certainly stands as one of the best Chicago-styles I've had. Which is probably a good thing, because, you know, it's like authentic or something.

Summary: Russian-approved.

We were here on a Sunday afternoon. It was pretty busy so we sat at the very back of the restaurant upstairs. We ordered the 4 cheese Bread to start but it came out with main!!!!! Deep dish pizza was to die for though.

I went for lunch and the place was nice. The pizza was good and the restaurant itself was very sleek. The pizza itself was smaller than I would've thought though and for me it seemed to taste like every other pizza.

Deep Dish Pizza Yum!!

My Yelp Friend (YF) Gem saw I was visiting her hometown of Chicago, she sent me a list of places I might be interested in going to. For Deep dish pizza, she recommended going to Lou Malnati's.

I have never had a deep dish pizza and what better place to try it than in Chicago.

Fortunately, Lou Malnati's was within walking distance from my hotel and we had time to burn, lunch was possible yes!!

We got there during the lunch rush. We put our name down and the hostess suggested we place our order now, since the wait for a table was 20 minutes, they could start on the pizza while we wait.

We pre-order "The Lou" - Spinach mix, mushrooms and sliced roma tomatoes covered with three cheeses. We added ground sausage and the lady taking out order suggested cooking it well done. It sounded good to us.

We went outside to wait (the place was packed, waiting list was long). About 20 minutes later we were called. We went to the second floor and were seated. Our waitress confirmed our order and we ordered Calamari Friti for appetizer.

The calamari came out fast. It was good. Fried perfectly crisp outside and tender inside. It came with marinara sauce which were a perfect match to the calamari.

Our pizza came out next. It was very delicious!! The crust was perfect. The ingredients blended perfectly. Adding the sausage was a good idea. Delicious!!

Service was very good!! Helpful suggestions and friendly service.

For a thin crust loving person like me, I liked this pizza a lot!!

Solid 4 Stars

I'll definitely be back. Thanks Gem!!

Lou's is well known across Chicago for the deep dish pizza. Having tried Lou's and giordanos, I'd have to say I'm more of a Lou's fan. The crust is the selling point, very buttery, it has an excellent flavor and crisp. I actually prefer the thin crust, so whatever crust you pick, Lou's is a great choice!

My mouth is watering just writing this. I now live in Seattle, WA and would give anything to have a Lou Malnati's pop up here! I know Chicago is best known for their deep dish, but I'm telling you, the thin crust is where it's at...Both are actually amazing, but the thin has the most perfect consistency and you can control how much you're eating a little easier :) My office still orders this regularly and it never gets old!

So, yes, DELISH deep dish pizza. We went to the location near DePaul and it was CROWDED! But the '30min wait' was only 15-17min and they encourage you to order while you wait so, very efficient   LOL. Service was very pleasant. We LOVED the family photos on the walls! Thanks
Great service , amazing pizza, you gotta try it guys .  Their deep dish pizza is one of the best in town
Pizza was good. I sat at the bar to get in past the wait. Just don't go if you are in a hurry!
Traditional chicago stuffed pizza. Great every once in a while and perfect to bring visitors to from out of town.

Had to try Chicago deep dish again. The hostess was friendly. I sat at the bar, which was great. It was a busy night, and the place was hoping with energy around different sporting events.
