If you're in Chicago, deep dish pizza is a must. & Lou's pizza is the absolute best. A friend & I were looking for Gazzola's pizza in the area yesterday, HIMYM fans will know about this place. What we didn't know is that it doesn't exist. We found the closest pizza place from our location & couldn't have been happier with what we found.
We shared the house pizza (Lou's) & are planning on going back again tomorrow.
Super delicious pizza--maybe even the best in Chicago. It's very busy but worth the wait. A++
One of the top five Chicago pizza joints...love this place!

Had the deep dish pizza and it was okay. Not really a fan of theirs or giordanos, but when in Chicago... The customer service was great! We ordered half cheese half sausage and they accidentally gave us all sausage, so our waiter didn't make us pay for it. We didn't even ask for that or complain at all, they just offered to not make us pay the bill. It was super nice of them, id def go back (but order something other than the deep dish) not my thing lol

This is the best Chicago deep dish I've had. Loved the location, it is a little loud but that's because it's so busy and I went on a Monday. Still think New York pizza is the best but will definitely return if I'm in town.

Just tried Lou's for the first time last night. I just moved to Chicago a month ago and have already tried Pequod's so the other pizza joints are really going to have to "wow" me after P's.

Unfortunately, Lou's was a major fail. I walked in before my friend met me there. I asked for a table for two. They wouldn't sit me until he arrived. The restaurant was virtually empty! What kind of sh*t is that? Not cool.

I begged to place the order before he got there so it could be ready in a relatively reasonable time after he arrived.  They supposedly put in the order. However, after he finally showed and after we sat down, we STILL waited another 50 minutes for the "famous" Lou's pizza to come out.

First of all, we had ordered a medium. What a huge mistake. It was huge. It could've easily fed four, maybe three fatties haha. Second of all... wait, wait, before I get to that...

Is it me or is a pizza supposed to have four specific things: dough, sauce, cheese, and whatever other crap you choose to put on your pie ("toppings"). Well, it was missing one very very vital thing! ...Sauce, sauce, where art thou?! It was seriously just dough, a massive amount of cheese, pepperoni, and GREASE. So much grease that I had to take napkins and soak it up in order to 'enjoy' a slice. [this was my second of all rant]

Third: Taste test! The pizza tasted okay but definitely does not win the crown for Chicago's best deep dish. Obviously whoever named it that had either A) not been to Pequod's B) was drunk C) had the munchies (pass it, yo) or D) likes plain ass carb-y cheese dough.

No thanks, Lou. I'll pass.

I split a small pizza with a friend--the perfect size for two!  We got the Lou (tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, 3 kinds of cheese) and it was spectacular. I'd never tried deep dish before, and don't consider myself a true cheese lover--but I was blown away by the flaky crust, comfort food flavor and the pure fun of eating it with a knife and fork!  (Also, the cheese really didn't overwhelm the pizza--there was a lot else to enjoy on the plate.) Sat outside and enjoyed a view of River North passers by.  Highly recommend!

If you eat nowhere else during your stay in Chicago, eat at Lou Malnati's!  The reputation of this place speaks for itself.  This restaurant certainly lived up to its reputation.  Several friends had told me to visit this restaurant while in Chicago and I am so, so, so happy that I did.  Hands down the BEST Chicago-style pizza that I've ever had, and one of the top 5 best pizzas I've eaten ever.  WOW.

I ordered the "Malnati Chicago Classic," which came with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust.  It was positively ambrosial.  The cheese just melted in my mouth and the crust was so crunchy.  It was such a glorious meal on a crisp October day in Chicago.  The personal pan size was enough food for this hungry foodie!

The service was great, though you should expect it to take at least 30 minutes for your food to come out (since they put it in the oven and ensure that the crust comes out very nicely).  Also be aware that this restaurant can be PACKED.  We fortunately visited at around 6:30pm on a Tuesday night, so it wasn't too terrible yet.  About half an hour into our dinner, we noticed large groups being turned away because they didn't have reservations and there really wasn't any space.  This restaurant is quite big, space-wise, so that just tells you how popular this place is!  This place is totally worth any wait, in my opinion.

I WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK here again next time I'm in Chicago!  What a legend of a place... you've missed out if you went to Chicago without eating at Lou Malnati's pizzeria.

Malnati Chicago Classic - personal pan size
Malnati Chicago Classic - personal pan size

review.des: Whenever I visit Chicago I pay my respects by eating at Lou Malnatis or Giordanos. Both great deep dish pizzas! The butter crust is delicious, full of flavor and crunch. The service was friendly and prompt. Overall great experience! Only deducted one star because for me thin crust all the way!!!

Don't go to the touristy Giordanos! Lou Malnati's is delicious and the true chicago pizza. We went at around 5 so it wasn't too crowded yet and we didn't have to wait in a line. When we left though around 7 there was a long line out the door. We ordered the Malnati salad and the classic medium deep dish pizza for the two of us (we took a little home). The salad was good but a bit overdressed. Definitely order the dressing on the side. The pizza was delicious although in my opinion it could have been a bit cheesier! Big chunks of sausage and the sauce was thick and full of tomato pieces. We even got two frozen pizzas to take home on the plane with us. We will be returning!

Not at all impressed. Took nearly two hours to get out order of 1 pizza and a salad. They forgot to cut the pizza and did not include the sides or  any napkins or plastic ware.  Over thirty minutes later they finally show up with it but by this time it is ice cold pizza and in a hotel we have no way to even warm it up. Won't recommend and won't go back.

Beat the dinner lines arriving by 5:30p Saturday.  Smartly after taking name for table, they let you order your pizza to start baking.  15 minutes later we were seated, ordered salad and drinks.  30 minutes later after we enjoyed salad, pizza arrives!  Simply delicious pizza.  Staff were all smiles.  Excellent Chicago experience and must do when visiting.
BEST. PIZZA. EVER....Thin crust (butter) or pan...get the Malnati's salad with his dressing or the creamy garlic. Sausage is, I believe, Malnati made.

SO GOOD! We ordered a small Chicago Classic and it was the perfect amount for two people. Crunchy, buttery crust, chunky tomato sauce, and lots of melty cheese. I have tried several Chicago pizzerias, but Lou's is by far the best. Well worth the wait!!
When it comes to Chicago pizza, this place is always competing for the top spot in my opinion. Polite wait staff and filling portions will guarantee my loyalty in foreseeable future.

I am absolutely disgusted by this pizza that I had delivered to me and my co-worker. I am not going to go in, but the picture is enough to see that the pizza is clearly burnt and felt like we were eating crackers with hard cheese and some sort of meat on it. I can't believe they are delivering pizzas like this from the great and mighty Lou Malnati's. You should be ashamed for this sort of quality. Will never order from this place or dine again. Just order from Pizano's.

Which Chicago pizza is best?  We vote for Lou's hands down. YUM!  Order a cold beer, the Malnati salad and the pizza.  The basic deep dish pepperoni is the family favorite.  Every time we visit Chicago Lou's is a must.

pics.caption: Best salad ever!! Minus the olives yuck. :)

review.des:
I ate here back in February when I was in chi town for a business trip.

The service was excellent, the salad and the wine!

However, I felt the pizza was terrible! The sauce had no flavor and it was bland. It tasted like Ragu!

I may be biased since I am a New York pizza lover or real Neo pizza lover, but I have to say restaurant was a chain and seemed like would be in the fast food/casual dinning group compared to Friday's and chilis only difference it's pizza! I do not recommend this place for "authentic chi pizza".

Pizza is usually great although it can vary from location to location.  Service and food at the Lincolnwood location is usually great.  Ate at the Buffalo Grove location last summer and the Lincolnwood regulars felt the pizza wasn't as good.
Try the Malnati's salad; it is tasty.
Probably a little bit healthier and freshest tasting deep dish of the chains but not as much savory flavor as competition.  However, if you're visiting Chicago, Lou's must be on your to do list.

I finally got to experience Chicago Deep Dish Pizza! My co-worked and I got a tip by our boss, who is from Chicago, that this was the place to go. Literally 1 hour off the plane and we were here at this location. Traffic is pretty terrible to get into the city, but once you are here you are in.

We ordered the The Malnati Chicago Classic with pepperoni on top. The crust actually resembles some type of pie crust. Right above it is sauce and sausage. Its much different than I thought as the sausage is one large piece the same diameter of the pizza. Above that is the traditional toppings of cheese, sauce, and pepperoni. It was pretty amazing, but after two slices it was hard to eat more. The amount of sausage is what kind of threw me off. I would have preferred less as the ratio from meat to cheese, sauce, and crust was just not right. The food quality was great, but it was not 5 stars for me.

I haven't had deep dish pizza in probably 25 years. It's usually a bit too much for me. I'm a thin crust loving kind of gal. The pie here totally changed my entire perception of pizza. You really can love both types! Who knew?

A good friend suggested Lou's to me and I'm forever grateful! I had never heard of butter crust and the first bite silenced me into very happy noshing. It was incredible! Soft crust and yet crispy in all the right places with bubbling, gooey cheese. Absolutely sublime.

pics.caption: Butter crust - YES! It's all about the classic! Omg...

review.des: This place didn't disappoint.   The local Chicago pizza was well worth the wait.   Beer was cold and service was solid.

Excellent gluten free pizza! Usually pizza places under cook the GF pizza and its soft and just...gross. This crust was thin and crunchy. Perhaps a bit too crunchy for some, but I loved it! **For those with Celiac or severe gluten allergies, the menu does warn that Lou's GF pizza does come into contact with cutting/prep surfaces that are also used for gluten-iferous foods.

pics.caption: Gluten free personal size cheese pizza

review.des: I didn't think I liked deep dish pizza, but when I first came to Chicago this was my first meal and I will never go back. It is the best pizza I've ever had and I will now forever swear by it!
Best pizza in town. Just be prepared for some waiting time, especially on weekends. Fun place. Nice service. Touristy, but hey, makes it different.

Eh. We ordered the sausage pizza. It was bad. It was super bland. The reason I love pizza is because of all the flavors in one slice. This had none of the pros of pizza. If just felt like eating a giant slice of soggy bread.

The service was slow and the girl was sarcastic to the point where it was rude. I asked for water without ice because cold water hurts my teeth. She yelled out "we have a complicated one here!" Half jokingly.

Other than having to wait 30 mins for your pizza to be ready, we enjoyed out night out at Lou Malnati's. For my family of three, we ordered the large deep dish with sausage. It was very delicious but one slice is enough! A must when you visit Chicago.

Me and my fiance saw this place on yelp with the highest rating. We went there it was crowded..so ordered to go.. 2 personal pizzas of their specialties. It was over priced but not as much as Gino's East. Paid almost $50 with the addition of a couple of toppings. The wait was a little long but we understand they were busy. The pizza was good...had it for leftovers the next was not bad.

We may go back to give it another try.

Yay for gluten free Chicago pizza!! Not true Chicago pizza as it's not deep dish...but the crust was amazing!!! Definitely one of the best gf crusts I've had...and I've tried a lot (Celiac). Also, reading other people's reviews about the regular "buttercrust" makes me think they try to make their gf crust the same. It was very buttery and delicious. Not too thin or cracker-like. I didn't feel cheated at all  about not being able to eat the authentic Chicago pizza. FYI the gluten free pizza comes with just cheese so you need to add toppings if you want meat, etc. I got it with sausage, and it was perfect.

My non-gluten free friends loved their regular pizza as well! Definitely lived up to these reviews. When we put our name in, they told us it would be an hour wait. We put our name in and then proceeded to order our pizza. When we sat down, our pizza arrived in 10 min. It was great timing and awesome that they have that option to speed up the process. I recommend doing that if there is a long wait!

Food is delicious. Wait times are its Ackelies heel. We were seated quickly though because our group was relatively small but if you order a pizza add another +30-45 minutes to your stay. We were Ok with that though and we really enjoyed the food.
If you have time and money to spare, you'll like it. If you're a rushing tourist who is trying to soak in as much as possible of Chicago, take a moment to see if it's worth spending 1-2 hours here. Luckily, they have Wi-Fi if you need something to do besides talking while you wait.
The pizzas are huge. The salads are huge. I recommend both. You'll love it! :)

Delicious !! Loved this pizza.
Close to the Merchandise Mart where we had just finished a Trade Show. Right out the back door of the Mart on the Wells side.......up a block or so.
Should be on our list to visit every time in Chicago.

I don't give five stars often; so let the deep-dish pizza debate begin!  I'm a Lou Malnati's fan and have been for a long time.

I've been coming to this location over the last year and a half.  It's now one of my favorites in town.  I love the neighborhood feel I get every time I come here, especially when any of the local sports teams are on TV.  The bartenders are always fun and friendly.

The service has always been swift and friendly.

To me, Lou's has the best deep-dish in town! (I just pissed off a bunch of people...LOL!) That's right, I say it!  Lou's the Best!

The butter crust starts it over the top, then the savory sausage in every bite...pushes it over!

I order one of two pizzas every time I'm in town, "The Malnati Chicago Classic" or a Thin Crust Sausage; both are absolutely the best around.

I really can't say anything more.  This is one of the coolest places in town to have a pizza and watch Chicago game on TV.  Feels like home.

Enough said!

Great deep dish pizza and cookie pizza. If you're going to Lou Malnati's, just come for those two things.

I didn't give this place 5 stars because I tried some of the appetizers (wings, bruschetta) and they were disappointing. Not very flavor or tender. Kind of boring. Also we were seated in the basement and the ambiance wasn't great.

As a New Yorker I was feeling pretty guilty for even trying Chicago style pizza...and have to say my expectations weren't very high. Well, I was totally wrong.
I ordered the personal pizza with sausage, onions and black olives. Ahhhmazzing. The crust was good...actually better than good, totally delicious! The flavors were great and the toppings were the perfect proportions.

Really glad I chose to go here for my first taste of Chicago style pizza

Food: Always great. We had the appetizer sampler and chopped salad to start. The sampler included fried motz, fried zucchini and cheese balls. I never had cheese balls before. They were pretty good. The salad is a must. Then we had a large sausage deep dish, a large plain deep dish with extra sauce and a plain thin crust. The deep dish pizzas were terrific. While I didn't try the thin crust, it actually didn't look all that interesting, but my daughter liked it.

Service: no complaints. Nice and attentive.

Atmosphere: busy, casual, pretty typical for family restaurants like this.

Will try to back whenever I'm in Chicago.

Relatively underwhelming.  45 minute wait quoted upon arrival so we took a spot at the bar.  Acceptable sauvignon blanc, some mozzarella sticks (decent) and calamari
(quite good) to tide us over. Never once did the hostess or bartender mention we should pre-order our pizza. We were sat at our table and our waitress asked if we'd pre-ordered. Huh?  If that's an option and suggestion, perhaps sharing that upon entering the queue would be appropriate.  Pizza finally arrived about 2 hours after we did (a good hour after we were sat) and...it was COLD! Hah.  Kind of funny.  The flavors were good, the crust was a bit tough but I gather that's a choice...the sausage had a nice flavor but was dry.  

We were given a complementary cookie pizza for our troubles and it was completely melted upon arrival (ice cream on top). An underwhelming experience overall.

Thanks Malnati's for catering our son's graduation party! We are from NYC, so a bit snobbish about our pizza. We had malnati's provide several deep dish pies, salad, sodas, some baked pasta dishes for a few pizza-haters, and an array of Italian cookies for dessert. They guided me through the order process, showed up at the hotel on time, had all the utensils, cups, plates etc.. in short, excellent service. The pizza was piping hot, I don't know how they did it. The salad was cool and crispy. And the price was reasonable. I highly recommend their catering service.

A friend and I were recommended Lou manati's left and right by seemingly the entire population of Chicago!

We had already a lot to eat, so we decided to go for the Chicago classic personal pan pizza and split it.

My initial reaction was that the sauce was very robust. There were whole tomatoes in the sauce, that I was very fond of. The cheese had that elasticity you look for when you pull it apart. The sausage was well seasoned and the inconsistency in size (as found in crumbled sausage), complemented the cohesiveness of the pizza, giving it that homemade feel. Also the crust was pretty crispy as well (I thought the abundance of sauce would've sogg-ified it)

My only critique is that the pizza as a whole was very bland. All of the ingredients and toppings in the pizza worked well together, but it all tasted very under seasoned.

Next time we are in town, I'd love to give this spot another chance, but until then, 3/5 is all I can give.

The best deep dish pizza in Chicago, period. I don't care what they tell the tourists about Giordano's but I've grown up with Lou's and it never disappoints. It is technically "Pan" pizza but it has thick layers of cheese and tomatoes (not just tomato sauce). The salads and other dishes are great as well but the pizza is the star. Also, for those of you cutting carbs, I recommend the "meat-za" which is a layer of sausage with all the pizza toppings, instead of crust.

The deep dish crust was amazing especially with the tomato sauce, but there wasn't enough cheese in my opinion. Regardless, I definitely liked it better than Ginos and Giordano's, but that's just my opinion.
Amazing this has to be the best pie.ever really!!!! price is great .large enough to share .a real find..

They do a good job of getting you to pre-order your pizza while you wait for a table. One would assume this means hot pizza. After waiting an hour and fifteen minutes we got a cold pizza. Our server told us he'd see what he could do, then returned five minutes later saying they'd taken the pizza off the bill. Okay, but the pizza was still cold. We asked that they maybe heat the pizza, which they did, and when it was warmed, it tasted alright. Wouldn't go back as it wasn't exactly stellar, even for free pizza. The house salad was meh.

Great lunch spot. We snuck in before the lunch risk started and were immediately seated upstairs. The rustic feel to it was inviting, complete with chic Edison bulbs everywhere. We were greeted quickly by our waitress who was friendly and accommodating and provided great recommendations for beverages, salads, and pizza. We started with a few beers, surprisingly ones from Michigan, but delicious and lived up to their name.

We got thw house salad, a blend of tomaine and spinach topped with fresh tomato, mushroom, gorganzola cheese, olives, and my favorite part, the crispy salami bits. I could've just feasted on those the entire day. The regular portion was the perfect size for two as an appetizer, and only left a few minutes before finishing that and our pizza arriving.

Which was delish. Our small pizza was perfect for me and my man, I'm a small eater and he's a big eater. We got "The Lou", which was decorated with spinach, mushrooms, and fresh tomatoes. The crust was crunchy, almost buttery, albeit kind of bland.  Deep dish deliciousness all the way and the toppings picked up the slack. Definitely a noteworthy Chicago deep dish go-to!
MY GO TO PIZZA PLACE IN CHICAGO. Amazing, fast delivery & always pleased with the pizza!! So yummy!
Was there tonight picking up my pizza and I think it was the manager but he was the nicest guy ever and the best customer service I ever had at a lous or any other restaurant!!! Love this place

This is the place to eat Chicago pie (deep-dished pizza). We came here at 1930 and had to wait 40mins for the table and another 30mins for our pizza. But guess what!!? It was worth the wait. The pizza was so yummy and it was soooo big. We ordered a medium and hardly finished it. And for $26 (before tip), it's worth the money...

pics.caption: "Build your own" pizza. Pepperoni, mushroom and spinach pizza.

review.des:
No trip to Chicago should be completed without a visit to Lou Malnati's. If you're looking for delicious deep dish pizza, this is the place to go.

When I knew I was going to visit Chicago, the only thing I really wanted to do was get good deep dish pizza. I was Lou Malnati's was the place to go, so we went on my first night there. We got two orders of pizza, cheese and pepperoni. Both tasted like magic and happiness. I liked both a lot, but I have to say the pepperoni was better since I like my pizza with more than cheese. The crust was also buttery which made it all the better.

You cannot go wrong with this famous Chicago Pizza spot!  We have been here twice.  I purposely planned to have lunch here at the end of our trip when I had no little dresses to fit into later that night and when we were slightly hungover.  

The first time we ordered cheese sticks, were seemed like traditional frozen cheese sticks and a deep dish pizza with pepperoni.  It was amazing, not like anything I've ever had.  One or two slices per person is PLENTY!

Second time my husband ordered breadsticks to start and we ordered the traditional deep dish, sausage.  It was so good!

I HAD to try deep dish while visiting Chicago and this place happened to be along my walk. It was a Saturday night and it was totally packed. We put our name in AND our order (because they take a long time to make) and then went to get a drink at a bar next door while we waited. They called when our table was ready and we went back to be seated.

We were seated in a room of other tourists, apparently, because the Blackhawks were on every TV and scored a bunch of times and no one said a word..so it was clear we were all out of towners. Even though we had ordered the pizza when we put our name in for the table, it still took kinda a long time. We ordered some calamari to munch on in the mean time. It wasn't very good, tasted like typical bar food calamari and wasn't very hot either. It was serviced with cocktail sauce, as opposed to marinara sauce. We asked for marinara sauce, but it never came. The calamari got even colder so we finally just ate it with the cocktail sauce because our waitress was MIA (we also asked for water that took us a couple of times of reminding her before we got those).

The pizza was good, but filling. I don't know how authentic it was, since we were clearly in a tourist trap. Definitely order the small if you're sharing just between two people. It's way more filling than it looks. We also got the deep dish brownie dessert, which was average.

Overall, I liked the pizza but the apps weren't impressive and neither was the service. The place also lacked ambiance..good thing that butter crust was so darn good.

Well let me start by saying this is my first Chicago deep dish, and I loved  it. Real busy resturant even on a Sunday. Was told the wait would  be 1 hr. I like the notification system for sitting patrons. Give you the ability to go  look around the city while you wait. But it was racing so I didn't. We ended up getting some  help from a hostess from upstairs and only waited 30 mins. Great customers  service up until we sat down.

The waitress seemed confused with  our preorder pizza ( where they have fix it then finish it  off  in the oven when u are seated so  it comes out quicker) well that was a fail because we waited 30-35 min for our pie. We ordered the classic Chicago deep dish. It was phenomenal. Just what I wanted, buttered crust, full  of cheese and top with one of the greatest tomato sauces I've had.
Glad I went with yelpers  suggestions and  ate at this place first.

So after my pizza high I hit a low again because the waitress was no where to be found and we told  her before we got the pizza we wanted the dessert cookie. S we wait again. Glad we had good convo while waiting. We get another waitress to  put  in our order. When it arrived  it was  perfect. The best cookie  that  has ever graced my palate. I was full and I wanted to  order another one. So I  have to return to chi town for some more. Great  place  just  wished the service was  better. EAT UP!!!

Last time out in Chicago I got recommended to this place they claim best deep dish in Chicago and let's just say I know me a deep dish , and WOW they win the trophy !

Best deep dish melts in your move the delivered to my hotel and came at proper time and let's just say I'm glad they can deliver if your out of state so when I go back home to California I will be shipping me some whole pizzas home

The original Lou is to die for !

Right near my new condo, how could I not check out one of the most established deep dish pizza venues in Chicago. My girlfriend's family had come to visit from Toronto and we wanted to ensure they tried some Chicago deep dish. We ordered the BBQ wings, calamari, and a few large 'The Lou' deep dish pizzas. Our waiter was very attentive and humorous and kept us entertained. The deep dish was good, however, not the best pizza I've ever had due to my travels in Italy and specifically, Naples. Will definitely return for some of their other menu items -

Best,
Charlie

Pizza is a touchy subject for Chicago-ians. This is my "go to" place for Sicilian: great sauce-cheese-topping taste combinations. Service has always been great, on-time and accurate.

Typically, we get take-out and eat at home. While I've eaten "in" at the Wells St location, we get most of our pies from the Lincoln-Wrightwood shop, can't say that we've ever eaten "in" there. The Lincoln location is a typical Pizza-Italian restaurant, no reason not to eat in except that home is close and more comfortable ;-)

The Malnati salad it was amazing, it was over a five star review. The salad came with the delicious sweet onion dressing that I could've eaten by the spoonful. The salad came out with salami Gorgonzola cheese tomato chunks mushrooms and olives.

This was our first Chicago pizza experience, I thought the dough would be a little more deep dish if you will meaning I thought it would be a little thicker.  Based on the waitresses recommendation we got a half cheese half special, which it had a sausage base. My husband thought that the sausage was an overkill and pretty much thought he was eating just a layer of sausage on his pizza.   My half with just cheese was pretty decent, I was happy with it and the flavor that came with and the buttery crust.

This is a popular at landmark so I would recommend going here and trying it out and seeing how you feel about it

Also there are many people waiting outside but when we walked in and asked for a table of two we had no wait. The pizzas take a 30 to 40 minutes to cook so be prepared for that.

This is one of our families go to places to bring our young kids.  We all enjoy the great taste of their thin crust plain cheese pizza, but where it is at with me is the thicker crust sausage pizza. This is my favorite sausage pizza in Chicago.  They have been growing their locations throughout the Metro area and you can find them in most neighborhoods. A very family friendly dinning spot and does not disappoint.

This place was just a short walk from our hotel and all the locals recommended this spot. I wasn't about to leave Chicago without getting my fair share of deep dish pizza! My family and I came here on a Monday night and this place had a line surrounding the door.  It's a bit different than what I'm used to. Here you order before you're actually at your table. Order while you wait and then once you get seated your food will be ready. Well, at least this is the idea.

The inside of this place is really crammed. Everyone is really close together and there's constantly someone trying to get by. The walls are covered in sports memorabilia which really gave a really nice feel and warming atmosphere.

We ordered a few pizzas to share amongst the five of us. Two deep dish and one thin crust. The server will cut the pizza and serve everyone at your table which I thought was really convenient since it's a bit crammed inside. I was so excited for the deep dish but I really think the thin crust stole the show. It was delicious and addicting. However, the deep dish was also rich and fluffy. I loved the fact that it wasn't dense to where you couldn't enjoy it. The toppings are piled on so make sure you love what you order! I can't get this kind of pizza at home so this was a really nice change of pace. If you're new to Chicago or just visiting put this place on your list!

We are fans of the Lincolnwood location. Their recent expansion with a dedicated take out lot and counter are great. The pizza is always great. They don't list their soups on the web page and I was told it was because not all locations have soup. Seems as though they could set up the web page to reflect those locations that do have soup.

I'm not a pizza snob. We don't have a real "Chicago Style" shop in Grand rapids so I was looking forward to this stop. We were on a layover stop on the railroad waiting to board the "City of New Orleans" to head south. We grabbed a cab at the station and told the driver to take us to the BEST pizza place in the area. WE HIT GOLD!

God I loved this place!!!! We had a Chicago Classic and it was so good that we also returned on our trip home a week later. Can't wait to go again.
Best deep-dish pizza in Chicago!  Butter crust was amazing. This place is the real deal. Great staff and the wait was short. Pre-order you pizza and it will cut down on the wait time.

So disclaimer, I am not the biggest deep dish fan. NY style is more my preference. That being said, when in Chicago I eat Chicago food.

We ordered a basic pepperoni deep dish pizza and even before eating it the smell was driving me crazy.

After diving in everything was delicious; from the buttery crust up to the pepperoni. What really stood out was their sauce and mozzarella though. This pizza was stacked with cheese and the sauce was so good. I wish I could make sauce like this. We will be back.

I have to buck the trend here. I don't see the high ratings. I find the crust to be greasy and bland. Great sauce, tons of cheese, too skimpy on the pepperoni. I went to Giordano's a few years ago and would like to return to compare.

Atmosphere is great! Would like to see a bigger draft selection and a craft root beer.
I have never had deep dish pizza before and this makes me wish that wasn't so! I am now deep dish pizza's biggest fan! I can't imagine a pizza better than this! Yum Yum Yum!!

ALWAYS PACKED! Been here twice and waited about an hour to be seated. But the wait is worth it, because their deep dish pizza is too good and instagram worthy. I had their veggie deep dish and it did not disappoint. Better go there with a good friend so the wait time goes by faster and not too hungry otherwise the wait will make you hangry

pics.caption: Ooey goeey cheesy deep dish pizza! I recommend getting it with veggies
Veggie deep dish pizza! Comes with 8 slices

review.des: Best deep dish in the city! Make sure to make a reservation though, because this place is always filled with tourists. Definitely order the deep dish here & don't forget to get the buttery crust! After having this for the first time this summer, I definitely think this is a once a month type of meal. It's a very satisfying meal, but it also is a heavy one!

For the wait this place has, I was expecting to be blown away. I wasn't blown away but the pizza is super tasty. However, I could probably live off of pizza. We were given an estimated 1 hour wait so we grabbed a drink and hung out outside. There's barely any waiting room inside which seems silly to me for a restaurant that is almost always on a wait. We lucked out by waiting outside as their patio is first come first serve, something they didn't tell us at the host stand. You would think that would be the first thing they say, to hopefully keep the wait down. They do allow you to pre-order your pizza, since the deep dish pizzas take up to 45 minutes, which helps a lot. Our server was slammed but she was great and their bottles of wine are cheap. The spinach bread is a great appetizer and their regular size salads are huge! After an app and salad, my BF and I split a personal size pizza, advertised as for 1, and it was more than enough. It's definitely a Chicago staple and the food is good. But be prepared to wait, most likely in an overly crowded area.

pics.caption: Personal size Lou Malnati's Classic with butter crust.

review.des: I do love my Lou's... but this place is always, always packed. The service can be slow--- but if you try to order ahead of time with the hostess, it will definitely speed things up! I always get the Lou's Salad and the cheese deep dish pizza... both are delicious!  Make sure you end it with the cookie pizza ;)

I order from Lou Malnati's all the time, I love their deep dish, butter crust pizza. I get it with sausage, mushrooms and low fat mozzarella. Yummmmmmmmmm
Also I am a Malnati rewards member.

My basis of judgement for deep dish spans little to none, unless you wanna count frozen pizza. I visited a friend who recently moved to Chi and requested that he take me to Lou's. The wait wasn't terribly long and as soon as we stepped out to grab drinks down the block, we received a text saying our table was ready. The wait for a small deep dish was probably 6-10 minutes, relieved with a few beers and little complaints. The crust was well-done, nothing was soggy and the sausage was perfectly seasoned. Deep dish wasn't THE best pizza I've ever had but it wasn't done terribly, either.

I was soo excited to try this place. I had high expectations for deep dish pizza, and honestly, I was a little disappointed.To me it's not as good as NY style, but if you like see dish it's still good pizza. Fair warning, it takes. FOREVER. To get your pizza. Make sure you get an appetizer!

So if you ask me, I'm a ny style pizza fan or better yet a Detroit style pizza fan.  But sometimes a good deep dish is what you crave.  I'm a fan of the giordano's but I don't think it's fair to compare he two.  They are two distinct styles of deep dish.  I do like the buttery crust at Lou's.  

It was a long wait to get in but they do have a slick way to preorder the pizzas while you wait since they take a while to cook.  Maybe because we were sooo hungry, and because of the wait, we were pretty satisfied with the meal.  

We ordered appetizers because we were so hungry but probably shouldn't have.  Just stick with the pizza.

My only complaint was that the pizza didn't seem fresh.  It didn't seem like it came straight out of the oven.  The cheese had firmed up and wasn't as melted as if it were fresh out of the .

So i never had real deep dish before coming here and I wasn't disappointed. The wait wasn't bad at all and we were lucky to sit at the bar while we waited for our table. But there was a group of ladies standing behind us who would not stop complaining. They were saying the bartender was ignoring them but they only been standing there for like 5 mins...In a fully packed restaurant... Really?!? They ended up tipping him like a dollar so we gave him extra tip..

When we sat down we got calamari for an appetizer and demolished it within 5 mins then came the pizza. The crust cheese and sauce taste like a buttery heaven. I was so happy. I ate two slices of a medium and was more than satisfied.

As a bonus we saw a couple of players for the 49ers since the Bears were playing them that weekend. They were huge and ate a ton.

Excellent Chicago deep dish style pizza. Been to this Wells St. location and out in the suburbs as well, always consistently good. Also have had their lasagna, good traditional style Italian comfort food. All reasonably priced.

Visited Lou Malnati's Pizzeria during a business trip to Chicago.  Went on a Friday night and the place was packed!  It took ~ 35 minutes to be seated for 3 people.  But, in order to speed up efficiency, they allow you to preorder your pizza so that it will be ready for you once you are seated in your table.  For the 3 of us, we ordered the "Lou" at a medium size since it said that it would be good for 4 people.  Once we sat down, it unfortunately took longer for the pizza to be brought out, and we ended up waiting for ~20 minutes for our pizza once we were seated.  
The pizza itself is so packed with stuff, it's ridiculous.  There's tons of cheese, tomatoes and tomato sauce.  The crust is impecable with a crunchy and buttery taste.  Just be warned though, after eating one slice, you might get food coma.  All 3 of us got food coma after eating 1-2 slices of the "Lou," and ended up having to call it a night.  But, the pizza itself was delicious.  Highly recommend it if you're visiting Chicago.

Chicago is known for it's pizza and this is obviously a place for Chicagoan's.  I'm originally from the south, it would take some getting used to.  My family enjoyed it and there is a popular appetizer we ordered (sorry I forgot what it was) that was truly excellent...IMO, better than the pizza.  Overall if my family enjoyed it, then I'm satisfied.  What are Moms for?  :)

I'm not a true deep dish lover, and Lou's was never my favorite. With that being said, they are consistent and reasonably priced when it comes to the Chicago deep dish game. Their beer selection is lacking, and if you want something besides pizza, I would consider going elsewhere. I've grown to appreciate their pizza. Therefore, I would recommend Lou's to new comers.

Being from the East Coast, I was totally not sold on Chicago Deep Dish.

As with many people not from the city, Malnati's changed my mind.

Great Chicago Deep Dish. I'm a convert.

The pizza is great. The service is excellent. The staff are friendly and patient. However, do NOT get toppings unless you want to be ripped off. My girlfriend and I got a small (10", serving 2) cheese pizza with olives, garlic, and peppers. We did not read the menu that carefully because the restaurant was insanely packed and we pre-ordered.

Each topping costs $1.95 EACH. So, for a ten inch pizza that had maybe a handful of olives, a single garlic clove, and half a pepper, we paid an extra ~$7.

An entire can of olives does not cost $1.95. An entire pepper does not cost $1.95. It's absurd.
Overall, it was a not bad experience first time driving deep dish pizza. Personally, I like thin crust pizza better. The environment and vibes were on point btw!
A good spot to grab a simple, traditional deep dish pizza. Wasn't wowed by the pizza itself but the establishment and service were great.

So I thought I'd try this place after seeing all the reviews. Pizza was decent. I think maybe if I had gotten one that was larger than the personal size I would have gotten the full experience. I've had deep dish at another place, and I just liked it better.

The wait is long, so don't go hungry. And pre-order your pizza so they will already have it while you're waiting for your table. Baking deep dish pizza takes time, so this helps with the wait once you're seated.
I love this Pizza.  Excellent quality of ingredients.  The crust is delicious too.
Great Lou's location. What's neat is that you can pre-order pizza while you wait, so that everyone wins. Love the sausage
I got a thin crust pizza for lunch here once. It was somewhat greasy with a bland and hard base. (Much like Pizano's, who also can't make a crust worth a damn.) I don't see the appeal.

I had Lou's for the first time and it was amazing. We ordered a pepperoni deep dish with the butter crust. The cheese was so thick and gooey that if I had choked to death it would have been worth it. (Lol. J/K). Seriously, do yourself a favor and pick up a pie from here, you won't regret it. Best pie ever!

A must for visitors and seemed popular with the locals too. Stick with the traditional toppings and expect a wait. Totally different from my expectation of deep dish pizza. Not at all greasy, but definitely a food fest situation. Yum!

pics.caption: Three of us could barely finish this.

review.des:
It's Lou's... what else would you expect.  Stuffed spinach and sausage was perfect.  The thin pepperoni was good... but I think they cooked it at the same time as the deep and it was cold. Still tasted good.

I'm a born and raised Chicagoan and try to get Lou's every time I'm back home... and have it delivered a couple times a year too.
I was traveling bot business and want a "Chicago Style" pizza and they didn't disappoint. One of the Best deep dish pizza's ever! Thank you.

Never had deep dish pizza before and this was my first food stop in Chicago. Guess we came at a good time as we were seated immediately and taken care of right away. Since we were starving we ordered a plate of wings and two deep dish pizzas. I had the mini pepperoni pizza and my BF had the Lou malnati. We definitely underestimated how filling one pizza could be.

Mine was good but the Lou malnati was hands down one of the best pizzas I've ever tried. It was oozing in cheesy deliciousness and baked with some sausages and meats. It was so good and even the tomato sauce was flavorful. We didn't end up eating it all and took some to go. But if you're gonna try deep dish, come here.
We came here for some deep dish pizza during a trip to Chicago after our concierge recommended the place. We found their portion sizes to be big and very filling. The customer service was also great!

While I love me some Malnati's, we've had more problems ordering here than anywhere else in the history of ordering food. As a girl who worked in restaurants (even a pizza joint) through college, I'm the first to understand that things happen. What I don't understand are shift managers blatantly lying to you when your food has been compromised, & never leaving messages for actual managers to call you back. Not cool.

Things happen, & when I don't say anything three out of four times, maybe more, I think I'm pretty laid back. All I'm asking is that you treat me w/respect when I'm paying you for food that YOU wouldn't eat yourself. It's PIZZA, dude. Nothing personal.

We were in town and had to try Lou's as it is known to be the best pizza in Chicago. We went in on a Thursday evening, right at dinner time, the wait was quoted at 45-60 minutes. We were told we should preorder our pizza to cut down on the wait once we were seated.We (family of 5) ordered a large half sausage half pepperoni with the butter crust. We waited the quoted time and once we were seated we ordered drinks and calamari to start off. Our waitress was prompt and courteous.

OMG...this pizza was so so good. I am not really a deep dish pizza fan because I hate when crust gets soggy or even worse, greasy. Lou Malnati's crust was neither, in fact it was crispy and delicious. The pizza sauce is incredibly light and fresh. We all loved the pizza and were stuffed when we left...not even room left to share dessert. In fact we had one slice on pizza leftover. This pizza was worth every single calorie. We tried Pequod's Pizza as well and thought that Lou's was better. I would highly recommend Lou's for great service and awesome pizza.

Our first true Chicago style pizza was enjoyed here for dinner on a slow starting Monday night. We were seated upstairs at a nice big round comfortable table for our group of five out of owners. Our waitress filled us in on just how "dense" and filling their pizzas are despite their somewhat smaller diameter. We all were on the same mission to enjoy great pizza. My wife and I decided to split a small size Classic Lou Malnati's with Italian sausage.

To start we all ordered local beers, the tortilla chips with three dips (for the veggie in our group) and cheese sticks for the one guy who thought he wouldn't get enough cheese with his pizza. The apps were fine and tasty along with the nice cold beers.

It wasn't long before our pizzas came out. My wife and I found the small size to be perfect for the two of us to split. The crust was crisp despite being quite thick, the extra thick layer of cheese was yummy without being gut filling, the sauce had a nice texture and taste to it and the sausages on top were lean and paired nicely overall with the pizza. Usually my wife has to sponge the extra grease off the top of her pizza with a napkin but not at all here.

We both loved the pizza and can't wait to return and try a different one.

Alright, alright, alright, as Matthew McConaughey would say.  This is the OG to the OG's in Chicago.  Sorry, Giordano's, you're great!  Sorry, Gino's East, you're pretty good too!  But Lou's is Lou's.  I've been living in Chicago now for 7 years.  There is 1 consistent pizza place that I have been going to for all 7- Lou's.  The deep dish crust is so golden and crunch in the best way to compliment the cheese and toppings.  It will be one of those crusts that make you excited to get to the end of the slice.  

I normally get the deep dish with sausage and green peppers.  Key point- the sausage is not in little bites or spread around sparingly.  You get sausage in EVERY BITE.  If I'm doing deep dish pizza, Lou's is my choice  Honestly, when people they don't like Lou's, I'm surprised.

I'm from CA and last month I traveled to Chicago on Business.  Lou Malnati's was the first place I went to straight from the airport.  It was my first time trying real Chicago Deep Dish pizza.  It was nothing I had imagined but better than I expected.  Considering i'm not from Chicago, I always thought of Deep Dish Pizza as a pizza with a really thick crust and tons of bread.  This was not the case at all.  To my surprise, Lou Malnati's had the perfect amount of crust (not thick at all) and the massive amount of cheese and meat was impressive.  Full of flavor.  I wish we had a Lou Malnati's in the LA area.  Now i'm just hoping my manager sends me to Chicago again.  Delicious!

By the way, it's nice how they allow you to pre-order your pizza before you are seated, so that your order comes out quickly.  Good service.
Visited 3 of their locations and it truly is one of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicago. Great service, love the modern industrial decor downtown!

One of my most favorite places for amazing Chicago style deep dish pizza! My two favorites are "The Lou" pizza and the "Malnati's Salad"! Both are delicious!! Lou Malnati's never seems to disappoint! Highly recommended.

Love!  The salad - great; the pizza - great; the beer - great; the server - great. We added pepperoni to the Classic and it was very good. I wish I could remember our server's name because he did an excellent job. He was friendly and attentive without being over-bearing. As usual, everything was delicious!

My first taste of deep dish Chicago pizza was Lou Malnati's both on previous trips and my most recent one.  The crust being buttery crispy makes this stand out to me. The crust balances perfectly amongst it's others ingredients and the fresh layer of tomato sauce on top brings in that sweet/sour tang to make it all come together.  I crave this pizza whenever I want deep dish Chi-style.  I'd have to put this up there in my top two favorites for deep dish.

Didn't really live up to the hype. Long wait (which is ok), but when we got the pizza it just wasn't all that impressive. Lots of cheese and the fillings just didn't have that much flavor. Eh, worth trying.

Pro tip: Take them up on the pre-order of pizza while you're waiting. Otherwise it takes 30-40 mins. (They are very up front it will take this long, but man feels longer when you're hungry!)

Came with a buddy while visiting Chicago, couldnt leave without trying Chicago style pizza. Got recommended this place by multiple people. Upon arriving, we see a long line out the door and at least 20 people waiting. We made a reservation for 2 and made our way to the full bar to order a drink while waiting. Within 5 minutes, a couple left and we took their spots. We took our name off of the waiitng list and ordered at the bar. The pizza takes about 40 minutes to cook so if your dining in, they suggest preordering it so you don't have to wait as long. We ordered garlic bread and a small (for 2 people) Chicago deep dish classic pizza. About 40 minutes later we see what seemed like a rather small pizza in front of us that we imagined would be bigger. It was not a problem as I did not finish my half. The pizza was excellent and the service was 2nd to none. Glad we stopped in and can say we had chicago style pizza, and come back if ever in chicago again!

Always have great service and food!!  I mostly take out since I live close by and the ladies who handle the take out run that ship tight!!  I love how organized they are and how efficient.  I do have a wait sometimes beyond the time given to me when I order but it's to be expected on a busy night. I actually don't like thick crust but I love their think crust, the Lou!  And the salads are good, too ;)  Neighborhood favorite!!

I totally understand the hype surrounding this place. My husband and I are on a cross country road trip and we knew we needed to stop and try true Chicago deep dish pizza. We were not at all disappointed! We got half of the Lou's and half of the Malnati's classic. Both were excellent, but the classic had the most delicious sausage I've ever had on a pizza! This was definitely worth the trip!

I was visiting Chicago and just had to try Chicago deep-dish. I was a bit wary of Lou Malnati's at first because it's a chain restaurant, which I always try to avoid.  But I have to say, I really tasted the love in every bite.  The sauce was a thick tomato jam.  The crust was almost brioche-like.  The mozzarella was generous.  I was a bit bummed that I only ordered the personal size and it was gone so fast.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  If you're doing delivery, order early as there's a long wait.
The best pizza in Chicago! Delivered, picked up or dine in. Lou's special with mounds of sausage and cheese is a super star food dish. Deep dish that is...

Indulgent? Yes. Deep? Definitely.  Knocked my socks off?  Ah, no.  
I won't even get into the NY vs Chi situation here, just judging what I tasted.  
I went simple with it, cheese, marinara.  It was good but it didn't take me to a place of pizza ecstasy unfortunately.  I wanted to taste each element, but it was really just marinara and crust for the most part, and the crust .....bland.  

Not to mention that bar service was bland too. Neither here nor there with it.  Chicago has a good rep for friendly service and people, the bartender wasn't either one of those things.  

You wouldn't be missing out if you didn't go but not awful if you do.  

Do with that what you will.  

Rating: Two complacent nipples.

We got Lou's delivered to the office for a welcoming event for new hires. The food was here right on time and the delivery guy was nice enough to come to the seventh floor to leave the pizzas here. They gave us plenty of plates and utensils, as well as dressing for the salad and parmesan and crushed red pepper flakes for the pizza.

Pizza was delicious, as it always is. I think Lou's deep dish has just the right amount of cheese. Other places serve deep dish with extremely thin crust and a pie full of cheese, Lou's crust is just a little bit thicker, which evens out the ratio of cheese to dough in every bite. I  also really like Lou's sauce. And their "Lou's salad" is wonderful.

To top it all off, they have individual pizzas! They cost $6 and are a perfect dinner for one. If you're eating with someone who has very different taste in pizza from your own, the personal pizzas are a great solution to a classic conundrum.
Best oohy gooey Chicago pizza made hands down.This crust is a meal in itself thick and satisfying.

This is always our last stop on the trade show circuit. The salad is the show stopper, maybe better than the pizza. Be prepared to wait, but you do order before you sit, so it's not and eternity for the food to come. We get one deep dish one thin crust
thin crust pepperoni XL and ask for it to not be overcooked and you will have an amazing pizza...
It's a staple for pizza in Chicago. I've had the Lou and the Chicago Classic. Both are great. The salad is also very good.

So we were in Chicago for five or six days and I haven't been in years. I love pizza. And I mean, I LOVE pizza. All kinds of pizza. Thin crust, deep dish, New York, Chicago, Neapolitan, whatever. I'll eat frozen pizza, leftover pizza, pizza that may or may not have fallen on the ground. In my books, even bad pizza is pretty good. And while Lou's was FAR from being bad pizza,I was just a tad disappointed, just a little let down  and perhaps a victim of my own sky-high expectations. Oh well, it was still pizza and it was still pretty good.

So starting at the beginning (finally) we had limited time and settled on going to the two biggest players in town (so far as I could ascertain), Lou Malnati's and Giordano's. Now I know that there are a LOT of other options but again, limited time and a long absence made me want to keep things as simple as I could.  So although I did cheat and have a thin-crust at the place next to our hotel, we stuck with the plan when it came to deep dish.

First off, the place is huge and even though we were relegated to the dreaded upper level, service was still good and they were more than accommodating with our many questions and various restrictions. Honey had the gluten free and I dropped the mushrooms from "The Lou" (despite the 'no substitutions' request) and all was good. We each ordered salads and I'm glad we did, seeing as they were both quite tasty (she had the Spinach, I had the House) and that the pizza took quite a while to get to us...but that's deep dish for you.

But after all of that it was just okay. She's had better gluten free and I've had better deep dish even in Toronto. Mine looked great and was more than acceptable but just wasn't as doughy, as savory, as buttery and as cheesy awesome as I was expecting. I don't know why, I really don't. It was fine and it was pizza and I still liked it but I felt a bit let down. When the salad is the best part of the meal, there's something not quite right. So on our next trip we probably won't be back to Lou's, given the vast array of other choices. Still, like I said it WAS pizza...and there's rarely ever anything wrong with pizza in my book.

pics.caption: The 'Lou' (minus the mushrooms and minus a slice).

review.des: Overhyped place to be honest. Poor service. Our server only come and helped us maybe a handful of times. Asked for hot tea, hot water and straw a couple of times but didn't come within a timely manner in my opinion. The classic was good. I like the meat layer and the crunchy crust! The veggie option with spinach and mushroom (I forgot what the name was) was soggy. The wait was 45mins. Food wait was about 20mins. Again, In my opinion this place was overhyped.

pics.caption: The classic. Heartburn, I embrace you :D

review.des:
This was my first experience with Chicago deep dish pizza and I gotta say it was pretty darn good! My mom and I came at 5:30PM, and it was already pretty crowded. We were supposed to have a twenty five minute wait, but we ended up waiting only five minutes! YAY! Also, if you had to wait more than I did, there's the option to order the pizza before you are seated, just because it takes so long to cook. Plus there's a really nice diagram in the front register area to see what the sizes of the pizza look like.

My mom and I ordered the Spinach Salad, the Stuffed Spinach Bread, and a small Malnati Chicago classic pizza. The spinach salad was pretty average, but I was still happy that we got a salad because the rest of our meal was so carby. It was nice to be able to eat something while waiting for the ~grand finale~. Nevertheless, our appetizer, the stuffed spinach bread, was delicious. It was kind of like it's own extra mini deep dish pizza with marinara sauce on the size, and I definitely recommend it if you aren't planning to eat an entire pizza!

The pizza was really good - the crust was crunchy, the tomato sauce was good, cheese was melted, the usual. Everything you want in a pizza! The only qualm I had was I wish it was a little more hot when it arrived to our table. Maybe it was just our pizza, but the cheese was pretty solidified after like five minutes which was kind of annoying.

Just to give you an idea of how much we ate - my mom and I ate all of the salad and spinach bread but only ate half of the small pizza and took the rest to-go to eat later. Overall, I thought this was a great place to try the deep-dish pizza: good service, good venue, good food. Check it out!

This is, hands down, the best pizza I've had in my life! I've never really had legitimate Chicago deep dish, so when we decided to head there for St. Paddy's Day, I made this a requirement! After being referred there by more than a few friends, we decided to give Lou Malnati's a shot!

It ended up being SO delicious that we went there a second time (in just 3 days!) and this was definitely the better location, mostly due to the additional seating. Since we were there the morning after St. Paddy's, I can tell you that their hangover-friendly bloody mary is fantastic! It's not too thick, and it has just the right amount of kick, if you order it spicy. I shared a house salad, and while it was fairly standard, it was nice after such a health-less weekend to get some greens in...

Then comes the best part - the pizza!!! We'd tried the Lou and the Chicago Traditional one on Friday night, and my heart ached for the veggies of the lou... but my stomach said I needed protein. So, we created the best pizza I've ever had - the lou + sausage! This was the thickest, most delicious, fresh pizza EVER!!! I only wished I were hungry enough to finish another slice. The veggies taste great, especially the mushrooms and roma tomatoes. It does take around 30-45mins for the pies to cook, but I promise, they're worth the wait!

If you're looking for a great Chicago experience, and some too-legit-to-quit-(eating) deep dish, look no further! Lou Malnati's was -the bomb-!!!

(Tip: Send someone ahead of your party, as there will almost certainly be a wait.)

pics.caption: The Lou with sausage! Best pizza of my life

review.des: If I can give no stars , I would opt for that option. Worst pizza ever. Soggy and full of less than prego grade sauce. How can anyone call this pizza?

Lou Malnati's is the exception to my non-deep dish rule. And that's based off of just their delivery cheese pizza. That's how damn good we're talking here.

Like I said, I'm not a huge fan of deep dish pizza. In fact, I pretty much thought I hated it up until Lou Malnati's. And you know what else I'm not a big fan of? Delivery. I love my pie fresh and hot. LM blew these notions out of the water.

The first thing I noticed about this pie was that it holds heat WAY better than a thinner crust pie. So that kicked my delivery judgement out the window. Secondly, how is this thing not the greasiest thing ever? It just isn't. I have no idea how, but hot damn it's good. Third, that sauce. You can actually taste the fresh tomatoes--obviously homemade. The sauce had enough flavor to carry this entire cheese pizza. Fourth, this is REAL deep dish pizza. That stuff in Cleveland I thought was deep dish, isn't. Can never be.

Now I know, only Chicago knows deep dish and Lou Malnati's just might be the best.

Best deep dish in the city. The salads are amazing. It is super busy anytime you go so I recommend coming prepared to wait awhile. Also I recommend the deep dish with pepperoni only. The ones with extra toppings are just not as good.

The good: everything is super fresh and light. Tastes like what authentic pizza should taste like, made with simple ingredients and very light tasting. Barely any grease, more tomato juices. The penne was also very light.

The bad: everything is very light tasting. Hahah I think I'm just accustomed to super cheesy greasy pizzas. I here Gino's is more cheesy but we didn't get to try that place.

First time in Chicago and was very excited to try a deep dish.

All of their pizzas take a minimum 30 mins no matter if you order a standard or add extra toppings. Which wasn't really a big deal for me, I like knowing my pizza is super fresh but think it's worth a mention so you know. Got just a personal Lou Malnati classic deep dish which is fresh tomatoes and sausage. My wife ordered the Malnati penne which came out in about 12-15 mins.

My wife really liked the food. I was just okay with everything. Service was fine.

pics.caption: Lou Malnati Classic deep dish personal size

review.des:
I decided to come here after a friend recommended it to me to try when I was in Chicago. As a New Yorker, I'm often convinced that New York pizza is the best pizza, period. After this trip, I can honestly say that a fair comparison cannot be honestly made. NY-style pizza and Chicago deep dish are two entirely different things. You eat deep dish with a fork and knife and you eat NY style with your hands. Try to do one or the other and you'll either look weird in NY eating your slice with a fork and knife or you bathe your hands in oil eating deep dish in Chicago with your hands.

Now onto the real review here for Lou Malnati's. I was in town for work and decided to give it a go before heading back to O'Hare. Service in the afternoon was quick and easy and I struck up a conversation with the bartender there that afternoon. He helped me walk through their menu and ultimately convinced me to get the Lou. I got an individual portion just for myself. My oh my, was I surprised to see just how much a small pizza was and how filling it was! The crust was flaky and the sausage was a perfect complement to the pizza, though the oil on the pizza was a bit much at times. Fork and knife definitely needed! The staff's recommendations were spot on and their pizza was something that allowed me to taste something unique to Chicago. I enjoyed the food overall and the service was great. Granted that it wasn't a super busy late Friday afternoon (it was 25 degrees out) I was glad to have been able to eat some good Chicago deep dish while also being able to converse with some locals.

The debate between who has the better pizza between New York and Chicago needs to be put to rest. They're two completely different things. If you're in Chicago, pay Lou's a visit...they have multiple locations. Great spot!

pics.caption: The menu alone should make you hungry.

review.des: Lou Malnati's is my favorite pizza (at least it is, so far). I haven't had to wait in incredibly long lines, and I have had all positive experiences with their pizza. Granted, the "deep dish" isn't deep enough for most tourists, but I love their pizza.
A Chicago classic deep dish pizza, I was born in Cook county I know.  It's worth the money to have a special high cal treat like this.  thumbs way up

I have gone to Lou Malnati's for their delicious deep dish pizza each of the two times I have visited Chicago. During both of my trips, I tried various other deep dish pizzas (Giordano's, Gino's, Pizzeria Uno), and I have to admit that Lou Malnati's has my favorite all-around deep dish pizza. They win be over with their delicious Buttercrust and perfect combination of cheese, sausage, and tomato sauce in their Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza. Their trio of dips and pizza chips is a great starter if you're into hummus and artichoke-type dips.

I can't finish a meal without having dessert, so their Chocolate Chip Pizza was a perfect ending to my experience. Warm, fresh baked cookie topped with vanilla ice cream and a ton of whipped cream. Delish!

pics.caption: The Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza - cheese, sausage, tomato sauce, buttercrust!
The Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza - cheese, sausage, tomato sauce, buttercrust!

review.des:
Piiizzzzaaaa!!!

This was great Chicago style pizza.  Don't try to build your own, go for the Chicago classic.

While the food was great the service was rather discombobulated.  Nothing major to deter you from coming here, just seemed like a bunch of staff that didn't know what they were doing.

We came in around 5 on a Friday and were seated immediately, but wow this hot spot fills up quick.  Go, and go early.

Wonderful deep dish pizza. Lasagne was superb. Nice selection of draft beers to go with it. BUT service is SLOW. BEER WAS WARM BY THE TIME THE FOOD ARRIVED. and they were not that busy. Otherwise a great place.
My favorite deep dish, family owned and they weren't afraid to invest in some of the more forgotten areas of Chicago.  When in the mood for pizza they are always my #1 choice!

Great pizza! You must get the Chicago style deep dish crust. Lines are usually out the door and they start early, but the wait is totally worth it. The salad is also good. Always a favorite when I am craving a good pizza.
My buddy Dustin and JBaz took me here the first time I come to Chicago. I loved it. It was de-licous. If you need a Chicago traditional slice of deep dish pie, do this. You'll be happy

Very mediocre pizza. :(. I love that it is loaded with cheese. For a place that is very nice and lovely, the food is cheap. Less than $10 for an individual pizza and the ones that serve 1-2 ppl are less than $20. The location is gorgeous. Pizza wasn't great though.

I forgot our server's name but he was sooo nice. I wish I had asked for his name. Service, location and interior was great.
Food wasn't great. If you visited Chicago and didnt try this place out, you honestly wouldnt be missing out on anything!
Had the classic deep dish. Buttery crust was great. Plenty of sausage and cheese. Pizza was well worth the wait.
Went for the experience and was not disappointed! Can't say I haven't had better pizza before (in my opinion), but the deep dish pizza was delicious and I loved the atmosphere.

We visited around 12 pm on a Tuesday and it wasn't busy when we arrived but about 20 minutes in, it became very busy and loud. Our waitress was very nice and quick. We got the three cheese bread for our appetizer which was delicious! We ordered a small butter crust half pepperoni half cheese which we were quoted about 35-45 minutes for. I wouldn't recommend coming for deep dish if you're in a hurry as it takes quite a while to make. The pizza was just ok. I'm not a huge fan on sweet sauce and tons of cheese.

Living in Houston, I have to admit that I am far from an expert on Deep Dish Pizza. That said, every time I am in Chicago, I always seek out a deep dish pie.

I have tried several of the most highly rated deep dish pies and always come back to Lou's. The signature butter crust is fantastic and the quality and quantity of filling keeps me coming back. I had the individual pie this time and the filling seem a bit less generous than the full size versions I had before. It was still great.  Accompanied by a good beer and I was very happy.

You will wait about 45 minutes for your deep dish.

The Roma tomatoes. The crust. Oh the cheese. But the Roma tomatoes!

Oh my.

This pizza was three main players all having a Me party while heartwarmingly, at the end of the story, realizing they're all in this together, and that things wouldn't have been the same if they had gone at it alone.

Wow.
